description: This is a good, basic wine with modest amounts of fruitiness and butteriness mingling on a medium body. A chalky, earthy note comes in on the midpalate and lingers.
title: Viaggio 2016 Buttercup Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Aromas of orange blossom and mandarin pith show on the somewhat flat nose of this bottling. There's a burst of acid on the tip of the sip, but it quickly fades into dried apple and orange-rind flavors.
title: Carson Ridge 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This wine is quietly floral with a thick entry of simple, lemon-lime flavors and a rounded structure.
title: Carneros Ranch 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This wine is flabby and full-bodied, with ripe flavors of green olive and apple. There's a lingering sweetness to the finish.
title: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Muted aromatically, this wine is intense in oak and richness, a mix of tropical pineapple, baked apple and robust butterscotch.
title: Chateau St. Jean 2016 Belle Terre Vineyard Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Puts all the pieces of the puzzle together, combining ripe tropical fruit, ample sweet oak and coastal acidity, but the picture is a little blurry. The wine is decadently ripe and obvious.
title: Testarossa 2005 Castello Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: A new Chard from this producer. It shows typical Napa characteristics of dryness and a dried herb earthiness, in addition to the apple, pear, oak and lees flavors. The texture is great, brimming with crisp acidity, yet the wine would benefit from richer fruit.
title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2005 Karia Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Simple and citrusy, this high-acid (7.2 grams) Chard has slightly sweet Meyer lemon, pink grapefruit, green pear and vanilla flavors. It's a clean, easy to like wine.
title: Pietra Santa 2005 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Like the Pinot Gris, this is fairly weighty, with ample concentration and richness at its price point. Pear and melon flavors easily carry the light touches of spicy oak. Drink now.
title: Concannon 2005 Selected Vineyards Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Polished and elegant, but a little earthy, with a thyme and sage edge to the fruit, and a soft, oaky finish. Could use more brightness and fruity richness.
title: Silverado 2005 Vineburg Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: After a very successful '04, San Saba's '05 Chard is a bit of a letdown. It's still very fruity in lemongrass, lime and pineapple fruit, and shows that lovely, crisp Monterey acidity. But it's also too sweet in oaky vanilla, with a sugary, cotton candy finish.
title: San Saba 2005 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: . Doesn't seem to have the elegant Burgundian quality of past vintages, and the main culprit is the flavor of apricot jam, which makes the wine a little heavy and suggests overripe fruit. Apricots are delicious, of course, but you don't want too much of that in a Chardonnay.
title: Talbott 2004 Sleepy Hollow Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: There's an earthy quality to this Chard, with herbal sage, dill and Bay laurel flavors to the underlying peach and apricot flavors. It's also a little on the soft side. Will benefit from decanting for a few hours, to take the edge off and let it breathe.
title: Frog's Leap 2005 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A little simple, but rich and forward in ripe fruit flavors, this zesty Chard offers a wealth of apricot, pineapple and peach jam flavors. Oak adds complexities of buttered toast and caramel.
title: Cinnabar 2005 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: There's an earthy taste to this Chard that brings to mind tobacco and dried sage, while the fruit veers towards apricots and peaches. Creamy oak adds the usual nuances to this dry, soft wine.
title: Tamayo Family 2005 Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

description: Riding the unoaked Chardonnay train is Daniel Gehrs, not really known for this variety. The wine is brisk, fruity and clean, bursting with tropical fruit and spice flavors and finishing long and clean.
title: Daniel Gehrs 2005 Unoaked Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Shows classic Santa Rita Hills cool-climate Chard notes of very high acidity and Meyer lemon drop flavors, but both may be too much of a good thing. So sharp, so citrusy, the palate craves something softer, creamier, and richer in fruit. Maybe it was a victim of the chilly vintage in a cool area.
title: Alma Rosa 2005 El Jagali Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: With a little neutral oak to give a touch of smoky cream, this everyday wine has good apple and peach fruit, and a nice clean cut of acidity.
title: Shooting Star 2005 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Well-ripened, a balanced Chard showing plenty of upfront fruit flavor and an opulent layer of toasty oak. Peaches and cream, tropical fruit and vanilla custard flavors lead to a spicy, slightly astringent finish.
title: X 2004 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Earthy and dry, with a dusty feeling, this pleasant Chard has apple and peach flavors enhanced with winemaker bells and whistles, like partial malo and partial oak. Still, it has a certain one-dimensionality of fruit.
title: Bell 2005 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: An unoaked wine that shows you don't need caramel and vanilla to make a good Chard. You get crisp acids and that earthy, mulchy richness that Carneros Chards have underlying the peaches and pineapples.
title: Kopriva 2005 Cassidy Ranch Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Lots of oak here, with toast, butter and caramelly vanilla riding over underlying peach and tropical fruit flavors. The texture is creamy smooth and rich. Nice Chardonnay at a decent price.
title: Chateau St. Jean 2005 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Consider it a food wine. It's on the lean side compared to today's superripe Chards, but it sure is elegant. The peach and pineapple fruit is controlled, the oak is moderate, the alcohol is low, and acidity is crisp and clean.
title: Andretti 2005 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Good everyday Chardonnay, a little stretched for fruit, but offering up pleasant enough peach, pineapple and apple flavors, with custardy, vanilla and woodsmoke nuances. Shares the characteristics of the best RRV Chard, although it's not as concentrated.
title: Lake Sonoma 2005 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Here's a good everyday Chard, offering immediate pleasure in the ripe tropical fruit and peach flavors, creamy texture and smoky oak influence. It's a blend of Russian River and Alexander Valley.
title: Huntington 2005 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: There's some new oak on this Chard, but the fruit really stars. It's so pure and clean and bright, suggesting pineapples, nectarines, guavas and Meyer lemons. It's a tiny bit sweet, but the acidity is high enough to make the finish feel dry.
title: Bonterra 2005 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: A nice Chard, grown in the up-and-coming Suisun Valley east of San Francisco in the Delta. Shows nicely ripened tropical fruit, with some oak influence and a long, spicy-fruity finish.
title: Bask 2005 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: Shows richness in the ripe peach, pear and apple flavors, although the wine, from Yountville and Oak Knoll, is a little soft and earthy compared to cool-climate Chards. Dry and clean.
title: Bell 2005 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Rich in apricot, peach and pineapple flavors that finish a little sweet and oaky. This is the kind of inexpensive Chardonnay that California so effortlessly produces, all to the benefit of consumers.
title: McManis 2005 Chardonnay (River Junction)

description: Clean, minerally and streamlined, with citrus zest, lees, oak flavors and a very dry finish. This will go well with shellfish. It's made in Mondavi's restrained, elegant style.
title: Robert Mondavi 2004 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Clean, dry and tart in acids, this is a minerally Chard with citrus and kiwi flavors. It has some oak that adds richness, but it's not really a rich wine. It's more of a streamlined, sleek sipper.
title: Belvedere 2004 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Dry, bright in acids, and fruity, with kiwi and lime flavors that finish with a spicy flourish. This is a nicely elegant Chard that won't break the bank.
title: Guenoc 2004 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: Here's a nice everyday sort of Chard, forward in bright lime, kiwi and nectarine flavors. Tastes like it comes from a far cooler climate than Paso Robles. A bit more concentration would send the score through the roof.
title: Robert Hall 2005 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Grown in the warmest part of the appellation, this Chard is soft and without the acidity you find closer to the ocean. But it's a very tasty wine brimming with tropical fruit, honeysuckle, buttered toast and vanilla flavors.
title: Rancho Arroyo Grande 2004 Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Another unoaked Chard hits the market, and with good results at a good price. Nothing but juicy peach, pear and pineapple flavors and crisp acidity. Oak probably would have brought it down.
title: Novella 2005 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: As tart in acids and zingy as cool-climate Chard comes, with bright, mouth-stimulating lime and kiwi flavors that finish dry and clean. There's a tiny bit of oak, but the fruit really stars in this tasty, affordable wine.
title: Queen of Hearts 2004 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Nice and crisp in acidity, with ripe peach, apple and pineapple flavors. There's a bite of green sharpness on the finish, but it's still a good Chard.
title: Leal Vineyards 2004 Estate Chardonnay (San Benito County)

description: Opens with a burst of charry, toasty oak, then settles down to show ripe white peach, pineapple, caramel and tapioca flavors. The grapes are from the Yorkville Highlands.
title: Wattle Creek 2004 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: Shows all the qualities of a fine Edna Valley Chard, from the juicy acids to the laser pure lime and nectarine flavors. It's thinned down from the better stuff, but still, not bad.
title: Bishop's Peak 2004 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Dry and crisp,  with mineral, ash and slate flavors relieved by a dash of grapefruit. A wine like this doesn't win competitions, but it has its place on the table with tapas or alone as an apéritif.
title: Eberle 2005 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: You hardly notice the mild oak and lees elements in this Chard because it's so tart with acids and pure in green apple, Meyer lemon and yellow apricot fruit. There's also a flinty minerality, making this quite Chablisian.
title: Domaine Santa Barbara 2005 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: A combination of Santa Maria and Santa Rita fruit, with the majority from Bien Nacido, this is a dry, crisp Chardonnay. It's more rustic than the Chards from Foley, the parent winery, but shows some interesting qualities.
title: Lincourt 2004 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Crisp in crunchy, mouthwatering acidity, with little or no oak, this Chard shows purely etched flavors of pineapples, kiwis, limes and dusty spices. It's a fruit-forward, food-friendly wine that's clean and direct.
title: Maddalena 2004 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: With peach custard, pineapple and smoky, oaky tastes, this is a good, satisfying Chard. It's dry and balanced in acidity, with a nice spiciness.
title: Domaine Chandon 2004 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Rich and vibrant in acid-accented lime, peach, pink grapefruit and tangerine flavors, this creamy, smooth Chard is partly barrel fermented, which gives it a toasty, buttery edge.
title: Blackstone 2005 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: The aim here seems to be to avoid ripe, opulent fruit in favor of an elegantly streamlined wine you might call Chablisian. The result is bone dry, high in aciditiy and lean, with mineral and citrus flavors. This is against the grain these days for fruity Chards.
title: Nickel & Nickel 2004 Truchard Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Here's a nice, clean Chardonnay whose best features are dryness and a rich coating of oak. The flavors veer toward peaches, apples and pineapples, along with a distinct spiciness and a bracing streak of minerality.
title: William Hill Estate 2004 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Fans of oak and fruity tropical flavors will appreciate the price on this well-organized, everyday Chard. It shows pineapple custard, vanilla yogurt and cinnamon spice flavors wrapped into a dry, creamy texture set off by high acidity.
title: St. George 2004 Barrel Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: The winery specializes in single-vineyard wines, and this is certainly a unique Chardonnay, but it's not an opulent one. On the contrary, it's flinty, acidic and raspingly dry, which makes one think it was picked early. It's almost like a Sauvignon Blanc, with its puckery lemon flavors.
title: Nickel & Nickel 2004 Searby Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: At three years, this Chard is losing some freshness, and is picking up a dried peach and apricot flavor. It's also softening, which emphasizes the creaminess. It's best to pop the cork on this dry wine now.
title: Perbacco Cellars 2003 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Tart and minerally, this high-acid Chard has green apple pie flavors, sprinkled with cinnamon and nutmeg. It's bone dry, an angular, somewhat lean wine that needs food to show what it can do. Try with grilled salmon.
title: St. Francis 2004 Behler Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This Chard has a lot of lees and oak influences. It feels overworked, especially given the high acidity and lean, citrusy fruit. Bone dry, this single-vineyard wine should work well with raw shellfish.
title: Barnett 2004 Savoy Vineyard Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: Gallo scores with this ripe, creamy Chard. It fills the mouth with tropical fruit, vanilla custard and woodspice flavors. Not a complex wine, it's a guaranteed crowd pleaser.
title: Napa Valley Vineyards 2004 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: There's lots of oak on this ripe wine, which has forward tropical fruit and spice flavors and a richly creamy texture from barrel fermentation. It's a bit simple, though.
title: Bouchaine 2004 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: On the soft and sweet side, with the flavor of extremely ripe white peaches drizzled with vanilla, caramel and buttercream. What this New World Chard lacks in complexity it makes up for in sheer, lip-smacking deliciousness.
title: Hangtime 2003 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Without showing the richness of prior vintages, this year's bottling is earthy and crisp and very dry. It has a steely minerality and modest fruit that suggests green apples and pineapples.
title: M. Cosentino 2004 CE2V Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: I like the dryness and crispness of this food-friendly wine, but it's not the fruitiest Chard to come down the pike. It's an earthy wine, with herb flavors veering into peaches, and enough oaky-leesy creaminess to add interest.
title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2004 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Parker's basic county Chardonnay shares the same features as his upper tier, namely a wonderful balance of acids, fruit, oak and alcohol. The flavors are of tropical fruits, although the wine is necessarily not as rich or concentrated as the single vineyards.
title: Fess Parker 2004 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This has a rich earthy quality, suggesting sweet heaps of mulch and herbs, in addition to fruitier flavors of apples and peaches. It's also somewhat soft and well-oaked. If you're looking for an example of Napa Chard, for better or  worse, this is a good one.
title: Calistoga Cellars 2004 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This wine offers powerful fruit, strong acids, strong oak and a creamy texture. It's dry, but almost desserty in the peach and pineapple custard, vanilla-drizzled flavors.
title: Midnight 2004 Equinox Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Straddles the line between an earthy herbaceousness and riper notes of peaches and apples. Either way, this is a balanced, crisp young wine, with a creamy texture and a very dry finish.
title: Rodney Strong 2004 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Tough and earthy, with coffee and dried herb flavors, this wine has buried peach and apple fruit that might emerge with decanting or a year or two of aging. It's very dry, with a good cut of acidity.
title: St. Francis 2003 Behler Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Earthy and dusty flavors of tobacco and herbs accompany the peach fruit in this dry, somewhat soft wine. Oak fills in the thin spots, lending sweet woodsap, vanilla and buttered toast.
title: Frank Family 2004 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Sweet in fruit, almost sugary but staying just dry, this well-oaked wine has ripe flavors of apricots, pineapples and bananas sautéed in butter. It's a tasty sipper meant to satisfy, and it does.
title: Château Souverain 2004 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Lots of rich, ripe tropical fruit flavors in this creamy, brisk wine. Vanilla, buttered toast and woodspice from oak add to the impact. There's nothing subtle about this bold Chardonnay.
title: Anapamu 2004 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: The fruit is leaner and thinner on this than most of Gallo's current Chards, but in a way, that works in its favor. The wine is more Chablisian, with moderate peach flavors and a crisp, clean minerality.
title: Indigo Hills 2003 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Showcases the bright acidity and pure tropical fruit flavors of cool-climate Monterey Chards, with a delicious kiwi and lime taste. This is a super price for a wine of this caliber.
title: Mountain View 2004 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Lots of ripe, rich Chardonnay character in this wine, with its strong flavors of peaches and cream, spicy woodsap, vanilla and buttered toast. It's a nice, dry wine with refreshing acids.
title: Husch 2004 Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: This is a good wine, but it provides ammunition for those who suggest that Napa Valley isn't the best place for Chardonnay. Dry, with an earthy edge to the fruit, and lots of oak.
title: Taylor 2003 Hillside Chardonnay (Stags Leap District)

description: Ripe in peach, pear and apple flavors, with a rich earthiness backed up by firm acids. The finish is dry and creamy.
title: Parkers Estate 2004 Private Reserve Blue Ash Road Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: All the bells and whistles have been applied to this elaborately crafted wine. There's lots of oak, and the mouthfeel is smooth and creamy, offset by crisp acids. There could be more fruit intensity, though.
title: Ironstone 2003 Reserve Chardonnay (Sierra Foothills)

description: This new brand from Don Sebastiani & Sons has got to have the most fun closure in the industry. The wine itself is what this company does so well, just about as good as it gets at this price. Ripe, balanced and superdrinkable.
title: Le Bon Vin de la Napa Valley 2004 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
winery: Le Bon Vin de la Napa Valley

description: Lots of toasty oak on this very dry wine, and a big burst of citrusy acids. In fact the fruit veers toward lemons, limes and grapefruits, just nudging into riper green apples and peaches.
title: Hayman & Hill 2004 Reserve Selection Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: With an oaky edge to the peach, apricot and orange cream flavors, this Chard is tasty, although a little soft. It sure is ripe, all the way through the spicy finish.
title: Kunde 2004 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Ripe enough in fruit, with massive, explosive peach custard, Key lime pie and vanilla flavors and a solid overlay of smoky oak. The finish is quick and somewhat simple.
title: Schug 2004 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This pleasant wine shows all the usual Chardonnay features of well-ripened tropical fruit and peach flavors, toasty oak, and a creamy, buttery mouthfeel. It's clean and brisk, with a long, fruity finish.
title: Castoro Cellars 2004 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Here's a friendly Chardonnay with bold flavors of peaches and tropical fruits, with a spicy dusting of oak. It has that nice, bright coastal acidity that balances the richness.
title: Domaine Santa Barbara 2004 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This wine shows those crisp, bright, mouthwatering Central Coast acids. They perk up the lime and tropical fruit flavors enhanced with a touch of vanilla and smoke from barrels. Finishes spicy and dry.
title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2004 Paragon Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: You'll find some tasty apricots, peach and vanilla-oak flavors in this soft, creamy wine. It's a nice California Chardonnay, slightly sweet in the finish, and a great accompaniment to salmon or pork.
title: Chateau St. Jean 2004 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This is a very hands-on winemaker wine. It's strong in lees and oak, and feels a bit manipulated. The underlying wine seems very cool-climate, suggesting green apples and cinnamon-laced coffee, with tart acids.
title: Clos La Chance 2003 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Everybody likes ripe tropical fruit, toasty oak, Asian spices, a buttercreamy texture and a long, fruity finish in their Chards, and this one gives it all, in an everyday, friendly sort of way.
title: William Hill Estate 2003 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Good melon, apple and vanilla aromas precede honey, vanilla and spice flavors. It's sweet, ripe and easy to drink, with touches of wood and marshmallow. Where this concept wine scores best is on the tongue: It has generous acidity and enough body to ensure balance.
title: Perfect 10 2003 Blonde Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: This very dry wine is earthy, with a dusty, tannic flavor of hazelnut skin and a slight bitterness, but it rewards with deeper tastes of white peach, and a rich overlay of oak.
title: Rodney Strong 2003 Reserve Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)

description: Even the regular St. Francis Chard is all barrel-fermented and frequently stirred, adding layers of textureto the pineapple and citrus fruit. Enough young oak is used to impart smoke, vanilla and marshmallow notes.
title: St. Francis 2003 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: One of the better values out there right now, this Chard features flavors of juicy yellow peach, green apple and pineapple, with a touch of spicy, vanilla-tinged oak, housed in a soft, creamy texture.
title: Leaping Lizard 2003 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: From a warmish Monterey County appellation comes this soft, creamy Chard. It has pretty flavors of very ripe white peaches and apricots, drizzled with vanilla, and seems a little sweet.
title: Heller Estate 2003 Estate Chardonnay (Carmel Valley)

description: Soft and a little thin, with lemondrop flavors and generous oak. This wine is fully dry, and has a pleasant, creamy texture.
title: Geyser Peak 2003 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A very nice Chard, especially at this price. Smooth and creamy, with good acids framing intensely ripe flavors of pineapple, marzipan and cinnamon spice, leading to a long finish.
title: Five Rivers 2003 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: There's a firmness in the mouth with this Chard. The fruit is ripe and spicy, the oak is just right, and the acidity is high, leading to a tart, dry finish.
title: Blackstone 2003 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: A nice Chard, with lively acidity and a modest coating of oak that frames peach and apple flavors. Easy to drink, and fine by itself or as a backup to fresh-cracked crab.
title: Flora Springs 2003 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Clean and sleek, a rather austere Chard whose flavors veer toward green apples and figs, with good acidity. Finishes with some earthiness.
title: Whitford Cellars 2002 Haynes Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A little rough around the edges, but likeable for its good peach and pear flavors. Finishes very dry and crisp, with an aftertaste of lees. This is a good, everyday Chard.
title: Toasted Head 2003 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Plenty of honeyed, caramelly toast on this fruity wine. The flavors are very ripe and pineappley, with lots of spices on the finish.
title: Benziger 2003 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Oaky and fruity, with a pleasant peaches-and-cream texture to the peach, pear and pineapple flavors. This is a nice everyday Chard with some fancy edges.
title: Weinstock Cellars 2001 Cellar Select Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Here's a good, all-purpose Chard when you want one that's oaky, ripe, dryish-sweetish and creamy. It has pretty peach, apple and vanilla flavors, and a slight roughness to the finish.
title: Dutcher Crossing 2003 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A real value at this price, considering its rich array of tropical fruit and creamy texture. Finishes with a swirl of spicy vanilla.
title: Shale Ridge Vineyard 2002 Lockwood Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: There's some richness in this well-made wine, which is showing peach and tropical fruit flavors, with vanilla and toast accents. Finishes a bit astringent, calling for rich shellfish.
title: Blackstone 2003 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Tight and lemony, with firm acids that make the tastebuds whistle. This is a dry Chard well suited to crab dishes.
title: San Simeon 2002 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Ripe and juicy in mango, pineapple and pear flavors, with a generous dollop of toasty oak and a vanilla cream texture. Finishes a bit sharp in acidity, but refreshing and tasty.
title: Talbott 2003 Kali Hart Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Oak stars in this wine, with its toasty, wood and vanilla aromas and flavors. It's a good wine, but could use greater freshness and intensity, especially at this price..
title: Falcor 2001 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Lots of pleasantly ripe pear, peach and apple fruit, with crisp acids and good wood. Easy to drink, with a slight roughness of texture.
title: Frog's Leap 2003 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is a pretty good wine. It has the ripe peach, tropical fruit and oaky flavors, creamy texture and oak of top Chards, although there's a homespun rusticity that shows.
title: Mia's Playground 2003 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This white has nice, ripe flavors of peaches and tropical fruits, and good oak. Rich and creamy, this Chard offers lots of pleasure at a good price.
title: Clos du Bois 2003 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: Strong in ripe apple flavors, with an herbal, earthy character and some tannins, this is a tough wine that finishes with some almond-skin bitterness. It's bone dry.
title: Mayo Family 2003 Laurel Hill Vineyard Unwooded Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: A nice example of a Carneros Chard, balanced in tree fruit flavors, with crisp acidity and a hint of pear liqueur on the finish. It's clean and refreshing.
title: Leveroni 2003 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Lots of smoky, caramelized oak has been applied to the underlying peach and pear flavors. Has a nice, creamy texture and finishes a little sweet.
title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2003 Paragon Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: With no oak, what you get in the aroma are the prettiest, cleanest scents of ripe apples, peaches, pears and spices. Would earn a higher score if it weren't soft and syrupy-sweet.
title: Bocage 2003 Unoaked Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Doesn't show a lot of fruit, with citrus flavors just verging into tart green apples. Very clean and zesty with acidity, with oak shadings, it will be good with broiled salmon.
title: Lake Sonoma 2003 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Lots of oak here, with the requisite vanilla, buttered toast and sweet wood notes on top of modest peach and tropical fruit flavors.
title: Screw Kappa Napa 2003 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Rather sharp and tart in green apple bitterness, and pretty acidic through the finish, although the oak and cream make up for it. But that structure works in favor of food.
title: Oakville Ranch 2001 Vista Vineyard Chardonnay (Oakville)

description: Fruity, oaky, creamy and slightly sweet, this Chard is solidly in the international style. It offers flavors of peaches, pears, vanilla and buttered toast.
title: Simi 2003 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Creamy smooth, dry and crisp with acids, this wine shows modest peach and coffee flavors, accented with a touch of smoky oak.
title: Cobblestone 2003 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Just pour it, and the aromas of peaches, tropical fruits and smoky oak waft out of the glass. Dry and easy, with tons of fruit and spice into the finish.
title: Rutherford Hill 2002 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This soft wine has an earthiness to it, with nuances of yellow stone fruits, but it's more about herbs. Finishes quick.
title: Hendry 2002 Blocks 19 & 20 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A longtime restaurant favorite, this wine mixes its peach and citrus flavors with minerally, stony notes and a kiss of smoky oak. It's very dry, with crisp acids.
title: Calera 2001 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: The softest and least concentrated of Mondavi's current trio of Chards. Peaches and cream, vanilla and dusty spices.
title: Robert Mondavi 2002 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This reserve-style wine, which is richer than the winery's regular release, offers lots of bang for your buck. Ripe and juicy in peach and apple flavors that are well oaked, with a long, spicy finish.
title: ForestVille 2002 Sonoma Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Here's a great value. It's as ripe as can be in tropical fruit and spices, and the oak contribution shows up as buttered toast and vanilla. Don't look for subtlety, just pure flavor.
title: Château Julien 2002 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Soft in acids, fat and lush in fruit, and enjoyable. The tropical fruit, vanilla and smoky oak flavors are explosive but dry, and very spicy.
title: Rabbit Ridge 2003 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: This nice, everyday Chard has pleasantly ripe, plump flavors of tropical fruits and peaches. There's a rich veneer of smoky oak that adds spices and vanilla.
title: Liberty School 2002 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Here's a simple, dry wine with lots of perky acids to boost up the apple and citrus flavors. There's some spicy richness and smoky oak in the finish. Pretty good value in a coastal Chard.
title: Concannon 2002 Selected Vineyard Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: A nice, somewhat earthy Chard. The fruit doesn't star here, although there are some polished apple and peach flavors. Rather, it's the structure. Good acidity and a touch of dusty tannins make this a natural for food.
title: De Loach 2001 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: You'd almost think this was apple cider, so pure in sweet green and red apple flavors is it. Whether that's due to oak, glycerine or sugar, it's too sweet, and low in acidity to boot.
title: Crichton Hall 2001 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Fruity and oaky, a likeable Chard that satisfies for its array of peach, pear, spice, smoke and vanilla aromas and flavors and creamy texture. But it could use more oomph.
title: Franciscan 2002 Oakville Estate Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Lots of apple, pear and tropical fruit flavors are bathed in toasty oak, and the texture is rich and creamy. For me, the drawback of this wine is that it lacks crispness and so has a syrupy taste and feeling.
title: Clos du Val 2002 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Ripe pear and tropical fruits, a spicy mouthfeel, polished oak and a touch of lees, a creamy texture, a slightly sweet, fruity finish-it's all here. Designed to appeal to popular tastes at an everyday price.
title: Geyser Peak 2002 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This is an everyday sort of Chard that earns extra credit for ripe, tropical fruit flavors, good acidity and veneer of oak. Thin on the finish, but a good value.
title: Kali Hart 2002 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: There's lot of oak on top of a somewhat thin wine, but it's pleasant enough, with modest pineapple and peach flavors and dusty spices. Finishes quick, with oak flavors.
title: Simi 2002 Sonoma County Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A spicy Chard from cool-climate Monterey. It's packed with pear, pineapple and mango flavors whose sweetness is boosted by smoky oak. Finishes with a long, candied flourish.
title: Pavona 2001 Chardonnay Blanc Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: This refreshing Chard keeps all its elements reined in for balance and charm. You'll find apple and peach flavors, subtle oak, crisp acidity and a touch of lees, all wrapped in a creamy texture.
title: Kenwood 2002 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Harrison seems to have put as much oak on their Chard as they do on their Cabernets. Opens with the powerful perfume of toasted wood, wood sap, caramel and vanilla cookie. Far below is a good wine with citrusy, appley fruit and good acidity.
title: Harrison 2000 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Feels rough around the edges despite some well-ripened peach, pear and apple flavors. Oak adds cream, vanilla and buttered toast. Turns sweetly honeyed on the finish.
title: Charles Creek 2002 La Sorpresa Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Citrusy and acidic, with background flavors of peaches and tropical fruits. This is a varietally correct Chard, clean and balanced. It will go fine with scallops or shrimp.
title: Firestone 2002 Santa Barbara Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Ultraripe in all sorts of fruity flavors, notably pear, and with a rich application of smoky oak, this wine will appeal to fans of big, unctuous Chards. It's spicy and long on the finish, too.
title: Ledgewood Creek 2002 Limited Reserve Suisun Valley Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: A bit old for an inexpensive Chard, but the wine is still fresh and fruity, displaying apple and pear flavors that have a thick overlay of oak. Flavor, not finesse, is what you get at this fair price.
title: Bishop's Peak 2001 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Way too oaky, like sniffing and tasting toothpicks. Somewhere under all that vanilla and smoke is some nice tropical fruit, good acidity and a rich, creamy texture.
title: Mount Eden Vineyards 2001 MacGregor Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Nice and fruity, with peach, pear and tropical fruit flavors and an edge of smoky oak. Has a rich, creamy texture boosted by a streak of acidity.
title: Harbinger 2002 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: From the warmer Carmel Valley, a wine with flavors of fruit pie, especially apples and peaches, including the sweet, buttery crust. Creamy, with an almond-skin bitterness on the finish.
title: Wines of Carmel 2001 Carmel Chardonnay Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Tight, with citrus, apple and pear flavors and high acidity. It's a bracing wine that stimulates the taste buds. Winemaker effects include plenty of sweet oak, but it's still lean and angular.
title: Charles Krug 2002 Peter Mondavi Family Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Always lean and sharp in youth, this year's vintage is even leaner than usual. It has citrus and herb flavors undercut by searing acidity, and is bitterly dry. Almost Sauvignon Blanc-like in its profile, and not likely to age.
title: Stony Hill 2000 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is a classic New World Chardonnay, ripe with apple, peach and tropical fruit flavors, and lavishly oaked with smoky vanillins. It has a creamy texture, a bite of acidity and a spicy finish.
title: Pepi 2002 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Opens with pretty aromas of tropical fruits and well-toasted oak, and then turns sturdily acidic in the mouth, with flavors of pineapples and apples. Finishes a bit lean, but it's a nicely structured wine that's versatile at the table.
title: Château Julien 2001 Private Reserve Sur Lie Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Tight and austere, with citrusy flavors, a hint of pear, and a metallic, minerally feel. Lavish oak adds smoke and vanilla. Turns acidic and prickly on the finish.
title: Laetitia 2000 Reserve Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Refreshing and on the oaky side, with wood sap, smoke and vanilla notes framing tart apple flavors. There's a spicy pepperiness through the short, dry finish. Good with roasted chicken.
title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2001 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Well-oaked, with apple and tropical fruit flavors and earthier notes of sage and oregano. It has a creamy texture and spicy-oaky finish that turns sweet and lemony.
title: Diamond Oaks de Maniar 2001 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is a very dry, austere wine, marked by lemon and lime flavors and brisk, bright acids. It is like a Sauvignon Blanc, with a creamier texture. Fine now with the right foods, but it might even improve with a year or two in the cellar.
title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2001 Paragon Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Opens with a strongly oaky, leesy note, and then it turns flamboyantly oaky and fruity in the mouth. The citrus and tropical fruit flavors are accompanied by a caramel taste that comes from well-charred oak barrels. A bit obvious in opting for a blowsy style.
title: Crooked Vine 2001 Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Lots of charry oak and lees give this wine notes of vanilla, sour cream and a smooth texture, but the flavors are pretty thin. They veer toward citrus fruits, with a sprinkling of oregano and dill. It's so austere, dry and tart, it's almost Chablisian.
title: Trinchero 2000 Mario's Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: One hundred percent new French oak has given this wine splinters. It blasts out smoky char and vanilla, and you can even taste oak on the sappy-sweet finish. Underneath all that are peach and tropical fruit flavors, but you have to search for them. Sometimes, less is more.
title: Husch 2000 Special Reserve Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: A pleasant sipper whose flavors range from citrus fruits through tropical fruits, indicating a regional blend. The other elements are similarly well balanced, with good acidity and a nice overlay of creamy oak and vanilla.
title: Eberle 2002 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: This is a likeable Chard brimming with citrus and green apple flavors and tart Russian River acids. Has a little oak, not much, just enough to lend some vanilla and cream notes.
title: Huntington 2001 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A controversial wine. Although the winemaker says it has little oak, it seems super-oaky, with overwhelming vanilla and smoke flavors. Also a lot of flamboyant tropic fruit. The combination is huge, bold and distinctive. Certainly not for the faint-hearted.
title: Van Der Heyden 2000 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Despite being clean and well made, there's not a lot of excitement in this earthy wine. It is dominated by acids, some dusty tannins and flavors of citrus and dried herbs. The finish is dry and tart. On its own, doesn't offer a lot of immediate pleasure, although goat cheese and similar fare will show it off.
title: Lambert Bridge 2001 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Pretty good Chard, with some polished white stone fruit flavors and an overlay of oak and lees. Feels a bit flat and simple; a well-made, decent Chard with no special features.
title: Sebastiani 2001 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A wine that is light in texture and weight, but the tropical fruit flavors are ripe and succulent, and rather heavy oak adds a coating of vanillins and toast. Offers plenty of fancy Chard character at a reasonable price.
title: Kenwood 2002 Shows Vineyard Pedigree Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Interesting to taste Saintsbury's Reserve next to the regular Chardonnay. Both naturally share the same taste and textural characteristics, but this wine is oakier and softer in the mouth, especially in acidity. It lacks the crispness and zest of the regular. Seems a bit heavy and flat, although it's still a nice wine.
title: Saintsbury 2000 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Not as rich or concentrated as the previous vintage, and the acidity is low, making for a mushy texture. Still, the peach and tropical fruit flavors are good. Turns hot with alcohol on the finish.
title: Carpe Diem 2001 Firepeak Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Quite austere, with citrusy, appley, minerally flavors and tart acids. This is not your usual fruit monster, although oak and lees do their best to add nuance and complexity. A good wine that is versatile at the table.
title: La Crema 2000 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Lip-smackingly tasty, offers a real blast of spicy peaches, apples and pears that fills the mouth and lasts through the finish. All that nice taste is accompanied by an overlay of smoky oak and a creamy texture.
title: River Road 2001 Proprietors Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Tastes lean and tart with acidity, with the flavors of apples and citrus fruits, almost like a Sauvignon Blanc. On the other hand, it's clean and well-made, and very dry.
title: Charles Creek 2001 Hawk Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Middle of the road stuff. Some nice peach, citrus and apple flavors, a bit of oak, and dry. Hard to find anything in particular to praise or blame, just good clean Chardonnay.
title: Rosenblum 2001 Napa Valley Select Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Well-oaked, with plenty of toasty, smoky, charry flavors. The underlying fruit veers toward peaches and pears. This is a pleasant wine, not very complex, but well made. Turns very oaky again on the finish, with sweet woody tannins.
title: Miner 2000 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Made in a highly individualistic style that's not for everyone. Tart and lean, with citrus flavors and just a riper hint of peaches. Drinks high acid, leesy and sour, with little to soften the hard, metallic mouthfeel.
title: Paraiso Vineyards 2000 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is a nice, flavorful wine with lots of peach, pear and apple tastes, and a round, creamy mouthfeel. It's a bit soft, but offers up lots to like at a gentle price.
title: Rodney Strong 2001 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Lots of oak and ripe apple and peach fruit, with good acids in this dry, creamy wine. The finish is filled with cinnamon, ginger and other spices. Can't quite overcome a certain simplicity and rusticity, though.
title: Kirkland Ranch 2000 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Solidly middle of the road, with sturdy flavors of peaches, some toasty oak notes, and a creamy texture. Finishes with some real richness and the tart, sour taste of lees.
title: Trellis 2000 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Extremely ripe fruity aromas and flavors of sweet pear and white peach mark this well-oaked wine, with its smoky vanillins and toasty edge. Feels a bit rough, and the finish has some jagged notes.
title: Jeriko 2000 Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Fresh and appley, an easy drinking Chard with all the basic features of oak, creamy texture and refreshing acids. Not especially layered or complex, but friendly and clean.
title: Husch 2001 Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Plump and juicy, packed with well-ripened flavors of peaches and pears. The texture is creamy, with a smoky, spicy edge to the finish. A bit flat, but tasty.
title: William Hill Estate 2001 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Way too oaky, like drinking toothpicks. Packs a mouthful of char and smoky spice riding on top of apple and peach flavors. The finish turns spicy and oaky again.
title: Madonna Estate - Mont St. John 2000 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Lean and appley in flavor profile, with crisp acidity. This is a sleek, tight wine, well structured, with standard oak and leesy notes. Does the job without any particular complexity.
title: Domaine Alfred 2000 Chamisal Vineyards, Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Tight and lean, a citrusy wine of high acidity that scours the palate and feels clean and refreshing through the tart finish. Unoaked. This austere wine will be good with shellfish or goat cheese appetizers.
title: Pellegrini 2001 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Smells oaky and fruity, with peach and apple aromas compounded with vanilla. The flavors are pretty nice, with apples and oaky influences. Fairly bitter and tart. Acidity creates burn through the finish, and lees add a sour component.
title: Stephen Ross 2000 Edna Ranch Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: On the herbal side, with tobacco and sage flavors alongside peaches and apples. Dry and tart, it's a refreshing and versatile wine.
title: Callaway 2000 Coastal Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A little obvious in its broad brush use of toasted oak. Pretty much all you get is smoke, char, vanilla and other sweet wood things. Underneath all that is fairly simple apple and peach fruit flavors and spice.
title: Château Julien 2001 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Very acidic now, actually with a bit of spritz underscoring apple flavors. Very dry, with a bit of oak influence. The finish is tart and bitter, with the taste of pepper and apple. -S.H.
title: Bishop's Peak 2000 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Fruity, with hints of peach and pear framed in tangy, lemony acidity and cinnamon spice. The wine is showing a touch of oxidation, which gives it a nutty edge. -J.M.
title: Cantiga Wineworks 2000 Oakless Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Avila is a new line from Laetitia and Barnwood wineries, and one that fills the important niche of affordable varietal wines. This lean Chard brims with bright flavors of lemons and grapefruits, but an overlay of oak adds richness. Intense acidity makes the wine's finish clean and zesty.
title: Avila 2000 Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)

description: This wine seems overly leesy, and very high acidity makes things even tarter, almost sour. The underlying flavors are citrusy and lemony, making the wine taste like a Sauvignon Blanc. It's not very "Chardonnay," but it's clean and vibrant.
title: Joullian 1999 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Easy to drink, a lemony, peachy wine with a pleasant overlay of oak and lees. It's far from a blockbuster, but pleasant enough, with good varietal character.
title: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2001 Wetzel Family Estate - Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Distinctly Chardonnay in the ripe apple, peach and pear flavors veering all the way into tropical papaya. There is some tremendous, supercharred oak here, lending notes of caramel, vanilla and meringue. Despite the richness, the wine needs a little more depth and pizzazz
title: San Saba 2001 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: From Chiles Valley, this wine has vivacious tropical fruit, peach and pear flavors, but seems a little heavy in the mouth, with dull acids. Oak provides creamy spice and vanilla, and it finishes with earthy heat.
title: Spelletich Cellars 2000 Rustridge Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Very lean and crisp, almost steely in the mouth. The fruit is thin, suggesting watered-down peach flavors. Yet there's something likeable about the intense citrusy cleanliness, the crisp, earthy acidity, the way the wine washes across the palate and stimulates the taste buds.
title: Holly's Hill 2000 Chardonnay (El Dorado)

description: This Chard is fermented on lees for 4-6 months, in both French and American oak, which is more than you can say for most other Chards at this price. Slate, pear and vanilla aromas don't prepare you for the uber-malo toasty flavors that coat pear and apple-skin fruit on the palate. Mouthfeel is resinous, creamy and full-bodied.
title: Monterra 2001 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: From R.H. Phillips, ití•s a shade oakier and more refined than their regular bottling. The peach flavors are more concentrated, and sappier, but it comes at the cost of crispness. The wine sags in the mouth, like a Dali melted watch. But it tastes good.
title: R.H. Phillips 2000 Toasted head Chardonnay (Dunnigan Hills)

description: Marked by extreme oak, with charred, vanilla-infused aromas and spicy wood flavors. The underlying fruit is hard to discern under all that wood, but seems to veer toward peaches. Slightly sweet, with good acidity, it will please those who think oak and Chardonnay are synonymous. -S.H.
title: Louis M. Martini 2000 Del Rio Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Shows typical communal flavors of peach, apple and tangerine fruit, with dusty spices and an overlay of oak that adds vanilla and toast notes. Ití•s a candied wine, sweetly flavorful but soft and a bit simple.
title: Phoenix 2000 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Organically grown, with a woody, peachy smell. It tastes of peaches and apples, although citric acidity gives it a lemony feel. Finishes crisp, with a Meyer lemon flavor. Good drinking, and the oak barely shows. -S.H.
title: Milone 1999 Sanel Valley Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: From mountain vineyards, and you can taste an iron-y concentration, bordering on iodine, that frames the peach and apple flavors. The flavors are long and ripe and spicy, yet there's a spine of acidic steel that makes it drink bright and fresh. -S.H.
title: Windwalker 1999 Reserve Chardonnay (El Dorado)

description: This is an earthy Chard. There are hints of green apples with a slight hint of wood, and the wine drinks dry. It's far from opulent, but there is good structure and mouthwatering acidity, and the finish is very clean. -S.H.
title: Schug 2000 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Nice and easy-drinking, with peach and apple flavors spiced up with the sweet vanillins and smoke of oak. Drinks a bit soft and slightly sweet, with rich extract that lasts through the finish. -S.H.
title: Arrowood 2000 Grand Archer Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: From a pioneer of this appellation, a full-throttle wine involving lots of new French oak. The flavors veer toward ripe peaches and apples and the acidity is predictably high, given its origins. There's a lovely, creamy mouthfeel. One criticism: Excessive sweetness. Tastes like it has some residual sugar that doesn't belong there. -S.H.
title: Husch 1998 Special Reserve Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: A lighter style of Chard. It has modest apple and peach flavors, spice and oak influence and refreshing acidity. Not a blockbuster, this Chard won't overwhelm your favorite foods, but will support dishes like salmon in butter sauce. -S.H.
title: Royal Oaks 2000 Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: There'some pretty apple and peach fruit, and enough oaky influences to bring out smoky, vanilla nuances.  The texture is supple, crisp and creamy.  Made in a crowd-pleasing style, and one that won't break the bank.
title: Kenwood 2000 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Toasty oak and bright citrus flavors form the core of this snappy wine.  Clean and fresh on the finish.
title: Bogle 2000 Chardonnay (Clarksburg)

description: Juicy peach and spicy lime fruit is joined by herbal notes and a whiff of lees in this dry, fairly tart wine. A burn of acidity piques the middle palate, and then the citrus flavors kick in on the crisp, clean finish.
title: Mirassou 1999 Coastal Selection Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: A new line from Fetzer. This wine has what consumers want, with pretty peach and apple fruit, crisp acidity, lots of toasty, spicy oak and a tiny bit of sweetness. It's a solid delivery at an affordable price.
title: Fetzer 2000 Five Rivers Ranch Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: Here's a tightly wound Chard with scads of acidity, so much that it seems to tingle on the tongue. The aromas and flavors are of green apples and buttered toast. Crispy clean wine, and very refreshing.
title: Handley 1999 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: Crème brûlée and baked apple aromas on the nose open to a smooth palate of mild apple, pineapple and spice flavors with citrus accents.The flavors aren't vibrant, though, and the intensity of the oak rendered the faint fruit nearly invisible.
title: Conn Valley 1998 Fournier Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: There's still a good and pleasant dose of pineapple and apple fruit accented by vanilla spice in this wine, but a mature and overly soft palate-feel suggests that it's best consumed near-term. Finishes smooth and light, with medium length. Drink up this year.
title: Peter McCoy 1997 Clos des Pierres Reserve Chardonnay (Knights Valley)

description: The deep gold color here suggests age, as do the soft, vaguely oxidized flavors. Still, it shows some nice vanilla and baked apple notes, as well as slight chalk accents, on its toasty oak frame. Drink now.
title: Renaissance 1997 Première Cuvée Chardonnay (North Yuba)

description: Lean and tautly balanced, this wine has an outdoorsy, mineral-and-hay bouquet and sweet herbal accents. Green apple flavors take over the palate, though hints of lemon and minerals also show up. Tasters didn't find anything terribly wrong here, just a lack of element that would make it more right. Finishes with lingering oaky notes.
title: Gary Farrell 1999 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Opens with a nice nose of roasted nuts, banana, caramel and a hint of smoke. The palate's pear, baked apple and apricot flavors wear interesting coconut accents, but all these are unfortunately overrun by a scotch notes peek out from behind an edgy acidity.
title: Ramey 1998 Hyde Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: The nose here delivers a hefty dose of meaty, smoky, nutty notes paired with mild pear and apple. The palate doesn't show complexity-a pronounced toasted oak rides hard on apple and pineapple fruit. It's balanced and finishes dry, but comes up wanting the desired texture and nuance.
title: M. Cosentino 1999 The Sculptor Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Lees and oak dominate the nose of this very ripe wine. The result is size: A big, rich, oaky, fruity quaff, it fills the mouth with flavors and palate impressions. At the same time, it's a one-dimensional wine; it assaults the senses, but on one plane. Finishes semi-sweet.
title: Dry Creek Vineyard 1999 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: From one of the best Chardonnay regions in the state, a cool-climate wine with pronounced peach, apple and tropical fruit flavors and a blast of zesty, spicy, smoky oak. Clean and crisp, with a creamy, rich texture. Finishes with a vanilla note. The package is marred by too much sugar; consumers love sweetness, but this one takes things a little too far.
title: Kendall-Jackson 1999 Camelot Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: From a value leader, another rich, creamy, toasty Chard, loaded with peach, apple and pear flavors and a lot of oak. Good acidity and a long finish, but it has a little too much sugar to be considered dry.
title: Château Souverain 1999 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This well-known, widely-distributed wine offers round apple-toast aromas and a rich, soft mouthfeel. Apple, caramel and orange-tea flavors play on the palate and into the creamy finish, with its big, spicy oak. It's solid and satisfying in a very mainstream manner.
title: Fetzer 1999 Barrel Select Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: There's plenty of apple, melon, and citrus fruit in this dry, stylish wine. Has a nice earthy streak that hits midpalate, then turns ripe and generous on the finish. It's a little on the simple side, but it's pretty good for the price.
title: Trellis 1998 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Citrus and buttery aromas. Ripe tropical fruits, maybe overripe, and even some vegetable-like notes. Fairly large, soft mouthfeel. Good elements, but slightly askew and out of scale.
title: Eberle 1998 Estate Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Minty pear and apple aromas, with a flavor profile that's pure green apple, orange and lime. Tart and chalky in the mouth, but there is a positive minerally quality working in its favor. Crisp and simple.
title: Retzlaff 1998 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Presents a lean nose, with light apple and herb aromas and a touch of an off-putting element to some tasters. Pear, lime and mint flavors on a streamlined mouthfeel are well integrated here. Green-apple finish with oaky notes. Improves strongly after the odd nose.
title: Marimar Torres 1997 Don Miguel Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Starts off a bit metallic, then turns more mainstream, with apples, citrus, and tropical fruits vying with a toasty, earthy edge.
title: Freemark Abbey 1997 Carpy Ranch Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: The nose is unusually foresty and smacks of orange, tree bark and some camphor. Sweet and full, with some long, spicy notes. A little out of the ordinary.
title: Echelon 1998 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Very lean and crisp, with lemon-lime and melony aromas. Offers bright lime and herb flavors on the palate. Decidedly lean, it is another of the lighter but attractive almost Pinot Grigio-like wines tasted.
title: Handley 1998 Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Lavishly oaked; grandiose toast meets smokestack lightning on the nose. It calms down on the palate, where it leans toward apple and lemon fruit before moving smoothly into a long, toasty finish.
title: Leeward 1998 Reserve Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Modest aromas of pear and vanilla on the nose. The fairly soft palate displays subtle apple fruit with buttery, toasty notes and a touch of earthy complexity. The finish builds nicely with earth and toast. A bit faint of fruit, but nicely built.
title: Steele 1998 Lolonis Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: Peach and vanilla are all over the bouquet, which indicates that the body will be plump and oaky, which it is. The wine is full of heft, but also falls flat, especially on the finish. A very straightforward butterball.
title: Beaucanon 1997 Jacques De Coninck Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Quite buttery, with ample apple, melon and citrus fruit. Some herb and mineral flavors add an interesting note of complexity to the long finish.
title: Babcock 1998 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: On the herbaceous side, with anise and pine/resinous notes competing with lean pineapple fruit. Finishes with a discordant, metallic quality.
title: Alexander Valley Vineyards 1998 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Pineapple and pear aromas lead into sweet, clean fruit flavors. The wine is a touch sweet, but it also has an interesting chalkiness in the mouth. Simple clean fruit on the finish. Cleanly made, but not very lively.
title: Raymond 1998 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: With this one you never get totally past the sulfuric, heavily buttered-up start. From there it improves a little, showing apples, spice and light pear fruit in the mouth. In the end, however, it is an overdone wine that is heavily oaked and getting old as we speak.
title: Silver Mountain 1997 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Buttered toast and mild fruit aromas open to green-apple and butterscotch flavors. Fairly thick and rich, but the flavors are not of scale with the wine's weight. Odd sweet and chalky finish. Big, but not substantial.
title: Mirassou 1998 Showcase Selection Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Light poached pear and vanilla aromas on the nose. On the palate the wine comes across as light, even a bit lifeless in both flavor intensity and mouthfeel. Soft pear and stone-fruit flavors. Oak comes way up on the finish, but it has little to build on.
title: Flora Springs 1998 Barrel Fermented Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Melon and pear aromas, but an odd note on the nose detracts. After that it's a stylish wine with a lean, angular profile showing pear and melon fruit and herb accents. Light but well balanced in the mouth. Touch of popcorn on the finish.
title: Wente 1998 Riva Ranch Reserve Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Overtly fruity, with apple and fruit-cocktail aromas. The palate is of medium weight and tangy, with tart orange flavors. Finishes similarly. Not on a par with previous performances from this winery.
title: Flora Springs 1998 Lavender Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: An overt sweetness marks the nose, and it comes across as fruit cocktail mixed with a whiff of the flower garden. Very much one of those tropical-fruit-dominated Chardonnays, but unfortunately there's something metallic and hollow about the core of the wine.
title: Hanna 1998 Proprietor Grown Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Deep caramel, buttersctoch ad vanilla aromas are offset by pear and sour-apple elements. Nicely balanced, with tangy acidity.
title: Sanford 1998 Barrel Select Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Odd, not unappealing nose with pear and vegetable spice components. On the palate it turns a bit more tart, with a slight anisette-like note. Full mouthfeel and a tart herbal finish of medium length.
title: Stags' Leap Winery 1998 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Honey, apple and oak-spice notes never quite come into perfect harmony, but still make music good enough to sip. Turns a bit syrupy and orangey on the finish.
title: Louis M. Martini 1997 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Lavishly oaked; grandiose toast meets smokestack lightning on the nose. It calms down on the palate, where it leans toward apple and lemon fruit before moving smoothly into a long, toasty finish.
title: Landmark 1998 Overlook Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Very dense, maybe too much so. You'll find toast, marmalade, and caramel aromas leading into earthy, appley fruit, spice and vanilla. It's chunky yet sharp, citrusy yet shrill. At the end it's just not balanced enough to merit higher.
title: Robert Craig 1998 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Has some positive apple, earth and toasty aromas, and a fairly plump, full mouthfeel. However, the green-apple fruit seems modest, even bland, and the toasty oak, while appealing, seems to suppress it.
title: Seven Peaks 1997 Reserve Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Opens with attractive spice, apple and tangerine notes. Flavors flatten out and don't sing like the aromas. Round and a bit low-acid for its weight. Toasty oak prevails on the dry, fairly long finish.
title: Kenwood 1998 Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: An interesting floral scent joins oranges, pears and lemons. Tartly acidic, with some grapefruit notes and what seems to be a touch of sweetness.
title: Aliento Del Sol 1998 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Light and simple pear and citrus fruit is clean and tasty enough. A pleasant quaff for a hot summer afternoon.
title: Gundlach Bundschu 1998 Rhinefarm Vyds Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Very citrusty to the nose, with clear hints of tangerine and grapefruit. The fruity flavor profile mixes chunky sweet fruit and leaner citrus. In the end it's inconsistent, with a cool, tangy side keeping it going, but also some simplicity holding it back.
title: Cinnabar 1998 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Somewhat sweet, with pear, hay, vanilla and caramel aromas, and sweet apple-spice flavors. Good mouthfeel and slightly tangy finish. Simple but not unappealing.
title: Baileyana 1998 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Good nose of ripe tropical fruit, with citrus, honey and toasty oak. However, it turns a bit sweet and one-dimensional on the palate. A bit ponderous-not light on its feet and without enough layers or complexity to justify its heft.
title: Benziger 1998 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Faint citrus, herb and green-apple aromas. Creamy in the mouth, with emphasis on lemon and lime flavors. The tart finish is a little short.
title: Carmody McKnight 1997 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: The least interesting of J. Fritz's vineyard-designated Chards. Has plenty of fruity, oaky notes, and an earthiness that smacks of rocks and soil. But a burnt note on the finish is jarring.
title: Fritz 1997 Poplar Vineyard Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Made of 100% estate grown fruit, this opens with a buttery, vanilla, almost liqueur-like nose. Pear flavors and a bit of tangy spice on the palate, the oak comes on strong on the finish.
title: Château Julien 1998 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Weak aromas of citrus, butter and smoke. Has correct varietal flavors of green apple and peach, and some oaky notes, but it's watery in the midpalate, and finishes thin. At 13,600 cases, you get the feeling they stretched this wine as far as they could.
title: Clos du Bois 1998 Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Pineapple and vanilla oak on the nose. Subdued fruit flavors, a little flat in mouthfeel. Nice orangey nutty notes on the finish; not badly made, but overall a little clumsy with the oak, making the fruit seem casual.
title: Charles Krug 1998 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Lively bright fruit in the pear and apple range mark this lush, forward wine. In the center there is a mix of tropical fruit and spice, with a lean and vivid finish that's rounded by oak.
title: Smith & Hook 1997 Baroness Reserve Masterpiece E Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: From a more obscure growing region north of Napa and east of Mendocino, there is some pear flavor on top of pronounced oak. Decent in the mouth with enough acidity to protect the fruit from oak overload. Lemony and light, with a lot of buttery, oaky, soft character. Tastes better at first and then loses steam.
title: Wildhurst 1997 Chardonnay (Clear Lake)

description: Good color and texture, but short on flavorful fruit. A bit lean and lemony throughout, the wine just never gets it completely together. A smidgin of green-apple crispness and a little warmth, but overall too green and lean to score higher.
title: Leeward 1996 Edna Valley Reserve Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: A cheerful sort of Chardonnay with juicy fruit rounded by a touch of oak and a fairly rich, buttery background with good structure The wine was made by Tom Eddy, the Napa winemaker known for big reds. The 1997 is the first national release for Salmon Harbor.
title: Salmon Harbor 1997 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This wine is from a sheltered canyon vineyard, safe from the chilly winds of northern Monterey County. Tasty tropical fruit comes shining through with a touch of peach leading to a long, happy ending.
title: Paraiso Vineyards 1997 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Ripe, with green apple, citrus and tropical fruit flavors. Dry and fruity. A little rough around the edges, with a slightly bitter finish. For everyday drinking.
title: Zaca Mesa 1997 Zaca Vineyards Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: An inexpensive Chard for everyday drinking. Shows pretty South Coast fruits of green apple, peach and citrus. Drinks clean and pure, with fruity acidity and little or no oak.
title: Mosby 1997 Santa Barbara County Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Gives a real jolt of tropical fruit, even banana, in the nose. Drinks ripe and rich, with big Santa Barbara fruit. Yet it seems a little disjointed, as if the parts weren't coming together. Might be better in a year.
title: Foxen 1997 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Dominant oak notes impact this wine in both taste and aroma, providing caramel- and tropical vanilla-like sweetness. It offers anise and pineapple flavors within its light-bodied frame.
title: Frei Brothers 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Banana custard and charred marshmallow scents show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is similar, with charred brioche and cream pie flavors.
title: Testarossa 2014 Cuvée 107 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Full and ripe, this wine offers thick meaty flavors of pineapple and peach, finishing in sweet vanilla oak.
title: Ca' Momi 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Aromas of white peach, honeysuckle and butterscotch are clean but quite plump on the nose of this widely available bottling. Tons of ripe stone fruit show on the palate, along with juicy apples and warm melons, cut by only the slightest acidity.
title: Castle Rock 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Strong aromas of pear cider, ripe apples, honey and a slight nuttiness show on the nose of this bottling. That cider flavor continues into the sip, where browned apples and sour-lime flavors show most prominently.
title: Travis 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara)

description: Aged entirely in neutral French oak, this wine takes a light, simplistic approach in its presentation of golden honey apple and pear flavor.
title: Bowman Cellars 2015 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This medium-bodied wine opens with a squeeze of acidity and follows through with simple and straightforward citrus flavors.
title: AuburnJames 2014 Berry Lane Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Richly fruity and semisweet, this medium-bodied wine smells like cotton candy and tastes like pear syrup. Smooth in texture and mouth-filling in concentration, it finishes on lingering sweetness.
title: Tortoise Creek 2015 Jam's Blend Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Low in oak and high in acidity, this wine shows an earthy underbelly of lemon met by more nuanced vanilla.
title: Viszlay Vineyards 2013 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This widely available white is unfussy and medium bodied, with toasted oak and baked apple flavors, brightened by a squeeze of lemon.
title: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: A large production offering, this white is simple and direct in its expression of the variety, remaining steely and low in oak on the palate, with a depth of green apple and melon fruit.
title: Decoy 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: From four estate vineyards, this wine appears to be low in oak and extra crisp in mouthfeel, offering austere apple and citrus elements with a slight metallic edge.
title: Thomas George 2013 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Faint aromas of lemon peel, apple peel and Meyer lemon pith show on the nose of this county blend bottling. Earthy clay-like notes meet with tangy citrus, sliced apple and pear flesh.
title: Lyric by Etude 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: A heavy frosting of sweet oak aroma and flavor covers this otherwise soft and unassuming wine. It smells like custard, tastes like pastry and has a butterscotch note on the finish.
title: William Hill Estate 2014 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: This bottling shows the sweeter side of the Chardonnay, offering honeydew, lemon blossom and pear cider notes on the nose. The acidity is powerful upon first taste, yielding to peach, nectarine and ripe apple flavors, which come across as confected after a couple of sips.
title: Robert Hall 2015 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: This basic, intensely ripe wine shows less fruit and acidity than toasty spice and oak. Fruit is sourced from Sangiacomo Vineyards and the wine fermented in both barrels and stainless steel.
title: Educated Guess 2014 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Toasted hazelnuts, lime zest and broad peach notes show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is relatively flat and easy with yellow apples and a tang of lemongrass with a buttered finish.
title: Chessman 2014 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: The tropical nose on this wine is inviting at first, then seems sweet, with aromas of Key lime and guava sorbet. Fruit-punchy flavors pop on the palate, where honeydew melon, peach, apple juice and tuberose battle for attention.
title: Limited by Cambridge Cellars 2015 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This wine is intensely full bodied and rich in creamy vanilla, showing plenty of oak influence and ripeness on the palate.
title: Pezzi King 2013 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Fairly shy on the nose, this wine eventually shows lemon pith, lemon candy and slightly sweet aromas. The flavors start crisp but go quickly flatter, with light Pink Lady apples and a touch of orange rinds.
title: Reinert Project 2014 All In Reserve Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Squeezed lime, pear shavings and poached apple arise on the nose of this bottling. There is a tingling and tactile acidity on the sip, but only very light flavors of green pear and lime rind.
title: Clos LaChance 2015 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: A confectionary note of marshmallow gives way to lighter intimations of citrus and sour-apple skin, making for a confusing combination of ripeness and tartness.
title: Fogline Vineyards 2014 Zephyr's Block Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This wine is both intensely ripe and veering on sugary, while not offering much in terms of body. It becomes somewhat flat on the finish.
title: Byington 2014 Tin Cross Harrison Block Reserve Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: A heavy dose of oak and spice flavors dominate the pear notes in this full-bodied, full-flavored and rather thick-textured wine.
title: Republic of Wine 2014 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: Made in stainless-steel tanks and a mix of French and American oak barrels, this new, low-priced, low-in-alcohol white is straightforward in its rich layers of butterscotch and tropical vanilla, with a roundness that many will find attractive.
title: We Are Sonoma NV Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: High in acidity and low in oak, at least on the palate, and indeed aged in a majority of neutral French barrels, this wine is bright in lemon and green apple, with a suggestion of mango, falling somewhat flat on the finish.
title: Grgich Hills 2013 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Baked pineapple and burnt sugar rise out of the glass before the palate unfurls a super-concentrated body and big presence of oak, the texture and tension of the wine still looking for resolution.
title: Scott Family 2014 Estate Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Full-bodied with a hearty presence of oak and tertiary wood flavors, this wine offers plenty of sour lemon and shy acidity.
title: Wellington 2013 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This is thick, quite ripe and full-bodied wine rich in baked apple and vanilla custard, the layers concentrated and veering on sweet.
title: Michel-Schlumberger 2014 Platinum Collection Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Lightly seared lemons, cut pear and a touch of butter show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is simple and easy to drink with light apple, nectarine and lime touches.
title: Cycles Gladiator 2014 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This full-bodied, generously oaked and caramel-laden wine starts to show overripe flavors and textures on the palate, becoming heavy on the finish.
title: Bluenose 2014 Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Tropical guava, flint and lemon chiffon combine for a mild-mannered expression of the variety untethered by oak, the wine said to have no barrel treatment whatsoever. An easygoing quaff, it goes down without nuance or fussiness, finishing clean and lean.
title: Folie à Deux 2014 Limited Release Unoaked Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: A light citrus and pine scent is the first impression then the flavors of this medium-bodied wine turn to ripe pear and apple notes. It feels full and smooth on the tongue. It's a nice choice when you're on a budget.
title: Illuminate 2013 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: Muted aromatics tease on the nose before chewy texture and full-bodied weight enter the scene. Deceptively light and airy at first, the wine then delves into a hearty taste of marzipan and oak.
title: Frisson Wines 2013 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Fans of oaky wines will like this one for its showy butter and vanilla aromas, flavors full of caramel, butter and vanilla, and almost-thick texture.
designation: Teal Bartolucci Vineyards Big Valley Ranch Organically Grown Grapes
title: Chacewater 2013 Teal Bartolucci Vineyards Big Valley Ranch Organically Grown Grapes Chardonnay (Lake County)

description: Extremely light on aromas, this bottling eventually shows lemon peel, chalk and slate. The palate is simple yet clean, with flavors of pear, nectarine and lime peels.
title: Liberty School 2014 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Very shy in aromas, this wine eventually offers slight minerality and the faintest whiff of white peach. The palate is also light, though not unpleasant, showing fresh lime zest and melon flavors.
title: Lucas & Lewellen 2014 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Punchy peach, mango, guava and nearly bubblegum aromas make for a very ripe and tropical nose on this wine. It's easy to sip, like a lazy summer day, with coconut-oil flavors cut by lemon juice.
title: Broken Earth 2013 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Extremely ripe and tropical aromas of tuberose, jasmine and apple blossoms prove quite overpowering on the nose of this wine. The palate shows lots of apple juice flavors and trends toward banana and pineapple tropicality.
title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2014 Fleur de Edna Winemaker Series Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: There's quite a showy, fragrant nose on this widely available bottling, with apple blossoms, tuberose and a touch of quinine. The palate also takes on a gin-and-tonic character, powered by lime juice, white peach and botanical notes.
title: Castle Rock 2014 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Nectarine flesh and a hint of guava combine for a rather tropical-leaning nose on this wine from the famed Hollywood director's collection. A straightforward and very ripe Gala apple character characterizes the palate, boosted by honeysuckle and tangerine, laid across a decently grippy texture.
title: Francis Coppola 2014 Diamond Collection Gold Label Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: This is an intense, somewhat unformed vineyard-designate, ripe with sweet tannins that takes on considerable barrel flavors of vanilla and caramel.
title: Acacia 2013 Thornton Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
