description: The nose of this widely available wine jumps from condensed apples and honey to cut pear on the more broad whiffs. The flavors are light and a tad ripe, with red apples, citrus and orange juice flavors.
title: MooBuzz 2014 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Canned pears and plumeria show on the nose of this bargain-priced offering, worthy of a weeknight dinner or later in the evening. The palate shows lots of ripe stone fruit, apple syrup and tangy citrus, the finish delivering a lasting acidity.
title: Mandolin 2014 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: The nose of this light-colored wine offers showy apple blossom and pineapple aromas, leaning into the ripe and tropical side of the grape spectrum. it delivers crisp energy once sipped, with very fruit-forward apple flavors and even a touch of guava.
title: Jason-Stephens 2013 Select Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Crisp and firm-textured, this wine has savory, lightly herbal aromas, flavors like pear juice and mineral water, and an engaging, rather thick mouthfeel that helps the flavors seems layered and complex.
title: Silver Palm 2013 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: There's a chalky tartness to this young wine, a single-vineyard designate from a consistent source. Gravenstein apple and a suggestion of honey star on the nose and palate around a medium body and finish.
title: Krutz 2014 Magnolia Inspiration Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Full bodied and quite ripe, this wine has a taste of Good & Plenty licorice around a core of vanilla custard and toasty oak. It is 100% varietal.
title: Dusk to Dawn 2013 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Lots of stone fruit ripeness marks the nose of this wine, with aomas of nectarine and peach cut by the sharpness of apple skins. The palate is all green apples and lime juice.
title: Magnolia Court 2013 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Coming in a sparkly package befitting its name, this boxed wine shows honeysuckle and pineapple on the nose. On the palate, green apple flesh and pink apple skins prove tart and ripe at the same time, though without tons of body or finish. It's a solid deal though!
title: Jewelry Box 2012 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: A Chardonnay for those who love pungent florality, this stainless-steel study offers showy apple and pear blossoms aromas along with extreme jasmine and tuberose. Those flavors are reflected on the sip, which also offers fruity pear cider yet retains crispness.
title: Wrath 2014 Ex Anima Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Fresh peach and light floral aromas lead to ripe, grapey flavors and a soft, soothing texture in this medium-bodied wine. It is smooth and low in acid, with a charming flowery element that helps it stand out.
title: McFadden 2014 Chardonnay (Potter Valley)

description: Brown sugar and brown apple betty figure into this wine's aroma and flavor profile, making for a slightly overdone quality of ripeness. Slightly tropical as it moves along, the finish is robust in size and body.
title: Eaglewood 2014 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Low in oak and high in acidity, this wine skews tart and high-strung in terms of citrus and wet stone-like notions, offering a bouquet of lemon chiffon. A nice entry and finish surround a less-intriguing middle.
title: Ministry of the Vinterior 2013 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Flavors are restrained in this medium-bodied wine, so there are not a lot of fruits or herbs to shout out. However, it has a straightforward appeal and will make an unobtrusive pairing with many foods because it has a good, crisp mouth feel.
title: City Winery Chicago 2013 Elevated Chardonnay Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: This has attractive peach and floral aromas and flavors, medium to full body, and a soft texture that is bolstered slightly by appley acidity.
title: McFadden 2014 Blue Quail Chardonnay (Potter Valley)

description: Fuzzy stone fruit from apricot to peach dominate on the nose and palate in this straightforward, creamy and richer-styled wine. Batches of apple and lemon give it a crisp edge toward the middle before denser crème brûlée and vanilla take over on the finish.
title: Custard 2013 Comfort Wine Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Slightly sour elements of lemon and lime meet with a riper nectarine tone on the nose of this wine. There is good citrus-driven acidity on the palate with limeade flavors, though it trends a bit sour and wipes up with not much finish.
title: Lockwood 2013 San Lucas Unoaked Pure Chardonnay (San Lucas)

description: Softly sweet, this brings bright Fuji apple and Anjou pear aromas and flavors. It charms with fresh fruit character and stays away from the dry balance of more serious wines.
title: Gen5 2013 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: This shows a bright yellow-gold color and light lemon and butter aromas. Pronounced butter, lemon and almond flavors almost overwhelm the lean texture. Tart in taste and light in texture, it refreshes the mouth.
title: JCB 2012 N 76 Chardonnay (Marin County)

description: The stainless-steel style reveals lots of green-leaning fruit on this wine: green pear, green banana and kiwi, altogether quite tropical. Similarly, the palate shows lime pith, apple blossoms and apple soda, moving toward a sour and bitter sensation as well.
title: Donati Family Vineyard 2013 Sister's Forever Unoaked Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: With aromas like butter and custard, and flavors that suggest ripe apple and crisp lemon, this is both refreshing and multifaceted. It feels light bodied and has a bit of a sweet-tart balance going for it.
title: Peltier 2013 Hybrid Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Exotic guava and pineapple form a profile of tartness that evolves into intriguing layers of dried herb and lemongrass in this white from a slightly cooler section of the Napa Valley. Medium in body and length, it is tight in minerality.
title: Monticello Vineyards 2013 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

description: This juicy middleweight is well-integrated in terms of oak and ripeness. Salty lime and pear interplay on the palate, finishing crisp and clean.
title: Beaucanon 2012 Ehlers Lane Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This medium-bodied white features balanced oak that manages to play off flavors of baked apple and butterscotch with compelling swathes of saltiness. This wine will work well with seafood as a result, and make for a decent match with midweek meals.
title: Luke Donald 2012 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Ripe in honey, butterscotch and oak, this wine was 100% barrel-fermented and it shows, an old-school tale of hedonistic richness and power over subtlety. It makes for a difficult food pairing, but aiming for something as treacly as the wine might be the best bet.
title: Newton 2012 Unfiltered Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A reluctant nose eventually shows the familiar hints of vanilla cream and lemon peel. It's a very straightforward Chard, with citrus and oak elements on full display. It's easy to drink but standard.
title: 10Span 2012 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Freshly squeezed lime, tangelos and mandarin orange elements power the nose on this wine sourced from near Greenfield. The palate shows a wide array of citrus as well as nectarine flesh and a nearly sweet honeysuckle.
title: Cinnabar 2013 Central Avenue Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Caramelized apples and toasted squash-seed aromas arise from this wine, which offers good zing but a more oxidized style on the palate. Flavors of nut-based syrups, dried citrus and slightly sour orange juice arise once sipped.
title: Sarah's Vineyard 2012 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Basketball star John Salley is the spokesman for this eco-minded project by Clos La Chance. The wine offers aromas of wet granite and fermenting apples. The flavors are similar, showing pear, slate and green-apple skins.
title: Clos La Chance 2013 The Vegan Vine Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: A plush ripeness pushes on the palate, with a taste of baked apple and tropical fruit that falls flat somewhat on the finish, its layers of oaky vanilla disappearing in a mist.
title: Graton Ridge 2012 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Elusive aromas mask an easygoing, straightforward white from the heart of the Russian River Valley. Characterized by matchstick and melon, it offers layering the back palate with additional flavors of apple and pear.
title: MacMurray Ranch 2013 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The entry-level offering for Rajat Parr's luxury brand, this is barely noticeable on the nose, with mere hints of melon. On the palate, it's pleasantly Chardonnay-like but quite naked and flat in flavor.
title: Sandhi 2012 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Golden in color, this full-bodied, oaky Chardonnay adds in 4% Sauvignon Blanc. Aged 16 months in French oak, it offers ripe fruit ripe that borders on confectionary.
title: Flying Horse 2012 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Muted aromatically this wine is oaky and verging on sweet, a tad out of balance in terms of alcohol and power. The finish is quick.
title: Schweiger 2012 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Spring Mountain District)

description: Crisp at first, this evolves into a ripe, juicy expression of considerable concentration and weight. Baked apple and caramel-toffee are layered throughout a broad-shouldered midpalate with a hit of spice on the finish.
title: Aver Family Vineyards 2012 Inspiration Gap's Crown Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Light and charming, this offers floral aromas, tropical fruit flavors, perhaps a touch of sweetness, a smooth texture, medium body and appley finish. It should be refreshing when well chilled.
title: Ironstone 2013 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Aromas are wintery in baking spices and cinnamon stick. Flavors follow suit, awash in rich vanilla and butterscotch with a layering of ripe tropical fruit and apple.
title: Truett Hurst 2012 Swallowtail Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The deep gold-brown color hints that this will be something unusual. Made in an overtly oaky style, this smells toasty and buttery and tastes like that too. Some will love it but more fruit flavor would balance out the apparently heavy winemaking inputs.
title: Dante Robere 2012 Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Generous in toasty barrel characteristics of smoky oak and apple crisp, crème brûlée and caramel, this is true to its 100% barrel fermentation and big-boned style.
title: V. Sattui 2012 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: A bit thin on the nose, this has buttery apple juice aromas. The acidity is a bit off, both tart and mixed with vanilla creaminess, and the flavors are slight with apple candy and tart lemon.
title: J. Lohr 2012 Highlands Bench Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This young Chardonnay packs an overpowering array of scents and flavors, and it may get better if they mellow over time. The nose offers grapefruit, guava and vanilla, while the palate is dominated by canned pears.
title: Still Waters 2013 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: A full-bodied wine with a style that incorporates richness in the aromas and restraint in the flavors. It smells sweet and candylike, but tastes dry and oaky. A touch of walnut on the palate adds an austerity that is smoothed over on the finish with a dash of sweet oak.
title: Wattle Creek 2012 Chardonnay (Yorkville Highlands)

description: Aromas of tropical pineapple and lemon are buried somewhat in this mid-weight wine. Nimble in acidity and straightforward in flavor, it finishes a tad abruptly.
title: Michel-Schlumberger 2012 Gold Collection Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: This straightforward wine brings vanilla, citrus and toasted wood to the forefront, with interesting whiffs of petrol as well. It's still tightly wound for a white wine, so waiting until 2016 may reveal more magic.
title: Bridlewood 2012 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: This oaky Chardonnay conveys rich, simple buttered toast and caramel flavors. It has good acidity and some nice tropical fruit and peach ripeness, but the oak overwhelms.
title: Sojourn 2012 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Simple and oaky, but it is also classic California, with ripe, forward apricot, orange and buttered cinnamon toast flavors, wrapped into a creamy texture.
title: Geyser Peak 2012 Water Bend Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Fermented and aged in new French wood barrels as well as two- and three-year old ones , this Chardonnay is too oaky. Caramel, butterscotch and vanilla dominate the underlying lime and pear fruit flavors.
title: Schug 2012 Heritage Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A bit thin, but it shows tropical fruit, citrus, peach, vanilla and buttered toast flavors.
title: Niner 2012 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: With crisp, mouthwatering acidity, this simple wine has a creamy texture housing mango, tangerine and apricot fruit flavors.
title: Clos La Chance 2012 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Oak dominates this wine, which is all about smoky buttered toast, butterscotch and caramel. Somewhere underneath all that is a pretty good Chardonnay, dry and crisp, with tropical fruit, peach and citrus flavors.
title: Sojourn 2012 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: The oak overpowers the limes and mangoes. Despite mouthwatering acidity, the wine is dominated by butterscotch and buttered cinnamon toast.
title: Olabisi 2011 Ceja Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is a simple, over-oaked Chardonnay. You'll find some good pineapple, peach and lemon flavors, but the barrel influence has been heavily laid on, giving it a heaviness of buttered toast and caramel.
title: Sojourn 2012 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: The trick with this wine is to keep it dry and elegant without being austere and uninteresting. The wine straddles that delicate border. It is indeed dry, with suggestions of oak influencing the apricot and tangerine fruit. But it can't quite overcome a certain rusticity.
title: Sequoia Grove 2012 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This Chard did not go through malolactic fermentation, allowing the acidity to stand up to what otherwise would be an overripe wine. It's strong in tropical fruits, peaches, brown sugar, vanilla bean and buttered toast flavors that are soft, direct and one-dimensional.
title: Saddleback 2012 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Jammy in orange, apricot and pineapple fruits, this Chard has an overlay of oak that brings notes of sweet buttered toast and vanilla. It's a simple wine, but has fine acidity.
title: Kessler-Haak 2012 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: The wine feels overworked, with oak used to make it richer. The result is dry, tart and thin, except for all that buttered toast.
title: D.R. Stephens 2012 Estate Chardonnay (Rutherford)

description: Oaky flavors of caramel, honey and butterscotch dominate. It's dry and crisp in acidity, with suggestions of limes and mangoes.
title: Balverne 2012 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This coastal Chardonnay is ripe and forward in apricots, orange and mangoes, bright in acidity and strong in oaky flavors of buttered toast.
title: Bernardus 2012 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: The price makes this Chardonnay a pretty good bargain. It's dry and crisp in acidity, with a creamy texture housing tropical fruit, peach, lemon custard, honey and buttered toast flavors.
title: Noble Vines 2012 446 Single Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: This simple Chardonnay has candied flavors of pineapples, lemons, vanilla, honey and buttered toast.
title: Folie à Deux 2012 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is your average California Chardonnay, oaky, creamy, soft and forward in tropical fruits, oranges and limes.
title: White Oak 2011 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: New oak dominates this Chardonnay, giving it strong flavors of buttered toast and butterscotch. The acidity is pronounced, and there are ripe mango and pear flavors, but it remains a simple wine.
title: Michael Pozzan 2012 Annabella Special Selection Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Ripe, jammy orange, lime, apricot and mango fruit flavors join with buttered toast and vanilla flavors to make for an opulent, yet simple, Chardonnay. Brisk acidity provides balance.
title: Testarossa 2012 Dahlia Dijon Clones Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: The winery has a track record for producing Chardonnays that are very appealing, though not particularly complex. This wine is rich in tropical fruits, pears and peaches, with buttered toast and vanilla notes, wrapped into a buttery, creamy texture.
title: Black Stallion 2012 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Simple and watery, but not without charm, this Chardonnay has lemon, lime, pear and oak flavors. It's soft, with some herbal interest.
title: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2012 Estate Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Brown sugar and buttered toast flavors dominate this wine, but it's not cloying, because it has lots of acidity. The mango, tangerine and peach flavors testify to exceptional ripeness.
title: San Simeon 2012 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: The oak is so strong that this wine is dominated by buttered toast, butterscotch, caramel and vanilla flavors. The malolactic fermentation adds to the impression of softness and gives the wine a creamy finish.
title: Bello Family Vineyards 2011 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: The flavors of pineapples, oranges, peaches and mangoes give this Chardonnay a fruit- juice sweetness. You'll find just enough acidity for balance, but it's still pretty candied.
title: J. Lohr 2011 Highlands Bench Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: A ripe white tasting of lemon chiffon that's sharp with an edge of acidity, yet softly textured. The wine's finish is quick.
title: Barra of Mendocino 2011 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: This is one of those Chardonnays that takes ripe fruit and then drenches it in oak. It's all too much. The orange, apricot and mango flavors have a buttered toast, caramelized richness that turns cloying despite brisk acidity.
title: Lafond 2010 Lafond Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Sweet oak, buttered toast and caramel flavors dominate this Chardonnay, overwhelming flavors of tropical fruits at the core. The palate feels soft, making the oak even more pronounced.
title: Flying Horse 2009 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Buttered toast, popcorn and butterscotch flavors mark this Chardonnay. The underlying wine struggles to come through, but shows good acidity and tropical fruit, lime and orange flavors.
title: Ferrari-Carano 2011 Tré Terre Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Powerful oak dominates this wine, giving it a flavor of buttered toast and a caramel richness. Underlying all the oak, there's tart acidity and flavors of citrus and tropical fruits.
title: Patland 2012 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This Chardonnay underwent aging in new French oak and sur lie battonage, yielding a wine that's certainly rich, but also jammy with flavors of pineapples, oranges and vanilla cream.
title: Midnight 2012 Estate Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Forward fruit and oak flavors mark this clean, swift Chardonnay. The palate boasts apricot, papaya and buttered toast flavors, balanced with crisp acidity.
title: Artesa 2012 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is your basic California Chardonnay with oak, orange, Meyer lemon and papaya flavors. Produced without malolactic fermentation, the palate is vibrant with acidity.
title: Mandolin 2012 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: This wine is dominated by oak. It's all about buttered toast, vanilla and butterscotch. Underneath is a ripe Chardonnay with tropical fruit flavors, but brightened by a shower of brisk acidity.
title: Dierberg 2011 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Oak dominates the palate with buttered toast and butterscotch flavors, as well as a buttered popcorn character, likely attributable to malolactic fermentation. The underlying fruits suggest pineapples and peach jam.
title: Reata 2012 Reata Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is a good, straightforward Chardonnay with buttercream, vanilla, tropical fruit and citrus flavors.
title: Arrowood 2011 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This accessible Chardonnay is honeyed on the palate with apricot, tangerine, peach and oak flavors. It has good coastal acidity for balance.
title: Pessagno 2012 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Sweetly aromatic of jasmine, this Chardonnay has a core of honey, apple and caramel, and is pleasantly crisp and balanced. Accessible and well-priced, it's a solid and friendly go-to white for just about any occasion.
title: McManis 2012 Chardonnay (River Junction)

description: Kunde's Reserve is all about the oak-rich buttered toast, caramel and butterscotch flavors. It overshadows the underlying fruit, but makes for a decadently pleasant sip.
title: Kunde 2012 Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Ripe tangerine, peach jam, vanilla and oak flavors are penetrating in this soft, creamy Chardonnay. It's a ripe, rich wine that's widely appealing.
title: Kunde 2012 C.S. Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: This is a nice Chard to drink now. It's creamy and smooth with tangerine, peach, apricot, vanilla and oak flavors.
title: Angeline 2012 Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Tropical fruit, peach, pear, green apple and lime flavors mark this fruity Chardonnay. It has prominent vanilla and buttered toast flavors, with a nice hit of acidity for balance.
title: Newton 2012 Red Label Chardonnay (Napa County)

description: A straightforward Chardonnay rich in vanilla and lemon meringue that finds its footing, teeter-tottering between crisp and oaky.
title: Josh Cellars 2011 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: Oak dominates this Chardonnay, with buttered toast and butterscotch flavors engulfing underlying tropical and citrus fruits. It's easy drinking and accessible, but without a lot of complexity.
title: Byron 2011 Nielson Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Tasted in August, crisp acidity gave this Chardonnay a slight effervescence that may disappear by the time you taste it. The sparkliness, however, actually is a welcome balance to rich, ripe pineapple, peach, vanilla and buttered toast flavors.
title: Evening Land 2011 Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: New French oak brings plenty of buttered toast and vanilla to this sweet, rather simple Chardonnay. It's a wine with universal appeal, with bright pineapple, lemon-meringue pie and honeysuckle flavors.
title: Amici 2012 Olema Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This Chardonnay has fine acidity and even some minerality giving a bracing edge to ripe tropical fruit, peach and citrus flavors. It's heavily oaked, though, and has a soft ripeness that makes the wine almost off dry.
title: Black Stallion 2011 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Standard Napa Valley Chardonnay, with citrus, peach and herb flavors, enriched with all the bells and whistles of oak, malolactic fermentation and lees aging, and balanced with brisk, lemony acidity.
title: Bell 2012 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Yountville)

description: The winery turns to this Monterey appellation to up their Chardonnay games. The wine is lush and oaky, with intensely ripe tangerine and apricot flavors.
title: Vina Robles 2012 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: There's lots of brisk, mouthwatering acidity in this Chardonnay. It shows clean, pure apricot, orange, tropical fruit and lime flavors, with a touch of honey and buttery oak.
title: Muirwood 2012 Reserve Zanetta Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: This is a lush, ripe wine with honey, vanilla extract, orange and lime flavors that have the caramelized sweetness of oak. Crisp acidity fortunately provides balance, on this good, straightforward Chardonnay.
title: Santa Barbara Winery 2012 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Hits the popular Chardonnay sweet spot right down the middle, with honey, orange, apricot and oak flavors, with a creamy, buttery mouthfeel.
title: Midnight 2011 Estate Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: This is good everyday Chardonnay, showing the creaminess and rich vanilla and fruit flavors people love. The acidity is strong, and the finish falls away a bit, but the citrus and tropical fruit flavors deliver.
title: Irony 2011 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: A pretty good Chardonnay, rich in oak and fruit. The butterscotch, caramel, buttered toast and citrus fruit flavors offer plenty of appeal.
title: Novy 2011 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: It's oaky, leesy and creamy, with buttered toast and caramel flavors dominating the pineapple fruit.
title: Luke Donald 2011 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Hard acidity like a squeeze of lime marks this dry Chardonnay. It's also quite oaky. Shows good citrus and tropical fruit flavors, but is rustic.
title: Gracianna 2012 Suzanne's Blend Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Lemony and tart, with richer notes of orange, cream and buttered toast, this wine offers everyday Chardonnay pleasure at an affordable price.
title: Inception 2010 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: The wine is tart and pretty thin in citrus and peach fruit, leaving the oak to stick out. Still, it does show fine elegance and minerality.
title: Talley 2011 Estate Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Lavish in oak, with buttered toast and sweet caramel dominating the underlying citrus and tropical fruits. The acidity is just fine, providing needed balance, but those woody notes are jarring.
title: Gallo Signature Series 2011 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Lots of oak in this wine. With buttered toast and butterscotch flavors, it overpowers the underlying orange and lemon fruit, which isn't strong enough to stand up under all that wood.
title: Inception 2010 Origin Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: A good, if fairly standard wine, showing all the popular Chardonnay elements. It's dry, crisp and creamy, with fruit and buttered toast flavors.
title: Nitty Gritty 2011 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Not a bad price for a rich, creamy Chardonnay. It's sweet in brown sugar, orange and pineapple jam and vanilla flavors that appeal to the popular style.
title: River Road 2011 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Shows plenty of Chardonnay character, with ripe tropical fruit, peach, buttered toast and vanilla flavors, and a creamy texture. Nothing complicated or fancy going on, just a slightly ripe wine that many Chard fans will like.
title: Camp 2012 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Shows good Chardonnay character, with pleasant citrus and tropical fruit, buttered toast and vanilla flavors. The acidity is fine, but it's watery, lacking depth and fullness. Disappointing from this producer.
title: Foley 2010 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A simple Chardonnay, it has strong acidity and equally strong vanilla, peach and orange flavors. There's even a hint of buttercream.
title: Roche 2012 Stainless Steel Fermented Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: An oaky, full-bodied, warm-climate Chardonnay with long lingering flavors of vanilla and coconut, as well as ripe apple crisp.
title: Wood Family Vineyards 2011 Para Mas Amigas Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Satisfies the Chardonnay sweet tooth, with vanilla, buttered toast and jammy apricot, orange, lime and honey flavors. There's good Central Coast acidity for balance.
title: Bernardus 2011 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Brisk, bright acidity brings a tang to the tropical fruit, pear and citrus fruit flavors. The oak seems a bit prominent, flooding everything with caramelized butterscotch and vanilla extract.
title: Chateau Lettau 2011 Jack's HIll Vineyard Clone 76 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: A very rich and elaborate Chardonnay whose winemaker intervention makes it ponderous. Oak barrels, with their buttered toast, and creamy lees, with their sourdough tartness, are fine as they go. And the pineapple and citrus fruits are ripe and forward. It's all a bit heavy.
title: Santa Barbara Winery 2010 Reserve Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A great everyday Chardonnay with buttered toast, buttered popcorn, pineapple-orange jam and vanilla flavors. Delicate Santa Lucia acidity provides crispness.
title: C. Mondavi & Family 2011 The Divining Rod Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Dry and crisp with creamy vanilla flavors accented with tropical fruits and pears, this is a straightforward wine for everyday enjoyment.
title: Wild Horse 2011 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This is a pretty, easy-going Chardonnay with fine coastal acidity providing a clean counterpoint to the heavy oak. The flavors are of buttered toast, buttered popcorn and orange jam.
title: Ten Acre 2010 Green Acre Hills Sangiacomo Vineyards Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: A good, straightforward Chardonnay with ripe, tropical fruit and pear flavors. It's creamy and oaky, but brightened with crisp acidity.
title: Newton 2011 Chardonnay (Napa County)

description: This is a bold, densely structured wine with vanilla-cream, orange-soda and pineapple-custard flavors. There's good acidity, but it appeals to the modern style with it's ripe, straightforward feel.
title: Godspeed 2010 Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)

description: Ripe and generously oaked on the palate, this Chardonnay has flavors of pineapple jam, buttered toast and buttered popcorn. It's brightened with crisp acidity.
title: Frog's Leap 2011 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Buttered toast, buttered popcorn, butterscotch and vanilla flavors are dominant, but accent ripe, jammy pear and peach flavors on this Chardonnay.
title: Gregory Graham 2011 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: The acidity really brings this Chard together, adding a racy edge to buttered toast, popcorn and orange marmalade flavors. Straightforward, but a good example of the modern California style.
title: Courtney Benham 2011 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is good week-day Chardonnay with buttered toast, orange jam and vanilla flavors. The acidity gives it a clean, vibrant finish.
title: Courtney Benham 2011 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: With all of the buttered toast, buttered popcorn and butterscotch flavors, this Chardonnay's fruit isn't allowed to speak. It has brisk acidity and rich tangerine and mango flavors, but the winemaker's hand feels heavy.
title: Fess Parker 2011 Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This tastes strongly oaked, and it shows in the form of buttered toast and caramel notes. The flavors of mango, pear and apricot meld with the brisk acidity and firm minerality.
title: Fess Parker 2011 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This unoaked effort sure tastes sweet, with flavors of sugared orange, mango and apple juice. The acidity is fine, giving balance to the sweetness.
title: River Road 2011 Un-Oaked Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Gregory Graham's first Lake County Chardonnay, this wine has notes of vanilla custard, lemon and toasty oak.
title: Gregory Graham 2011 Wedge Block Chardonnay (Lake County)

description: The oak is a bit heavy-handed in its buttered toast and caramel flavors. Underneath that veneer is a perfectly nice Chardonnay that has clean, tart citrus, pear and green apple flavors.
title: Mi Sueño 2009 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: One dimensional and clean, this has brisk acidity and a creamy mouthfeel, with pineapple, orange, lime and mineral flavors.
title: Lawer 2011 Duck Shack Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A Chardonnay of heightened acidity, this is fresh, light and banced, with tastes of lemon and pear.
title: Cable Car 2011 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: The oak barrel influence comes across quite strong in this Chardonnay. The wine itself, made from fruit sourced from this mountain appellation in the central part of Sonoma County, is rich in tropical fruit and pear flavors, with zesty acidity.
title: Mi Sueño 2009 Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)

description: Simple and direct, this tastes like blend of apricots, pears and mangos, with a gentle oak touch. It has pleasant acidity and nice warmth from the alcohol. Drink now.
title: Huntington 2011 Costello Vineyard Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Creamy and buttery, this Chardonnay provides satisfying vanilla and tropical fruit flavors that finish on a honeyed note.
title: Pedroncelli 2011 Vintage Selection Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Oak is the strongest element in this Chardonnay, providing dominant buttered toast, butterscotch and caramel aromas and flavors. The wine also has great acidity and ripe flavors of green apple, pear and kiwi.
title: Mi Sueño 2009 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is weighty, creamy and medium to full in body. It has plenty of lime and pear flavors, plus slight brown sugar and vanilla notes.
title: Souverain 2010 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: Flavors of ripe tropical fruit, orange and smoky, sweet oak influence this slightly sweet Chardonnay. It's made in the popular style, with brisk Russian River acidity that provides mouthwatering balance.
title: Lawer 2011 Three Coins Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Rich, ripe and oaky, this shows fruit-forward apricot, orange and pineapple flavors. The mouthfeel is creamy and tastes buttery-sweet. Simple, but appealing in the modern Chardonnay way.
title: Chime 2011 Chardonnay (Napa County)

description: This tastes sweet and creamy, with buttered toast, buttered popcorn and tropical fruit flavors. It's made in the modern style, and despite its shortcomings, it will appeal to many Chardonnay fans.
title: Bell 2011 Chardonnay (Yountville)

description: Too oaky, this is dominated by buttered toast and crème bruûlée flavors. Underneath all that are some nice notes of pineapple, orange and apricot. Drink up.
title: Bluenose 2010 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This shows flavors of honey, tropical fruit, vanilla and smoky oak that are wrapped into a creamy texture. It will satisfy your basic Chardonnay needs.
title: Joanne Weir 2010 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: This seems as sweet as a fruit tart, featuring pineapple and orange jam flavors, with an oaky hit of buttered toast. Brisk acidity provides needed balance, but it's still pretty simple.
title: Rutherford Ranch 2011 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This hits it right in the sweet spot for Chardonnay-loving consumers, with buttered toast, honey and grilled pineapple flavors. It's part of Delicato Family Vineyards' Noble Vines series.
title: Noble Vines 2011 446 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: With its dryness and elegance, this is a good Chardonnay for everyday drinking. The citrus and peach flavors are counterbalanced by an herbal earthiness, like a note of dried sage.
title: Educated Guess 2010 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Buttered toast, buttered popcorn, orange marmalade and lemon zest flavors characterize this lush, creamy Chardonnay.
title: Rutherford Hill 2010 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Not particularly Chardonnay-like, this tastes more like a Sauvignon Blanc, with flavors of citrus, lemongrass, vanilla and honey. It seems a little sweet on the finish, but nicely tart.
title: Counter Punch 2009 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Dry and soft, this is a little earthy, so if you're expecting a big, rich wine this might not be for you. It has dried herb, grilled pineapple and smoky oak flavors.
title: Clos du Val 2010 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A tropically oriented Chardonnay, this has aromatic hints of corn nuts and apricot fuzz, finishing with a taste of sour lemon.
title: Gen5 2011 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: This is too oaky, but it's dry and crisp in acidity, with interesting citrus, tropical fruit and pear flavors. The heavy application of oak results in buttered toast and caramel accents.
title: Gallo Signature Series 2010 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is all about buttered toast, buttered popcorn and orange- and pineapple-soda flavors. Fans of the popular style will love it.
title: Rutherford Hill 2010 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Oak sticks out on this wine, with a buttered-toast note dominating the modest underlying fruit. There's also an herbal quality, which is sometimes found in Napa Valley Chardonnays.
title: Joseph Cellars 2010 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is dry, crisp in acidity and clean, with citrus and tropical fruit flavors. With no oak, the fruit stars. There's a touch of apricot that gives it an eccentric taste.
title: Lincourt 2011 Steel Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Made in the popular style, this has buttered popcorn, pineapple jam, lemon meringue pie and smoky vanilla flavors. It seems a little sweet, but brisk in acidity.
title: Buena Vista 2011 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Ripe flavors of orange and tropical fruit jam abound, with a buttered toast richness from the oak. Its appeal is all upfront, with a simple, popular sweetness.
title: 16X20 2010 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: There are lots of rich, ripe vanilla, buttered toast and tropical fruit flavors in this creamy wine. Brightened with acidity, it will appeal to plenty of Chardonnay fans.
title: Steelhead Vineyards 2010 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This tastes a little vegetal, but it's dry, crisp and creamy, with decent orange and peach flavors.
title: Gracianna 2011 Suzanne's Blend Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: New oak stands out in this slightly sweet Chardonnay, giving a butterscotch taste to the pineapple and fig fruit. It has pleasant acidity.
title: Chamisal Vineyards 2010 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: There's lots of zesty acidity in this ripe, forward Chardonnay. It features fruity flavors of oranges and apricots, with a touch of oak that lends a buttered toast note.
title: Sean Minor 2010 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Seemingly sweet and oaky, this has buttered popcorn, buttered toast and caramel cream flavors. The fruit suggests pineapples and pears.
title: Kunde 2010 Kinneybrook Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: With no oak aging, this Chardonnay stands all by itself. It's defined by brisk acidity and ripe flavors of tangerine, peach and lime pie.
title: Valley of the Moon 2011 Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This tastes very oaky, with notes of buttered toast and sweet, smoky butterscotch dominating the apricot and orange fruit.
title: Lafond 2009 Lafond Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This shows simple flavors of orange and apricot juice wrapped into a creamy texture that seemingly finishes slightly sweet. The best thing is the acidity, which is brisk and stimulating.
title: Dahlia 2010 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: This bottling has a creamy texture, with pleasant, simple flavors of citrus and buttery oak.
title: Franciscan 2010 Cuvée Sauvage Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Elegance, not opulence, marks this Chardonnay. It's very dry and acidic, with citrus, herb and toast flavors. Don't look here for a big, fat, buttery, ripe style, because you won't find it.
title: Longwood 2010 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Made in a style to appeal to many Chardonnay drinkers, this one seems to have sweetness, with flavors of custard, vanilla, butter cream and orange jam.
title: Churchill Cellars 2010 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This wears an oak jacket over its pineapple, orange and honey flavors. Brisk acidity brings a clean finish.
title: Hook & Ladder 2010 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is an estate-grown Chardonnay, with flavors of vanilla, tropical pineapple and guava that are surrounded by an oaky character and a lemony finish.
title: LangeTwins 2010 Reserve Chardonnay (Clarksburg)

description: As sweet as a dessert pastry, with vanilla, cream, toast, butter and pineapple jam flavors. Vibrant acidity provides balance just in time.
title: Michael Pozzan 2010 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Made in the popular style, this will find plenty of fans. It's sweet and creamy in buttered toast, pineapple and pear flavors.
title: Picket Fence 2010 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Few wineries produce an Oakville Chardonnay. This is a soft and heavy effort, with apricot and tangerine flavors.
title: Havens 2009 Chardonnay (Oakville)

description: Made in a style to appeal to the masses, this is a soft, sweet Chardonnay. It's rich in vanilla cream, pineapple and orange jam and buttered toast flavors.
title: Handley 2010 Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: Almost as sweet as a dessert wine, with caramel, butterscotch and honey flavors riding over the underlying pineapple and peach notes. An enjoyable quaff.
title: Eberle 2010 Estate Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Made in a style to appeal to today's Chardonnay fans, this has flavors of buttered toast, popcorn, vanilla, pineapple and Key lime pie, with crisp acidity.
title: Chronicle 2010 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a big, sweet, extracted wine, for those who like Chardonnay packed with fruit. It tastes like buttered popcorn, orange jam, gingerbread and vanilla caramel.
title: Tangley Oaks 2009 Lot #6 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: A solid everyday Chardonnay, showing good pineapple, peach and pear flavors, with a nice edge of buttered toast and vanilla.
title: Stickybeak 2010 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Buttered toast, caramel, vanilla bean, spice and pineapple and orange jam aromas and flavors mark this wine. It's a little sweet and white sugary on the finish.
title: Valley of the Moon 2010 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: A ripe Chardonnay, big and full, with fistfuls of oak influence and a spoonful of sugar to help it go down. Find some rich crab cakes in a creamy sauce and enjoy.
title: Concannon 2010 Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Butterscotch and pineapple and peach jam flavors mark this Chardonnay. Fortunately, it's balanced with crisp acidity and a certain minerality. It's an obvious crowd pleaser, and would score higher except for the seemingly sweet finish.
title: Garnet 2010 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Take a few bucks off the price, and this would be a good value. As things stand, this Chardonnay, which is a blend of Santa Clara Valley and Santa Cruz Mountains fruit, is fairly standard. It's dry and crisp, with pleasant lemon-custard flavors that turn a little unripe on the finish.
title: Sarah's Vineyard 2010 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: At the equivalent of about $6 a bottle, this is a good buy. It's made in the popular Chardonnay style, with pineapple, peach and spice flavors accented by smoky oak.
title: Black Box 2010 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: New oak accounts for only 30% of the barrel regimen, but it dominates this Chardonnay, with buttered toast, vanilla and caramel flavors. Fortunately there's also strong pineapple, Asian pear and apricot fruit, but the oak is too powerful.
title: De Loach 2010 OFS Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Good, in a simple way, with Chardonnay personality that will appeal to lots of people. It's dry and creamy in texture, with bright acidity framing citrus and tropical fruit, peach, mineral and vanilla flavors.
title: RouteStock 2010 Route 121 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Sharp acidity and even some tannins mark this simple Chardonnay. In its favor are savory green apple, peach and lime flavors, with creamy, oaky notes.
title: Markham 2010 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Simple and sugary sweet, with buttered toast, vanilla, orange and pineapple flavors, brightened with a squirt of lime-juice acidity. It's made in a style meant to appeal to millions of Chardonnay lovers.
title: Ministry of the Vinterior 2010 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Not much going on in this soft, direct Chardonnay, besides sweet oak, with its buttered toast, vanilla and butterscotch flavors. Way underneath is pineapple and lemondrop fruit.
title: Frank Family 2010 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: The best thing about this Chardonnay is the acidity, which fortunately balances the sugary orange jam, vanilla cream and buttered toast flavors. Without that crispness, the wine would be nothing but sweetness. Wherever the acidity came from, it's welcome.
title: Stuhlmuller Vineyards 2010 Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Ripe, sweet pineapple and orange jam flavors mark this rather simple, forward Chardonnay. Oak brings even sweeter vanilla, buttered toast and caramel notes. It's designed to appeal to the modern style.
title: Hahn 2010 SLH Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Very acidic, almost sour, which gives the citrus fruit flavors a lemondrop throat lozenge taste. Sure does get the tastebuds whistling.
title: Lincourt 2010 Unoaked Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: The vineyard is a great one, but this Chardonnay tastes way too oaky. It's swamped by buttered toast, vanilla and butterscotch flavors that barely give the underlying pineapple and lemon fruits a chance to express themselves.
title: Merryvale 2009 Hyde Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Shows the weakness of certain Napa Valley Chardonnays, with a dry herbaceous taste that accentuates the acidity and even the tannins. Although there are pineapple and oak flavors, the wine lacks interest.
title: Peter Franus 2010 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Too oaky-sweet, with buttered toast, honey and buttered popcorn flavors overwhelming the natural pineapples and tropical fruits. Lots of people will like it, but for purists, it's too much of a good thing.
title: Riverbench 2009 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Made from organic grapes and packaged in a 500-ml Tetra Pak, this Chard is made from ripe fruit with a toasty caramel molasses halo around it, and finishes sweet. It would be quite drinkable on a camping trip or tailgate party.
title: CalNaturale 2009 Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: This is a sweet, oaky Chardonnay, made to appeal to the modern palate. It has sugary pineapple, green apple, pear, buttered toast and vanilla custard flavors, fortunately brightened with zesty acidity.
title: L de Lyeth 2010 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Almost as sweet as a dessert wine, with buttered toast, honey, caramel corn and pineapple jam fruit flavors. There's good acidity, but the sweetness makes it simple.
title: Calera 2010 Thirty-Fifth Anniversary Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Fruity and oaky, with pineapple cream, tangerine sorbet and buttered toast flavors. Made in a ripe, opulent California style.
title: William Hill Estate 2006 Estate Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Chardonnay has not been Trefethen's strong point, and this '08 doesn't change that perspective. It's soft in structure and candied, with simple apricot, pear and oak flavors that finish sweet.
title: Trefethen 2008 Harmony Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

description: Too sweet for comfort, with sugary pear, nectarine and orange flavors, liberally enhanced with caramelized oak. Shows good acidity, but really needs to be drier.
title: Pezzi King 2010 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Made in the modern style, this is a simple, sweet Chardonnay, with pineapple and pear jam, buttered toast, honey and vanilla flavors.
title: 401K 2009 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This certified-green grown Chardonnay that has a pronounced aroma of green olive brine and is also most definitely toasty and tropical, finishing sweet. Would this make a happy companion on a picnic? Yes it would.
title: it. 2009 Estate Grown Reserve Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: This unoaked Chard has a fragrant floral nose, a lot of grapefruit and stone fruit flavor and slight sweetness with a mineral chaser on the finish.
title: Healdsburg Ranches 2010 Unoaked Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: A bit metallic and brittle. But there's plenty of sweet pineapple and mango fruit, and enough oak to give a buttered toast richness.
title: Cameron Hughes 2009 Lot 232 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: The vineyard is a good one, and the underlying wine is rich in pineapples, green apples, lemons and limes, brightened with brisk acidity. However, the oak is heavy-handed.
title: Peter Paul Wines 2009 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a strongly flavored Chardonnay. It packs a punch in ripe tropical citrus fruit, pear and vanilla oak flavors that are honey sweet on the finish. The acidity provides balance, but seems awkwardly applied.
title: VJB 2010 Gabriella Ranch Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Lots of oak on this Chardonnay, which is dominated by toothpicky vanilla and buttered toast aromas and flavors. Underneath is a fine, crisp wine, with tangerine and sweet Meyer lemon flavors.
title: Paraiso Vineyards 2009 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: The winery describes this as having little to no oak aging, and certainly, the grape fruit stars. Pineapples, Meyer lemons, limes and kiwis are front and center, accented with brisk Central Coast acidity.
title: Wrath 2010 Ex Anima Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Smells and tastes too oaky, with buttered toast and vanilla notes smothering everything else. Somewhere down in there is a pretty nice Chardonnay, with good acidity and fine pineapple, pear and apple flavors.
title: Clos Pegase 2009 Mitsuko's Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A ponderous Chardonnay, marked by excessive new oak flavors and the heavy hand of the winemaker. Shows pineapple, pear and tangerine flavors, but the barrel and malolactic additions soften and sweeten them.
title: Cinnabar 2008 Skyland Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Oak stands out on this Chardonnay, offering buttered toast and vanilla flavors. The wine underneath is a little thin in fruit, but it has nice Monterey acidity.
title: J. Lohr 2009 October Night Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Like tasting toothpicks. New oak accounts for just 40% of the aging, yet dominates with caramel, vanilla and buttered toast. Somewhere below are pineapple, pear, lime and honey flavors. Will appeal to Chardophiles who enjoy this New World style.
title: Artesa 2009 Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Light, bright and balanced, this inexpensive Chardonnay is not complex and could use a little oomph in there somewhere, but has enough apple and pear flavor to get you through.
title: Sharabella Wines 2009 Mery nel Cielo Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: A well-priced, easy-to-like Lake County Chardonnay with lots of minerality and lemony richness that starts to fall flat and sweet on the finish. A little more acidity and a little less sugar would have made this a better wine.
title: Cache Creek Vineyards 2008 Chardonnay (Lake County)

description: Oaky and jammy, with pineapple and tangerine flavors in a creamy texture. Designed to appeal to the American sweet tooth for Chardonnay.
title: Merriam 2009 Simoneau Ranch Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Soft and simple, with oak-infused pineapple, pear and buttered toast flavors. A decent everyday Chard in the modern style.
title: Graton Ridge 2009 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Made in the ripe, sweet, oaky California style, this barrel-fermented Chardonnay has flavors of pineapples, pears, peaches, buttered toast and vanilla cream, balanced with crisp acidity.
title: Y Rousseau 2009 Milady Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)

description: Deeply colored in gold, this Chardonnay already is showing signs of premature aging. The pineapple and mango fruit is drying out, showing a nutty edge, as in cashews and macadamias. Oak sticks out a bit clumsily.
title: Sonoma Coast Vineyards 2009 Gold Ridge Hills Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Way too oaky, with caramel, buttered toast and smoky vanilla flavors dominating the fruit beneath. There's a sound, crisp, citrusy wine down there, but the winemaker needs to let it, not the oak, star.
title: Pfendler 2009 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: From the Seven Deadly Zins folks, a sweet, oaky Chardonnay with honeysuckle, apricot and vanilla slathered all over its full body.
title: Seven Heavenly Chards 2010 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Shows all the hallmarks of the modern style of Chardonnay, with lots of ripe citrus and oak. The wine has too much oak, though, and is dominated by caramelized wood and sweet vanilla flavors that swamp the fruit.
title: William Hill Estate 2008 Bench Blend Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A flowery, middle of the road Chardonnay with baked sour apple and citrus predominating, it's fine at the price and a reasonable mid-week option with roast chicken.
title: Fenestra 2009 Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Tastes old and tired, losing fruit and turning herbal, nutty and earthy, with dried apricot and orange flavors. Interesting from a connoisseur's point of view, but it's hard to tell why Mayacamas held back this wine for so long.
title: Mayacamas 2008 Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)

description: Brisk in mouthwatering acidity and ripe in pineapple and apricot flavors. It's so ripe, it tastes botrytized, except that it's totally dry. Feels rough and challenging.
title: In Re 2009 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Powerful and intense in flavors of pineapples, mangoes, sweet cream and buttered popcorn, with good acidity. Flamboyant, but it feels over-worked and too sweet.
title: Estancia 2007 Reserve Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: This bottling seems to be getting sweeter over the past vintages. The '08 is distinctly sugary, with jammy orange and lime flavors. It's cloying after the first sip.
title: Carmel Road 2008 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Made in the simple modern style of lots of caramelized oak and sweet fruit, with no particular subtlety. Shows powerful tangerine, pineapple, apple and honey flavors.
title: Terra Sonoma 2009 Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Made in the popular style, this Chardonnay has ripe fruit flavors of pineapples, limes and mangoes, and strong oak notes of vanilla and buttered toast.
title: Kunde 2009 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Made in the popular style, this sweet, direct Chardonnay has orange, lime and pineapple fruit juice flavors. Crisp acidity gives it much needed zest.
title: Carmel Road 2009 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Made in the ripe, oaky style, this Chardonnay has buttered popcorn, caramel candy, pineapple marmalade and vanilla flavors. An appealing, direct wine to drink now.
title: Davis Family 2008 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Simple and concocted, with layers of sweet, caramelized oak, pineapple jam and buttered popcorn. Good acidity makes it bracing. Lots of people will like it, but it needs to be drier and more interesting at this price.
title: Fleming Jenkins 2009 Jenkins Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Too oaky, with toothpicky vanilla and caramel flavors swamping the underlying fruit. Too bad, because the basic wine is nice and crisp in pineapples.
title: Novy 2009 Rosella's Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Made in the popular style, this Chardonnay offers ripe pineapple, orange jam, buttered popcorn and spice flavors. It's soft and a little sweet.
title: Hanna 2009 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Simple and direct in oaky, fruity pineapple and lemon jam flavors, this Chardonnay tastes a little sweet. It's made in the modern style, appealing if not particularly complex. Drink now.
title: Presqu'ile 2009 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Lots of sweet oak on this Chardonnay, giving it domineering buttered toast and caramel flavors. The underlying wine is rich and ripe in pineapples.
title: Carmel Hills Winery 2009 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: An easy Chardonnay, simple and pleasing in pineapple jam, tangerine, sweet vanilla and buttered toast flavors. Ready to drink now.
title: Calcareous 2009 Twisted Sisters Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: A rather simple Chardonnay made in the modern style, with lots of flamboyance and flash, but not much subtlety. Strong and rich in pineapple and peach jam flavors, it's brightened with zesty acidity.
title: Textbook 2009 Fin de Journée Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Dry and acidic, with sweet and sour Lifesaver pineapple and lemon candy flavors. Made in an easy-to-like style. Production was 4,500 cases, and the alcohol is a modest 13%.
title: Sonoma-Loeb 2009 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: An everyday Chardonnay with a creamy texture and oak-inspired buttered toast notes. The underlying fruit has pineapple and orange flavors.
title: Mossback 2009 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Made in an oaky, creamy style to appeal to popular tastes, this Chardonnay has jammy pineapple flavors. It's brisk in acidity and is somewhat simple, but the price isn't bad.
title: Rutherford Ranch 2009 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Nicely dry and crisp, with some good pineapple flavors enriched with oak. Loses points, however, due to a certain vegetal character that's compounded by the fruit starting to fall out.
title: Hahn 2007 SHL Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Creamy and polished, with good acidity and pleasant citrus, buttered popcorn and mineral flavors. Could be a little more complex.
title: Wellington 2009 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: A pretty, polished and simple wine that shows the buttery creaminess, toast, popcorn and pineapple jam flavors people like. Easy to find, with more than 17,000 cases produced.
title: Santa Barbara Winery 2009 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: From the Langtry Estate in Guenoc, Lake County, this has very intense pineapple on the nose and palate, and is rich and sweet on the finish. Pair it with spicy food or something briny from the sea.
title: Guenoc 2009 Chardonnay (Lake County)

description: Tastes tired, with jammy tropical fruit flavors starting to drop out. Still shows vibrant acidity, but the fresh fruit character, the most likeable part of such Chardonnays, is disappearing, replaced by more herbal and vegetal notes.
title: Fog Crest 2007 Estate Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A rich, oaky, fruity Chardonnay with lots of tropical fruit flavors. Pretty standard, but the price is pretty good for this style.
title: Sebastiani 2008 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Made in the modern style of lots of ripe tropical fruit, green apple and creamy oak flavors, this Chardonnay is uplifted by bright, citrusy acidity. Drink it now.
title: Jax 2009 Y3 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A modern, popular Chardonnay made with very ripe tropical and pear fruit flavors and a strong oaky influence. Not very subtle, but will satisfy fans of the style.
title: Inception 2009 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: So sweet and caramelized in smoky oak, it tastes almost like a dessert wine. There might even be some leftover sugar in the wine. Yet it has brisk, refreshing acidity, and there's no denying the deliciousness of the pineapple and lemon-pie flavors.
title: Costa de Oro 2008 Gold Coast Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Made in the modern style of oaky softness and jammy ripe fruit. Shows appealing pineapple, pear, buttered toast and vanilla cream flavors, with just enough acidity for balance.
title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2008 Foggy Oaks Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Rich flavors of peaches, pears, buttercream and toast appear in this dry Chardonnay, which shows no signs of tiredness, although many 2007s do. The chief problem is excessive softness. It lacks balancing acidity and brightness.
title: Hopper Creek 2007 Los Chamizal Vineyards Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Too sweet and jammy to earn a higher score. Although the acidity is nice and bright, the wine tastes almost cloying in pie-filling pineapples, apricots, mangoes and honey. Needs to be drier, firmer, more nuanced.
title: Acacia 2008 Winery Lake Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Lots of forward fruit in this Chard that's made in the popular style. Brims with pineapple jam, pear, buttered popcorn and caramel flavors, in a buttercream texture.
title: Terlato 2008 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Fruity, with scads of pineapple, green apple, mango and vanilla cream flavors, brightened with crisp acidity. It's made in the popular style, at a popular price.
title: A By Acacia 2008 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Thin and acidic, with just the barest suggestion of grapefruit juice. Maybe some pineapples. Earns an extra point or two for dryness and elegance, but really lacks richness.
title: Jordan 2008 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: With sweet, vanilla custard and buttered popcorn flavors piled onto the golden apricot and pineapple jam fruit, this Chardonnay is made in the popular style. It's refreshed with clean, crisp acidity.
title: Tangley Oaks 2007 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: As sweet as buttered popcorn and a pineapple-lemon tart dessert pastry. Will appeal to the popular style, but would benefit from greater dryness and nuance.
title: Pietra Santa 2008 Signature Collection Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)

description: This Chardonnay is from the big San Bernabe Vineyard. It's rich and forward in pineapple jam, pear and lemon flavors. The oak seems overly elaborated, but it sure is opulent in vanilla and críªme brulée.
title: Fog Head 2008 Limestone Ridge Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: New oak constitutes 40% of the barrel regime, but it dominates, with toothpicky sweet, caramelized vanilla aromas and flavors. Beneath that is lemon and green apple fruit. Production was 8,000 cases.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 2008 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Brisk acidity marks this wine, giving it a mouthwatering quality, and the flavors veer toward lemons, limes and grapefruits, with a richer touch of nectarine and pear. It's a good, everyday Chardonnay, at a fair price.
title: J. Lohr 2008 Riverstone Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Made in the predictably ripe, oaky style, this Chardonnay will satisfy certain fans, but it lacks subtlety and complexity. It's all about pineapple jam, buttered popcorn and sweet caramel.
title: Kimmel 2008 Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Sugary sweet in caramelized oak, pineapple jam and green apple flavors. Acidity fortunately provides some balance, but this is still is a pretty obvious wine meant to appeal to popular tastes.
title: Jeff Gordon 2007 Ella Sofia Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: One of the leanest, most severe Chardonnays out there. In its favor is extreme dryness, elegance and a refreshing minerality. But the citrus flavors are so thin, there's just not much going on, and a little oak doesn't help. Simply lacks richness.
title: Nickel & Nickel 2008 Truchard Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Pretty severe, an acidic, raspingly dry wine and even a tannic one. Shows an astringency rare in Chardonnay, even though there are some good pineapple and buttered toast flavors. Not an ager.
title: Nickel & Nickel 2008 Searby Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A solid, direct Chardonnay. Doesn't offer a whole lot of complexity, but it's dry and creamy, with spicy, oak-inspired pineapple and green apple flavors.
title: Sonoma-Cutrer 2008 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Released at the age of nearly four years, this wine tastes a little sweet and tired, like melted apricot jam sprinkled with vanilla and cinnamon, with dried fruit and herbal notes. Drink now before it goes further downhill.
title: Sonoma-Cutrer 2006 The Cutrer Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This pretty good everyday Chardonnay shows slightly sweet flavors of peaches, pineapples and mangoes brightened with crisp acidity. You could even make a summertime wine cooler with it.
title: Three Saints 2008 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Dry, crisp and austere, although it's elegant in its own way. Shows citrus, mineral and lees flavors, with some creamy, buttered toast notes.
title: Dillon 2008 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Yountville)

description: This is a good, dry and racy Chardonnay. It's not rich or particularly fruity, but it is elegant, with mineral-infused suggestions of citrus fruits brightened with a bite of acidity.
title: Of The Place 2008 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Buttered toast and caramel corn dominate this Chardonnay, which also features ripe pineapple and golden mango flavors. It's made in the popular style of ripe, oaky fruitiness.
title: Eberle 2009 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Dry, acidic and earthy, lacking the richness you want in a fine Chardonnay. Could almost be a Pinot Grigio, with its crisp citrus and mineral flavors.
title: Justin 2009 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Shows the ripe pineapple fruit, acidity, minerality and above all sweet, smoky oak that mark a rich California Chardonnay. But there's something off. Hard to say exactly what, but it's in the taste. Like a smattering of mold or shriveled grapes that's off-putting.
title: La Feníªtre 2008 í" Côté Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This is a clean, oaky and fairly simple Chardonnay. It satisfies the basic varietal requirements, with pineapple tart, buttered toast and cinnamon spice flavors. From Testarossa.
title: Dahlia 2008 Reserve Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Lots of oak on this wine, which shows rich vanilla custard, buttered toast and caramel flavors. However, the underlying fruit isn't able to support it. There's some pineapple and nectarine, but the wine ultimately collapses under all the wood.
title: Guarachi Family 2008 Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)

description: A pretty good, everyday Chardonnay that gives consumers the buttered toast and vanilla notes that come from oak, on top of a friendly, pineapple-flavored Chardonnay. A little one-dimensional, but will satisfy lots of wine drinkers.
title: Clos du Bois 2008 Sonoma Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Not very subtle, but oaky and ripe, with strong flavors of pineapple jam, pear, vanilla and toasty oak. Made in the popular style, at a decent price.
title: Santa Barbara Winery 2008 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: A little heavy and dense in oak and lees, which tamp down the fruit and give the wine a certain flatness. Nonetheless you'll find grace notes of pineapples, apricots and minerals.
title: Deep Sea 2008 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Tries for Burgundian richness, but ends up rather common, although it will satisfy fans of buttery, oaky Chardonnays. Shows ripe flavors of pineapple jam, apricot purée and buttered popcorn.
title: Dutch Bill Creek 2008 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: An easy-drinking, tasty Chardonnay at a pretty good price. Shows Central Coast acidity and bright flavors of limes, pineapples and pears, with a touch of sweet oak.
title: Hawk Crest 2007 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: A very rich wine, courtesy of some Viognier and Pinot Gris, not to mention new oak. Offers flattering flavors of pineapples, golden mangoes, vanilla cream, buttered toast and honeysuckle flowers.
title: Cycles Gladiator 2008 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: A bit quick on the finish, but otherwise a nice everyday Chardonnay. Shows a soft, buttercream texture, with dry, subtle flavors of pineapples, pears and buttered toast.
title: Geyser Peak 2008 Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Super-fruity in pineapples, peaches and sweet vanilla oak, with adequate acidity, this is a rich, forward Chardonnay to drink now with shellfish or mushroom risotto.
title: Calera 2008 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Made in the popular style of oak-enhanced ripe fruit, this Chard shows flavors of pineapples, peaches and cream, buttered toast, buttered popcorn and cinnamon spice. It finishes a little sweet and simple.
title: B.R. Cohn 2008 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A flowery Chardonnay with delicate, almost evanescent flavors of buttercup, buttered toast and grapefruit. It seems overly strong in oak and weak in fruit, showing a minerally spine and raw alcohol. Clean and bone dry, but lacks richness and vibrancy.
title: Sand Hill 2007 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Tasty and rich, this unoaked Chardonnay is very ripe and crisp, with vanilla and honey touches to the candied lemondrop, pineapple and honeysuckle flavors. Drink now.
title: Rivino 2008 Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: This medium-bodied wine is pleasant and fruity, showing ripe apple and peach flavors over soft acidity.
title: Plungerhead 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: This older vintage white has a salty briny nose and a disjointed sensibility of tart lemon on the palate, becoming somewhat heavy on the palate amidst its ultimate leanness.
title: Blagden 2012 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Light on the nose and crisp on the palate, this is a simple, enjoyable white wine, smooth and easygoing with highlights of apple and melon.
title: Cannonball 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Sweet, honeyed and confectionery, this wine is for fans of the style: light-bodied and tasting of baked tropical fruit.
title: Ca' Momi 2016 Heartcraft Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Delicate apple, pear and mineral flavors give a fruity but lean personality to this light-bodied wine. It makes good, basic refreshment.
title: Lucinda & Millie 2016 Made with Organic Grapes Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Assertive oak wraps around substantial richness and body weight in this highly ripe wine that lacks somewhat in structure. Tropical vanilla and coconut linger longest.
title: Gracianna 2016 Suzanne's Blend Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Candied yellow apples, sweet honeydew and very ripe Bosc pears show on the nose of this bottling. Tropical flavors of guava and tuberose dominate the sip, proving a tad thick and fruity.
title: Member's Mark 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Quite weak on the nose, this bottling shows dried lemon skin and orange rind aromas. There is a decent texture to the sip, with flavors of lemon reduction and pithy grapefruit.
title: Russian Ridge 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This is a rich, thick and confectionery-feeling white wine, that's full bodied and brawny in style. Pineapple, marshmallow and green olive ride the midpalate before finishing simply.
title: Hanna 2015 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A bit weak on the nose, this bottling gives off scents of charred toast and cold steel. The palate offers flavors of sour orange rind and tart apple flesh.
title: Esser 2015 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Creamy and oaky, this everyday Chard is marked by ripe flavors of pineapples and tropical fruits. It's high in acidity, making the finish tart.
title: Lake Sonoma 2008 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Tangy acidity marks this dry wine. It gives a prickly sensation to the pineapple, peach and pear fruit flavors, almost as if it were slightly sparkling. Not unpleasant, just offbeat.
title: Stephen's 2007 MacBride Vineyard Chardonnay (York Mountain)

description: A real fruit bomb, with explosive flavors of pineapples, lemons, limes and peaches, accented with sweet smoky oak. Malolactic fermentation adds softer flavors of buttered popcorn.
title: Davis Bynum 2007 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A sound, good Chardonnay that offers popular flavors made in the modern way. The wine is soft and dry, with ripe notes of pineapples, pears, buttered toast and butterscotch.
title: Athair 2007 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Enormously fruity, offering a blast of pineapple jam, lemon cream pie, butterscotch, vanilla and spice flavors. Will satisfy lots of Chard fans.
title: Franciscan 2007 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Super-ripe and super-oaky, with flavors of buttered popcorn, vanilla smoothie, pineapple custard and cinnamon spices. Really, really rich, if not particularly subtle.
title: Sextant 2008 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Not a lot of fruit in this dry wine, but it's refreshing in acidity, with a firm minerality. Shows suggestions of citrus and apricot. Nice with chicken enchiladas.
title: Bearboat 2007 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Opulent and made in a popular style, but super-oaky, with the barrel regimen overpowering the fruit. Simply too strong in caramel, buttered popcorn and sweet wood vanilla flavors that swamp the underlying pineapples.
title: Artesa 2007 Reserve Estate Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Super-ripe and super-oaky. Will appeal to fans of this overblown style, with its pineapple, crème brûlée and sugary meringue flavors.
title: Waugh Cellars 2008 Indindoli Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Sweet and direct, with honeyed flavors of pineapples, buttered popcorn, vanilla and cinnamon. Will satisfy fans of this ripe, oaky style.
title: Paradise Ridge 2007 Nagasawa Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Creamy and tartly acidic, with sour pineapple candy, pear, buttered popcorn and vanilla flavors. Made in a popular style that will appeal to fans of oaky Chards.
title: St. Francis 2007 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Sweet and simple in vanilla custard and buttered popcorn flavors, with a blast of pineapple jam. If you like fruity sweetness, it's for you.
title: Domaine Alfred 2007 Chamisal Vineyards Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: A fine, useful Chardonnay, made in the modern ripe style. Bursts with juicy pineapple, Key lime pie, Meyer lemon, buttered toast and vanilla flavors, accented with crisp coastal acidity.
title: Black Box 2008 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: A pretty good Chardonnay. Its a little pineapple juicy, and the oak is pretty strong, but a streak of minerality and crisp, clean acidity give just enough structure.
title: Dutch Bill Creek 2007 Heintz Ranch Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: New smoky oak dominates this Chardonnay. Under all that vanilla, buttered toast and caramel, you'll find pineapple and tangerine jam flavors, wrapped into a creamy texture.
title: Nickel & Nickel 2007 Searby Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Fruity and oaky, this Chard offers ripe pineapple and pear flavors, enriched with the buttered toast and caramel of smoky oak. It's a bit soft and direct, but very tasty.
title: Rutherford Hill 2007 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Oaky, with vanilla and buttered toast flavors smothering the underlying pineapples, pears and green apples. Such a pretty wine. Why put all that wood on it?
title: Benovia 2007 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A little sweet, like a vanilla wafer, but with its crisp acidity and tangy pineapple, lime and roasted almond flavors, it's a good value.
title: Five Rivers 2007 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Nice and creamy, with milkshake flavors of apricots, peaches and pears, spiced with cinnamon toast and butter. Good everyday Chard.
title: Matchbook 2007 Old Head Chardonnay (Dunnigan Hills)

description: Clean and delicately structured, like fresh spring snowmelt flavored with pineapple and citron essence and a dusting of vanilla.
title: Angeline 2007 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Dry and easy, with refreshing acidity framing pleasant flavors of pineapple sour candy, lemon sorbet, buttered toast and vanilla. The alcohol is nice and low.
title: Q 2007 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Good price for a Chard this nice. It's creamy and tasty, with pineapple, pear and mineral flavors liberally accented with vanilla and buttered toast. Production was 16,000 cases.
title: Echelon 2007 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Here's an affordable, everyday wine that will satisfy Chard fans for its creamy texture and sweet vanilla, buttered toast and pineapple tart flavors.
title: Axis 2007 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Made in a ripe, oaky style, this Chardonay has soft, luscious flavors of pineapple jam, pears, vanilla cream and buttered toast.
title: Robert Hall 2008 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Nice and crisp, with rich flavors of apricots, pineapples and pears, accented with smoky oak and a scour of coastal acidity. But finishes a little too sugary sweet.
title: Joullian 2007 Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: A little soft and direct, with jammy, pie-filling flavors of pineapples, tangerines, pears and apricots. Drink now.
title: Nicholson Ranch 2006 Cuvée Natalie Estate Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Good everyday value in a Chardonnay. Shows a wealth of buttered toast, pineapple, lemondrop and cinnamon flavors, in a creamy texture.
title: Napa Family Vineyards 2007 Estate Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Rich and oaky, this Chard has flavors of vanilla custard, caramel, butterscotch, pineapple jam, Meyer lemons and pear tart with the crust. It's a crowd-pleaser that will appeal to legions of Chardonnay lovers.
title: Hess Collection 2007 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)

description: Ripe and juicy, with pineapple, pear, apricot, vanilla and buttered toast flavors. This is a nice everyday Chardonnay. From Talley.
title: Bishop's Peak 2007 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: The aroma suggests a ton of oak, and that impression carries over to the flavors. Butterscotch, buttered toast, caramel, crème brûlée, they're all tasty, but you don't want them to dominate, and here, they do. The underlying flavors of pineapples are swamped.
title: Sand Hill 2006 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: A nice, relatively inexpensive Chardonnay to enjoy with fish, pork and chicken. Dry and creamy, it has flavors of pears, guava and spicy vanilla.
title: Marq 2007 The Foraging Boars' Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Dry and zesty in acidity, this Chard offers flavors of apricots, green apples, pears and butter cream. It's pretty good for this everyday price.
title: Concannon 2007 Selected Vineyards Chardonnay (Central Coast)
