description: The oak contributes buttered toast, butterscotch and caramel flavors to this dry, crisp wine, but the underlying fruit isn't strong enough to support all that weight. Shows only modest flavors of pineapples, kiwis and minerals. Disappointing.
title: Clos Pegase 2007 Mitsuko's Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This unoaked Chardonnay is straightforward. It shows crisp flavors of pineapples, pears, green apples and spices, with a fruity-sugary finish.
title: Viansa 2007 Senza Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Here's a good but rather generic California Chardonnay. It shows well-ripened flavors of pineapple jam and pears, balanced with firm coastal acidity and rich layers of smoky, caramelized oak. Drink now.
title: 5 Points Cellars 2007 Alder Springs Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: For eight bucks you get a rich, creamy taste of pineapples, green apples and cinnamon spice. Not quite sweet, not quite dry, but balanced with crisp acidity. A bargain.
title: Talus Collection 2007 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Tastes like the mashed pulp of ultra-ripe peaches, pears and limes, sprinkled with vanilla and cinnamon and brightened with crisp, zesty Central Coast acidity.
designation: Francis Coppola Diamond Collection Gold Label
title: Francis Ford Coppola 2007 Francis Coppola Diamond Collection Gold Label Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Nice and dry, with a good structure featuring crisp acidity and a firm minerality. The flavors-pineapples, apricots, peaches and green apples-are a little one-dimensional, though.
title: Simi 2006 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Sweet, smoky oak dominates this Chard, giving a caramelized, vanilla custard taste to the underlying pineapple fruit. Fans of this style will enjoy it.
title: Rodney Strong 2006 Chalk Hill Estate Vineyards Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)

description: The new oak stands out and dominates this Chard, and while the toasty vanilla, caramel and charred woodsap flavors are pleasant, they overpower the modest pineapple and apple fruit.
title: Rodney Strong 2006 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Ripe, fruity and oaky, in the modern style, this Chard shows vanilla and butterscotch-tinged flavors of candied pineapples and honey.
title: Rutherford Ranch 2007 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Very ripe and oaky, what this wine may lack in subtlety it makes up for in sheer power. Bursts with ripe, candied pineapple and lemon honey flavors that finish sweet.
title: Louis M. Martini 2006 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Crisp and spicy, with oak and lees influences, yet lacking a bit in fruity concentration. With one-fifth Pinot Gris, the wine shows modest citrus, apple and floral flavors.
title: Babcock 2006 Rita's Earth Cuvée Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Shows rich flavors and a creamy texture, with pineapple-infused crème brûlée, buttered cinnamon bun and honey. Could be more focused and crisper in structure.
title: Sonoma Cuvée 2006 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: At about four years of age, Talbott's '04 tastes overripe. It has the aromas and flavors of a botrytized, late-harvest Chardonnay, brimming with apricot jam and pineapples, except that it's bone dry. With the very high acidity, this makes it unbalanced and not entirely enjoyable. This is a bottling that seems to do better in cooler vintages.
title: Talbott 2004 Diamond T Estate Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: The vineyard is a pioneer in the Santa Maria Valley and it's nice to see they've finally branded their own wine. The Chardonnay is marked by brisk, cool-climate acidity that does a needed job of balancing the superripe pineapple jam and overtly oaky flavors.
title: Sierra Madre 2006 Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: There's a ton of oak on this wine. It dominates the underlying fruit flavors, which are actually quite pleasant, offering ripe tropical fruit and pear flavors. But the caramelized, charred wood taste dominates, resulting in an unbalanced Chardonnay.
title: Rutz 2005 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Really too oaky for the underlying wine, this Chard, which is a blend of some of the winery's favorite vineyards, is dominated by wood-inspired char and caramel. Somewhere under there are modest pineapple flavors.
title: Ferrari-Carano 2006 Dominique Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Comes down on the honeyed, easy side of Chardonnay, with ginger ale, pineapple jam, green apple butter and vanilla flavors designed to please. Drink now.
title: Hawkes 2006 Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Oak stars in this wine, to its detriment. Underneath all that wood is a crisply elegant Chardonnay with ripe pear, peach and papaya flavors. But the oak plasters it with a ton of caramel and butterscotch that tastes excessive.
title: Rutz 2005 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A textbook example of a New World style of California Chardonnay, with high oak and very ripe pineapple pie filling, vanilla-honey and cinnamon spice flavors wrapped into a soft, semi-sweet mouthfeel. Many consumers will love it.
title: Huge Bear 2006 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A nice everyday Chard, fairly rich in fruit, herb and spice flavors, and with a nice overlay of oak. Easy to drink and totally dry.
title: Handley 2006 Handley Vineyard Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Rich and ripe in fruit and a little heavy in toasty oak, this Chard will appeal to fans of that California style. It oozes with pineapple tart, peach pie, butterscotch and caramel candy flavors.
title: Highway 12 2006 Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: A beat or two off the pace of previous vintages, the '04 is a little soft and one-dimensional. Tastes like it was baked by the heat, with jammy white and yellow fruit flavors that have a trace of bitterness.
title: Merryvale 2004 Silhouette Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Here's an oaky, ripe Chardonnay. It has pleasant pineapple, peach and lemon flavors and crisp acidity, and while it's not especially complex, it's a nice Chard for drinking now.
title: Hendry 2005 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: With a touch of smoky, honeyed oak, this Chard has forward peach, pear and tropical fruit flavors, balanced with a crisp streak of acidity. Nice and versatile, it's a good Chard at a fair price.
title: Tortoise Creek 2006 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: A nice, pleasant Chardonnay from a winery that donates 10% of profits to animal and guide dog causes. Rich and creamy, it's strong in tropical fruit and vanilla spice flavors.
title: Cru Vin Dogs 2006 Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Here's a bright, strongly flavored Chardonnay. It has pie-filling peach, pineapple and apple flavors, while some new oak adds buttered toast and vanilla.
title: Napa Station 2007 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Off a pace from the 2005, this wine tastes too oaky, with caramelized wood aromas and flavors that make it hard to appreciate the actual Chardonnay. If you like that oaky style, it's for you.
title: Dillon 2006 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Yountville)

description: High acidity and modest alcohol combine to make this dry wine crisp and elegant. It's not particularly rich, but has just enough pear and peach flavors to get by.
title: Handley 2006 Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: This is a lively, bright young white wine that brims with acid-inspired tangerine, lime, quince and clove flavors. It has a little touch of oak, but is really fruit-driven. Represents a nice value in a dry, fairly complex sipper.
title: Ironstone 2006 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: The oaky power of this wine is its hallmark, giving smoky, buttered toast, vanilla and woody extract tastes to the underlying pineapple and pear flavors. Would be better if the oak weren't quite so dominant.
title: Artesa 2006 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Tastes oaky and ripe, with smoky, butterscotchy flavors of pineapples, candied apples and pear jam. Production was 3,232 cases.
title: Truchard 2006 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Tastes a bit sharp and minty in the mouth, but you'll find some good new oaky vanilla and smoke flavors backing up pineapples, green apples and pears.
title: Francis Ford Coppola 2006 Director's Cut Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Tastes too oaky and extracted, making the sweet wood, butterscotch, pear jam, peach cobbler and pineapple custard flavors a little obvious. But it will satisfy fans of this style.
title: Davis Family 2006 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This high-acid Chardonnay has a prickly mouthfeel. It tastes considerably more tart than almost anything out there, which at least makes it different. Other than that, it offers fairly standard flavors of peaches, citrus fruits and pears, with oak elaborations.
title: Nicholls 2005 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This is a powerful Chardonnay. It's explosive in tropical fruit, in malic acids and in new charred oak. All the parts kind of stick out on their own, going in different directions. It's a good New World style, but it should have more synergy.
title: Keller Estate 2006 Oro de Plata Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Vibrant and racy, this Chard's bright acidity boosts and brightens the lime, pineapple, Meyer lemon and vanilla flavors. Try with grilled salmon with a tropical fruit salsa topping.
title: Claiborne & Churchill 2006 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Partially barrel fermented and aged on the lees, this Chard has a creamy texture, and good flavors of pears, pineapples, figs and vanilla. Brisk acidity makes the finish clean and tart.
title: Kunde 2006 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Oaky influences give this wine a candied taste of caramel and lime pie, on top of the grapier flavors of pineapples and pears. It's solidly in the mode of what Americans want in a Chardonnay.
title: 10 Knots 2006 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: An easy Chard, with good varietal character and a nice, dry finish. Crisp acids and a rich coating of oak enhance the modest pineapple, peach and pear flavors.
title: Beaulieu Vineyard 2006 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Very ripe and fruity, this is sort of a second wine from Malibu Estate, with good acidity that makes it crisp. It's an easy sipper with enough peach, pear, pineapple and spicy creamy flavors to satisfy Chard aficionados.
title: Surfrider 2006 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Ripe and oaky, this Napa-grown Chardonnay has upfront flavors of pineapples, peaches and vanilla. The charred smokiness on the barrels stands out.
title: Raymond 2006 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A little too ripe and oaky for elegance, this is almost dessert-like, in the sweet vanilla, crème brûlée and pineapple jam flavors. Crisp acidity helps to balance.
title: Novy 2006 Keefer Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Here's a likeable Chard, with peach, pear and fig flavors that have a distinctly herbal edge, like dried sage. Turns buttery and vanilla-y on the finish.
title: St. Clement 2006 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is rich and fruity and direct. It appeals for its acid-laced lime, kiwi, passionfruit and pineapple flavors and rich, smoky coat of oak.
title: Novy 2006 Rosella's Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Shows real Central Coast character in the zesty acidity that makes this Chard so bright. With jammy pineapple, Meyer lemon, kiwi and fig flavors, it also has forward oak influences. Lots going on in this fresh young wine.
title: Concannon 2006 Selected Vineyards Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: On opening, the oak on this Carneros Chard was overwhelming in smoke and char, giving the pear, Meyer lemon and kiwi flavors a woody undertow. As it breathes, it softens and unifies, but it's still a Hulk of a wine.
title: Cameron Hughes 2006 Lot 57 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: With jammy peach, apricot, pear and pineapple fruit flavors, this is a pretty nice everyday Chard, at a fair price. It has a creamy texture and a spicy aftertaste.
title: Geyser Peak 2006 Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Pretty nice for a Chard of this everyday price. Made by 7-Eleven for sale in their stores, it's dry and creamy, with good varietal flavors of peaches, pears and apple butter, and is a good value.
title: Sonoma Crest 2005 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: You can really taste that cool-climate Anderson Valley acidity. There's also a minerality to the citrus and sweet oak flavors. Finishes a little austere, but elegant. Drink now.
title: Handley 2005 Estate Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: Here's a nice, everyday Chard that shows the pedigree of its appellation in the balance of crisp acidity and ripe fruit. Shows peach, apple, apricot and smoky vanilla flavors that finish with a dusting of Asian spice.
title: Paraiso Vineyards 2005 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: If you like oak, you'll love the toast, caramel, butterscotch and crème brûlée flavors in this Chard. There's apricot and pineapple fruit, too, but that oak is the dominant taste.
title: Calera 2005 Chardonnay (Mount Harlan)

description: A nice wine, good and dry. It has forward peach, pineapple, apricot and oaky vanilla and caramel flavors, and a finely acidic finish.
title: Bearboat 2004 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A little soft and candied in its oaky pineapple, applesauce and buttered-popcorn flavors, but easy to drink. Chardonnay admirers will recognize a distinctively Californian interpretation of the variety.
title: Lake Sonoma 2006 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine is very, very dry and minerally-lean, with a scour of acidity. The cleansing mouthfeel and the versatility it shows at the table with food are pluses.
title: Koehler 2005 Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: With no oak influences at all, this Chard is on the acidic side, with bright, clean flavors of green grapes, yellow apricots and fresh pineapples. It's dry, but rich in fruity essence.
title: Domaine Chandon 2006 Unoaked Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A little heavy in oak, this Chard has rich, long hangtime flavors of apricot jam and pineapples, wrapped in a creamy texture. It finishes dry and spicy.
title: Liberty School 2005 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: High, brisk acidity is the star in this Central Coast Chard. It gives a good kick to the ripe guava, nectarine, mineral and vanilla flavors. Good value, and very versatile with food.
title: Estancia 2006 Pinnacles Ranches Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: There's lots of ripe, appealing green apple, vanilla and honey flavors in this Chard. What it could use is greater structure and complexity. But it does show promise for this Delta appellation that's lately been fighting for recognition.
title: Bask 2006 Babcock Ranch Chardonnay (Suisun Valley)

description: Pretty good wine for 10 bucks. It's dry and crisp, in the Monterey style, with good citrus fruit and mineral flavors that are accented by sweet oak.
title: Mandolin 2005 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: A little on the thin side, fruit-wise, although there's a wealth of toasty oak, and the wine possesses that bright acidity so associated with the vineyard and appellation. The flavors veer toward apricots and papayas. While official alcohol is only 14.5%, the finish is chili-pepper hot.
title: Martin Alfaro 2005 Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: As always, a nice, easy-drinking Chard with plenty of Central Coast character. The cool, long hangtime has given very ripe fruit, while preserving vital acidity. The winemaker brings a deft touch of oak.
title: Wild Horse 2005 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Here's the latest entry into the red-hot unoaked Chardonnay category in America, and it's a solid hit. Dry and crisp, it's rich in apricots, pineapples, tangerines and spices.
title: Jewel 2005 Un-Oaked Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Not a bad Chard from this warm Central Coast region. It's a little rough around the edges, but is dry and creamy, with a nice mingling of fruit and oaky elements.
title: Sylvester 2005 Kiara Private Reserve Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: A great buy at this price, with juicy fruit and a rich mouthfeel. Apricot, peach, pineapple, vanilla and buttercream flavors mingle into a spicy finish.
title: Château Julien 2005 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Nice and creamy, with good varietal flavors of well-ripened peaches, pears, apricots and kumquats, enriched with a touch of smoky oak. Finishes with some real richness.
title: Sterling 2005 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Big, soft and fruity with a touch of confectionery richness, this wine offers intense ripeness and moderate structure.
title: Tamber Bey 2016 Deux Chevaux Vineyard Dijon Chardonnay (Yountville)

description: Steely and measured in ripeness, this wine is acid driven and crisp in style-a layered expression of green apple and lemon.
title: Red Car 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Green-olive and marshmallow flavors mesh in a fleshy, fruity mix of yin-yang flavor in this lightly ripe white.
title: Aviary 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is a big effusive white, intensely full bodied and ripe in floral, earthy matchstick and pineapple. It finishes in a voluptuous embrace of crème brûlée.
title: Crosby Roamann 2015 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Honey and graham cracker are the richer elements of this otherwise bold, ripe and concentrated white, which has a hearty helping of oak and Gravenstein apple.
title: Dutton Estate 2016 Warren's Collection Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a well-made moderately flavorful wine that captures the varietal's apple and butter character along with decent balance and a smooth texture.
title: Twisted Cedar 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Yellow apple and sweet oak aromas make for a pleasant if not particularly complex aromatic entry to this bottling. Ripe apple and pear meet with sweet buttercream on the palate.
title: Esser 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Thick and oaky, this estate wine evokes caramel and pineapple-upside-down cake-its texture lushly unctuous and rich.
title: Kunde 2016 C.S. Ridge Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: A broadly defined, simply structured white, this has expansive richness on the palate and measured acidity on offer. Green apple, lime and lemon custard provide varietal character.
title: WindVane 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This wine has a strong candied flavor of sugarcane and baked pineapple, allowing its ripeness and barrel-fermentation to speak loudly and with conviction.
title: Saddleback Cellars 2016 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This wine has pretty floral elements that come to fore ahead of a heavier, riper style that's viscous and plush on the palate. Golden-apple flavors take on a baked note, accompanied by pineapple and crème brûlée.
title: Knights Bridge 2016 East Block Chardonnay (Knights Valley)

description: Ripe tasting, rounded and rather soft in feel, this medium-bodied wine oozes pear, butter and butterscotch flavors for a rich, mouthcoating effect. The McManis family makes it from a vineyard that is certified sustainable.
title: McManis 2017 Chardonnay (River Junction)

description: Wisps of lime and tangerine in the aroma lead to some riper richer flavors in this medium-bodied and soft-textured wine. It has light butter and vanilla accents and low acidity.
title: Jessie's Grove 2017 Jessie's Collection Estate Grown Steel Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Fruity and full bodied, this white is densely concentrated in pear, nutmeg and a confectionery core of vanilla crème brûlée.
title: Flower Child 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This full-bodied wine amps up the butter and vanilla notes on a rich soft texture. It is mouth-filling, verging on sweet, and feels low in acidity.
title: Sand Point 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Rounded aromas of poached pear show on the simple nose of this bottling. There is a boost of orange zest on the sip, which then settles into flavors of apple flesh.
title: Broken Earth 2016 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Golden oak, lemon chiffon and pineapple combine within this intensely high-acid white, which may need more time to integrate in the bottle.
title: The Withers Winery 2016 Peters Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a robust high-toned white, direct in lemon and apple flavors, its nose floral if not somewhat muted. Full bodied, it holds its ripeness and power in check, allowing an underlying streak of acidity to refresh the palate.
title: Chateau St. Jean 2016 Cold Creek Ranch Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: The winery has raised the price over the previous vintage, but this is a much better wine than the '04, showing all the hallmarks of a wonderful, long hangtime vintage. Pineapples, kiwis, limes and green apples are enriched with a touch of smoky, buttery oak and creamy lees.
title: Angeline 2005 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: These divas are some winemaking women, and they've produced a Chard of style and elegance. It's long on crisp green apples, with richer notes of pineapple marmalade and butterscotch, and is completely dry. Very nice for the price.
title: Divas Uncorked 2005 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: Shows a deft touch with the varietal, with lusciously ripe apricot purée, green apple and tropical fruit flavors that are layered with spicy oak. Notable for its balance, and the fresh acidity that makes the finish so clean and lively.
title: Merryvale 2005 Starmont Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Made in a leaner, crisper style, this Chard has citrus, floral and tart green apple flavors with a steely minerality. It's a very balanced wine that won't overshadow cracked crab or roasted chicken with rice.
title: Clos La Chance 2005 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This is a pretty good price for a nice, clean Chardonnay from Carneros. The wine is dry and crisp, with green apple, peach and pineapple flavors, as well as the buttered toast from aging in oak barrels.
title: Egret 2005 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: From 25-year-old vines, this Burgundian-inspired white wine wisely avoids the herbaceousness that can accompany Napa Valley Chardonnay. It has passion fruit and papaya flavors that could be a little more concentrated, and also possesses a rich coating of caramelized oak.
title: Signorello 2005 Veilles Vignes Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Made in the ever-popular style of a fully ripened, fruity Chard, with a good amount of new French oak and a creamy mouthfeel. Gets the job done in a fancy, no nonsense way.
title: Hess 2005 Su'skol Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Racy and crisp, this has an earthy quality to it, like herbs that have been scattered onto ripe tangerines, pineapples and mangoes. It's really an interesting wine, and the acidity makes it food-friendly.
title: Screw Kappa Napa 2005 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Rich, creamy and fruity, with a blast of pineapple, peach pie, green apple butter and Asian spice flavors, it's dry, with refreshing cool-climate acidity.
title: Mia's Playground 2005 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Actually from the cooler Oak Knoll area, this is crisp and earthy. It has rich peach, pear and pineapple fruit, with hints of thyme and rosemary, and a pronounced coating of oak.
title: O'Brien 2005 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Taz has been doing a pretty good job with Chard. I wish this wine were a little more controlled and drier. It's like an explosion in a fruit store, bombarding you with pineapples, guavas, nectarines, wild honey and little pieces of charry oak. But it sure is a ride.
title: Taz 2005 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: A Monterey appellation on Chardonnay usually means a crisp, brightly acidic wine, with intense fruit flavors from the long, cool growing season. Here, you get upfront honeydew, apricot, pineapple, white peach, green apple and tangerine flavors wrapped in a creamy texture. Finishes with a softening touch of sweetness.
title: Raymond 2005 R Collection Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Clarksburg is the Sacramento Delta region that's located in the hot inland, but benefits from fogs and breezes blowing in from the Golden Gate. This wine shows fresh acids that boost and cleanse the ripe tropical fruit, peach and apricot flavors.
title: Siqueira 2005 Chardonnay (Clarksburg)

description: Dry and brightly crisp, with the pineapple tart, vanilla-flecked kiwi and lime custard flavors that are so typical of the appellation.
title: Castle Rock 2005 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Calera raised their price a buck over last year, though this is still a pretty good buy. It's quite an acidic wine, in a day and age when so many Chards are meltingly soft, and while it's not complex, it is dry and fruity, with a firm minerality supporting the Meyer lemon, nectarine and vanilla-rich oak flavors.
title: Calera 2004 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: I like everything about this wine. Peaches, pineapples, vanilla custard and buttered toast flavors, crisp acids, a creamy, oaky veneer, a nice, long dry finish-it's all there. It doesn't have the concentrated intensity of greater wines, but it's very nice.
title: Wente 2004 Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: There's an earthiness to this Chard, and a softness despite high (.65) acidity. The flavors veer toward peaches and pineapples, with sweet, fresh green thyme and lots of toasty new oak. Pretty good, with an oaky, honeyed finish.
title: Falcor 2003 Genny's Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is a ripely fruity wine with a dollop of French oak that's a textbook example of Lodi. Soft in acids, with powerful tropical fruit, nectarine, peach, pear and apple flavors, it offers clean, easy drinking.
title: 7 Heavenly Chards 2005 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Nice and direct in ripe fruit and oak flavors, this is textbook proper Chardonnay. The flavors are of tropical fruits and spice, the texture is creamy, the finish is long and spicy.
title: Martin Ray 2005 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The 65% new oak is not balanced. Hard to say why. The fruit's there, all gooey pineapple tart and sweet vanilla buttery pie crust, and the alcohol doesn't bother me a bit, but the wine loses points for that toothpick taste.
title: Falcor 2003 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Here's a modest, likeable Chard, a bit soft, with pear, apple, peach and cream flavors. It's extremely well balanced, and has a satisfyingly long finish. Great with roast chicken or grilled fish with a brown butter sauce.
title: Mosaic 2004 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Chard doesn't get any riper, unless it's late harvest. Floods the mouth with peach custard, pineapple, guava, nectarine and apple flavors, with a rich, creamy, oaky finish. It's a bit one-dimensional, but what a tasty dimension.
title: Blackstone 2004 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: If you like acidity, your salivary glands will love this Chard, which is tart to almost searing. It shows good tropical fruit and new oaky flavors, but that acidity limits what otherwise is an opulent wine.
title: Owl Ridge 2004 Vineyard Select Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: A junior version of the very fine Reserve, the '05 is ripe and forward in tropical fruit and flowery spice flavors, with an overlay of smoky, creamy oak. It's explosive, but balanced and controlled.
title: Simi 2005 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Nice peach and apple pie flavors, along with fresher honeydew define this friendly, soft, somewhat earthy wine. A bit of lees and oak and complexity.
title: Mill Creek 2005 Estate Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: You want pure Monterey Chardonnay? Go here. It's all about peaches, apricots, pineapples, limes and kiwis, not to mention fresh crisp acidity. Where all that cream came from is a mystery, given that the wine is unoaked. Good wine, good price.
title: Bocage 2005 Unoaked Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Immediately likeable for its direct, ripe flavors of candied peaches, kiwis, limes and pineapples. It has just the right acidity and a creamy texture.
title: Rodney Strong 2004 Chalk Hill Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: There's a soft, earthy weightiness to this Chard, compared to more coastal bottlings that offer brighter acidity. Yet it's tremendously forward in tropical fruit flavors that are very ripe, almost sweet. A little ungainly now, but could knit together in the next five years.
title: Chalone Vineyard 2004 Estate Chardonnay (Chalone)

description: It offers up lots of ripe kiwi, peach, pineapple and spice flavors, brightened by a good cut of acidity. Tastes fresher than some far more expensive Napa Chards.
title: Pavilion 2005 Chardonnay (Yountville)

description: Made in a different style from most Sonoma Chards, this wine is less about fruit than minerals. It has a steely mouthfeel, with mouthwatering acidity and hints of citrus zest. Could almost be a Sauvignon Blanc.
title: I'M 2004 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Smoky-oaky and crisp, with pleasant peach, pineapple and buttercream flavors. This is an easy-to-enjoy Chard with elegance and charm.
title: Cuvaison 2004 Estate Selection Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: From the cooler, southeast part of the valley, but the wine still has that heavy softness that so many Napa Chards have, with the flavor of pears and oak. Tasty enough, but lacks the vital spark you get from cooler climates.
title: Whitford 2003 Haynes Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Very bright and tangy in tangerine, lime and nectarine flavors, with bright acidity, this wine also boasts a firm, steely minerality.
title: Grayson 2005 Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Here's a tight, acidic young Chard from this cool-climate appellation. It's showing lots of mineral flavors now, against a background of Meyer lemon and apricot, and the finish is totally dry.
title: Kinter Collins 2004 Pacheco Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: There's lots of richness in this dry Chardonnay. From the peaches and cream, pineapple tart and smoky oak and vanilla flavors, to the smooth, creamy texture and the long, cinnamon spice finish, it satisfies. And look at that price.
title: Pavilion 2004 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: There may be a little oak on this Chard, but the fruit really stars. The apple, peach and apricot flavors are perked up by crisp acidity, and the alcohol is a refreshingly low 13%. This is a good price for a wine of this quality.
title: St. George 2004 Barrel Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Showing the high, brisk acidity this region is known for, this dry wine has modest peach and pineapple flavors and some smoky oak. Feels like sur lie aging played a part too, to judge by the creaminess. This pleasant sipper gains complexity as it warms in the glass.
title: Mount Eden Vineyards 2003 Wolff Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Fruity enough, with white peach and pineapple flavors enriched with a dollop of smoky oak and a chalky minerality in the finish. This is a fine everyday Chardonnay with some real complexity and elegance.
title: Calera 2003 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This is a good, oaky Chardonnay for those who like their Chards bright in acidity and fruit. The flavors veer toward ripe pears, buttered toast and sweet herbs, but have an earthy undercurrent.
title: Artesa 2004 Estate Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Earthy and minerally, and very dry, this Chard has a scour of high acidity. It's a lean wine, by the usual fruity standards, but a clean, complex one, rather Chablisian in its way, and might improve with some time in the cellar.
title: Stephen's 2004 MacBride Vineyard Chardonnay (York Mountain)

description: From up in the Chalone highlands comes this very dry, acidic and rather earthy Chard. It has peach and apricot flavors, with a touch of green tea and tannins. Seems like it has the structure to age, although that has got to be considered a gamble.
title: A Donkey and Goat 2004 Brosseau Vineyard Chardonnay (Chalone)

description: Made in a very dry and acidic style, this wine has flavors of limes, honeydew melons and buttercream. It's tight and minerally, with a tart, high-acid finish, and seems designed to complement food.
title: River Road 2004 Hopkins Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Made in a very ripe, extracted style, this eccentric wine has flavors of apricots, or more precisely, apricot marmalade on buttered toast, because it's also oaky. It's dry and crisp in acids. A bit unusual, but in its own way, a good wine.
title: River Road 2004 Mills Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This simple Chard has likeable, intense flavors of lemons and limes and other tropical fruits, such as guavas and nectarines. It's very dry, and the finish is rich in clean, bright, palate-stimulating acids.
title: Hahn 2004 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Characterized by bright acidity that makes the lime custard and peach flavors dance on the palate, this Central Coast Chard is fun to drink. It finishes in a swirl of toasty oak.
title: Baileyana 2003 Estate Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: The acidity and asperity of this Chard are a bit beyond my comfort zone, but that's Edna Valley for you. It's certainly a distinctive wine, a best-blocks selection rich in lemon, lime and mineral flavors, to which the winemaker has added a filigree of toasted oak.
title: Baileyana 2003 Grand Firepeak Cuvée Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Full-bodied and dry, this 3-year-old Chard is picking up dried fruit notes, although it's still rich in peaches and pineapples. The high acidity has carried the wine this far, but it should be consumed now.
title: Calera 2002 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This isn't one of your tropical fruit and oak, acidic cool-climate monster Chards. It's soft and earthy, with a dried sage and oregano edge to the green apple and white peach flavors.
title: Gundlach Bundschu 2003 Rhinefarm Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: A well-behaved Chard with a streak of minerality that uplifts the apple and peach flavors, as well as lees and oak. Finishes a bit rough and earthy, with tobacco leaf acidity.
title: Chalk Hill 2002 Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)

description: Compared to the winery's Starr Ridge Chard from the same vintage, this is unassertive. It's thicker in the mouth, and softer, with a malted, custard texture framing peach flavors.
title: Gary Farrell 2003 Westside Farms Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: I like this smooth, dry wine, although it's rather overworked. The oak and lees are a bit obvious, yet the papaya and peach fruit flavors, and the acidity, are powerful enough to make it all work.
title: Paraiso Vineyards 2003 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: I tasted this alongside a Chard costing more than twice as much, and it held its own. The fruit, acids, oak, spice and creamy texture come together in an appealingly balanced package. Finishes dry, long and complex, but just a tad thin.
title: Estancia 2003 Pinnacles Ranches Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Started in the early 1980s by veteran winemaker Chuck Ortman, Meridian hit the bittime after it was bought by Beringer, when it became a dependably value-oriented winery. This Chard benefits from Beringer's extensive vineyard acreage in the county. Winemaker Signe Zoller chose lots that combine balance and complexity with lush pineapple, peach, tangerine and honeysuckle flavors, set in a creamy texture.
title: Meridian 2003 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This is a tense, taut Chardonnay. It's high in acids and nerve-penetrating too, with notes of steel and gunmetal. What fruit there is veers toward ripe grapefruit. Needless to say, the wine is bone dry.
title: Gary Farrell 2003 Russian River Selection Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a fairly simple wine that has been rather heavily oaked.It has pleasant flavors of peaches, mangoes, cinnamon and cream, with lots of vanilla and char.
title: Hess Collection 2003 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Despite the best efforts of a new generation of Wentes to make Chardonnay succeed in Livermore, they can't subdue Mother Nature. It's just too hot out there. This is a decent wine, with good fruit and lots of attention to detail, but it lacks freshness and acidity.
title: Wente 2003 The Nth Degree Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Pretty acidic now, and dry, with the flavor of grapefruit and lime juice and a squeeze of peach syrup. There's a mineral thing going on in the finish.
title: Marcelina 2003 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Rather earthy and herbal, despite plenty of sweet oak. As it airs and warms, pear and citrus flavors emerge. Made in a leaner, acidic, perhaps more food-friendly fashion.
title: Testarossa 2003 Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: On the sharp, acidic side despite well-ripened pineapple fruit, oak and lees. Try with boldly flavored foods that call for a big Chard.
title: Baileyana 2002 Grand Firepeak Cuvee Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Ripe in tropical fruits and spicy, with lots of oak and a minerally feel, this Chard is a bit astringent around the edges. Give it a year or so to come together.
title: Stuhlmuller Vineyards 2003 Estate Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Ripe, user-friendly Chardonnay. Vanilla, toast and pear aromas and flavors delivered with a plump, easy to swallow mouthfeel enlivened by just a touch of citrusy zip on the finish.
title: Wild Horse 2004 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Picnics and Chardonnay: predictable, but perfect. If you're into the dejeuner sur l'herbe  thing with, say, salami and pastrami sandwiches with Swiss cheese, roast chicken, potato salad, creamcheese-filled celery sticks, olives, apples and bananas, this rich, creamy, and fairly-priced Chard will not disappoint. You'll like it even served in little plastic glasses.
title: Quail Ridge 2003 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Here's a big, ripe, creamy, oaky Chardonnay. The oak stars, contributing flamboyant vanilla, char and woody spices, but there's plenty of fruit flavor ranging from apples and peaches all the way to papayas.
title: Kunde 2003 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Nowhere near as rich or compelling as the reserve, but at less than half the price, a good deal. Plenty of rich fruit and spicy oak, in a creamy texture.
title: Artesa 2002 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: It's all here in spades, the toasty oak, ripe tropical pineapple and mango, peppery spices and creamy texture. Good acidity, too. A little obvious, but will satisfy fans of opulent Chards.
title: Storrs 2003 Christie Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Rather light in weight, but pretty, with delicate, smoke-tinged pear and citrus flavors that gather focus on the crisp finish.
title: De Loach 2002 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: There's certainly a lot of flashy oak and lees here, contributing pretty  vanilla and caramel flavors. But there's something disjointed about the underlying wine, which lacks vibrancy.
title: Miner 2002 Wild Yeast Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Nice and rich in toasty oak, framing mouthfilling flavors of pineapples, papaya, peach and cinnamon spice. Feels creamy-smooth, with a good tang of acidity.
title: Valley of the Moon 2003 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Flamboyant tropical fruit flavors star in this polished, likeable wine. Pineapples, mangos, melons, peaches and spicy pears, with a dollop of vanilla and buttered toast, all in a creamy texture.
title: Hahn 2003 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Joins very ripe, tropical fruits (like guavas and papayas) to vanilla-tinged, smoky oak to produce a likeable, flavorful Chard. Has a rich, almost thick, creamy texture that finishes with a swirl of spices.
title: Beaulieu Vineyard 2003 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Fruity and oaky, with char and caramel dominating the apple and peach flavors. This tasty wine  finishes a little sweet in fruit and wood sap.
title: Adastra 2002 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Ripe and forward in peach, applesauce, butterscotch, vanilla and toasty flavors, this creamy Chard is fun to drink. It explodes on the palate, and has a long, rich finish.
title: Amici 2002 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Sweet in caramelized oak and vanilla, with very rich, ripe tropical fruit and pear flavors, this is a decadent Chard. Fortunately, it has good acidity and is clean and firm on the finish.
title: Robert Craig 2002 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Lots to like in this wine. It has ripe peach and pear flavors, with a blast of smoky oak, buttered toast and lees. Finishes rich in honeyed fruit.
title: Château Souverain 2003 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Lots of green apples in this crisp, clean Chard. It's lightly oaked, with a creamy texture and spicy aftertaste. Very food-friendly.
title: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2003 Wetzel Family Estate Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Oaky and sweet in honey, mango, papaya and pear flavors, swirled with vanilla. Fortunately there's a good grip of acidity to balance the sweetness.
title: Benziger 2002 Ricci Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Ripe in tropical fruit and peaches, and fairly oaky. The rich, creamy texture and long, spicy finish are pleasant.
title: Lambert Bridge 2002 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Bright in acidity, with nice apple, peach and sweet oak flavors. Finishes with butter, spice and vanilla.
title: Beringer 2002 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A zesty, vibrant Chard, filled with acids, with flavors ranging from ripe citrus to peach. There's very little oak, so the fruit and crispness star. Long, spicy finish, and terrifically food-friendly.
title: Concannon 2003 Selected Vineyards Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Unusually tropically, even for California Chard. Big time flavors of ripe, juicy papayas and mangoes that are well oaked. Tasty, but a little syrupy-soft.
title: Cinnabar 2003 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Bright in fruit and rather tart, this pretty wine is enriched by smoky oak and a creamy texture. It's spicy through the finish.
title: Wildhurst 2003 Reserve Chardonnay (Lake County)

description: So pectin-ripe and oaky it's gooey-sweet, like a creamy dessert. Mango, papaya, pear, vanilla, buttered toast, the works. Needs elegance and flair, though.
title: Rosenblum 2002 Lone Oak Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Pretty and polished, a soft and gentle Chard with peach, spice flavors and a touch of lees. Easy to drink and likeable for the seamless blend of fruit and oak.
title: Kunde 2002 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Pretty sweet in vanilla creme and tapioca, with a melange of tropical fruits. Clean acidity keeps it crisp and vibrant. Almost like a dessert wine, except it's dry.
title: Dunnewood 2002 Signature Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: Citrusy, oaky and leesy, with high acidity. This is a sleek, streamlined Chard whose lemon and green apple flavors are enriched with smoke and vanilla.
title: Waterstone 2002 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This will be an education for those who have never tried a totally unoaked Chardonnay made from really good grapes. You get to taste the pure flavors of pineapple, peach and spice that mark this appellation, as well as the zesty cut of acidity.
title: Morgan 2003 Metallico Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Soft and easy, with some complexity, a pretty Chard with peach and mango flavors and a generous dollop of oak. It's the kind of wine that appeals across the board.
title: Byington 2002 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A bells and whistles Chard that pulls out all the stops for richness. Ripe tropical fruit and peach flavors swim in smoky oak with vanilla and spice overtones. The texture is creamy, with crisp acidity.
title: Markham 2002 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: I'll bet there are 2000 Chards out there from famous, expensive wineries that are already getting tired, but this giveaway is full of life and zest. Eagle's Domain is a Rutherford négociant. This wine has peach and pear flavors wrapped in a creamy texture, and a rich veneer of oak. Your friends won't believe it didn't cost a lot more.
title: Eagle's Domain 2000 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A great value for its great big burst of juicy peach, pear and tropical fruit flavors and the crisp acidic flair of its mouthfeel. Totally dry and balanced, it shows little oak, but the flavors stand on their own.
title: Maddalena 2002 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Gina is a second label from the esteemed Flora Springs Winery, of Napa Valley. This wine bears much in common with FS's barrel-fermented Chards. It's richly textured, with tropical fruit flavors and a plastering of smoky, vanilla-infused oak. It was even barrel fermented. The texture is as creamy as a milkshake, and there are all sorts of dusty Oriental spices on the finish. It's a little sweet.
title: Gina 2003 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Polished and tasty, a nice Chard notable for its bright burst of citrusy acids. The fruit is tangerines, pineapples and mangoes.
title: Gainey 2002 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: A very well-behaved Chard and a good value from this appellation. It's pretty rich in appley flavors, with bright acids and a smoky veneer of sweet oak.
title: Pavilion 2003 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Big, ripe and juicy, with concentrated tropical fruit flavors and a rich, creamy texture. Oaky and smoky, this plush wine isn't subtle.
title: Logan 2002 Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Butter, pear and cinammon aromas preface tropical fruit on the palate. Feels round and medium-weight, with oak not so obvious until the finish. Even so, Winemaker Cara Morrison says that future vintages will show even less wood.
title: Jekel 2002 Gravelstone Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Much oakier and more leesy than Stevenot's estate Chard. Unleashes a blast of well-toasted oak and vanilla that frames underlying flavors of pineapples and pears. Finishes soft, with an earthy, tobaccoey edge.
title: Stevenot 2001 Chardonnay (Calaveras County)

description: Here's an everyday Chard with interesting features. It has citrusy, lime zest flavors and high acidity, and the absolute dryness serves to accentuate the tartness. That makes it very clean, with a razorsharp edge that will be nice with fresh cracked crab.
title: Rancho Arroyo Grande 2002 Private Reserve Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: This mountain wine is taut with crisp acidity and a minerally spine. It's also well-oaked and leesy, and the oak has lots of char. This firm structure frames flavors of citrus fruits. It's a good wine, but could possess more fruity opulence.
title: Cinnabar 2001 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Soft, ripe and oaky, with leesy flavors and notes of apples and tropical fruits. The creamy texture fans out over the palate, finishing with a honeyed smoothness.
title: Ferrari-Carano 2001 Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: From a box that holds the equivalent of four regular bottles, a nice, rich Chard. It's all about ripe tropical fruits, peaches and cream and Asian spices. Finishes long and flavorful.
title: Black Box 2003 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Instantly appealing for its well-oaked flavors of ripe tropical fruits, intense spices and clean, zesty acidity. There's a streak of sweet-and-sour lees throughout. A relative value considering its pedigree.
title: Qupé 2002 Bien Nacido Vineyard Y-Block Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: The grapes struggled to get ripe, and you can taste the ocean climate in the green, citrusy flavors that just barely veer into white peach. Acidity is high, and oak has been kept strictly as a light seasoning.
title: Concannon 2002 Reserve Limited Release Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Ripe and concentrated, in the way of mountain wines, with intense lemondrop, honeydew and papaya flavors. Scads of oak add layers of smoke, vanilla and wood spice notes. At the same time, there's a thick, heavy quality to the texture that costs a few points.
title: Clos La Chance 2002 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Medium weight and well balanced, there's melon, pear and oak on the palate, and aromas of green pea, citrus and toast. Finishes on the short side, with smoke and toast.
title: Blackstone 2002 Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: A little on the lean side, but there's enough apple and peach fruit to satisfy. Oak adds the usual notes. This crisp, tart wine is very clean and will be good with shellfish.
title: Keenan 2002 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: For the past few years, Lake Sonoma has been crafting intensely oaky, well-ripened Chards that offer lots of drinking pleasure. This wine is redolent of peaches and tropical fruits, and is spicy and smooth.
title: Lake Sonoma 2002 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: From EOS, a bells and whistles Chard, with lavish French oak, lees, ripe fruit, malolactic fermentation, the works. For all that, it's pleasant rather than grand, with smoky, appley flavors and a creamy texture.
title: EOS 2002 Cupa Grandis Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: They managed to get a lot of flavor and oak into this wine. It has flavors of peaches and sweet honeydew, with layers of smoke, vanilla and spice. Very clean and satisfying, and a good value.
title: Echelon 2002 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Combines all the essentials of a big California Chard in an affordable package. Ripe tropical fruit, plenty of smoky oak, lees, a creamy texture, and a long, spicy finish combine to make for a nice wine.
title: Sebastiani 2001 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Smells and tastes like oak, with opulent vanillins, smoke and buttered toast. Yet it's thin on fruit. There are suggestions of tart green apples and hints of white peach. Turns a bit watery on the finish, except for the oak.
title: Patz & Hall 2002 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: You'll find apple, peach and citrus flavors in this bright, clean young wine. It has the crisp acidity of a cool climate, and finishes with an intense taste of spicy white peach. Nice value.
title: Jekel 2002 Gravelstone Winemaker's Collection Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Drinks lean and citrusy, with grapefruit and lemon flavors marked by sharp acidity. It's also bone dry, and while there's some oak, it stays in the background. The result is a firm, austere Chardonnay that will likely gain some complexity with bottle age.
title: Grgich Hills 2001 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A nice Chard from a winery that pioneered it in the Livermore Valley. Has delicate flavors of apples, peaches, apricots and herbs and is fully dry, with a rich overlay of smoky oak. There's a density and weight in the mouth that are especially impressive at this price.
title: Wente 2001 Chardonnay (San Francisco Bay)

description: A nice, round Chardonnay with loads of ripe, fruity flavors. White peach, pineapple, buttered toast and vanilla are just a few of the tastes that make this fun to drink. Has a good overlay of oak and a creamy, spicy texture that finishes sweet.
title: Sterling 2002 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: A nice example of a middleweight Chard from this region. It shows all the proper characteristics while remaining solidly in the middle of the pack. Flavors range from apples and peaches through riper tropical fruits, with good acidity, while oak frames it all in smoky vanillins.
title: White Oak 2001 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Starts with inviting aromas of Bosc pears and green apples, and a perfume of smoky caramel and vanilla. Yet it's tight and taut in the mouth, and on the austere side. The flavors veer toward hazelnuts and hard peaches, and finish dry and tart, with steely acids.
title: Dutton-Goldfield 2001 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: An entirely unoaked wine designed to showcase its terroir, which it does in the tartly crisp acidity and streamlined citrus and apple flavors. The wine drinks severe and steely sharp. The bottle I tasted was also a little fizzy.
title: Melville 2002 Clone 76 - Inox Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A junior version of the Private Reserve with many of the same qualities of opulently ripe tropical fruit, lavish oak and toast, and a rich, creamy texture. Of course, it's not as massive as the PR, but is nonetheless a good wine. Loses one point due to astringency on the finish.
title: Beringer 2001 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Pretty good Chard, with very ripe, pronounced flavors of white peach and pear all the way into tropical fruits. Fairly oaky, with sweet vanilla and buttered toast. A bit soft in acids, but perfect for a rich salmon dish, perhaps served with a buttery cream sauce.
title: Schug 2001 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Minerally and crisp, a sleek, angular wine without the big tropical fruits normally found in this AVA, but very nice nonetheless. Flavors of stone and citrus are accompanied by bracing acids. Nice with shellfish.
title: Ventana 2001 Gold Stripe Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: A rather lean, citrusy Chard, and with high acidity. There was no malolactic fermentation. Flavors of limes, honeydew and apples drink clean and bright, and there is little oak influence beyond the creamy texture.
title: Waugh Cellars 2002 Indindoli Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Made in the style popular today, with rich, ripe flavors of peaches, pears, and tropical fruits, and a generous dose of oak. Feels creamy and very spicy in the mouth and through the long finish.
title: Quail Ridge 2000 Reserve Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Shows impressive heft and viscosity for a wine that's totally dry, with honeyed Golden Delicious apple and spiced pear notes at the core. Shows a little heat and lots of buttery character on the finish.
title: Paraiso Vineyards 2001 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Simple and fruity, with fruit cocktail flavors dominated by peaches and sweetened citurs fruits, especially grapefruit.
title: Firestone 2001 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: A blend of Russian River and Carneros fruit, with just a pinch of estate fruit for seasoning, this is California as we all expect it: Pear, baked apple and citrus flavors dressed up in butter and toast. Soft and easy to drink.
title: Stonestreet 2001 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Made in an earthier style. Not that there aren't exuberant flavors of apples, pears and peaches, but they're conjoined with notes of tobacco and herbs. Not especially oaky, but the smoke and vanilla complexities are just right.
title: Handley 2001 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Ripely fruity, with sun-warmed flavors of white peach and nectarine. Acids are fine, and boost the structure. There's also a subtle overlay of oak that adds to the tastes.
title: Perry Creek 2001 Chardonnay (El Dorado County)

description: This fruitywine has crisp acids and a pretty overlay of toasty oak. Drinks rich in apple, citrus and pear flavors, with a creamy texture, and is dry.
title: Lake Sonoma 2001 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A bright, zesty wine, long on flavor and easy on the wallet. Has pretty flavors of sweet ripe peaches, framed in toasty oak, and a rich, creamy texture. This good wine is a value.
title: Mendocino Gold 2001 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: A bit lean in fruit, with shades of apple and peach, although the oak is very elaborate and stars with vanilla, smoke and creme brulee notes. The wine is fully dry and has crisp acidity, and is very nice for this everyday price.
title: Gallo of Sonoma 2001 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A good, everyday Chard from a cool climate, with apple flavors and quite astringent. Oak softens the high acidity, and the wine comes across as somewhat tart and lean. Good, for those looking for an alternative to the fat, blowsy style.
title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2000 Paragon Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Boldly assertive with full-throttle flavors of pears and apples, with a lot of sweet, smoky oak thrown in. Dryish and smoothly textured, a creamy wine that feels good and round in the mouth. Not a lot of depth, but clean and flavorful.
title: Château Souverain 2001 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Ripe grapes went into this juicy, extracted wine, with its big, bold flavors of peaches and spice. Oak adds smoky nuances and a round, creamy texture through the long finish.
title: Bargetto 2001 Regan Vineyards Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This is a lean and young wine, whose flavors tend toward grapefruits and limes. There's also a streak of mineral and slate, and the finish is very dry and acid tart. Clearly from a cool climate, it may gain additional complexities in the cellar.
title: Wedell Cellars 1999 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: A good, not great, and refreshing wine, with flavors ranging from citrus fruits to peaches. Has a good overlay of oak and crisp acids. Very clean and balanced, but lacks expected richness, and snaps to an early finish.
title: Merryvale 2000 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A nice, easy drinking wine made in the international style. Quite ripe and extracted, with strong apple and peach flavors. Well oaked, with a smoky, creamy texture and a honeyed taste through the finish. A little hollow mid-palate, but that's a minor defect.
title: Laurier 2000 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A nice mouthful of Chard, one that shares the finer features of the appellation. Well-ripened fruits, ranging from peaches and pears to mangoes, provide delicious flavors, while acids are crisp and bright. The wine is fully dry, with oaky notes. It's not complex or layered.
title: San Simeon 2000 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Grown down on the gravelly banks of the Russian River, this is not a big, rich Chard, but a lean one, with lemon and apple flavors and a sharp bite of acidity. Oak adds softening complexities and a creamy texture, but it's still a tart, clean wine.
title: Murphy-Goode 2000 Island Block - Estate Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Strikes a middle of the road note, offering solid varietal notes of apples, peaches and pears wrapped in toasty oak, with crisp acids. Feels round and smooth in the mouth, and finishes with a slight bitterness.
title: Wellington 2000 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: This is a good value in Chardonnay because it's quite rich and layered, with tiers of fruit that wash over the palate. There's a nice, earthy note, and also a good dose of oak. Finishes with a trace of bitterness.
title: Hahn 2001 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: A lean, sleek Chard, with citrus flavors veering into green apples, and bright, firm acids. Oak fattens and adds sweet creamy notes. Turns dry on the finish, with oriental spices.
title: Mazzocco 2000 River Lane Vineyards Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Solid middle of the road Chard, all peaches and cream and opulent spices. Dry and rich, with a creamy texture, the wine turns peppery on the finish.
title: Benson Ferry 2001 Select Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: A nice, easy drinking Chard with the usual winemaker bells and whistles. Peach and apple fruit is wrapped in plenty of toasted oak, and drinks smooth and creamy. Finishes a bit simple, and the wine is overpriced.
title: Lolonis 2000 Private Reserve Chardonnay (Redwood Valley)

description: Full-bodied and mouthfilling, a big wine with green apple and pear flavors and overtones of citrus. Oak and lees are subtle and balanced. The finish has a rich spiciness.
title: Rosenblum 2000 Lone Oak Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Rather lean, acidic and bitter, with citrusy, appley flavors and a nice overlay of oak and lees. With only 646 cases produced, seems to be the victim of overly cool growing conditions.
title: Ledson 2000 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Nowhere near as rich as the sumptuous '99. Leans toward lime flavors, with high acidity and smoke and vanilla from oak. The finish is very clean and refreshing, but this is far from an opulent Chardonnay.
title: Martin Ray 2000 Miriage Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A nice, well-rounded wine, with enough ripe, appley fruit and oak to satisfy. Dry and crisp, with a polished structure.
title: Lake Sonoma 2000 Heck Family Cellar Selection Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Oakier and leesier than the chateau's regular bottling, with riper fruit that veers into papayas and mangoes. Still, there's something earthy and heavy about the wine. -S.H.
title: Château Julien 2000 Private Reserve Sur Lie Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: A very nice Chard, and a fine example of a Sierra one. Has all the peaches and cream you could want, spiced with vanilla, shining acids and a long, fruity finish. -S.H.
title: Stevenot 2001 Chardonnay (Sierra Foothills)

description: Comes down on the lean, herbal side, despite substantial oak shadings and a solid dose of lees. The underlying fruit veers toward citrus and apples. High acidity makes the middle palate and the finish bitter. -S.H.
title: Robert Craig 2000 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Lean and earthy, a wine with apple flavors and high acidity whose virtue is cleanliness and vibrancy rather than delicious hedonism. Restrained fruit lets the alcohol and acidity star. Try with mussels, clams or grilled veggies. -S.H.
title: Lockwood 2000 Estate Grown & Bottled Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Tight and lean, an austere wine marked by citrus and tobacco and a blast of tart acidity. Feels crisp and clean, almost like a Sauvignon Blanc, although oak and lees add rich, creamy notes. Still, this is a hard-edged Chard. -S.H.
title: Artesa 2000 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Plenty of upfront apple, peach and pear flavors. Feels supple and opulent, with a silky texture. The finish is ripe and spicy. A bit obvious on the oak: It smacks you with smoke, toast and vanilla. -S.H.
title: Burgess 2000 Triere Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A tight, flinty Chard whose green apple and lime flavors are accompanied by mineral, slate and chalky notes. Feels streamlined in the mouth despite elaborate oak. The finish is short and spicy. -S.H.
title: Buehler 2000 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A pleasant, medium-bodied wine that offers pretty pear, melon, citrus and apple notes.
title: Frei Brothers 2000 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Strikes a middle-of-the-road profile, with just enough peach and pear fruit and spicy oak to satisfy. The finish is honeyed and long.
title: Clos du Bois 2001 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Oaky, opening with a blast of char and vanilla that only gradually reveals underlying aromas of peaches and tropical fruit. Rich and full-bodied, with a solid grip of acidity.
title: Sunstone 2001 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: A robust blend of toasty oak, melon, citrus and spice flavors. Tangy and bright, but quite fruity, too.
title: Cottonwood Canyon 2000 Bistro Classic Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A nice, easy-drinking Chard, with modulated fruity flavors of peaches and apples, and pretty brisk acidity. The acids make the wine feel tingly on the palate, which stimulates the taste buds. The finish is balanced and dry.
title: Kenwood 2001 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Oaky, peachy, appley, tropical fruity, vanilla-y, spicy, creamy, honey, toasty-what else can you say? Another good California Chardonnay that gives the people what they want, at a price that, these days, is fair.
title: De Loach 2000 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Toasty, spicy oak leads the way here, framing pear, apple and lemon flavors in a medium-bodied mouthfeel. Bright on the finish.
title: Markham 2000 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Fresh and fruity, with big, clean flavors of apples, peaches and oriental spices. It's also pretty oaky, with telltale vanilla, smoke and char. Drinks fully dry, although the fruit makes it feel sweet and honeyed through the finish.
title: Fess Parker 2001 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Classic cool-climate North Coast Chard, with well-etched flavors of green apples and pears, framed in smoky oak and oriental spices. Bright and acidic, with a long finish marked by cinnamon and honey. On the sweet side, so try with sweetish foods, like mango salsa on chicken or salmon.
title: Handley 2000 Estate Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: Pretty lean and citrusy for a Chard, with lemon flavors, although an overlay of oak richens and adds texture and depth. The finish turns tart with acidity.
title: R.H. Phillips 2001 Toasted Head Chardonnay (Dunnigan Hills)

description: Here's a proper wine that delivers plenty of varietal character. It has flavors of white peaches veering into tropical fruits, and is framed in plenty of toasty oak. The finish, with so much ripe fruit and caramel, is a little sweet.
title: Sterling 2001 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: Clearly well made, with ultraripe grapes whose sugar was pushed way up by California sunshine; shows crowd-pleasing oak and a creamy, tangerine sorbet flavor and texture. If anything, a bit too flamboyant and obvious. Can you fault a wine for being so made-up that it lacks subtlety?
title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2000 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A bit leaner and earthier by a hair than Kunde's Ridge bottling, but still a richly fruity wine. Spreads sweet oak all over the mouth, with accompanying vanilla and toast notes. Acids and tannins are soft and approachable.
title: Kunde 2000 Kinneybrook Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: An unoaked Chard, and it's fascinating to see what Santa Lucia Highlands fruit tastes like. It's vibrantly fruity, a wine whose citrus, apple and peach flavors are highlighted by the crisp acids characteristic of the appellation.
title: Bocage 2001 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Here's a good value from an area that's becoming known for affordable wine. It's ripely fruity, round, supple and dry. Fills the mouth with pretty flavors that are underscored by rich lees.
title: Peirano 1999 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Superextracted and ripe, a big candy bar of a wine filled with sweet peach liqueur and nectarine flavors. Spicy oak adds additional sweet, sappy vanilla and oak elements. Big and lush, but could use more balance and harmony.
title: Melville 2000 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Very ripe and very oaky, this is a big wine filled with the flavors of sweet summer peaches, figs, vanilla and cream. It has a little bit of residual sugar and finishes with a honeyed, custardy aftertaste.
title: Midnight 2000 Equinox Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Firm and smooth textured, with a toasty edge plus apple, pear and modest citrus flavors.
title: Aix Monterey 1999 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: A nutty, leesy wine that takes those positive attributes to the limit, resulting in a mix of flavors that range from peanut brittle to lemon custard. The delicate melon and citrus fruit ends up getting a little overwhelmed.
title: Clos La Chance 2000 Vanumanutagi Vineyards Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: The flavors in this kosher wine are very rich, commingling tangerines, ripe peaches, and mangoes for a thoroughly mouth-filling experience. Oak adds smoky, spicy notes. Ití•s a bit sweet, and could use more bright acid because ití•s too soft right through the finish.
title: Hagafen 2000 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Winemaker Doug Meador says this is not a "California Fats" Chardonnay, by which he means he went light on the oak and allowed the fruit to speak for itself. It's pretty fruit, with the smell and taste of apples. However, that slight touch of oak adds just the right amount of vanilla and cream to the mix. -S.H.
title: Ventana 2000 Gold Stripe Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Packs more flavor than any other two wines put together. This fruit bomb explodes on the palate with limes, tangerines,  peaches and the sweetest green apples and papayas, and it's all creamy and spicy. It feels dryish until you swallow, when a peacock's tail of sugar fans out on the way down. -S.H.
title: Raymond 2000 Estates Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Here's a wine that is marked by smoky oak and the creamy effect that comes from lees aging. But the underlying fruit is lean and citrusy. You can taste lemons and grapefruits as the liquid sloshes across the palate. It's a very dry wine, the kind that makes you want to put food into your mouth. -S.H.
title: Merryvale 2000 Starmont Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: If you like the smell and taste of well-toasted oak barrels you'll flip over this wine. Opens with a blast of char, vanilla, and woody spices. Sweet oak dominates the flavors. Buried under all that wood are peach and apple flavors that straddle the border between dry and off-dry. -S.H.
title: St. Clement 1999 Abbotts Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Lean and strongly flavored with a taste of the earth: mineral, slate and subtle hints of apples. The winemaking was hands -on, with partial barrel fermentation and lees aging, but it's still a wine of austerity, at least for Chardonnay. High acidity adds a scour to the finish. -S.H.
title: Lazy Creek 2000 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: This is a bit drier and crisper than many Chards out there today. It has bracing acidity and even some scouring tannins, and what fruit there is veers toward apples and citrus rather than riper peaches. That makes it a food wine, and a very nice one, too. -S.H.
title: Benziger 2000 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Lean and angular, with citrus fruit flavors and tart acidity that lavish oak does little to alleviate. Many of the 2000 North Coast Chards show this lemony profile. It's very dry, with a rasp on the palate that cries out for food, and it's also heady and high in alcohol. -S.H.
title: Adastra 2000 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Smells oaky and sweet, tastes oaky and sweet. Other features include apple and peach flavors, a gingery spiciness and a rich, creamy mouthfeel. It's also round and mellow in the mouth. -S.H.
title: Anapamu 2000 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Lush and candied, this wine is like liquid apple pie and peach cobbler. Spicy-sweet fruit hits the palate in a creamy texture, with an edge of cinnamon. Fills the mouth with fruit, with decent acidity and some dusty tannins. -S.H.
title: Geyser Peak 2000 Reserve Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: This Chard is light and refreshing, with hints of pear and peach flavors, framed in tangy citrus notes. Simple and clean. -J.M.
title: Murphy-Goode 2000 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Here's a lean, angular wine that drinks surprisingly tart and lemony, despite sur lies aging and 100% barrel fermentation. Airing reveals notes of pippin apples and a wallop of smoky oak, but the palate impression is acidly citric and dry. A Chardonnay for shellfish? -S.H.
title: Schug 2000 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A pretty blend of apple, pear, citrus and herb flavors. Medium-bodied and moderate on the finish. -J.M.
title: Silverado 1999 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Simple peach and apple flavors provide surface charm, but the wine is light despite being generously oaked. The dominant feature is spice, from the middle through the short finish. It's also very clean. -S.H.
title: Royal Oaks 2000 White Hawk Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Peaches and cream drizzled with cinnamon and brown sugar, with a swirl of vanilla-that's what this wine tastes like. It has the acidity to balance the sweetness, though, and a round and supple mouthfeel. -S.H.
title: Sunstone 2000 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: A light texture, pleasant Chardonnay that serves up pretty pear, apple and citrus flavors.  Clean on the finish.
title: Silver Rose Cellars 1999 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: From high above Napa Valley, a curiously lean wine.  Except for a massive dose of oak that contributes sweet vanillaand smoke, it's tight to the point of austerity.  What flavors there are veer toward lemon and apples.  A leesy flavor shows up in the tart, dry finish.
title: Atlas Peak 2000 Atlas Peak Chardonnay (Atlas Peak)

description: Here's all the oaky vanilla, ripe peach flavor, and creamy texture that people like in an affordable wine.  It's not white Burgundy, but this pretty wine from the Sierra Foothills has plenty of charm and character.
title: Indian Springs 2000 Chardonnay (Nevada County)

description: Here's something different in Chard.  Starts with blunt aromas of green apples, honey and smoky oak, very clean and penetrating.  There's lots of peach and apple fruit in the mouth, accompanied by sharp acidity.  This is an angular wine with layers of complexity.
title: Navarro 1999 Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Intensely bright fruit and high acidity characterize this Monterey County wine, with its peach and guava flavors.  It's very clean, and scours the palate.  The long, fruity finish is a little sweet, with a slightly sour note of lees.
title: Ventana 1999 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Rich and textured, this wine brims with peach, tropical fruit and smoky oak aromas, and drinks fruity and crisp.  In fact, the acidity gives it a burn in the middle palate and finish, pushed along by leesy notes.  This structured wine demands food.
title: RustRidge 1999 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Round, silky and polished, this clean wine is streamline and almost austere in terms of fruit.  Beyond the crisp acids and dusty tannins, the main influence is lees, although some figgy, peach flavors develop in the finish.  Reflect's the winery's emphasis on lees flash, more structure and longevity.
title: Robert Mondavi 1999 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Size defines this well-oaked full-bodied wine, which starts with creamy, leesy aromas and turns richly oaky and fruity in the mouth.  It's a bit jagged now, and the parts need a little time to knit together, but should make for fine drinking after 2002.
title: Château Souverain 1999 Winemaker's Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Pretty peach and tropical fruit aromas, enveloped in smoky oak, are acompanied by leesy notes.  Drinks easy and soft, with plenty of fruity flavors and vanilla-oaky contrasts.  The polished finish is pleasant.
title: Calera 1999 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Tight, lemony and leesy, this wine strides off in it's own direction, away from pronounced oak superripe fruit, more in the direction of mineral and stone.  It's austere, sleek and steely, softened by lees creaminess, but angular.  Call it Chablisian.
title: Robert Mondavi 1999 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Continues the CDB tradition of ripe, full-flavored Chards at a good price. Flavors of pear, apple, vanilla, smoke and dusty spices cascade off the palate, in a richly textured wine that's oaky-sweet. Finishes soft, with dusty tannins.
title: Clos du Bois 2000 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: There's a strong leesy, cheesy note on top of apple and peach fruit, in addition to a moderate dose of oak. That leesy quality returns in the finish, where it turns slightly bitter and spicy. This is a nice, pleasant, mildly complex wine.
title: Newlan 1999 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Austere by current standards, with faint apple and peach aromas and a kiss of oak. It's very clean in the mouth, with apple flavors and bright, crisp acidity. Seems more food-friendly than some of the more over-the-top opulent Chards.
title: Handley 1999 Handley Vineyard Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Melon, peach and vanilla aromas lead to a refreshingly fruity wine in the mouth. The flavor is peach, and creamy soft. It's a little earthy on the finish, with a trace of orange-rind bitterness.
title: Midnight 1999 Equinox Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Ripe and polished apple and peach fruit is joined by smoky oak notes in this easy-to-like wine. Zesty, fresh acidity makes the fruity flavors bright and alive. The finish is spicy, with a smattering of dust and tartness.
title: Michel-Schlumberger 1999 Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: This Sonoma County Chardonnay is a mainstream success, with ripe, peachy fruit, leesy notes and not that much oak. It finishes dry, clean and crisp, with a slight bitter-almond note.
title: Valley of the Moon 1999 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Subtle citrus and peach aromas mark this pretty wine, with light oak shadings. It's round and supple, with some nicely extracted citrus fruit and crisp acidity. It's light and elegant, but no blockbuster.
title: Beaulieu Vineyard 1999 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Quite different from Spelletich's Spotted Owl release, this wine has spiced green-apple aromas. While it's as rich in flavor as the other offering, the acidity is lower, so the wine seems softer and creamier.
title: Spelletich Cellars 1999 Heroncroft Vineyard-Keefur Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The nose here shows clean pine and citrus notes, with accents of herb and tropical fruit. Straightforward apple, pear and nut flavors show on the palate. In some ways, including the nutty finish, the wine is good-in other ways, it's just there.
title: Plumpjack 1999 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: The pleasant nose of nuts, green apples and caramel also shows an odd whiff that mattered more to some tasters than others. Light apple fruit, spice, earth and butterscotch notes play on the full, but vaguely sour milk-tinged palate. Finishes tart and dry with slight mineral notes, in the manner of some white Burgundies. We've been big fans of Foxen's wines in the past, but this one left us scratching our heads.
title: Foxen 1998 Tinaquaic Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
