description: This wine cuts a racy Chablis-like profile. Green apple and lemon-lime fruit, mild spices and a dry earthiness are all in play here. They ride on brisk acidity through a tart and minerally finish. A thoroughbred wine that, to some, "lacks stuffing."
title: Longoria 1999 Huber Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: The nutty, smoky notes on the nose are overshadowed by taut, high-octane alcohol-mineral scents. The stony, mineral-laden palate also shows earthy, apple-oatmeal flavors. The mouthfeel is full, yet tight (we could say ripe, but it's not fruit-driven wine). This unusual offering fades long but closed, with hints of spice and coffee. Previous tastings of Mt. Carmel have proved it a tough read when young. Hold and taste in three years.
title: Babcock 1998 Mt. Carmel Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Slightly odd-scented nose with hints of pipe tobacco, grapefruit, green apple and herbs. Better on the palate with green pear, faint apple, pineapple and herbal notes in a tart, lean framework. Pleasant hints of oak show up on the finish.
title: Morgan 1999 Reserve Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Respected vineyard source and established record of the winemaker notwithstanding, the dense gunpowder/matchstick quality here isn't easy to take-or even read. It is stylized, and big (we can sense suppressed tropical fruit and earthy, mineral notes below the veneer). Hidden treasureâ"¦or just rough stuff?
title: Au Bon Climat 1999 Sanford & Benedict Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Some panelists praised this Chardonnay's balance and zingy citrus flavors; others were put off by its potent, even overwhelming, oak and green woody aspects. It's full-bodied, and there are pleasant pear, lime and butterscotch notes fighting for space on the palate. Give it a year or two and judge for yourself.
title: Au Bon Climat 1999 Mt. Carmel Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Crisp and clean; a bit leaner than you'd expect from South Coast grapes, veering into citrus fruits like grapefruit. New oak and lees aging adds complexity, but still, it's an angular, structural wine. Food will wake it up.
title: Royal Oaks 1999 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: If you didn't know the price and had to guess, you'd probably figure this wine would cost about $18. It's enormously ripe and fruity, with bright peach, tropical fruits and spices and quite a bit of oak. The technical notes say it was partially barrel-fermented. A wine of enormous charm and a great value in Chardonnay.
title: Dreyer Sonoma 1999 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A very oaky wine, displaying bright, flashy vanilla spice aromas riding on top of ripe tropical fruit ones. Drinks very fruity and bright, with flavors ranging from green apples to pears and papayas. A well-made Chard from an increasingly well-regarded region of Monterey County.
title: Paraiso Vineyards 1998 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: You have to hand it to Rodney Strong for being able to produce 71,000 cases of this wine at such an affordable price. It shares the ripe peach, green-apple, butter, smoke and spice notes of much more expensive Chards, and the crisp acidity, although not the complexity or opulence. But it's a very nice wine, and a good value.
title: Rodney Strong 1999 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Has rich, earthy aromas of loam, mineral and citrus, with hints of riper peaches and pears. Those fruits come out on the palate, with a solid dose of spicy oak. Finishes earthy, with some complexity.
title: Cobblestone 1998 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Starts off with earthy apple and peach aromas, with a whiff of smoky oak. This is a young wine, and the acidity is still very high, while the flavors are tight and lean, veering toward the peach and citrus side. It's also very dry. Will probably open up with age, but needs food to show its best.
title: Clos du Bois 1999 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Plenty of spicy oak in this ripely fruity, basically simple wine. Aromas and flavors veer to tropical fruits and spice; technically, it's dry, but it gives the palate impression of honeyed sweetness. Crisp acidity completes the package.
title: Robert Mondavi 1998 Coastal Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Usually exuberantly rich and opulent, this wine, from this vintage, is comparatively thin. There's some polished apple and peach fruit but it turns watery on the palate, and not even a solid dose of French oak can lend it much substance. Turns spicy and oaky on the finish.
title: Marimar Torres 1998 Don Miguel Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Estate bottled and barrel fermented, with lots of buttery flavors from full malolactic fermentation. Intensely fruity, it retains some acids, and shows a good clean mouthfeel and a persistent finish.
title: Brutocao 1997 Bliss Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Emphasizes oak-derived elements-toast, cream and hints of menthol-backed up by pineapple and other tropical fruits. A big, hefty mouthful.
title: Landmark 1998 Damaris Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Green apple, tropical fruit, and spice notes on the nose open to a sweet-spicy palate of almost citrus candy. Medium weight and lightly crisp mouthfeel. Softly spicy, the finish is of medium length. Made from organically farmed fruit, this is a pleasant easy-to-drink wine.
title: Lolonis 1998 Chardonnay (Redwood Valley)

description: Heavy, superripe apple aromas lead you to expect a rich, dense wine, but instead you get a rather restrained, crisp mouthful of Chardonnay. Despite the richness on the nose, it ends up showing the lighter side of Chard.
title: William Hill Estate 1998 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Appealing nose with spice, green-apple and herb elements. Pear and pineapple flavors, light to medium bodied. Lemon and oak on the finish. Not complex, but satisfying.
title: Jepson 1998 Estate Select Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: A complex nose of earthy, herb and mineral aromas, with menthol notes. The citrusy fruit is subdued and the wine displays a crispness that is almost sharp. The wine reads bright, but almost piercing. Usually a keeper, so time may smooth its rough edges.
title: Sonoma-Cutrer 1997 Les Pierres Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Springy and almost sharp, with pear, melon and mineral aromas and flavors. Shows an attractive, full mouthfeel, but with bright acidity and a crisp finish containing an engaging chalky note. Reads like a good, full-bodied Pinot Grigio. Refreshing.
title: MacRostie 1998 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Camphor on the nose is the only thing standing in this one's way. The apple fruit has a baked element that works, yet the the remaining citrus fruit is a little light and hard to define. Harmonious enough, but not a blockbuster in any way.
title: Newton 1998 Naturally Fermented Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Very apple-flowery nose with herb accents. Fairly soft, round mouthfeel. Buttered popcorn and apples on the palate, with a fair amount of oak coming up on the finish.
title: Durney 1996 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Carmel Valley)

description: Green apple, caramel and herb aromas. The palate displays sour apple, herb and pineapple notes, with a medium mouthfeel. Chalky, slightly tart note on the finish. Possesses positive elements, but lacks cohesion.
title: Girard 1997 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Quite buttery. Deep pineapple and Bartlett pear fruit is spiced up with vanilla, clove and nutmeg notes. Seems almost sugary sweet, but has adequate acidity for balance.
title: Château Julien 1998 Private Reserve Sur Lie Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Soft and smooth with a rather rich nose of apple, honeydew and vanilla. Fruit mixes on the palate. Low acid, perhaps, but has enough nice aromas, flavors, and a pleasantly spicy finish.
title: Bridlewood 1997 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: A very creamy, almost crème brûlée style to the aromatics. Butter plays a big role throughout the wine; the offsetting elements are apples and nuts. It's very oaky, which could settle in or remain unintegrated. Time will tell.
title: Bogle 1998 Colby Ranch Reserve Chardonnay (Clarksburg)

description: Opens with an appealing bouquet of pear, caramel and toasty oak. However, the wine does not follow through as positively, turning slightly woody and lemony. Lacks the body and finish we have experienced here before.
title: Guenoc 1998 Genevieve Magoon Reserve Chardonnay (Guenoc Valley)

description: A somewhat lean, citrusy rendition of Chard, with the emphasis on tart pineapple, pear, and green-apple fruit. Clean and crisp, the finish features some lingering lime and citrus notes.
title: Pezzi King 1998 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Distinctive orange and tangerine flavors are accented by vanilla buttercream and herb. A bit chunky perhaps, but the bright citrus-fruit character shines through on the tangy finish.
title: Lockwood 1998 Estate Grown & Bottled Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Opens with an engaging, complex nose of apple fruit, spice and earth. Tart apple flavors, but with a certain rustic edge. Not appealing to all tasters. The oak expands on the finish, shadowing the fruit, for an edgy close.
title: Royal Oaks 1998 Whitegate Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Predominately pear flavors are supported by melon, lemon, apple and caramel. Finishes slightly sweet and also with a bitter pithy note, making for an unusual juxtaposition of flavors.
title: Talley 1998 Oliver's Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Pear, vanilla and floral notes open to a palate of spicy, earthy, lemon-pear flavors. Fairly high acidity keeps the long, butterscotch-tinged finish from becoming cloying, but it's not the most harmonious marriage between sweet and sour.
title: Roche 1998 Barrel Select Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Pears, green apples and butter from front to back; there's also some cantaloupe and papaya. A little indistinct and modest, it may not bowl you over but it certainly won't offend. Could use a little something extra to elevate its profile.
title: Clos du Bois 1997 Flintwood Vineyard Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Solid, with pear and buttery aromas. Fairly rich fruit with menthol oaky accents on the medium-weight palate. Toasty oak predominates on the finish. Lots of flavor, but it ends up a bit heavy.
title: La Crema 1998 Cold Coast Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Caramelized apples and oak show some waxy and banana-like nuances. It's creamy soft, and smooth, with a hint of spice and a long, oaky finish.
title: Raymond 1997 Generations Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Spearmint sticks out on the otherwise mildly spicy nose. The fruit is a little thin, but it's properly in the pear and apple spectrum and the oak is good. Toast and butter come on strong on the woody finish.
title: Stevenot 1997 Shaw Ranch Chardonnay (Calaveras County)

description: Offers a big, attractive nose of spice, pineapple, vanilla and a floral/herb note. Medium fruit with spicy, candied notes on the palate.
title: Benziger 1998 Yamakawa Vineyards Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Sweet almost candy-like lemon-pineapple aromas, toasty oak and apple on the nose and in the mouth. A nice mid-weight wine with a plump, slightly oaky finish. Straightforward, no bells or whistles.
title: Carmody McKnight 1998 Millennium Celebration Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Aromas of baked apple and a buttery, almost cheesy note on the nose. Modest pear fruit and a soft mouthfeel; the creaminess is almost cheesy again-too much malo? Redeems itself with a solid finish that nicely displays oak and citrus.
title: Baileyana 1997 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: A tough wine to size up: The aromas are heavy, with sizable oak casting a mature note over everything. "Toast" is the operative word here, and if you don't like smoky oak, you should probably head the other way. A nutty, leesy, smoky wine that will likely please some and turn off others.
title: Beringer 1998 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Fruity and straight ahead, with good orange, lemon and pear aromas and flavors. Lean and lively, with a tart brightness right through the finish. Shows very good fruit, if not a great deal of complexity
title: Valley of the Moon 1998 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Green-apple fruit with some caramel notes on the nose. The crisp apple character carries through the palate, picking up some lime accents on the medium-length finish. Clean and direct, showing honest fruit.
title: Martin & Weyrich 1998 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Offers an appealing nose of green-apple and herb aromas, with an interesting bergamot-like note. Manages to be round and tart at once, with pineapple and citrus flavors. Ends with a slightly tart but attractive finish.
title: Jekel 1998 Gravelstone Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: The bouquet is different from the flock, featuring pungent grapefruit and a hint of flowers. The flavor is sweet with ripe pineapple, and it finishes slightly woody and buttery. It's a definite departure from the norm, which helps it out in the long run.
title: Field Stone 1998 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A non-malo style that's loaded with apple, pineapple, citrus and white-peach fruit. Has a sweet-tart sense to the flavors, but finishes lean and crisp.
title: Chateau Montelena 1997 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A well-made earthy, oaky wine with a funky, toasty nose, medium green-apple flavors and a spicy, toasty finish. It delivers all this, but it doesn't quite go the extra mile. Consequently it suffers from being too moderate overall.
title: Clos Pegase 1998 Mitsuko's Vyd Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: There's zippy and refreshing flavors in this little fruit bomb that just keep coming at you, starting with green apple on through to a potpourri of tropical fruit. The finish is medium with a touch of oak.
title: Geyser Peak 1998 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A bells-and-whistles Chard marked by lees exposure and plenty of toasty, smoky oak. The fruit is there, too-ripe and full, all peaches and cream and green apple, with a noticeable earthy or herbal streak. Finishes with a bit of sweetness.
title: Lolonis 1997 Chardonnay (Redwood Valley)

description: A fruity everyday wine with proper elements of green apple, peach, cinnamon and clove. Clean, vibrant and fruity, and there's not much oak to mar the pretty flavors. Best Buy.
title: Grey Fox 1997 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A young, steely, fruity Chard, not lavishly oaked, so the ripe, clean fruit shines through. Marked by peach flavors, it's tight and lean enough so that it could age.
title: Savannah-Chanelle 1998 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Nice pear and citrus aromas. Drinks dry and fruity, without much oak. A pretty, everyday Chard. Uncomplicated but clean, lively, and refreshing, with good acidity.
title: Ventana 1997 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: There is toasty oak on the opening but it is well integrated with ripe apple and tropical-fruit flavors, sprinkled with an intriguing squeeze of lime and a grassy slightly underripe melon edge. The finish is long, with a lemony allspice character and good complexity of flavor.
title: Fritz 1997 Dutton Ranch Shop Block Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A nice, everyday Chard, with pronounced lemon-peach aromas and flavors, and plenty of toasty oak notes. This is a workhorse wine: oaky and sweet enough to please the white-wine crowd.
title: Clos du Bois 1998 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: An everyday Chard that won't break the bank. Has decent apple and peach aromas, with some toasty oak notes, and it drinks dry and clean.
title: Trellis 1997 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Has pretty lemon and peach aromas and flavors. A light-bodied, easy-drinking wine. Clean and racy.
title: Bartholomew Park 1996 Weiler Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: A strong and forceful nose leads a lees-aged wine that's plenty thick and creamy, but comes up a little short. Slightly lean on the midpalate and lemony, Acacia manages to grab the typical bitter-almond flavor common to Carneros but doesn't give us the bright fruit necessary to offset the rougher edges.
title: Acacia 1997 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Pretty apple, peach and pear aromas and flavors. Crisp and spicy, but seems to lack a bit of richness, and finishes a bit short.
title: Matanzas Creek 1996 Sonoma County Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Well crafted, with tropical fruit flavors. Barrel fermentation adds leesy, creamy notes, and it's oaky and ripe. A big, bold Chard, not shy about itself, that could use a little more finesse. But the price is fair.
title: Presidio 1997 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: From a cool site near the town of Graton, this is a highly concentrated, slightly cloudy wine with strong Gravenstein apple and lemon-lime aromas. Wild anise flavors season the rich, bold palate, but the finish seems diluted.
title: Spell 2015 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A reductive nose distracts from the dusty oak, vanilla and robust peach and papaya notes in this food-friendly, round and approachable wine.
title: Kenwood 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This bottling is very showy on the nose with tons of white flowers, tuberose, guava and mango, though a slice of lime peel cuts the tropicality a bit. Guava peel, feijoa and bitter limes show on the sip, where that slightly treacly tropicality reigns.
title: Austerity 2016 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: This is a sturdy straightforward wine with good balance between medium body and lively acidity, while showing mild apple and citrus flavors.
title: Navarro 2015 Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: This is a good no-nonsense wine that emphasizes fresh lemon and apple flavors and adds in light oaky elements. It's medium bodied and the texture balances crispness with a touch of buttery richness.
title: Old Soul 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: This offers concentration and weight despite a light take on ripeness, combining both sides of the coin in a package of moderate acidity and lush tropical fruit. Meyer lemon, pineapple shine brightest, as the texture of the wine is slightly gravelly.
title: Director's Cut 2015 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Simple in its offerings of juicy pear and fennel flavor, this light-bodied white is ready for the table, subdued in a backbone of buttery oak.
title: Benziger 2014 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This wine is youthfully pugnacious, gamy and nutty with sharp acidity that has yet to come into its own. From good fruit grown by good people, it has potential to soar in richly layered green apple and pear once it settles into itself.
title: The Calling 2015 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Strong butterscotch aromas and rich, seemingly sweet caramel and melted-butter flavors give this full-bodied wine a syrupy character. The balance is quite soft and oaky components overwhelm the fruity ones.
title: Oak Farm 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: This wine is sourced from the Wood Vineyard along the appellation's Eastside Road, a relatively warm location that adds rich lemon chiffon and graham cracker to the whole. Creamy and velvety on the palate, it remains lush on the finish, tasting of baked peach pie.
title: Buehler 2015 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is an intense wine, robustly ripe and showy in oak. It tastes of baked apple and vanilla wood.
title: Chasseur 2014 Graton's Choice Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Light lemon butter meets with Key-lime pith and a steely minerality on the nose of this bottling from the pioneering property that is now owned by Bill Foley. It's very light on the palate, with touches of citrus, apples and cider-like spice, proving easy to sip.
title: Firestone 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Unctuous and bold with toasted oak flavor, this wine shines with layers of ripe, round pineapple and pear flavor.
title: Folie à Deux 2015 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: If almond Danish came in liquid form, this wine would be it. The aromas suggest vanilla, toasted almond and cream while the flavors are equally pastry-like, with a sweet touch. The texture is soft and smooth.
title: LangeTwins 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Clarksburg)

description: Honeyed crème brûlée flavor is the highlight of this salty, moderately structured wine that's fairly priced and simple in its approach.
title: Raeburn 2015 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a good, middle-of-the-road, unoaked wine. It has moderate fruit concentration, medium body, a nice balance and a crisp sense of freshness.
title: Sketchbook 2015 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: This wine has an unctuous nose that shows jasmine, plumeria, coconut and ripe apple scents most prominently. Ripe mango, coconut and banana touches show on the palate, which is clean but quite tropical.
title: Baily 2016 Chardonnay (Temecula Valley)

description: Approachable, ripe and round, this white celebrates full-figured baked apple and crème brûlée notions, with additional vanilla notes.
title: Geyser Peak 2014 Water Bend Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Butterscotch, lemon peel and a faint flinty quality show on the nose of this bottling from the Chalone team. Tangy mandarin flavors meet almond butter, honeysuckle and gunmetal touches on the palate.
title: Gavilan 2014 Chardonnay (Chalone)

description: Light white peach and apple aromas show off this boutique bottling from one of the few commercial projects in Ventura County. There'a plenty of tension on the palate, with tangy citrus and buttery nut flavors, which ultimately feel a little soft.
title: Clos des Amis 2015 Olivelands Vineyards Chardonnay (Ventura County)

description: Lemon, butter and marshmallow flavors follow rich butterscotch aromas as this medium-bodied, soft-textured wine spreads its unctuous, candied flavors across the palate. It's very tasty in an extreme, buttery style.
title: Las Positas 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Meyer lemon and ripe brown pear notes meet touches of macadamia nut and smoke on the nose of this bottling. The flavors are light but pleasant, recalling toast and lemon butter.
title: Sola 2015 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Oaky walnut aromas kick off this medium-bodied wine, opening into warmer pear and apple flavors on the palate. It feels dry and reasonably rich in texture.
title: Ivory and Burt 2014 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Key lime and honeysuckle scents show on the nose of this bottling. Pithy green apple flavors and tightly wound tension mark the palate, finishing rather short.
title: Demetria 2014 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Prominent oak aromas meet with baked apples and toasted cashew on the nose of this widely available bottling. There is solid acidity at the tip of the sip, but then the sweet oaky elements take hold, adding hints of smoke to the candied lemon flavors.
title: Cupcake 2015 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Cloudy in color and intense in acidity, this estate wine shows a richness of apple, pear and anise, cradled in oak, that finishes tartly.
title: Viszlay Vineyards 2012 The 809 Estate Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: From an estate vineyard, this wine is robust, full-bodied and viscous, with an underlying hint of petrol and plenty of oak. There's a tartness behind its flavors that gives it a lift as it finds its way to the finish.
title: Lawer 2015 Cannon Block Chardonnay (Knights Valley)

description: This is from a hillside estate vineyard and is entirely barrel fermented, its oak subtle and supportive. Medium bodied and not overripe, it offers honeysuckle aromas and lime and lemon rind flavors.
title: Kuleto Estate 2014 Homestead Block Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is a soft, simple white marked by green olive and vanilla bean flavors that feel concentrated and full on the finish.
title: Tierra y Mar 2014 Chemin D'Or Cuvée Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Dried apple and caramel scents lead the nose of this wine, building toward a bigger presence of tannin and oak and meeting a stony acidity and sour lemon tartness along the way.
title: Argot 2013 Simpatico Ranch Chardonnay (Bennett Valley)

description: This bottling from winemaker Chris Cameron shows smoky touches of vanilla and caramel on the nose, proving quite ripe and buttery. Dried lemon skin and smoked white meat flavors show on the palate, making this a solid weeknight sipper for anyone who likes a full-bodied Chardonnay.
title: Broken Earth 2014 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: The caramel oakiness of this wine is offset by austere structure and a focused midpalate, the flavors leaning toward cool-climate green apple and kumquat. It returns to richness and intensity on the finish.
title: Piña 2014 Low Vineyard Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

description: This bottling is ripe and tropical but approachable on the nose, with honeydew melon, banana and nectarine aromas. There is a decent punch of acidity and noticeable texture upon first sip, veering toward sweet apple and bubblegum flavors on the finish.
title: Eberle 2015 Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: A smoky scent and earthy, crisp-apple flavors make this medium-bodied wine a change of pace from the average butterball Chardonnay. It has welcome acidity and a nicely smooth texture.
title: Parducci 2015 Small Lot Blend Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: Dark gold in color, this wine is marked by floral jasmine aromas before toasty oak and weightiness take over on the palate. Green apple and tropical flourishes provide additional richness.
designation: Blondie Gone Wild Red Hen Vineyard
title: Ideology 2014 Blondie Gone Wild Red Hen Vineyard Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

description: Moderate acidity buoys a rich note of caramel apple in this appellation wine, which is moderate in both ripeness and texture. It finishes clean and simple.
title: Laguna 2014 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Light and fresh on the nose, this bottling offers pleasant key lime pie aromas. The palate is more standard than flashy, with sliced pear and grapefruit pith flavors.
title: Firestone 2014 Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Deep gold in color, this vineyard designate is oaky, with gingerbread, caramel and canned pineapple flavors. It's full, unctuous and creamy on the palate.
title: Gregory Graham 2014 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Butterscotch, tangerine and honeysuckle show on the nose of this bottling. There is a bit of textural tension to the sip, with buttery hazelnut and seared apple flavors. Familiar if simple.
title: EOS 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Light aromas of lemon peel, yellow pear and lemongrass make this an appealing option for pairing with Asian food of all kinds. The palate shows fresh lemon, lime peel and yellow grapefruit touches, along with a wet clay element.
title: Broadside 2015 Wild Ferment Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Lots of white flowers, from jasmine to lilies, show on the nose of this well-priced bottling, alongside poached pears and lime sorbet. The palate packs tangy pungency, with Anjou pear and Granny Smith apple flavors.
title: Cameron Hughes 2015 lot 533 Limestone Cowboy Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Crisp and clean lines of tart apricot, nectarine, Gala apple and honeysuckle ride a steely frame that characterizes the nose of this wine. Minerality shows first on the sip, but then the wine becomes ripe with apple, pear and peach flavors. A green-apple-rind tartness arises on the finish.
title: Angeline 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: With a tropical nose of guava and fleshy texture on the palate, this wine is unfussy and straightforward in approach and style.
title: Mountain View 2014 Slippery Slope Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Hugely floral with jasmine and honeysuckle in aroma, this light, approachable white is also oaky and ripe in pineapple and papaya, with a lingering freshness of acidity.
title: Picket Fence 2014 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Medium bodied and soft in texture, this wine has a pale, brownish-gold color, butter and vanilla flavors, and a lingering vanilla finish.
title: Boeger 2015 Chardonnay (El Dorado)

description: The unoaked style is readily apparent on this bottling. Fresh and bright green aromas outdo the more savory ones, conveying Anjou pear, jasmine and light apple cider on the nose. Green apple and more pear show on the palate, with a pithy apple-skin flavor providing tang to the slight acidity.
title: Carmel Road 2014 Unoaked Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: This is a rich, lush, full-bodied expression of the variety, exhibiting oak in its classic rendering of caramel apple. Textured and thick, it has a tartness that balances some of the ripeness on the finish.
title: Vine Cliff 2014 Proprietress Reserve Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: As advertised, this lush white is barrel fermented in 40% new French oak, and it imparts quite a bit of that upbringing in its toasty character. Apple and preserved lemon offset ripe fruit flavors.
title: Eco Terreno 2014 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: A tartness of acidity weaves its way throughout an otherwise barrel-influenced, medium-bodied experience, streaked in simple renderings of pineapple, pear and green olive. There's richness and concentration on its edges.
title: Clos Pegase 2014 Estate Grown Mitsuko's Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Light aromas of lemon curd and Gravenstein apple meet with a touch of crackling minerality and a bit of struck match on the nose of this bottling. The palate starts sour with kumquat and pink-grapefruit flavors, evolving into warmer notes of poached pear and lemon-lime soda.
title: Sand Dollar 2014 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This is a simple, rounded and juicy white, succulently ripe and full bodied in lemon, grapefruit and mango, with supportive oak.
title: Sean Minor 2014 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This wine has faint floral aromas and a note of the tropical, built around an unfussy core of caramelized oak that manifests as crème brûlée.
title: Stephen Vincent 2014 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A fairly interesting though somewhat curious array of aromas arise off of this lower-priced bottling by the Testarossa crew, showing passionfruit macaron, struck match, shaved sandalwood and roast-chicken aromas. The woody character carries to the palate, where oak flavors meets with dried apple, dried pear and dried white flowers.
title: Cuvee Los Gatos 2014 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: A baked lemon, honeyed aspect of this wine makes it seem overripe in many ways, a lush, full-bodied characteristic that seems slightly overdone. From one of the farming family's Green Valley ranches, it's intense and creamy.
title: Dutton Estate 2014 Dutton Palms Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Mild fruit and vanilla flavors and a smooth, soft texture give this medium-bodied wine a soothing personality.
title: Sand Point 2014 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: A candied caramel scent is prominent on the nose of this bottling, which also shows smoked apple, vanilla sauce and toasted sesame aromas. That vanilla-cream character extends to the nicely textured palate, where lemon curd and lime-juice flavors pop.
title: Fossil Point 2015 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: This is a rich, ripe and tropical white, with a mix of sweetness and salinity that plays well off each other. It becomes simple on the finish.
title: Rock Wall 2014 Chardonnay (Knights Valley)

description: Oak smoke, vanilla and an underlying aroma of crisp apple show on the nose of this widely available wine, a reliable choice for all types of parties. Apple and pear lead into white peach on the palate, with a strong oaky seasoning.
title: La Crema 2014 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: The sites behind this wine range from near Rockpile to several of the Sangiacomo's vineyards in the southern part of Sonoma. Together they gel into a creamy, vanilla-laden experience, rich but not overly so, with plenty of ripe apple and pear.
title: Smoke Tree 2014 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Four appellations across the county contributed to this easygoing white. It's dark gold in color with a taste of peach skin, pineapple, vanilla and oak, which has a succulent sweetness to it but never becomes cloying.
title: River Road 2014 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This medium-bodied Chardonnay has big aromas and flavors. It smells like toasted oak and pineapple, and tastes buttery and appley, with extra baking spice flavors and a smooth texture.
title: Oak Ridge 2015 Old Soul Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Grapes come from both the Knights Valley and Napa County for this wine, named by former model and Real Housewife Brandi Glanville. Bold as Brandi, it shows a hit of oak around thick waves of anise, vanilla and melon, ready for anything.
title: Unfiltered Blonde 2014 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Fruity and buttery aromas join pear and baking-spice flavors to create plenty to enjoy from this medium-bodied and soft-textured wine.
title: Navarro 2014 Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Sliced green pears, honeysuckle, jasmine, cut limes and a touch of apple-flavored bubblegum show on the nose of this bottling. The texture is nicely cut with steely grip, releasing flavors of sour apple, ripe nectarine and honeydew.
title: Robert Hall 2015 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: This medium-bodied wine is very fruity in aroma, and exudes ripe pear and fig flavors. Add in creamy vanilla accents and a very soft texture and the effect is almost sweet.
title: Tortoise Creek 2014 Jam's Blend Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Lively aromas like crisp apple and white peach join more creamy, pastry-like flavors of butter, vanilla and toasted almond in this medium-bodied wine. It is soft in texture and so fruity it seems sweet on the finish.
title: Van Ruiten 2015 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: A hearty cradling of oak provides a tinge of vanilla sweetness here, before richer notions of apple pie and cinnamon tug at the wine's fuller-bodied core. It'll appeal to fans of this richer, riper style, while still finishing in a measure of acidity.
title: Napa Cellars 2014 Classic Collection Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Passionfruit, lemongrass, exuberant lemon-lime soda and squeezed orange juice aromas show on the fresh, exotic nose of this botttling. The palate is driven by citrus, simple yet tasty, with fresh limes, kumquat and light guava, proving both tropical and racy.
title: Esser 2014 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Perfumed in white flowers and apple blossom, this dark golden wine, aged in neutral oak, is soft and relatively light, a mix of ripe pear and vanilla.
title: Venture Wines 2012 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is an orange citrus-tinged wine, fully layered and weighty in apple and pear. Popcorn, corn nuts and toasted oak provide the warmth and breadth of aroma and flavor. This wine is ready for crab cakes.
title: Rodney Strong 2014 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Overt butter in the aroma and flavor give this medium-bodied wine a lavish personality, while light fruit nuances take a back seat. The texture is smooth, almost thick; and buttery, vanillin notes keep going on the finish.
title: Red Car 2013 Manchester Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino Ridge)

description: Offered in a 100ml travel size, with fruit sourced from both the Russian River Valley and Sonoma Valley, this is a worthy companion when pocket size is important. Light citrus and green apple show on the nose before an oaky palate of buttered toast enters the fray.
title: FlyWine 2014 The LayOver Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine has an unusually rich gold color, aromas like ripe pear, vanilla and nutmeg, and similar pastry and baking spice flavors plus that core of pear. A creamy texture and soft finish round it out nicely.
title: Five Rows 2014 Marmont Vineyards Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Salted caramel and baked apple contribute to the rich, full-bodied luxuriousness of this wine. Matchstick, lemon tart and pineapple add to the experience, finishing tart and with substance.
title: Black Stallion 2014 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: From the winery's estate, this wine opens in pretty floral notes of jasmine and orange blossom, following on the full-bodied palate with baked pear and vanilla. It finishes tart and dry.
title: Kunde 2014 C.S. Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: An ode to the founding fathers, this bottling is quite tight on the nose, with lime skin, lime blossom and Meyer-lemon juice aromas. The palate offers apple skins, crisp apple flesh, lemon-tinged butter, grapefruit zest and a shaving of vanilla.
title: The Federalist 2014 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Fresh-squeezed yellow grapefruit and pear juice trend toward white flowers and a tropical style in this widely available, stylishly labeled and crowd-pleasing bottling from the pioneering Niven family. Apple juice and apple blossoms combine on the palate, where flavors lean slowly into banana and ripe pears.
title: True Myth 2014 Paragon Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: There's an indulgence of oak on the nose and palate of this wine, which makes it more challenging for the aspects of pear, nutmeg and melon to shine through. The acidity fights to make its mark, too, resulting in a medium- to full-body feel.
title: Gibbs 2013 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Fresh apple rinds, squeezed Mexican lime and a touch of guava show on the nose of this crisp yet tropical-tinged bottling. The flavors also start light with citrus and then delve into more guava-led tropicality, approaching ripe tuberose-flower pungency.
title: Cinnabar 2014 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Intensely generous in toffee and buttered caramel, this wine veers into a perception of sweetness, held up by a thick presence of oak. Medium bodied, it tastes heavier than expected.
title: Rutherford Hill 2013 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Muted on the nose, this tightly wound white is thickly textured yet light bodied in fruit and power. Apple and melon are the stars of the show, gently riding a wave of chalky tannin.
title: Trig Point 2014 Signpost Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Named in honor of North Carolina's first commercial winery and a woman born in the 1500s in the Lost Colony of Roanoke, this white is floral in kumquat and toffee, a mix of rich and robust that's tropical in personality. Tangy acidity closes out the finish, revealing the toasty oak it inhabited for a year.
title: Virginia Dare 2014 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Subtle green-apple aromas and rich, ripe pear flavors make a pretty convincing argument for this full-bodied but soft-textured wine.
title: Twisted Cedar 2012 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Soy and honey swirl around notes of tight-grained oak, with a touch of vanilla-caramel sweetness on the rich, toasty finish. Full flavors of baked pineapple and papaya abound on the palate and through the close.
title: Merriam 2013 Bacigalupi Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Brisk aromas of apple, squeezed lemon, pear flesh and a steely minerality show on the nose of this widely available wine. The palate offers candied apple, seared pear slice and a tangerine-pith grip.
title: Noble Vines 2014 446 Chardonnay (San Bernabe)

description: Lemon-lime aromas and flavors like meringue and butterscotch pudding turn this wine into a virtual dessert. It's not what many people would expect from this grape variety, but it's very tasty and rich.
title: Chateau Côte Nord 2014 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: This smoothly round and full-bodied wine offers a taste of the tropics, combining pineapple, payapa and coconut in tone and flavor. The oak (only 20% of it new) is pronounced, though on the way to integration, .
title: Levendi 2013 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Quite ripe in style, this wine packs a bevy of white flower aromas, from jasmine to tuberose, as well as fleshy yellow pears. There is solid sizzle in the glass once sipped, but the honeysuckle prominence, ripe peach and powerful orange-blossom flavors dominate.
title: Robert Hall 2014 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: A medium build and managed acidity combine for a crowd-pleasing wine that will satisfy in melon, lime and vanilla. The oak is never obtrusive or unsupportive of the whole.
title: MacMurray Estate Vineyards 2014 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Unctuous and made in a robust style, this wine offers a taste of caramel apple and hazelnut, with the illusion of sweetened oak amid a persistent finish.
title: Herencia 2014 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: Honeyed in apple, pear and mango, this is a tightly wound, full-bodied wine, voluptuous and quite ripe in style.
title: Balverne 2013 Estate Grown Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Austere and slightly bittersweet at the start, this wine evolves into flavors of lemon and lime around large wrappings of oak that give it a woody taste. The finish is lean and brief.
title: Stickybeak 2013 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Sweet-leaning aromas of pineapple, ripe red apples and white lilies show on the nose of this bottling. The palate starts with nice texture of Meyer-lemon pith, then settles toward ripe pears and apples, with hints of coconut and pineapple flavors.
title: Cupcake 2014 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: A straightforward, medium-bodied wine that's not fussy, this offers generously expansive flavors of apple skin and pear, veering toward the tropical end of the fruit spectrum on the finish.
title: Roche 2013 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Dried lemon, sliced pineapple, ripe yellow apples and a squeeze of lime show on the light nose of this bottling from the Gallo family. The palate is juicy and showy, but not overbearing, with sliced apples, a pinch of salt and nectarine flavors trending toward tropical edges.
title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2014 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: From 2,800 feet in one of the newer American appellations, this high-desert bottling offers plush and ripe lemon cream, pineapple and guava notes on the nose, with a slight chamomile complexity in the background. The flavors are intriguing, with Rainbow Stripe bubblegum, cotton candy and apple-strudel elements.
subsubregion: Antelope Valley of the California High Desert
title: Coruce 2013 Chardonnay (Antelope Valley of the California High Desert)

description: The nose on this wine combines the more tightly wound tonic profile with richer accents of browned walnuts and pan-fried apples. Flavors are light, clear and easy, with pear, apples, pineapple and cinnamon proving right down the middle stylistically.
title: Firestone 2013 Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: From vines planted in the 1960s, and given time in 100% French oak, this dry, unctuous wine is tropical in character. A mix of pineapple and nutmeg teases its way into notes of canned corn.
designation: The Hidden One Old Vine Estate Grown
title: Leto 2013 The Hidden One Old Vine Estate Grown Chardonnay (St. Helena)

description: Well made, well balanced and rich in flavor, this medium-bodied wine has fruit flavors that are almost sweet but countered by crisp acidity. It tastes spicy like vanilla and nutmeg on the finish.
title: Vigilance 2014 Chardonnay (Red Hills)

description: With aromas and flavors like a pear tart, this wine has plenty of fruit character accented by vanilla and custard. The balance is slightly soft, the body not too full and the texture relaxed.
title: Husch 2014 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Quite reserved in aromas at first, this starts to show bruised lemon skins, ripe stonefruit and a touch of cream on the nose. A preserved lemon element and sour orange character mark the nose, with touches of marzipan yet lacking the usually associated creaminess.
title: Byington 2013 Wrights Station Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Sweet vanilla oak gives this full-bodied, tropical wine its signature, a luscious taste of fruit-forward approachability that risks becoming overdone. From Vine Hill Ridge Vineyard in the heart of the appellation, it exhibits the power and warmth of the vintage.
title: Dutton Estate 2013 Kyndall's Reserve Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Perfumy on the nose, this is a lavishly oaked, full-bodied mix of caramel and vanilla atop baked apple pie and grilled mango. More tropical than crisp, it speaks to a warm vintage and a stylistic approach to go for the gusto.
title: The Grifter 2014 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is a polished and attractive medium-bodied wine. It offers classic apple and pear aromas, and light vanilla and nutmeg flavors. Balanced a little toward softness rather than crispness, it's very easy in texture.
title: Shannon Ridge 2014 High Elevation Collection Chardonnay (Lake County)

description: An almost overpowering fragrance greets the nose on this bottling, with scents of lime and pear blossoms, honeysuckle, jasmine and peach sorbet. The palate is very citrus-driven, with oranges and tangerine skin, proving quite sour and tart for such a ripe introduction.
title: Pace 2014 Huber Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: From the estate Main Ranch and given 10 months in French oak, less than half of it new, this has a high-acidity backbone that lifts and balances out the wine's richer tendencies. Lemon crème brûlée provides the weight and intensity.
title: Trefethen 2013 Harmony Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

description: Sharply etched in pineapple and Meyer lemon, this wine retains a brightness of fruit and acidity throughout, never overly impeded by oak. A subtle, earthy herbal streak plays in the background.
title: Michael Mondavi Family Estate 2013 Isabel Mondavi Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Opulently dense, this wine opens nicely in orange blossom and caramel apple, followed by a palate that's somewhat incomplete in fruit-flavor follow-up. Concentrated and full bodied, it packs a powerful punch, ending in oak.
title: Acacia 2013 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Floral and inviting in vanilla and caramel, this wine tastes bigger and richer than it is, offering more in the way of ripeness and texture than acidity. It finishes full bodied.
title: Bouchaine 2013 Estate Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Coconut-laden oak kicks off the entry of this wine, a crisp version of the variety that nonetheless exhibits plenty of oak characteristics and a rich ripeness of baked apple, pear and pineapple.
title: Bellacana 2013 Bellacana Vineyard Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: This ripe wine is intense and full bodied, with sultry layers of baked apple and peach. A flinty note marks the finish.
title: Francis Ford Coppola 2013 Director's Cut Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Very little of this bottling was made. It's an experiment in making a white wine the way one would a red, fermented with skins and seeds, then aged eight months in new French oak. It's not for everyone. Cloudy and funky, it's teeming with acidity and yet somewhat dense on the palate, the fruit muted in favor of a taste of flowers and clay.
title: Gary Farrell 2013 100% Skin Fermented Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: High in acidity and low in oak, this is a white that pushes the limits, reflective of the extreme, cool-climate vineyards from which it sources. Fresh-squeezed lemon is the star, the wet-stone minerality razor sharp.
title: Red Car 2013 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Soft and round, this is a ripe wine accented in toasted oak, vanilla and Good-n-Plenty-type licorice, made in a likable style.
title: Vintager 2012 The Californian Limited Edition Chardonnay (Knights Valley)

description: Caramel and white-chocolate aromas lead to very ripe, buttery flavors, a sense of sweetness and an almost thick texture in this full-bodied wine. Practically as rich and creamy as a milkshake, it will delight some drinkers for its unctuousness.
title: Poseidon 2013 Estate Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: Ripe and oaky, there's a hedonistic tone to this wine sourced from the heart of the appellation and made for relatively wide distribution. Fennel comes to the fore on the nose, followed by green apple and pear, with plenty of vanilla on the finish.
title: Laguna 2013 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Interesting nuances of honey, peach and spiced pear light up this medium-bodied, extremely fruity and flavorful wine. It's opulent and soft enough to pair well with spicy food or to serve with salty cheeses.
title: Old Soul 2013 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: This stainless-steel bottling shows overwhelming white-flower elements on the nose, from tuberose to honeysuckle to jasmine, cut by a bit of baking soda. The palate is so floral and aromatic that it almost tastes like a different grape, with sharp apples, more tuberose and a steely frame.
title: Hess Collection 2014 Shirtail Creek Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Lemon and apple blossoms plus a tiny bit of honeydew meld for a pleasant nose on this widely available wine. The energetic palate offers fresh green apple and lemon salt flavors that make you salivate, though it packs almost too much punch.
title: Slow Press 2013 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: This is a delightfully straightforward wine, supple and smooth in floral honeysuckle and orange blossom behind ripe apple flavors and crispness.
title: Acacia 2013 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Lively in aromas and with vivid flavors like grapefruit and apricot, this wine tastes lightly herbal and appetizing. It has light oaky, buttery notes in the aroma and fairly vivid fruit flavors. The texture that gets richer with each sip, revealing a rather full body.
title: Victor Vineyards 2013 Lawson Ranch Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Winemaker Mike Mooney named this after his great-great grandfather, who settled in the Central Coast region in the 1840s. The wine is light and nearly green in the glass, with lime blossom and green banana aromas that verge on tropical. It's extremely juicy and ripe on the palate, with some citrus-rind bitterness offering balance.
title: El Pistolero 2014 Cold Steel Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: A very reluctant nose offers weak aromas of wet cement and a basketful of lemons. The palate is more about texture and energy than flavors, which include pear skins and orange rinds.
title: Sandhi 2013 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This is a very good, crowd-pleasing Chardonnay with lots of ripe, fresh fruit flavors and tasty accents of vanilla and butter. It is medium-bodied, soft and smooth in texture, leans toward sweetness and has a lingering, fruity finish.
title: Dalliance 2013 Chardonnay (Lake County)

description: Deep yellow in color, this wine is into oak, with elements of caramelized vanilla and baked pear. Medium bodied and unctuous, it will fulfill the needs of fans of a bigger, voluptuous style.
title: White Oak 2013 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Nearing greenish-yellow in the glass, this wine offers lemon curd, a touch of oak and a flash of white peach on the nose. Golden apple and iodine flavors show on the palate, which proves more bitter and sour than ripe.
title: Firestone 2013 Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: A unique blend of fermenting orange, aging white flowers, dried apples and a musky sandalwood show on the nose of this wine. The palate is simultaneously rich, sour and creamy, with tangerine and banana flavors.
title: Cima Collina 2013 Tondre Grapefield Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Golden in color, this wine has a light presence on the palate, offering both floral and herbal highlights of jasmine and cinnamon. A faint squeeze of citrus is perceptible throughout, before the wine finishes in a flash.
title: The Federalist 2013 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Toasted oak and vanilla are noticeably present on the palate and nose of this wine, which evolves in the glass to take on a more tropical feel and tastes of ripe pineapple and guava. Medium to light in texture, it finishes smoothly and flat.
title: Sonoma-Cutrer 2013 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: The nose on this wine from regional pioneer Gary Eberle is reserved at first, then releases seared lemon, tightly wound stone fruit, soft butter and caramel nibs. There is a pleasant weight on the medium-density palate, with sour-leaning flavors of Granny Smith apple peels, lime rinds and some riper honeydew melon.
title: Eberle 2013 Eberle Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: A subtle but not quite austere wine, this has mild honeydew melon aromas, subdued grape and mineral flavors, and a dry, slightly tart texture that's appetizing. Light-bodied, it makes a nice choice for people who don't like too much fruitiness.
title: Abbeyville 2013 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: A jasmine bouquet introduces layers of bright lemon and lime in this sharply etched white, low in oak but high in acidity. Straightforward and medium bodied, it has a pronounced tartness on the finish.
title: Aviary 2012 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Candied lemon drop comes first to mind in terms of the wine's bouquet, which settles into more subtle orange blossom. Sublime and layered in characteristic apple and pear, it shows tartness on the abbreviated finish.
title: Hess 2013 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Very light in color, this wine has a pungent nose that features white flowers, cold steel and lime juice. The palate is bright with racy acidity, showing lots of honeysuckle, some ripe green apples and hints of honeydew and kiwi.
title: Irony 2013 Small Lot Reserve Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Aromas of struck match, seared lemon, roasted apples and a touch of butterscotch prove clean and not overpowering. This is a very straight-ahead Chardonnay, with lemon fruit, chalk and noticeable oak influence.
title: Estancia 2013 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Oak, ripe pear and caramel dance to the fore of this wine's bouquet, followed by thick, textural layers of lingering vanilla cream. The oak remains pronounced throughout the glass, giving the wine a sweetness on the finish.
title: Nicholson Ranch 2012 Estate Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Very light in the glass, this offers lime juice, lemon peel and tuberose on the nose. There is decent acidity and minerality on the palate, with apples, white flowers and melon.
title: La Merika 2013 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: A steely, crisp and linear expression of the variety that's soft and approachable, this offers ripe apple and fig at its core, around a medium body and finish.
title: Napa Cellars 2013 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Rich and ripe, this intense wine is verging into tropical land with pineapple and mango, plus an overreaching expression of oak and vanilla. It offers medium- to full-bodied weight and a big finish.
title: Matrix 2012 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Waxy apple and pear give this juicy wine a satisfying aroma and flavor profile, the fruit just ripe and unfettered by oak. The finish is direct and awash in vanilla. This is a decent value for the quality.
title: Frei Brothers 2013 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: There is a curious sense of tropicality on this wine, with pink grapefruit flesh and pink rose petals showing on the nose. The palate stays in that style, with ripe papaya, mango and banana. It tastes good, just not much like Chardonnay.
title: Martin Ranch 2013 Thérèse Vineyards Griva Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: A sweet viscosity mires what this wine is otherwise trying to say, a single-vineyard offering from a cool section of the appellation that telegraphs ripeness beyond other attributes. Rich brioche and crème brûlée rule the day, atop full-bodied intensity.
title: Landmark 2012 Lorenzo Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This savory, salty and oaky white offers flavors of baked and dried apple and butterscotch. Medium to full bodied, it's a strong wine firm in tannin, with its sense of ripeness peaking on the finish.
title: Hanna 2013 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Wafts of campfire smoke, vanilla bean and wet granite greet the nose. The palate shows lemon-lime soda and hard caramel candies, with a touch of bitterness. It's clean and well made, but not too showy.
title: Laetitia 2013 Estate Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Baked pear and honeysuckle combine around a floral, perfumy vibe, the wine medium in weight, texture and body. A crisp and lemony finish rounds it out, the wine structured and soft.
title: Markham 2013 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A serious personality comes from oaky, earthy aromas and flavors, a bit of welcome astringency and good acidity. It seems full bodied, dry and rich enough in texture to be appealing without losing the tanginess underneath.
title: Drytown 2013 Estate Chardonnay (Sierra Foothills)

description: A salty, briny, minerally quality is pronounced in this larger-scale wine that opens intensely sour before mellowing into green apple and quince notes. Medium in weight, body and impact, it finishes with a tartness that suggests the need for food.
title: Folie à Deux 2013 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This stainless study shows crisp and ripe yellow apple flesh, with white rock and slate minerality. Apples, from Golden Delicious to red, also dominate the flavor profile, which is straightforward and accessible, though not complex.
title: Four Vines 2013 Naked Unoaked Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Aged in white oak barrels from Minnesota, the winemaker's home state, this wine offers exotic honeysuckle and baked pineapple at its core, beautiful aromas that gain weight on the texture. Toasted caramel and coconut define the finish.
title: Murphy-Goode 2013 Minnesota Cuvée Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Caressed in forested earthiness, this wine is both crisp in acidity and creamy in baked apple and crème brûlée, a layering of lemon meringue on top. It is integrated and balanced up until the finish, where a firm grip of oak takes hold.
title: VML 2012 Ivywood Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A strong, toasted, smoky aroma and charred oak flavors define this medium-bodied, rich-textured wine. Not exactly light on its feet, but fans of oak will appreciate the bold, toasty, buttery character.
title: Page Mill Winery 2013 Vitner's Select Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: The very lively nose blends milky marzipan, ruby-red grapefruit juice, ripe nectarine and rain on concrete. Given those dynamics, the palate isn't as compelling, presenting apple, pear, orange peel, lemon juice and a vanilla-custard finish.
title: Sarah's Vineyard 2012 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This bright, fresh and fruity wine presents an appealing mix of apricot and peach aromas, ripe and round peach flavors and a smooth texture. Rather full bodied, it is lifted by a good amount of tangy acidity.
title: Jeriko 2012 Upper Russian River Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: There's a curious sign of age on this otherwise young wine, with oxidized aromas of sweet smoke, marshmallows and marzipan. It's not quite as oak-driven on the palate, where a citrus-juice backbone holds up the otherwise subdued flavors.
title: Stolo 2012 Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)

description: Made from organically farmed grapes grown in an estate vineyard, then cradled in American oak, this delivers subdued aromas of ripe, lusty lemon and big oak. Lurching toward the finish are flavors of caramel and bittersweet dried fruit.
title: ZD 2012 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Caramel and vanilla wrap around generously ripe flavors of apple, pear and tropical papaya. Entirely fermented in oak, its wood provides a medium-bodied mouthfeel and ample accents of sweetness and spice.
title: Highway 12 2013 Nueva Carneros Highway Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Tropical fruit drips from this barrel-fermented Chardonnay, accented in golden honey and toasted oak. Crisp at first, then oaky, it feels a bit disjointed but manages to resolve its issues on the finish, a nice combination of the two.
title: McIlroy 2012 Signature Edition Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This budget-minded white veers toward overripe fruit and a layering of vanilla sugar yet retains enough minerality on the back end to remain vibrant and juicy.
title: Ministry of the Vinterior 2012 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This stainless-steel wine doesn't present much on the nose, just a little apple cider, chalk and metal. The acidity is powerfully bright, with citrus zest dominating the flavors, and a very quick and tight finish.
title: Tolosa 2013 No Oak Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This stainless-steel-fermented wine offers a curiously herbal aroma of lemon verbena, with a bit of wet slate and fresh-cut honeydew. As expected, the flavors are steely at first, with fruit flavors of ripe pear and lemon emerging in the midpalate, winding up on a distinctly tart apple-skin finish.
title: Carmel Road 2013 Unoaked Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: The nose is a bit astringent, with barrel smoke and pineapple as the most appealing elements. The palate is dominated by apple, lemon custard and peach chiffon, with a bit of oak toast.
title: Le Vigne 2013 Kiara Barrel Select Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Here is a solid, dry, rather full-bodied Chardonnay with a subtle floral aroma. It offers savory rather than fruity flavors, rich mouthfeel and lingering finish of baking spices. Not a light pre-dinner drink but more of a match with rich sauces on pasta, poultry or pork.
title: Matchbook 2012 Old Head Chardonnay (Dunnigan Hills)

description: Muted and sour, this lemony Chardonnay from a cool vintage offers puckeringly high acidity and relatively low alcohol.
title: Tuck Beckstoffer 2011 Semper Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: A strong showing for wine that comes in a box, this begins with aromas of nectarine and peach before delivering stone fruit flavors on the palate as well. A touch of bitter tension on the end makes for a solid value wine, great for camping and parties.
title: Black Box 2013 Platinum Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Fresh and apparently unoaked, this offers an appealing floral aroma, with a slight buttery accent over the crisp apple flavors. It is light to medium-bodied, soft in texture, showing no apparent oak flavors but instead straightforward fruit character.
title: McFadden 2013 Blue Quail Chardonnay (Potter Valley)

description: From a vineyard on the southeastern side of Sonoma Mountain this spent more than a year in French oak, half of it new. Golden in color, it features quiet aromatics of coconut and tropical pineapple around light minerality and a citrus-tinged finish.
title: Three Sticks 2012 One Sky Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)

description: Coming from one of the appellation's newest and most exciting vineyards, this oak-powered wine opens with notes of bright citrus and vanilla-laced buttercream. The palate is powered by the barrel, with hardcore caramel and an almost bitter tannic element. Better for the oak lovers than the acid heads.
title: Presqu'ile 2012 Presqu'ile Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: From Sam Sebastiani comes this Chardonnay made in a classic California manner. Rich in buttery oak and sweet vanilla, the grapes are a mix of Wente and older clones, fermented and aged in a combination of French oak, a third of it new.
title: La Chertosa 2012 Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Talley Vineyards' bargain brand offers light lemon and chalk aromas before delivering a palate where brisk acidity is the primary player. White rocks, apple, lime and honeysuckle flavors linger in the wings.
title: Bishop's Peak 2013 Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo)

description: Made by winemaker Georgetta Dane, this white is awash in kumquat and vanilla, the medium-bodied layers of texture soft and round and accessible to a broad range of palates.
title: Chloe 2012 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Fruity and robust in apple and tropical citrus, this is well-defined and balanced in terms of oak and richness, the aromatics a tad muted. Fermentation occurred in both stainless steel and French oak.
title: Migration 2012 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: There's a world of lemon chiffon and vanilla crème brûlée in this wine, both aromatically and in taste. Medium weight and well-balanced, it delivers a hit of tart lemon on the finish.
title: Twenty Bench 2013 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This unoaked Chardonnay is awash in green apple, tart lemon and tropical pineapple, light and lifted on the palate. It goes down easily, and will track well at the table. Salads, seafood and brunch-type fare are all good bets.
title: Dealy Lane 2012 Unoaked Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A well-behaved 100% Chardonnay fermented in stainless steel, it had no malolactic conversion to add a buttery quality. Smooth-textured and medium-bodied, it's filled out by moderate pear and apple flavors accented with hints of white pepper, fig and vanilla.
title: Verde Sole 2013 Chardonnay (Sierra Foothills)

description: This wine has overlapping personalities. One drips richly in vanilla and honey, while the other is lemony tart and electric in acidity. They commingle on the finish, and will clearly decide whether to get along or part over time. Give the wine a good swirl.
title: Foppiano 2012 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Steely yet somewhat sweet, it offers a richness of baked apple and pear amid midweight layers of softened tannins.
title: Girard 2012 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The grapes for hail from both Carneros and Oak Knoll and have undergone both barrel and stainless steel fermentation. The result is a medium-weight to fuller-style of clean, crisp lemon and pear flavors, a swirl of tropical vanilla on the finish.
title: Educated Guess 2012 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A deeply golden Chardonnay from E & J Gallo's Edna Valley brand, this wine starts with a tightly wound nose, faintly offering tart apple, lemon rind and a slight herbal character. An elegant but brief flavor of perfumed pear washes away quickly without much finish.
title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2012 Fleur de Edna Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: This wine from longtime Santa Cruz Mountains producer Cinnabar offers a very subtle nose with slight, brisk minerality. Once sipped, the flavors remain subtle, though are nicely rounded with a bit of guava-based tropicalitythat emerges toward the finish.
title: Cinnabar 2012 Central Avenue Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Intense in lemon and silky, it shows a touch of effervescence from the bright acidity and is textured from the time spent in barrel. The finish and lingering aftertaste steer sweet, into the land of butterscotch and caramel.
title: Gloria Ferrer 2011 Estate Grown and Bottled Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Coming in at the less-oaked end of the California Chardonnay scale, this presents aromas of slate, graphite and cut grass. It delivers those same flavors to the palate as well as some green pear. It's restrained, yet still New World.
title: Baileyana 2012 Firepeak Estate Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: It conveys lots of ripe, forward citrus, pear and green apple flavors. Oak plays only a supporting role, with crisp acidity and creamy lees co-starring with the fruit.
title: Schug 2012 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Rich in tropical fruits, apricots and pears, it shows lots of oak and lees complications. It aspires to importance, but falls short in overall balance. Drink up.
title: Friedeman 2012 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: With toasty oak and leesy notes and a creamy texture, this is a fairly manipulated Chardonnay. The underlying fruit doesn't really stand up to the interventions, offering only modest pineapple and peach flavors.
title: Chalk Hill 2012 Estate Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)

description: Apricot, tangerine, peach and papaya flavors give this wine magnificent ripeness, accompanied by plenty of smoky, caramelized oak.
title: Pfendler 2012 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This difficult vintage has resulted in a difficult wine. It's dry, acidic and oaky, and the apricot and orange fruit is thin.
title: Krupp Brothers 2011 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is a well-priced Chardonnay that's rich and properly varietal. It's fruit-forward in pineapples, papayas, green apples and pears, with a subtle oak influence. The texture is smooth and creamy.
title: Kirkland Signature 2012 Signature Series Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a very ripe Chardonnay, with pineapple, orange and apricot jam flavors. It's rich but not particularly subtle, with lots of new French oak.
title: Nickel & Nickel 2012 Truchard Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This wine is soft, herbal and earthy. It has a lovely smoky creaminess, as well as hints of white stone and tropical fruits, but lacks a certain vibrancy.
title: Rutherford Hill 2012 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: The flavors of sweetened herb tea, pineapple and buttered toast mark this fresh, vibrant young Chardonnay. It's brisk in acidity and dry in the finish. A bit rustic, it's a fine wine to drink now.
title: Sojourn 2012 Campbell Ranch Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a big, fruity, oaky Chardonnay. What it lacks in subtlety it makes up for in sheer power. The flavors of apricots, tangerines and limes, with smoky oak influences, are rich and forward.
title: Hess Collection 2012 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This young wine is in your face now with strong acidity, powerful oak and jammy apricot, tangerine and green apple fruit. It's all too much of a good thing. It may be showing better by early 2015.
title: Ernest 2012 Dutton Ranch Rued Vineyard Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: Buttered toast, honeysuckle and vanilla flavors dominate. The underlying fruit flavors suggest mangoes, pears and limes. Drink this oaky wine now.
title: Bernardus 2012 Rosella's Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Clean and tart in lemon flavor, it has a bright streak of acidity throughout. Refreshing, it'll work well as an apéritif, a hint of pear lingering on the soft palate and finish.
title: Chacewater 2012 Made with Organically Grown Grapes Chardonnay (Lake County)

description: This attractively priced wine has nice acidity and subtle flavors of pear and lemon. A pronounced swaddling in oak reveals itself on the nose and mid-palate. Enjoy it with food on the richer side.
title: LangeTwins 2012 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Clarksburg)

description: Lots of ripe tropical fruit and peach flavors in this Chard, along with oak notes of buttered toast. You'll also find mouthwatering acidity and a creamy, leesy finish.
title: Bernardus 2012 Soberanes Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This rich, good Chardonnay is easy to drink. The tropical fruit, apricot and peach flavors are accented with oak, and balanced with acidity.
title: Cru 2012 Appellation Series Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Pure fruit flavors and zesty acidity mark this wine. It's rich and ripe in orange, apricot and papaya flavors, with little or no oak influence.
title: Peter Cellars 2012 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: With a little oak giving the wine a toasty, buttery mouthfeel, this Chard is brisk in acidity. It has ripe, flashy tropical fruit, tangerine, apricot and pear flavors.
title: Cameron Hughes 2012 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: A little oak, brisk acidity and good flavors of lemons, limes and mangoes mark this dry, stylishly creamy wine that's fine for drinking now, at a good price.
title: Hess Select 2012 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Ripe in tropical fruit, apricot and Meyer lemon flavors, it shows plenty of toasty oak. It's dry and creamy but not particularly complex. Drink up.
title: Bernardus 2012 Sierra Mar Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Oaky flavors of buttered toast and vanilla bean dominate this Chardonnay. It's also ripe in mango, pear, apricot and orange flavors allied with acidity. But the overall quality is average.
title: Andretti 2012 Montona Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: The wine offers a fantastic array of butterscotch, orange, pineapple, peach and vanilla bean flavors, brightened with vital acidity. But as rich as the wine tastes, it lacks a certain distinction.
title: Ca' Momi 2012 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: New French oak sticks out on this Chardonnay, making the co-stars buttered toast and caramel. Underneath the wine is dry and brisk in acidity, with lime and mango fruit flavors.
title: The Calling 2010 Jewell Vineyard Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Soft, ripe and oaky, this Chard has sweet, jammy flavors of lemons, oranges, apricots and oak. It's a flashy, opulent wine to drink now.
title: Peloton 2012 Spanish Springs Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo)

description: This is a good Chardonnay, by objective standards, but it does show the limitations that Napa Chard often exhibits. It's dry and clean, with a rich overlay of oak, and the lemon, lime and mango flavors are nice and ripe. However, the wine is a little heavy and obvious.
title: Frog's Leap 2012 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This widely produced Chardonnay is soft and oaky, with honey-infused vanilla, mango and Meyer lemon flavors. It's your basic Chardonnay, creamy and easy to drink.
title: Truett Hurst 2012 California Square Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Bright acidity gives mouthwatering liveliness to the tropical fruit, Meyer lemon, pear, vanilla, buttered toast and butterscotchy oak flavors. It's made to order for the popular style.
title: Simi 2011 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Appeals to the popular palate with white sugar, apricot, orange, pineapple and oak flavors. The apparent sweetness suggests pairing with cured meats. A weekend brunch with a ham omelet will be fine.
title: The Federalist 2011 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This Chard bowls it right down the middle of today's popular taste, offering ripe tangerine, apricot and mango flavors, enriched with plenty of caramelized oak. It's not particularly complex. Drink up.
title: Sonoma-Cutrer 2012 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Oaky flavors of buttered toast and butterscotch dominate this simple Chardonnay. It has ripe flavors of pineapples, mangoes and peaches.
title: Santa Barbara Winery 2011 Reserve Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Brisk acidity helps to provide some balance to this wine's oakiness, but it's still somewhat clumsy in profile. Flavors of buttered toast, caramel and dill dominate underlying notes of tropical fruit and pear.
title: Ferrari-Carano 2011 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Oak layers onto more oak in this toasty, buttery Chardonnay. Somewhere underneath all that wood is a soft wine with pineapple, peach and tropical fruit flavors.
title: Ferrari-Carano 2010 Emelia's Cuvée Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: New French oak lends toasty flavors of wood and butterscotch to this Chardonnay. It's rich and opulent with flavors of pineapple, orange and buttered toast.
title: Hendry 2011 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This soft, candied Chardonnay is enormously fruity with flavors of orange, peach, apricot, tropical fruit and buttered toast. Crisp acidity adds some balance.
title: Rutherford Ranch 2012 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: 100% barrel fermented in 50% new French oak, this wine is dominated by flavors of buttered toast, vanilla and butterscotch. Underneath all the oak is a wine that's quite brisk with acidity and a delicious pineapple-jam flavor.
title: Schug 2012 Estate Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This Chardonnay has an elegant structure with brisk acidity that counters flavors of tropical fruits, peaches, pears and sweet oak. The mouthfeel is a bit thin, but it's a pleasant wine.
title: Sonoma-Cutrer 2011 The Cutrer Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Made from organically grown grapes, this Chardonnay imparts a taste of beeswax and lemon. It's robust in acidity and structured with a sizeable finish. Small percentages of Muscat, Viognier and Riesling are mingled in.
title: Bonterra 2012 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: Caramel, oak and intensely ripe mango and peach flavors mark this Chardonnay. It's simple and straightforward, but pleasant drinking.
title: Calera 2012 Chardonnay (Mt. Harlan)

description: This bottling, from grapes grown in the winery's estate vineyard, has varied over the years. The 2011 vintage is not the finest expression, but it's a soft, easy-drinking Chardonnay with modest peach, pear and mango notes, along with substantial oak influence.
title: Signorello 2011 Hope's Cuvée Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: New oak gives this Chardonnay hints of buttered toast, vanilla and caramel. At the core, however, the wine is crisp with flavors of pineapples, green melons and sweet Meyer lemons.
title: Lincourt 2011 Courtney's Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Floral aromatically, this Chardonnay was fermented in neutral French oak and is elegant in style. High in acidity and with vibrant lemon flavor, it's a balanced and cohesive wine.
title: Longevity 2012 Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Ripe, exotic papaya, mango, apricot and tangerine flavors highlight this wine. There's also plenty of buttered toast notes, but it's balanced with brisk acidity. This is a fine wine for drinking now.
title: Calera 2012 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This ambitious effort from Trefethen was grown in a block of the estate vineyard. No effort was spared, with careful clonal selection, tasteful oak application and all the bells and whistles of Burgundian technique. The result, however, leaves something to be desired.
