There's a taste of green pea lurking in the background behind the tropical fruit, green apple and peach flavors that must be due to the unusually chilly vintage.
title: Trefethen 2010 Harmony Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

description: A touch of oak brings a buttery, toasty note to this Chardonnay. It shows fine acidity and dryness, with notes of tropical fruits, peaches and green apples.
title: Destination 2011 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Ripe flavors of peaches, Meyer lemons, limes and green apples mark this wine. The richness is balanced with acidity. For the price, it's a fine example of Russian River Chardonnay.
title: Sonoma Hills 2011 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: You'll find nice acidity, lots of toasty oak and citrus, tropical fruit and peach flavors in this dry Chardonnay. It's pleasant and fancy in its own way, but turns watery on the finish.
title: Sonoma-Cutrer 2011 Les Pierres Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Sourced from a host of vineyards, many of them in Sonoma County, this is an intensely dark, weighty Chardonnay with a taste of sour lemon and apple, rich in oak with a clean finish.
title: B.R. Cohn 2011 Silver Label Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: The oak is heavy-handed, giving the wine strong buttered toast and caramelized flavors despite rich pineapple and lemon fruit. The winery's Stainless Unoaked 2011 Chardonnay bottling is more balanced.
title: Chamisal Vineyards 2011 Estate Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: This Chardonnay shows a huge improvement over previous vintages. It take ripe tropical fruit and oak flavors and elevates them, with crisp acidity and an overall balance.
title: Laguna 2011 Laguna Ranch Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This Chardonnay is heavy and manipulated. The oak influence dominates everything else, in the form of buttered toast and butterscotch flavors on the finish. This is a fine one, but it lacks dryness and clarity.
title: Armida 2011 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This Chardonnay was barrel fermented and aged in 50% new French oak. You can taste the barrel influence in strong notes of buttered toast and butterscotch that dominate the underlying pineapple, pear and apple flavors.
title: Clif Family 2012 Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

description: Kenwood perfected their Chardonnay style a long time ago, and it works, so why would they change? The quality may vary vintage to vintage, but not by much, and the price is always everyday. The 2012 is ripe and fruity, with orange and mango flavors enhanced by sweet oak and crisp acidity.
title: Kenwood 2012 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: You'll find oaky aromas and flavors of buttered toast, sweet vanilla and butterscotch on this Chardonnay. The underlying fruit is pure and intense, suggesting ripe apricots, green apples and limes, brightened by a streak of acidity.
title: J. Lohr 2011 Riverstone Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: A good, if standard, wine that will satisfy Chardophiles who like their wines lush and ripe. It's rich in honey, pineapple, Meyer lemon and peach flavors.
title: Herzog 2011 Special Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A fairly standard Chardonnay, rich in oak, lees and ripe citrus and tropical fruit flavors, but raised up by brisk acidity and a fine minerality that gives it extra complexity. It's rich with honey and brown sugar, but doesn't feel cloying.
title: Icaria 2012 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This unoaked Chardonnay is so ripe and rich, you won't miss the buttered-toast flavor of oak. It's incredibly potent with limes, mangoes, oranges and pineapples, uplifted with brisk acidity. A weekend brunch of scrambled eggs and smoked salmon will be the perfect occasion.
title: Hoopla 2012 Unoaked Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is undeniably an oaky wine with a prominent layer of buttered toast and butterscotch, but the underlying orange, guava and lime flavors are pristine.
title: Frank Family 2011 Lewis Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: There are lots of rich, ripe pear, green apple, tropical-fruit and buttered-toast flavors in this creamy Chardonnay. It's lush and ripe, but has enough acidity for balance.
title: Frei Brothers 2011 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Plenty of crisp acidity balances the citrus, tropical fruit and pear flavors in this ripe Chardonnay. There's also a strong jacket of smoky oak with its buttered toast and vanilla richness. The result will please Chard lovers at a good price.
title: Cameron Hughes 2011 Lot 361 Chardonnay (Atlas Peak)

description: Full of apricot jam, honey, tangerine, Key lime pie and oak flavors, brightened by crisp acidity. It defines the rich, California Chardonnay style. Drink now.
title: 32 Winds 2010 Spinnaker Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Its brisk acidity and dry, tart lemon-and-lime flavors make this a nice wine to drink now. It has the herb and tobacco notes you often find in Napa Valley Chardonnay.
title: Hill Wine Company 2011 Black Dog Series Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: An oaky, ripe style of California Chardonnay, this tastes like a dessert pastry of citrus and tropical fruits, vanilla wafer and sugar. Brisk acidity goes a long way toward providing balance.
title: 32 Winds 2010 Hudson Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is an eccentric Chardonnay, despite coming from a highly esteemed vineyard. It's acidic and oaky-sweet with pineapple Life Savers candy pineapple and lemon-drop flavors.
title: Cellars 33 2011 Keefer Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This easy-drinking Chardonnay boasts flavors of sweet cream, buttered toast, honey and apricot-orange juice. Drink it over the next few months with shrimp salad, smoked trout or a weekend brunch of scrambled eggs and lox.
title: Bianchi 2011 El Camino Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Strong in oak and fruit, this ripe Chardonnay features apricots, oranges and peaches. It's honeyed, but finishes dry, giving the impression of great richness.
title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2010 Foggy Oaks Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Notes of pineapple candy, buttered popcorn, honey and vanilla flavors. Brisk acidity adds an important balance.
title: Martin Ray 2012 Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Although Chardonnay might not traditionally be Justin's strong suit, this is a ripe and creamy wine, with notes of tropical fruit, citrus and oak throughout.
title: Justin 2012 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Made in the popular style, this Chardonnay is heavy in oak, with ripe, jammy orange, pineapple and creamy lees flavors. It's a good wine, if not particularly subtle or complex.
title: Alysian 2010 Russian River Selection Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This Chard's oak accents pineapple and lemon fruit flavors. It's dry yet honeyed, that paradox of Chardonnay, with a good burst of citrusy acids for brightness.
title: Wild Horse 2011 Unbridled Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Francine's Selection has for almost 20 years been un-oaked and this vintage is as well, but its concentration of ripe flavors gives the impression of oak, the richness of creamy fruit and slight residual sugar giving it an impression of being a bigger wine. Pair with equally creamy and rich foods.
title: Toad Hollow 2011 Francine's Selection Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: After a poor showing in 2009, Jigar has redeemed itself. Their 2010 Chardonnay is rich and smooth in tropical fruits, cream, buttered toast and cinnamon spices. It's starting to show its age, so drink up.
title: Jigar 2010 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The sourcing on Landmark's Overlook bottling has changed constantly over the years. This 2011 is certainly rich in pineapples, nectarines, tangerines, Meyer lemons and smoky oak. It reflects the popular Chardonnay appetite.
title: Landmark 2011 Overlook Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Massively rich and ripe, a big, glamorous Chard that caters to the contemporary style. It's front-loaded with white sugar, tropical fruit and oak flavors. Sometimes less is more.
title: Matanzas Creek 2011 Journey Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Fires on all cylinders, with massive tropical fruit, peach and green apple fruit, enriched with sweet, smoky, vanilla-accented oak. The malolactic fermentation gives it a creamy, buttered-popcorn richness. It's rich and appealing in the modern style.
title: Rodney Strong 2011 Estate Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)

description: An easy, flashy Chardonnay to drink now. Shows tropical fruit, green apple, honey and sweet oak flavors, with a savory edge of acidity.
title: Sebastiani 2011 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Oak sticks out on this Chardonnay, with buttered toast, honey and caramel flavors dominating the underlying tropical and citrus fruits. It has good acidity and a fine minerality, but feels overworked. Drink now.
title: Saintsbury 2010 Brown Ranch Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Sweet vanilla, white sugar and orange jam flavors mark this Chardonnay. It has excellent acidity, and some stony, minerally notes. Despite the esteemed vineyard source, it's too oaky, and lacking in subtlety.
title: Stomping Girl 2011 Hyde Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Simple and satisfying with lots of ripe pineapple jam, orange sorbet, caramel, buttered toast, honey and cinnamon spices, in a creamy texture.
title: Jacella 2010 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A full-bodied yet crisp Chardonnay, balanced with just a tiny hint of lingering ripeness. Fine for mid-week meals.
title: Silver Buckle 2011 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: This ambitious winery continues to struggle to find the formula for pricy Chardonnay. They turn now to this new Sonoma County appellation, but the result is still pretty ordinary. The wine is all about buttered toast, popcorn and fruit jam, with a creamy texture that's universally appealing.
title: Captûre 2011 Ma Vie Carol Chardonnay (Pine Mountain-Cloverdale Peak)

description: Tasty in the modern style, with ripe, forward pineapple, orange, peach jam and buttered toast flavors. There's good acidity, and even a hint of minerals, but the wine ultimately is lushly one-dimensional.
title: Broadway Vineyards 2010 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Sweet vanilla, buttered toast and caramel dominate this Chardonnay. It does have some peach and tropical fruit flavors, and is nicely smooth and creamy, but the oak stands out.
title: Pure Cru 2010 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is an easy-pleasing Chardonnay, made to appeal to the popular style. It's rich in tropical fruit and citrus flavors, accented with plenty of sweet oak. Feels creamy and smooth, with a clean bite of acidity.
title: Terlato 2010 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Great acidity on this wine, with a squirt of lime juice giving it needed zest. The wine itself is simple, lush and fruity, with peach and pineapple flavors.
title: Lincourt 2010 Courtney's Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Brisk acidity is the best thing about this Chardonnay. It gives a mouthwatering zinginess to the tropical fruit and citrus flavors. The finish is a bit lush and simple with notes of buttered toast.
title: Francis Ford Coppola 2011 Diamond Collection Black Label Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Made in a drier, leaner style, this Chard is marked by citrus zest, herb and lees flavors. It's an elegant wine for drinking now.
title: Houdini 2011 Dean Block Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Creamy, buttery and honey-like, with rich orange and mango fruit flavors. The winemaker prevented the malolactic fermentation, so the acidity is crisp and apple-y.
title: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2011 Estate Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: This is a good wine, but it relies too much on oak, overwhelming it with buttered toast and caramel. The result is a rich but unbalanced wine, with underlying orange, pineapple and peach flavors.
title: Merryvale 2010 Silhouette Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is appealing for its richness, but it's heavily oaked with buttered toast and butterscotch flavors that overwhelm the underlying fruit. Too bad, because it's a nice Chardonnay with bright pineapple and orange flavors supported by fine acidity.
title: Kunde 2011 Wildwood Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Fruity and delicious with straightforward candied pineapple and orange flavors. Oak adds notes of buttered toast, while crisp acidity provides balance.
title: Windsor Oaks 2011 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This Chard is a bit heavy and oaky, with buttered toast, orange, pear and spicy fruit punch flavors. It's ripe with juicy fruit flavors but balanced by crisp acidity.
title: Ballard Lane 2011 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: There's good Santa Barbara character in this Chardonnay, with brisk acidity and minerality girding the tropical fruit and peach flavors. It's a little thin, but elegantly structured.
title: Magistrate 2011 Limited Production Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This wine plays it right down the middle, with pleasant flavors of buttered toast, orange jam and vanilla. With balancing acidity, it gets the Chardonnay job done in a good, straightforward way.
title: Russian River Vineyards 2010 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Rich and oaky, this wine's buttered toast and buttered popcorn flavors are the main attraction. You'll also find a pineapple-orange jam note, plus a vanilla-like sweetness.
title: Chateau St. Jean 2010 Belle Terre Vineyard Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Dry and oaky, this Chardonnay offers herb-inflected pineapple and pear flavors.
title: Patland 2011 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Made in the popular style, this has flavors of buttered toast, orange, peach, Meyer lemon and vanilla bean, which are brightened by crisp acidity. Drink now.
title: Alderbrook 2010 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This presents the opulence that many Chardonnay fans enjoy. It bears flavors of caramel, orange, pineapple, tapioca, vanilla, honey and cinnamon, which are wrapped in a creamy texture.
title: River Road 2011 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The brisk acidity on this wine balances the seemingly sweet flavors of pineapple-orange jam, vanilla bean and buttered toast. This is an affordable introduction to the fine Chardonnays from this well-regarded Santa Barbara County appellation.
title: Three Saints 2010 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Dry and acidic, this Chardonnay has a herbaceous earthiness, plus flavors of orange and pear.
title: Shadowbox 2010 Orchard Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This Chardonnay is rich and balanced, with brisk acidity and deep, long flavors of limes, tangerines and Meyer lemons.
title: Four Vines 2011 Naked Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This has apricot, orange and Meyer lemon notes, plus a sweet toastiness. It will appeal to consumers who enjoy Charonnays with a buttercream-like smoothness and a buttered popcorn flavor.
title: Flocchini 2011 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Simple and straightforward, this Chardonnay has notes of vanilla, caramel and oak. A bite of sweet baked apple is most pronounced on the finish.
title: Epilogue 2010 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: A fine Chardonnay for drinking now, this will satisfy for its creamy texture and tart flavors of buttered toast, oranges and pears.
title: Hawkstone 2011 Barney's Heritage Cuvée Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This follows the tried and true path of making Chardonnay with ripe fruit and plenty of creamy oak. The flavors are of apricots, oranges, sour lees and buttered toast.
title: Jeff Gordon 2011 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Ripe and juicy, this bears orange, lime and tropical fruit flavors. It's dry, but so fruity that it almost seems sweet. The acidity is strong and the alcohol is refreshingly modest.
title: Robert Hall 2011 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: This effort shows the dry earthy and herbal qualities that often mark Trefethen Chardonnays grown in this southerly district of Napa Valley. It has flavors of tobacco, tropical fruit and oak, with lots of zesty acidity.
title: Trefethen 2010 Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

description: Heavy oak and lees were applied to this wine's rich, ripe flavors of tropical fruit, Meyer lemon, orange and lime. It's delicious, but it lacks nuance and complexity.
title: Frank Family 2011 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This brisk, satisfying Chardonnay offers plenty of varietal flavors of tropical fruit and green apple, with a smoky jacket of oak.
title: Kenwood 2011 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This is an easy Chardonnay, seemingly sweet and ripe in apricot, orange and mango flavors, with vanilla and buttered toast notes from the oak aging. Mouthwatering acidity provides great balance.
title: De Tierra 2009 Reserve Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: This is a tasty Chardonnay, showing lots of pear, orange, mango, vanilla-cream and butterscotch flavors. It tastes on the sweeter side.
title: Calcareous 2011 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: A seemingly sweet, simple but likeable Chardonnay, this shows the buttered toast and buttered popcorn flavors so popular among consumers, with rich pineapple and mango notes and a nice burst of Carneros acidity.
title: Reata 2010 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Strong in oak and ripe fruit, this tastes overworked. It's dominated by buttered toast, butterscotch and pineapple jam flavors. It will satisfy legions of Chardonnay lovers who like this popular style.
title: Sierra Madre 2010 Block 210 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: The underlying wine here is fine, crisp and minerally, with green apple fruit. Lots of new oak, however, sticks out, in the form of buttered toast and butterscotch.
title: Pine Ridge 2010 Dijon Clones Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Lots of dominating new French oak shows up in the form of smoky, vanilla-rich buttered-toast aromas and flavors. Under the oak are forward notes of pineapple jam, green apple butter and spice flavors. A little obvious in its appeal, but it will satisfy lots of Chardonnay lovers.
title: Trione 2009 River Road Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: With flavors of buttered toast, vanilla, sweet mango and orange jam flavors, this is as rich, ripe and oaky as they come. Finishing with a honeyed accent, it's made to appeal to consumer's who enjoy the popular style.
title: Dillon 2009 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Yountville)

description: This brims with ripe, forward flavors of pineapples, golden mangos, honey and spicy pears, with vanilla and buttered toast notes despite being unoaked.
title: Dillon 2009 Stainless Steel Fermented Chardonnay (Yountville)

description: The white sister to the wine Seven Deadly Zins, this is lusciously sinful in its own right, tasting of oak, vanilla and marshmallow and even movie theater popcorn. Creamy, this finishes with a swath of ripe green apple.
title: Seven Heavenly Chards 2011 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Rich, if a little one-dimensional, this has flavors of creamy orange, yellow apricot, vanilla and buttered toast. It will appeal to fans of the forward style of Chardonnay.
title: Domaine Eden 2009 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Strong and oaky but not particularly subtle or complex. It's impressive for its sheer power, offering blasts of buttered toast, butterscotch, pineapple and orange jam and vanilla, wrapped up in a creamy texture.
title: Sobriquet Winery 2010 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Dry, brisk in acidity and ripe, this has stimulating minerality that undergirds the fruit flavors of Meyer lemon, lime and guava. But what dominates is the hugeness of size and the richness that goes on and on.
title: Boheme 2009 English Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is too oaky, with vanilla, buttered toast and butterscotch notes dominating the underlying pineapple and guava flavors.
title: Groth 2010 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Sweet oak and buttered toast flavors dominate this Chardonnay. Underneath there are flavors of pineapple, pear and orange. It's rich, dry and bright in acidity.
title: Stemmler 2010 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is pretty standard, with good acidity pervading tropical fruit flavors. There's a rich overlay of sweet oak.
title: Walt 2010 La Brisa Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Rich and buttery, this has smoky oak and toast flavors that frame the pineapple and orange jam notes. Not overly complicated, this is made in a way that appeals to Chardonnay lovers. Production was a hefty 16,500 cases.
title: William Hill Estate 2010 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This has slender flavors of tangerine and peach. It's elegantly dry, clean and brisk in acidity, with a light touch of smoky oak-definitely worth the price.
title: Lockwood 2010 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: A solid Chardonnay, this is dry, rich and creamy, with lemon, lime and tropical fruit flavors. A touch of oak brings a nice note of buttered toast.
title: Fleur 2010 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: This is a fairly simple wine. Although it's rich in apricot, orange and tropical fruit flavors, not to mention oak, it's a little overripe and seemingly sweet. The vanilla and buttered toast flavors will appeal to many.
title: Riverbench 2010 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Using grapes sourced from a cool subappellation of the Lodi area, this is a fine, ripe wine that finishes sweetly on a note of vanilla. Its acidity is in balance, making this a wine that will easily please a crowd.
title: McManis 2011 Chardonnay (River Junction)

description: This is a stainless-steel-aged Chardonnay with splendid streaks of lemon, honey and kiwi that surround a core of tart apple. It's balanced with good acidity that greets you on the entrance and on the finish.
title: Jason-Stephens 2010 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Clara Valley)

description: Packaged in an attractive sunflower-adorned screwcap bottle, this Chardonnay made from organic grapes is light, bright and straightforward-tasting of lemon, lime and kiwi-with barely any oak influence.
title: Girasole 2010 Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: This delivers what many American consumers want in a Chardonnay. It's creamy, buttery and seemingly sweet, with candied pineapple and orange flavors.
title: Rock Wall 2010 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A pretty good Chardonnay made to appeal to consumer's who relish the popular style. It's rich and creamy, with pineapple jam, orange and mango juice and buttered toast flavors.
title: Rock Wall 2010 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: The fruit sure is ripe in this Chardonnay. It bursts with pineapples, limes and apricots, with bright, brisk acidity. The finish is entirely dry.
title: Martin Ray 2011 Unoaked Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: With no oak influence, this is pure and simple. It has direct flavors of ripe pineapples, apricots, oranges and Meyer lemons. The acidity is very strong, giving the wine a sweet-and-sour feel.
title: Balletto 2010 Teresa's Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This Chardonnay remains dry and resistant in acids and tannins. The flavors are elusive, suggesting minerals and lemons, with plenty of brisk, citrusy acidity.
title: Grgich Hills 2008 Carneros Selection Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Acidity dominates this Chardonnay despite rich pineapple, orange and apricot flavors. It's rather oaky, with a flavor of buttered toast. Made in the popular style, it's for drinking now.
title: Graton Ridge 2010 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Dominated by sweet oak and sweet fruit, this Chardonnay is made to appeal to consumers who enjoy the popular style. This tastes like orange and lemon jam, with body from the alcohol.
title: Santa Barbara Winery 2009 Reserve Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Marked by flamboyant oak, this wine is dominated by buttered toast and sweet butterscotch flavors. Down under all that is pineapple and mango fruit. Will appeal to fans of this oaky style.
title: Guarachi Family 2010 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Sweet and soft, this simple Chardonnay has flavors of oranges, pineapples, vanilla, cream and buttered toast. It's made in a style to appeal.
title: Maldonado 2009 Parr Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Simple and honey sweet, made in the popular style, with jammy apricot, nectarine and citrus flavors. Bright acidity provides clean balance.
title: Alderbrook 2009 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This has orange, pineapple and green apple flavors that are accented by oaky caramel. Balanced with crisp, citrusy acidity, this should pair well with rich shellfish fare. Drink now.
title: Windsor Sonoma 2010 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Flavors of creamy vanilla pudding, buttered toast and pineapple jam mark this slightly sweet Chardonnay. A crisp streak of acidity provides much needed balance to the richness.
title: Cartlidge & Browne 2010 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: Rich, ripe and oaky, with crisp acidity and notes of pineapple jam and buttered toast. Tasty and flashy, but is marked with a slightly vegetal flavor.
title: Laetitia 2010 Estate Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: This is a dry, minerally and acidic Chardonnay, with just enough of a squeeze of lemon and lime to satisfy. Drink this austere wine with roast chicken, broiled halibut and vegetable tempura.
title: Sanglier Cellars 2010 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Strong and eccentric, this tastes like the grapes from this fine vineyard had a hit of botrytis. But it's not sweet; the end result is dry, with apricot and honey flavors.
title: Suacci Carciere Wines 2009 Heintz Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Good acidity in this wine, with a pleasant minerality, but it's really too fruity and buttery. Shows little subtlety beyond pineapple, peach and pear jam flavors.
title: Adelaida 2010 HMR Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Dry and somewhat herbaceous, this Chardonnay has some good pear, melon and orange fruit, but otherwise is missing out on opulence, especially at this price. New oak, to the tune of 40%, contributes buttered toast and caramel, but the wine needs more than that.
title: Grgich Hills 2009 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Rich in tropical fruit and citrus flavors and generously oaked, this Chardonnay is made in the modern style, designed to appeal. It's dry and properly crisp, with a fine minerality, but is overworked. You can feel the heavy hand of the winemaker.
title: Robert Mondavi 2009 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: New French oak dominates this wine with buttered toast and caramel flavors. Despite this heavy hand, the underlying wine somehow shines through, with orange, mango, pear and peach flavors, brightened with brisk acidity.
title: Lobo 2010 Wulff Vineyards Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

description: Overworked and oaky, with vanilla, buttered toast and sweet caramel flavors dominating everything else. Buried beneath are pineapple and pear flavors.
title: Rodney Strong 2009 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Dry, minerally and acidic, this Chardonnay offers pineapple, lemon and mineral flavors. It's a food-friendly wine that won't compete with what you eat. At this price, it's a good restaurant wine, and easy to find, with 7,500 cases produced.
title: Black Stallion 2010 Estate Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Sweet, ripe and intense, with vibrant acidity brightening lime, kiwi, orange, pear and pineapple flavors. It's long-hangtime Edna Valley fruit, pure and simple.
title: Center of Effort 2009 Effort Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: You'll be surprised how much class there is in this inexpensive Chardonnay. It's rich in orange, pineapple and butterscotch flavors, while brisk acidity etches it in brightness. Finishes a little sweet, but you can stand this against many Chards that cost two or three times as much.
title: Hilltown 2010 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: A streak of green testifies to some unripe notes, which are accompanied by notable acidity. The wine is rather lean and angular, especially compared with lusher, riper Chards from the vicinity, but some will like its linearity and low alcohol.
title: Chanin 2009 Los Alamos Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Sweet and oaky, with orange, pineapple and pear jam, buttered toast and vanilla flavors. Plays it safe down the middle by appealing to the popular taste.
title: Hanna 2010 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: For the price, this is a good value in California Chardonnay. It shows ripe flavors of citrus and tropic fruits, with a creamy, oaky mouthfeel that finishes with a clean scour of acidity.
title: Wilson Daniels 2010 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Everything tastes interventionist on this Chardonnay. The fruit is extracted in pineapple jam, the oak is strong, the wine went through malolactic fermentation, which gives it buttered toast flavors, and the acidity feels unnatural given the ripeness. Will satisfy fans of the New World style, but the wine, tasty as it is, lacks authenticity and balance.
title: Stuhlmuller Vineyards 2009 Reserve Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Treads a vital line between a heavy, overworked oakiness and the rich, Burgundian opulence you want in a great California Chardonnay. Unfortunately, it crosses that line. Shows too much oak, dominating the citrus and tropical fruits with buttered toast and butterscotch.
title: Merryvale 2009 Silhouette Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Sweet, rich and oaky, marked by flavors of buttered popcorn, toast, pineapple jam and ripe apricots. Made in the modern style that will be liked by many, but not particularly sophisticated.
title: James Family Cellars 2010 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: A good Chardonnay that offers plenty of tropical fruit, pear and sweet, smoky oak flavors, brightened with crisp acidity. But Ridge hasn't been known as a source of great Chardonnay for years, and this '08 doesn't change that. It's seriously overpriced.
title: Ridge 2008 Monte Bello Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Not the best Tinaquiac to come along in recent years. Even though the new oak is a relatively modest 25%, it seems over-oaked, dripping with buttered toast and caramel flavors that overshadow the underlying citrus and tropical fruits.
title: Foxen 2010 Tinaquiac Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This is an elegantly constructed wine. It's not especially rich, but subtle in citrus fruit, roasted nut, jasmine, vanilla and oak flavors, brightened with notable acidity. A note of green sage is distracting.
title: Freemark Abbey 2010 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Here's a rich, soft Chardonnay made from exceedingly ripe grapes, and a heavy application of oak flavoring. Brims with pineapple críªme brulée, butterscotch, vanilla cookie and cinnamon flavors.
title: William Hill Estate 2006 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Rich and sweet in pineapples, pears and honey, with sweet buttered toast, vanilla cream and buttered popcorn flavors, this Chardonnay overdoes it in the modern style. It will appeal to lots of consumers.
title: Parallel 2009 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Your average California Chardonnay, fruity in pineapples and vanilla cream, with a spicy, butterscotchy richness.
title: Dutch Bill Creek 2009 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Sweet and extracted in pineapple, tangerine, lime and vanilla flavors, this Chardonnay also is generously oaked, which gives it even richer vanilla and buttered toast notes. It's flashy, yet would benefit from greater dryness and restraint. Size isn't everything.
title: Anaba 2009 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This everyday Chardonnay will appeal to fans of the modern style of ripe fruit and plenty of oak. It's rich and creamy, with pineapple, tangerine and mango flavors.
title: Lake Sonoma 2010 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Bright, jammy pineapple, yellow apricot and white peach fruit flavors mark this unoaked Chardonnay. It has brisk acidity and is almost sweet in honey. Delicious, but simple, and made for drinking now.
title: Adastra 2010 N'Oak Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is one of those wines that could be anything from Chardonnay to Pinot Grigio or Sauvignon Blanc. It doesn't really matter, because it's pleasant and easy to drink, with sweet flavors of tangerines and vanilla.
title: Daniel Gehrs 2010 Oak Free Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: A rich, oaky Chardonnay, fairly standard issue. It's sweet and opulent in vanilla, caramel, buttered toast, pineapple marmalade and ripe pear flavors, in a creamy texture.
title: Manzanita Creek 2010 Foothill Vineyard Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)

description: An earthy Chardonnay, with herb-infused citrus and peach flavors, overlaid with sweet oak. It's soft and a little sweet and ready to drink now.
title: Schug 2008 Heritage Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Flashy and flamboyant, but smells and tastes overoaked, with buttered toast, caramel and vanilla meringue notes swamping the underlying tangerine, lemon and mango fruit. Drink now.
title: Dutton Estate 2009 Dutton Palms Vineyard Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A 100%-organic Chardonnay, stainless steel fermented and poured into a handy-dandy, also certified-organic AstraPouch (1.5 liter). This easy-to-bring-on-a-picnic wine is clean, balanced and simply drinkable with a note of sweet grapefruit and pineapple.
title: ecoVINO 2010 AstraPouch Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: Way too much oak on this wine, which is dominated by buttered toast and butterscotch aromas and flavors. Underneath all that you'll find pineapples and guavas.
title: Oakville Ranch 2008 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Eccentric, with sweet and sour tangerine, banana and buttered toast flavors. Crisp acidity provides balance, but the wine is nearing the end of its useful period.
title: Ici/La-Bas 2007 Elke Vineyard Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: With loads of sweet, smoky oak and superripe flavors of orange and pineapple jam, this Chardonnay offers consumers what they want. Good in a California way, but purists will expect something more nuanced.
title: Armida 2009 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Too oaky, with vanilla, buttered toast and caramel dominating the pineapple, pear and lime flavors beneath. The wine is fundamentally good and crisp, but has been swamped by barrel influences.
title: Groth 2009 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is a useful if not particularly complex Chardonnay. It shows good coastal acidity and fine, long hangtime tropical fruit flavors, accented with oak. Will appeal to those who like a slightly sweet Chard made in the popular style.
title: Hearst Ranch 2009 Glacier Ridge Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Overworked and overoaked, dominated by buttered toast and caramel flavors. Underneath is pineapple, tangerine and apricot jam, brightened with crisp acidity.
title: MacRostie 2008 Wildcat Mountain Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: With zesty acidity, this Chardonnay's ripe pineapple, green apple and pear fruit flavors are balanced with a clean scour. It's a little sweet and direct, a wine to drink now.
title: HB 2009 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Lots of ripe pineapple and tropical fruit flavors in this direct, one-dimensional wine. Lots of oak, too, with a veneer of buttered toast and vanilla. Easy to find, with 10,000 cases produced.
title: Main & Geary 2009 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Simple and sweet, this Chard charms with pineapple, tangerine, Meyer lemon, buttered toast and cinnamon spice flavors. It's not especially complex, but will dazzle Chardophiles who want richness and oak.
title: Armida 2010 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Sweet and fruity in orange, pineapple, pear and lime flavors, with a good burst of acidity for balance. A rich, spicy New World-style Chardonnay for drinking now.
title: Midnight 2009 Estate Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Showing oaky flavors of vanilla, butterscotch and buttered toast, this Chardonnay has the brisk acidity of the Arroyo Seco appellation. The flavors are of pineapples, oranges and limes.
title: Mercy 2009 Zabala Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Muted at first, this 30,000-case production Chardonnay slowly develops tart, tropical aromas, then bits of apricot, vanilla and oak. It's aged in "Old Heads" (barrels from past vintages) and is a good-enough value for the price.
title: Matchbook 2009 Old Head Chardonnay (Dunnigan Hills)

description: The fruity flavors of pineapples, mangoes and papayas burst from this wine, with a rich layer of smoky, caramelized oak. Almost as sweet as a dessert pastry, it's made to appeal to the popular Chardonnay palate.
title: William Hill Estate 2009 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: With a taste of white sugar and honey, this Chardonnay can't really be described as dry. But it is clean and vibrant in acidity, with rich pineapple jam and green apple flavors, and the underlying tang of minerals helps to ground it.
title: Rutz 2009 Proprietor's Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Chardonnays from this vineyard always are powerful, but this bottling is over the top. It has ultraripe apricot and tangerine flavors, with strong acidity. Seems almost botrytised, with a honeyed intensity, although it's dry.
title: Sheldon 2007 Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Tastes pretty sweet, with a sugar and honeysuckle richness. But the tangerine fruit flavor is deep and impressive, and the vanilla and buttered toast notes from oak are what consumers like.
title: Bridlewood 2009 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Could finish drier, as there's a sugary sweetness throughout. But a lemony scour of acidity helps, and the flavors are extraordinarily rich, suggesting lemon meringue pie and pineapple marmalade.
title: Alpha Omega 2008 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A good Chardonnay, modestly oaked, with pleasant flavors of lemons, pineapples, buttered toast and cinnamon spice. Brisk acidity makes it finish bright and clean.
title: Wine Spots 2009 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Classic Edna Valley Chardonnay, dry, minerally and crisp in acidity, with strong, upfront tangerine, pineapple and pear flavors. A clean, brisk and tasty Chardonnay for drinking now with salmon or ham.
title: Fossil Point 2009 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: An eccentric Chardonnay. It's certainly not shy, offering a blast of pineapple, Meyer lemon and Asian pear fruit flavors, brightened with good acidity and elaborated with oak. The trick with this kind of Chardonnay is to make it finish dry. This one doesn't.
title: Rued 2009 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Made in the Californian way of ripe fruit and sweet oak, this Chardonnay is dominated by flavors of buttered toast, buttered popcorn and pineapple jam. Will have plenty of fans of the popular style.
title: Tolosa 2008 569 Edna Ranch Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: A strong, oaky Chardonnay. Lacks subtlety and interest, but if you're looking for sheer power, it's for you. Shows pineapple jam, buttered toast and caramel flavors.
title: Kuleto Estate 2009 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Flamboyantly rich and manipulated Chardonnay, with buttered popcorn, tropical fruit and caramaelized toast flavors. Feels a little heavy-handed, but lots of Chard lovers will like it.
title: Mi Sueño 2008 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: This is a richly sweet Chardonnay, made in the popular style, for drinking now. The orange, pineapple and apricot flavors are savory, and the oak gives caramel notes.
title: De Sante 2008 Old Vine Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Made in the modern style, with plenty of sweet oak and modest lime, green apple, persimmon and buttered toast flavors, brightened with acidity. Shows good varietal character for the price.
title: Byron 2009 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Will satisfy Chard fans who like ripe fruit and plenty of oak. Shows pineapple marmalade, orange fruit cake, vanilla, buttered popcorn and smoky oak flavors, finished with brisk acidity.
title: Buena Vista 2008 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Simple in buttered popcorn and toast flavors, this Chard has underlying flavors of pineapples. It's a dry wine, crisp in acidity. Made in the popular style for drinking now.
title: V. Sattui 2008 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A dependable Chardonnay, ripe and opulent in pineapple, crème brûlée, vanilla cream, buttered toast and cinnamon spice flavors. Could and should be drier, as it exceeds the sweetness speed limit, but will satisfy fans of this ripe California style.
title: White Oak 2009 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This Chardonnay has good flavors of pineapples, golden mangos, green apples and honey. It's pretty good, but one drawback is that the acidity is very strong, almost overpowering.
title: Bookster 2009 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Wente is well known for its Wente clone, a popular sight in many a California Chardonnay vineyard. This flavorful example is compellingly rich and textured, yet modest in alcohol, with a happy apple, melon taste and a bit of an exotic lift on the finish, possibly from the 2% Gewürztraminer that's blended in.
title: Wente 2009 Morning Fog Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Made without oak, although the wine has a tart leanness that would have benefited from a little barrel exposure. Nonetheless, it's dry and crisp and minerally, with modest pineapple, Meyer lemon and flower flavors.
title: Sebastiani 2009 Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Ripe and oaky in the modern style, with strong apricot, tangerine, pineapple and peach flavors and a buttery, creamy texture. Offers lots of upfront Chardonnay character.
title: Educated Guess 2008 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A nice, smooth Chardonnay, with ripe fruit and cream and lots of oaky buttered toast. Made in the popular California style.
title: Beringer 2008 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Too much oak on this Chardonnay. It's dominated by the aromas and flavors of buttered toast and caramelized, vanilla accented wood. Underneath all that are some pretty good pineapple, peach and pear flavors.
title: Beringer 2008 Private Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Fancy and oaky, with crisp acidity balancing strong pineapple, green apple and new oak flavors. A modern style Chardonnay to drink now.
title: Wrath 2008 Fermata Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Shows all the hallmarks of a fine Chard, except complexity. It's dry, creamy and smoky in oak and lees influences, with flavors of pineapples and peaches. Easy to find, with 250,000 cases produced.
title: Rodney Strong 2009 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Sweetly ripe and oaky, with pineapple jam, kiwi, pear and green apple, and notes of vanilla, buttered popcorn and cream. Defines the fruit-forward, buttery style of Chardonnay in a soft, forward way.
title: Paradise Ridge 2008 Sapphire Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Oaky and ripe, this Chardonnay shows soft flavors of pineapples, Meyer lemons, mangoes and sweetly smoked vanilla oak. Made in the modern style for drinking now.
title: Hawkes 2008 Gravel Bar Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Lots of rich, forward pineapple, ripe pear jam, vanilla cream and buttered toast flavors in this Chardonnay. It will satisfy your sweet tooth, with its honey-rich finish. Drink now.
title: Bedarra 2008 Reserve Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Tasted in August, this Chard was tart, almost fizzy in acidity, not unpleasant in itself, but unusual. It gave a bubbly note to the peach, pear and pineapple flavors. Drink now.
title: Kunde 2008 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: A good wine, comprised of fruit from vineyards scattered across Santa Barbara County. It's bone dry and crisp in acidity, and also pretty oaky. The underlying fruit flavors are of apricots and pears, with perhaps a touch of botrytis. Ready to drink now.
title: Gainey 2008 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Depends for its appeal largely on oak's vanilla cream and buttered toast flavors, in addition to ripe pineapples and peaches. Made to appeal to the popular style. Could show more nuance and sophistication.
title: Riverbench 2008 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Shows the vanilla and buttered toast notes from oak that people like, in addition to varietal flavors of pineapples, green apples and lemons. A bit one-dimensional, but will satisfy Chardonnay fans who want that rich creamy opulence.
title: Waterstone 2008 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Here's a basically good California Chardonnay, made in the popular style. It's ripe in pineapple, orange and mango fruit, with an elaborate overlay of sweet, smoky oak.
title: Buena Vista 2007 Ramal Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This super-ripe, oaky, leesy Chardonnay lacks subtlety, but packs plenty of power. It's enormously forward in apricot and pineapple fruit, with the custard, buttered popcorn and caramel flavors that come from barrel fermentation. Finishes with a brown sugar sweetness.
title: Sonoma Coast Vineyards 2008 Gold Ridge Hills Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Located in a very cool site, in a difficult environment, this vineyard needs a warmer vintage to succeed, which 2008 wasn't. The wine is high in acidity, almost sour, and the apricot flavors are intense and overpowering. Lots of new oak provides a welcome, softening richness, but the wine still tastes sharp and unbalanced.
title: Sonoma Coast Vineyards 2008 Antonio Mountain Vineyard Aria Block Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Pretty simple in pineapple, orange and peach flavors, like a fruit juice drink you buy at the supermarket. Good acidity provides balance, but the wine remains straightforward.
title: Gary Farrell 2008 Carneros Selection Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Sweet and oaky, this Chard tastes like a vanilla and caramel cream soda, with alcohol and a squirt of pineapple essence. Defines the superripe, opulent style, without much complexity.
title: Paoletti 2008 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a dry, firmly crisp Chardonnay, with pineapple, apricot, mineral and vanilla flavors. It's somewhat simple and direct, but very clean and zesty. Nice for drinking now.
title: Leto 2008 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A good, rich Chardonnay that satisfies fans of oaky, ripe bottlings. Brims with pineapple, peach, buttered toast and cinnamon spice flavors, brightened with crisp acidity.
title: Fair Hare NV Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: Bone dry and hard in acidity, this is an austere Chardonnay that lacks richness, and hopes to trade on elegance. It has modest pineapple flavors, touched with smoky oak and lees. Defines a low-alcohol, minerally approach. Drink now.
title: Clos du Val 2008 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Very ripe and forward in pineapples and honey, with brisk acidity. Good and rich, but seems overwrought, lacking complexity and nuance, like a fruit juice drink.
title: Melville 2008 Estate Verna's Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: A good Chardonnay, if a little unbalanced, showing some green, minty notes to the citrus and oak. Despite the rich creaminess, feels somewhat unripe. Drink now.
title: Tantara 2007 Dierberg Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Very oaky and very ripe, offering a flood of pineapple jam, pear, vanilla and toasty oak flavors. Crisp acidity provides needed balance and a clean, brisk mouthfeel.
title: De Loach 2008 Cool Coastal Vineyards Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Very rich, ripe and oaky, but something of a fruit-oak bomb. Blasts the palate with pineapple jam, toasty meringue, caramel and buttered toast aromas and flavors. Lacks subtlety.
title: Derbes 2006 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Oak sticks out on this Chardonnay, striking with buttered toast, vanilla and wood char notes that dominate the underlying wine, which has perfectly fine citrus and tropical fruit flavors.
title: Schug 2008 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A bit common, with a scoury texture and decent flavors of pineapples, apples and oak, with a very dry, acidic finish.
title: St. Francis 2008 Wild Oak Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Fruity and oaky, with rich flavors of pineapples, pears, buttercream, vanilla cookie and toasty meringue. Crisp acidity provides clean balance.
title: Martin Ray 2008 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Ripe and fruity, this is a Chardonnay that will appeal to fans of the modern style. Brims with pineapples, lemons, limes and green apples, with a touch of vanilla cream.
title: Guenoc 2008 Chardonnay (Lake County)

description: Fruity and oaky, this Chardonnay is made in the modern California style of immediate palate appeal. It's not especially complex or ageworthy, but has crowd-pleasing flavors of pineapple tart, crème brûlée and vanilla cookies.
title: Athair 2008 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A little too soft and sweet for balance, with flavors like the melted filling of pineapple tart, lemon meringue pie and vanilla custard. Alcohol adds a nice, balancing burn.
title: Adelaida 2008 HMR Estate Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Dryness and herba notes mark this wine. Despite some rich oak influences, it comes down on the mineral and sage side, only vaguely suggesting fruitier notes of pineapples and peaches.
title: Summers 2008 Stuhlmuller Vineyards Reserve Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Tastes very oaky, with vanilla and caramel flavors dominating the earthy pineapples and green apples. That earthiness shows up in the form of sage-like herbs. Ready now.
title: Oakville Ranch 2007 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A lean, crisp, herbal Chardonnay. Lacks richness, but the structure is dry and elegant. Shows tobacco, sage, cedar and citrus fruit flavors.
title: Elkhorn Peak 2007 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Good and rich, but tastes too oaky, with the pineapple, nectarine and peach flavors swamped by vanilla, caramel and butterscotch. Other than that, there's a fine, crisp minerality to the finish.
title: Fleming Jenkins 2008 Jenkins Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Quite a nice Chardonnay, especially at this price. It's elegant and crisp, with a mineral undertow to the pineapple, buttered toast and honeysuckle flavors. Easy to like for its balance.
title: Hahn Estates 2008 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Dry and creamy, with peaches and cream, buttered toast and mineral flavors. The oak sticks out a little too much, and there's some bitterness that rich fare will help balance.
title: Coquelicot 2007 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: A nice Chardonnay whose rich, sweet smoky oak is pronounced, but doesn't dominate, as it does on their reserve Proximus bottling. Shows a nice minerally and slight herbal taste to the pineapples, apples and peaches.
title: Adastra 2007 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Smells a bit underripe, with a whiff of fresh asparagus, and richness is missing in the mouth. The flavors are of citrus fruits, lees, oak and fresh herbs. Nicely dry and crisp, but rather lean.
title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2007 Arcadia Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A dry, somewhat lean Chardonnay marked by suggestions of lemons and limes, with some oak and lees influence, and notes of fresh herbs. Almost like Sauvignon Blanc in its tart, lemony feeling. Drink now.
title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2007 Karia Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Made in the California style, with very ripe pineapple and apple fruit, elaborated by French oak barrels, malolactic fermentation and sur lie aging. The result will appeal to many, even if it's a bit obvious and direct.
title: J. Lohr 2006 October Night Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Tastes too oaky, with overwhelming smoky caramel, vanilla extract and buttered toast notes that swamp the underlying pineapples and peaches. In this case, you're better off with Gainey's regular 2007 Chard, which costs a lot less.
title: Gainey 2007 Limited Selection Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: There's an herbal undertow to this wine, with suggestions of dill and sage to the pineapples, green apples and buttercream. It's also soft, lacking the clean vibrancy that a rich Chardonnay requires. Drink now.
title: Frog's Leap 2008 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Oaky and ripe, this Chardonnay shows barrel-inspired vanilla and buttered toast flavors that enrich the pineapples and apples. A touch of Gewurztraminer lifts it into floral and lychee territory.
title: Wente 2008 Riva Ranch Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Crisply acidic and very dry, with modest pineapple, lime and mineral flavors and a touch of leesy sourness wrapped into a cream mouthfeel. Drink now.
title: Muirwood 2008 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Briny and oaky, this wine offers a sweetness of vanilla, peach and pineapple, with a bite of apple pie at its end.
title: Benziger 2016 West Rows Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This well-balanced wine is medium to full bodied, has modest fruit and spice aromas and a clean, straightforward fruit flavor.
title: Fleur 2016 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: This wine presents as oaky upfront before making room for layered flavors of melon, baked apple and peach, the grapes sourced from a multitude of locations within the appellation. Round and approachable, it offers great value.
title: La Crema 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Very shy on the aromas, this bottling slowly reveals hints of key lime pith. There is decent texture and bright acidity on the palate, which is clean but only shows hints of a citrus flavor.
title: Divum 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: This wine is intense in acidity, with a severity that takes time to resolve. The oak is dusted in vanilla, adding to an inherent richness of lemon meringue and brioche.
title: Altvs 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Stainless steel fermented and then aged in neutral French oak, this white is light, ripe and simple, wrapped up in confectionery hints of peach, apricot and melon supported by subtle wooden tones.
title: Fallon Place 2016 La Cruz Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Light peach and honey aromas lead to very ripe, full fruit flavors and a hint of sweetness on the palate. This unoaked wine has medium to full body and a rich soft texture.
title: Jessie's Grove 2017 Steel Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Robust ripeness and oak rule the day in this hearty white, big on flavors of butterscotch and caramel.
title: Hawley 2016 Hopkins River Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a robust oak-driven white, rich in baked and concentrated apple, melon and pineapple flavors. The structure is moderate if not somewhat muddled, with a nuttiness that comes through on the finish.
title: Roth 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This wine is a tad disjointed and hard to define, lacking in structure but big on vanilla bean and baked-apple flavor, with a hint of honeysuckle on the nose.
title: Big Vine 2013 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Partially fermented in barrel and partially in stainless steel, this is a likable white with plenty of ripe tropical fruit, vanilla oak and grainy texture that's made in a full-bodied robust style.
title: Educated Guess 2015 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Candied flavors like caramel and butterscotch make this full-bodied wine seem sweet, while a lush, soft texture coats the palate.
title: Ivory and Burt 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: A value-driven proposition that's been left unoaked, this wine is fully creamy and robust despite its lack of wood, shining in lemon and grapefruit flavor and a depth of texture. It finishes clean and crisp.
title: Bennett Valley Cellars 2016 Bin 5757 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: White peach, caramel and browned butter aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is soft and easy with flavors of roasted apple and cinnamon, though it could use a more acidic boost.
title: Sean Minor 2016 Four Bears Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This is a full-bodied white rich in buttery oak and baked apple, with a tang of lemon and a yeasty nose of baked biscuit.
title: Séamus Wines 2015 Buena Tierra Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The nose on this bottling is very showy with aromas of apple blossom, cut Anjou pear and guava. The palate skews tropical, with green papaya and underripe banana flavors, and a decently fresh acidity.
title: Angeline 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: There's a crushed nut aroma on the nose of this bottling, along with sour tangerine and chamomile. Dried lemons and lime peels show on the sip, which is bitter with pithy flavors and framed with a bit of acidic zip.
title: Ca' Del Grevino 2014 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This wine is highly ripe and voluptuous, with a distinct boldness of tropical flavor and almond paste. Full figured, it's embraced by a generosity of oak that makes itself known.
title: Frank Family 2015 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Buttercream aromas show shyly on the nose of this bottling, coating the pear flesh and fresh lime scents. It's somewhat flat on the palate, with ripe Pink Lady apple and melon flavors.
title: Hahn 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: This is a simple, acid-driven white that's light and bright with a restrained sense of ripeness. Tight-grained oak is wrapped around a buttery middle.
title: Auburn 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Super-oaky and fruity, with pineapple, pear, peach and apricot flavors under a heavy coating of buttered toast and caramel from barrel aging. Not very subtle, but dry.
title: Ironstone 2007 Reserve Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sierra Foothills)

description: Sweet in oak and ripe in fruit, this Chard offers strong flavors of pineapple crème brûlée, vanilla bean, pear custard, buttered popcorn and cinnamon spice. It's made to flatter the palate in a flashy way.
title: Davis Family 2007 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Fruit and acidity star in this fresh, clean coastal Chardonnay. It brims with crisp flavors of pineapples, pears, green apples and peaches, of the ripest kind. Easy to like and drink.
title: Daily 2008 Unoaked Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Monterey is at the forefront of unoaked Chardonnay and this delightful bottling shows why. It's dry, racy in acidity, and rich in mineral-inspired pineapples, limes and apples. Doesn't need any oak to satisfy.
title: Lapis Luna 2008 Unoaked Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Oaky and ripe. This is your classic Burgundian-style Chardonnay, rich in vanilla and buttered popcorn, pineapple, peach and spice flavors.
title: Jacella 2008 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Oak dominates this Chardonnay, flooding it with smoky toast and woodspice flavors on top of the green apples, pineapples and buttered popcorn. It's crisp in acidity and slightly sweet.
title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2007 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A bit on the sweet, fruity-oaky side, but saved by crisp acidity. Shows jammy pineapple, lemon, buttered popcorn and smoke flavors.
title: Bonterra 2007 Reserve The McNab Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Oaky and tart, with pineapple crème brûlée, Asian pear, vanilla and buttered popcorn flavors. A good, crisp Chardonnay to drink now.
title: Q 2007 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Smooth and creamy, with mineral-infused pineapple crème brûlée, green apple butter and smoky oak flavors. Rich, if a little direct. Drink now.
title: Clos La Chance 2007 Liebeler Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Sort of the anti-Chardonnay, a very dry, crisp and austere wine based on minerals and dried citrus fruits rather than rich tropical fruits and elaborate oak. It's quite clean, with a refreshing bite of acidity. Interesting and different.
title: Bedarra 2007 Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: With forward pineapple jam, apricot, buttered toast, vanilla and smoky oak flavors, this will satisfy Chard lovers. It's dry, with a creamy mouthfeel.
title: Stratton Lummis 2006 Artist's Series Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Fruity and oaky, if a bit direct. It offers vanilla, buttered popcorn, pineapple crème brûlée and Asian spice flavors. Drink now.
title: Rancho Sisquoc 2007 Flood Family Vineyards Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Very tasty and nicely crisp, but kind of candied, like a pastry with lemon cream, pineapple custard and vanilla spice, in a smoky, sugary crust. Almost a dessert wine in apparent sweetness.
title: Fernwood 2007 Vanumanutagi Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Rich, but tastes over-oaked at this point in time, with smoky caramel, crème brûlée and buttered toast flavors dominating the pineapples, pears and green apples. Could integrate in time. Fans of new oak will love it.
title: Benovia 2007 La Pommeraie Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A solid, everyday-style Chard. It's ripe and forward in pear, melon and papaya flavors, with a rich overlay of smoky vanilla wrapped into a creamy texture.
title: Ukiah Cellars 2008 Two Vineyards Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Oaky, with sweet-and-sour Chinese restaurant sauce flavors of pineapples, rice vinegar and sugar that are tasty, but pall. The vineyard requires extreme dexterity to get things right, and not everyone does.
title: Sheldon 2006 Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: A dry, crisp wine, with the herb and mineral tinge that often accompanies Carneros Chardonnay. Shows flavors of pineapples, green apples and peaches, with oak influences.
title: Benziger 2007 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Here's a bone-dry, crisp, minerally Chardonnay that will be great with shellfish. It has subtle flavors of limes, Meyer lemons and figs. Very clean and refreshing.
title: Clos La Chance 2008 Glittering Throated-Emerald Unoaked Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: High in acidity, with the tang and taste of a kefir lime, this barrel-aged Chardonnay has richer notes of vanilla, buttered toast and cream. Good price for a food-friendly wine.
title: Martin & Weyrich 2006 Jack Ranch Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Rich and extracted, with pineapple tart filling, butterscotch, caramel and smoky flavors. Feels a bit soft, and the oak sticks out.
title: Cambria 2007 Katherine's Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A bit heavy-handed in the high alcohol that gives a touch of heat, which in turn accentuates the oak. Soft, too. The tropical fruit flavors are opulent, but the wine needs greater structural balance.
title: Cambria 2007 Bench Break Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A good everyday Chardonnay that shows crisp acidity and the ultra-dryness and cleanliness of a well-made Central Coast Chard. Made for drinking now, with lime, white peach and mineral flavors.
title: De Tierra 2006 Coast View Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: This is a regional wine, but don't dismiss it because it doesn't have a vineyard designation. It shows the vibrant acidity of the Highlands, and the long, cool vintage has given exceptionally ripe flavors of pineapples, guavas and passionfruit. Your guests will love it.
title: Paraiso Vineyards 2007 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Direct, with smoky oak-infused flavors of ultra-ripe pineapples, oranges, pears and honeysuckle. Very bright acidity makes it mouthwatering.
title: Beauregard 2006 Trout Gulch Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Call it Chablis-like. This Chard is bone dry, crisp in citrusy acidity, and features stony, minerally flavors of Meyer lemons and limes. Try as a richer alternative to Pinot Grigio.
title: Cameron Hughes 2007 Lot 115 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Fresh and vibrant, with crisp acidity brightening pineapple, golden apricot, lime and pear flavors. There's a bit of oak, but the fruit really stars in this savory young Chard.
title: Egret 2007 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Fruity and forward, with jammy apricot, pear, pineapple and vanilla cream flavors, girded with a tang of minerals. Grown on the Sonoma side of Carneros.
title: Bonneau 2007 Catherine's Vineyard Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: Rich and flamboyant in ultraripe pineapple jam, butterscotch and vanilla flavors, this Chard leaves little to the imagination. It has direct appeal for deliciousness.
title: Hahn 2006 SLH Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Rich and oaky, with mouthwatering acidity, this Chardonnay offers tiers of ripe pineapple, green apple, honey, vanilla and cinnamon flavors. It's an easy sipper that offers lots of value for the price.
title: Bonterra 2007 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: Rich in pineapple custard, pear and mineral flavors, this Chard offers lots of direct pleasure. Drink now with crab cakes, roast salmon, or squash risotto.
title: Artevino 2006 Reserve Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: Dry and crisp in cool-climate coastal acidity, this polished Chard shows pretty flavors of pineapples, green apples, honey and oak spice. It's creamy, and made in the New World style.
title: Landmark 2007 Overlook Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Shows distinct cool-climate acidity framing streamlined flavors of pineapples, lemons and limes, minerals and spices. It's an elegantly structured, clean wine that will satisfy Chardonnay lovers.
title: Hess 2007 Su'skol Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: From Raymond, a solid Chardonnay at a fair price for the quality. Bone dry and crisp, it has modest pineapple, pear and kiwi flavors, girded with a tangy minerality.
title: R Collection 2007 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: This is a strongly flavored Chardonnay. The fruit is extremely forward, veering from oranges and pineapples into apricots and even suggesting a touch of botrytis. The oak sticks out, all vanilla and butterscotch. It's not exactly an unbalanced wine, but it is ungainly. Drink now.
title: Clos Pegase 2006 Hommage Mitsuko's Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Oaky, with dominating aromas and flavors of butterscotch, vanilla custard and meringue. Underneath all that are ripe pineapple and golden mango flavors.
title: Huntington 2006 Castello Vineyard Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Made in the extracted New World style, this Chard has jammy apricot, pineapple and pear flavors liberally drenched in butterscotch-scented, smoky oak. The grapes come from Santa Lucia Highlands and Paso Robles.
title: Bridgeway 2007 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Somewhat herbal and earthy, with peach, apple, citrus, tobacco and spice flavors generously influenced by smoky oak. The creamy texture gives it generosity. Drink now. From the veteran winemaker, Kent Rasmussen.
title: Elkhorn Peak 2006 Vineyard Select Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Crisp acidity and laser-pure fruit immediately characterize this as a Central Coast Chardonnay. It's not a blockbuster, but with zesty pineapple, apricot and peach flavors, it's a great buy at this price.
title: Mandolin 2007 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Tastes a little too strong in the meringue, buttered toast and sweet vanilla flavors that suggest over-oaking. Underneath is a nice Carneros Chard, crisp, spicy and tropical fruity.
title: Cuvaison 2006 S Block Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Does a good job at expressing ripe, cool-climate Chardonnay character at a fair price. Creamy and smooth, it shows peach, pear, buttered toast and vanilla flavors, with a spicy finish.
title: Rodney Strong 2007 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Fruit and oak are the duo that star in this rich, forward wine. The flavors of peaches and cream, pineapple meringue pie, butterscotch, smoke and vanilla will appeal to fans of luscious California Chardonnays.
title: Pellegrini 2006 Olivet Lane Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Oak dominates this wine. The idea seems to have been Chablis, to judge by the dryness and citrusy minerality. But the char and toast are very strong and the underlying richness isn't there for balance.
title: Ernest & Julio Gallo 2005 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Previous vintages tasted more balanced than this super-oaky one. The wood erupts from the glass, suggestive of caramel, buttered popcorn, vanilla cream pie and charcoal, overwhelming what seems to be a perfectly nice wine. Some folks will love it. Others will find it the poster child of overoaked California Chard.
title: Peters Family 2006 Sonoma Stage Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: A rich, direct Chard that leaves little to the imagination. It offers a sunburst of oak-inspired tropical fruit flavors that are very ripe and jammy, in the modern California style.
title: C. Donatiello 2006 Orsi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A nice Chardonnay that feels pedigreed and well-made, with crisp acidity and a creamy texture framing very ripe tropical fruit and citrus flavors. The oak dominates, however, making the wine heavy in sweet, caramelized toast.
title: Patz & Hall 2006 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Although this Chard is unoaked, its has strong flavors of vanilla and crème brûlée, in addition to the tropical fruits, roasted green apples and sweet lemon custard. It's direct and strong, an inexpensive Chard to pair with rich fare, like scallops in cream sauce.
title: Sebastiani 2007 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This strongly flavored Chardonnay has charry oak, tangerine, peach and pineapple flavors, wrapped into a creamy texture. Does a good job at a fair price.
title: Kenwood 2007 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Dry and crisp, this Chard has flavors of green apples, peaches, yellow apricots and vanilla cream, with little if any oak influence. Acidity perks it up, making the wine clean and vibrant.
title: Hoopla 2006 Chardonnay (Yountville)

description: A fairly rich Chard whose creamy texture holds fruit-forward, smoky flavors of baked apples, grilled pineapples, vanilla, butterscotch, and dusty Asian spices. Drink now.
title: Wente 2007 Morning Fog Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Oak dominates this Chard. It's an example of the old criticism, drinking toothpicks. The flavors of buttered toast, caramel, roasted meringue and crème brûlée dominate the pineapple and pear fruit, unbalancing an otherwise excellent wine.
title: Freeman 2006 Ryo-fu Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Fans of oaky Chards will find this one perfectly acceptable. It's dry and crisp, with ripe pear, peach, pineapple and smoky barrel flavors that define the California style.
title: Sanford 2006 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This '06 is the winery's regular bottling, not the reserve, and Chard lovers will find it a little lacking in richness. Still, it's a dry, crisp, elegantly structured wine, with mineral-infused pear and pineapple flavors.
title: Clos du Val 2006 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: The woody oak and Asian spices of cloves, nutmeg and cinnamon dominate this Chard, with its modest flavors of pineapples, nectarines and kiwi fruits. Backed up with firm acidity, the wine also has a firm spine of minerals.
title: Windbreak 2005 Sarmento Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Those used to the fabulous richness of Ed Sbragia's Chardonnays at Beringer might find this disappointing. It's a good wine, with the Burgundian formula of half-barrel fermention in new oak, malolactic fermentation and weekly lees stirring, so it has those winemaker-added notes of creamy, yeasty smokiness. Yet the underlying pear and apple flavors are a little thin.
title: Sbragia 2006 Home Ranch Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: This nice drinking Chard offers plenty of bang for the buck. It's dry and creamy, with oak-infused pear, peach and green apple fruit flavors that finish in a swirl of dusty spices.
title: Cameron Hughes 2006 Lot 59 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Entirely barrel-fermented in older barrels, this wine nevertheless shows plenty of buttered toast aromas to go with its tropical fruit. It's broad in the mouth, medium-bodied and turns citrusy on the finish.
title: Wente 2006 Morning Fog Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Showing true cool-climate character, this Chard brims with tropical fruit, pear, honeysuckle and smoky oaky-vanilla flavors, with a gentle scour of acids. Pretty good price for a wine this rich.
title: Bennett Family 2006 The Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Ripe, soft and creamy smooth, this Chard has polished flavors of pineapple jam, vanilla, pears, apple butter, honey and cinnamon.
title: Matanzas Creek 2006 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: This is the winery's no-oak Chardonnay. It didn't undergo the malolactic fermentation, so that appley acidity is pronounced. With citrus and mineral flavors, you might think it was a Sauvignon Blanc, except for the peach and pear richness on the finish.
title: Charles Creek 2006 Por Favor Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: The vineyard is an old one, on the Napa side of Carneros. The wine shows the delicate structure, dryness and minerality of the region, with citrus, peach and vanilla oak flavors. It's an elegant, light-bodied wine meant to be opened now.
title: Beringer 2006 Stanly Ranch Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Here's a straightforward Chardonnay, with potent fruit and the crisp acidity of this cool, coastal region. The flavors are pure Meyer lemon, lime zest and tangy mineral.
title: Stephen Ross 2006 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: A low-priced everyday Chard of sophistication and elegance. It's dry and wonderfully crisp, with subtlely oaked flavors of pineapples, peaches, green apples, pears and kiwis. Easy to find, with more than 12,000 cases produced.
title: Raymond 2006 R Collection Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: A good wine that provides real Russian River Chardonnay character, at a decent price. Dry and crisp, it's made full Burgundy style, with vanilla and smoke accents to the pear, green apple and tropical fruit flavors.
title: Taft Street 2006 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Nice everyday wine, with pleasant peach, pineapple and pear flavors that finish with a touch of smoky oak and vanilla. It's easy to enjoy this one with ham, crab, corn on the cob or just by itself.
title: Sterling 2005 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: It's all upfront in this direct Chard, with ripe pineapple, yellow apricot and passionfruit flavors that have been generously oaked. Will satisfy fans of big, lush California Chards. Drink now.
title: Dutcher Crossing 2006 Costello Vineyard Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Frog's Leap's Chards always have a softly herbal earthiness, even though there's plenty of pineapple, green apple, apricot and vanilla oaky flavor. That herbaceousness keeps the wine from soaring.
title: Frog's Leap 2006 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: That terrific Santa Rita acidity is there, and the oak regimen tastes very expensive, but the fruit doesn't seem up to the task. It's a pretty good wine, with pineapples, dates, crème brûlée and spices, but there should be greater richness and complexity from this esteemed vineyard.
title: Testarossa 2006 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: An acidic, bone-dry Chardonnay, brilliant in fruit, that doesn't seem to have been touched by oak. It's so pure in zesty Meyer lemon, lime and kiwi flavors, with a mouthwateringy clean finish.
title: American Roots 2006 White Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: X's basic Chard shows the bright acidity and minerality of Carneros, with ripe, savory peach jam, apple butter and tropical fruit flavors enriched with caramelly, smoky oak. It trades elegance for sheer power.
title: X 2006 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: The good news is the ripeness of this wine. It's also the bad news. It's so big in jammy peach, pear and tropical fruit flavors, and so oaky, that some degree of balance has been lost. Needs a little more restraint.
title: X 2006 Truchard Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Made with full-throttle Burgundian techniques, with barrel fermentation in lots of new oak and sur lie aging applied to fat, juicy berries, to judge from their ripe, jammy fruitiness. Bursts with apricot, Meyer lemon, pineapple, guava, date, fig and smoky flavors. A bit over-wrought.
title: Peju 2006 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: It's disturbing to taste a wine so dominated by sweet vanilla and toasty char, especially when the underlying wine is as good as this one seems to be. Buried under all that wood is a crisp, pineappley and minerally Chardonnay of considerable sophistication.
title: Robert Young 2005 Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Most of the grapes came from esteemed Dutton vineyards. The wine is enormously ripe. The juice was barrel fermented and aged sur lie. Creamy, packed with tropical fruit and smoky vanilla flavors, it's hedonistically delicious, but almost as sweet as a dessert wine.
title: Girard 2006 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Lots to like in this dry, fruity Chardonnay. It has flavors of tropical fruits, buttered toast and caramel, wrapped into a rich, creamy mouthfeel. But it's pretty acidic, if you're sensitive to prickliness in your wines.
title: Frostwatch 2005 Chardonnay (Bennett Valley)

description: Polished and fruity, with ripe peach custard, nectarine, pear and spicy green apple flavors enriched with the vanilla and buttered toast of oak barrels. Crisp acidity makes the wine racy.
title: Hook & Ladder 2006 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Pavilion has a perfect record with Chardonnay, four vintages in a row with a consistent score. The â"˜06 like its predecessors is ripe and satisfying, with good varietal character. The peach and pineapple flavors have creamy, smoky nuances.
title: Pavilion 2006 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
