description: This single-vineyard wine from Foxen's estate is a little too sweet. It seems to contain residual sugar, to judge by the jellied pineapple and apricot flavors. If you don't mind that, you'll find a crisply acidic, clean wine, with oak and lees complexities.
title: Foxen 2006 Tinaquaic Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: The vineyard is on Frei Road, which is in the cooler, southern part of the appellation, and this wine shows how well a good vintage can ripen the grapes into tropical fruit directions while still maintaining vibrant acidity. But the oak drowns the terroir in caramelly, butterscotchy sweetness.
title: Patz & Hall 2005 Zio Tony Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: It has very crisp acids and those kiwi and lime flavors that mark cool-climate Chards. Oak and lees aging add richer, creamier notes.
title: Wattle Creek 2005 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: Proper rather than exciting, this Chard was made classic style, with 100% barrel fermentation, 100% malolactic fermentation and plenty of lees. It's creamy and smooth, with modest flavors of peaches, pineapples and green apples.
title: Terlato 2005 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Has all your basic barrel-fermented Chardonnay character without being particularly complex. The wine is slightly sweet and oaky-creamy, with apricot, pineapple, peach and spicy mango flavors.
title: Flora Springs 2006 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Patz & Hall has captured the cool-climate essence of southern Sonoma Chard with this dry, crisply acidic, and vibrantly fruity young wine. Might have benefitted from less new oak though, because the caramel and toast seem a little excessive.
title: Patz & Hall 2005 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Big and bold, a Chard that shows off its terroir in the crisp, citrusy acidity and clean purity of fruit. The flavors veer toward pineapples and green tropical fruits. Oak plays a very prominent role, perhaps a little too much so, in this dry wine.
title: Figge 2005 La Reina Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: A little weedy, despite lots of flashy oak. The pineapples and peaches have notes of dried dill and thyme, and the finish is dry and crisp. Nice with broiled halibut in a thyme-butter sauce.
title: Domaine Chandon 2005 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Mer Soleil Chards seem to get bigger, riper and oakier every year. Of course, this is the winery's style, and when it works, the results can be fabulously rich, but this caramelized wine seems a little top-heavy.
title: Mer Soleil 2005 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Lots of oak on this fresh, young Chard. It's a bit too heavy on the char, toast, vanilla, and woodsap, and not enough about the peaches, pears and pineapples.
title: Pendleton 2005 Paraiso Vineyards Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Juicy and crisp, with green apple, lime and cinnamon granola flavors. Finishes clean and spicy.
title: Christine Andrew 2005 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Taste more like a white Rhône wine than Chard, so loses a point or two for lack of typicity, but it's a flavorful sipper. With rich flavors of honeysuckle and tropical fruit, the mouthfeel is soft and barrel-creamy.
title: Napa Cellars 2005 Chardonnay (Napa County)

description: Clean and flinty-minerally, this is a light-bodied, delicate Chard whose appeal is in its elegance. Oak accents modest pineapple, pear and peach fruit.
title: Talley 2005 Estate Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Many wineries have taken fruit from this vineyard, generally with good results. The '05 Lucas & Lewellen shows its terroir, with a cool-climate crispness backing up ripe pineapple tart, nectarine and papaya flavors. But the oak-inspired caramel, char and butterscotch is a bit heavy-handed.
title: Lucas & Lewellen 2005 Goodchild Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Good everyday Chard, with direct flavors of pineapples and kiwis, and the buttercream and smoky vanillins that oak barrels contribute. Finishes dry and crisp.
title: De Loach 2005 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Here's your basic straightforward upscale California Chard. It's forward in tropical fruit and oaky butterscotch and vanilla char flavors, wrapped into a creamy texture. There's a touch of green in the finish, though.
title: Chateau St. Jean 2005 Belle Terre Vineyard Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Shows the limpid quality of Carneros Chard, with its crisp acidity and tang of minerality. The fruit veers toward green apples and pineapples, and as good as it is, the palate needs to be a little stronger and more concentrated.
title: Beaulieu Vineyard 2005 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Ripe and oaky, with juicy pineapple marmalade and butterscotch flavors balanced with crisp acidity, and a dry finish. Easy to like this creamy Chard.
title: Chalone Vineyard 2005 Chardonnay (Chalone)

description: Sourced primarily from the estate's Carneros vineyards, this is entirely barrel-fermented in French oak. Yet the oak provides gentle accents rather than an outsized coating. Pineapple fruit is lightly touched with hints of vanilla and butter, turning crisp and lemony on the finish.
title: William Hill Estate 2005 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A little light in flavor, but dry, crisp and balanced. The flavors are of pineapples, green apples, nectarines and oaky butterscotch.
title: Schug 2005 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Oaky and leesy, this is a pretty good Chardonnay whose main attributes are dryness and acidity. Toast and smoke dominate the tropical fruit flavors.
title: Cottonwood Canyon 2001 Barrel Select Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: No oak on this stainless steel-fermented wine, so that the Edna Valley character shines. Brims with lemon and lime, kiwi and vanilla flavors, with clean acidity.
title: Cameron Hughes 2005 Lot 22 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: The '05 is a good wine, a little thin in peach and pineapple fruit, with a strong overlay of toasty, spice oak and a vanilla cream mouthfeel.
title: Monticello Vineyards 2005 Estate Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

description: Ripe in pineapples and pears, creamy and well-oaked, this is a pretty good Chard, with a dried herb edge to the fruit. It finishes with a soft, peaty earthiness.
title: Chappellet 2005 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Tasted alongside the winery's more expensive vintage bottlings, this one's so close, you can hardly tell the difference. It's very dry and oaky, with a bracing minerality to the kumquat and pineapple flavors.
title: Cottonwood Canyon NV Bistro Classic Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: With its rich kiwi, Key-lime pie and roasted hazelnut flavors and creamy texture, this Chard packs plenty of pleasure. Crisp acidity makes the finish clean and zesty.
title: Martin & Weyrich 2004 Jack Ranch Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: This Chard has been variable over the years, and I'm not sure why. This one plays it straight down the middle. The winemaker says it has "Muscat" flavors, which it does, but that makes the wine floral, while acidity gives it an almost chlorophyl taste. But it's dry and zesty.
title: Nickel & Nickel 2005 Searby Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: An earthy aroma blows off and this medium-bodied wine reveals appealing fresh apple and light spice flavors, buttery accents and good balance.
title: Toad Hollow 2017 Francine's Selection Unoaked Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Rounded aromas of yellow apple and lemon wedge show on the nose of this bottling by the country music star. It's very zippy on the palate, carrying flavors of honeydew, ripe pear and peach, that are seeming a touch sweet.
title: Z. Alexander Brown 2017 Uncaged Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Broad aromas of poached pear, clotted cream, cashew and a hint of toasted brioche show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is clean although very light in flavor, offering green-pear and key lime pie touches.
title: Clos La Chance 2017 Murphy's Choice Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: The grapes for this wine come from the Rodgers Creek Vineyard in the new appellation. This is a hearty barrel-fermented white that's lush and luxurious, moderate in oak with big flavors of marshmallow, peach and vanilla.
title: Silverpoint Cellars 2016 Chardonnay (Petaluma Gap)

description: Fresh aromas of yellow pear, sharp lime and a hint of crushed white rocks show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is loaded with lime flavors reminiscent of a margarita, along with toasted oak.
title: Olelo 2017 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Creamy, round and lush in strong flavors of vanilla, baked apple and pear, this white is powerfully tannic and grippy as it finishes.
title: Volunteer 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Honeysuckle and pear-flesh aromas make for a slightly sweet aromatic entry to this bottling. The palate dries up with chalk and lime-rind flavors before ripe melon touches take over.
title: SeaGlass 2017 Unoaked Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This wine has classic aromas of apple and butter, then good and ripe fruit flavors accented by vanilla and caramel and surrounded by a rich soft texture.
title: The Federalist 2017 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: This is a mild-mannered white, lemony in apple and pear. It has an intensity that finishes dry and oaky with a strong finish of tropical richness.
title: Dutton Estate 2016 Kyndall's Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a thick full-bodied white with structured tangy acidity that tries to keep up with the oak. A nutty profile defines its flavor. The palate is viscous and lush.
title: Dutton Estate 2016 Dutton Palms Vineyard Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Seared apple, lemonade and lemon-blossom candies show on the steely nose of this fresh twist-top bottling. Tangy orange rinds meet with broad Pink Lady apple flavors on the palate.
title: Formation 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Thick, woody and flavored in anise, mango and pear, this is an approachable, attractively priced and well-made wine that will work well with food or on its own.
title: Folie à Deux 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Roasted pear, light banana and baked-earth aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Muddled flavors of pome fruit, lemon peel and melon arise on the palate, which is a touch flat in texture.
title: Cinnabar 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Floral muscat-like aromatics persist in this wine. This is a tight, firmly crisp in acidity example of the variety that is integrated and moderately ripe.
title: Taft Street 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Full bodied and almost fat with all its unctuous flavors, this wine smells like butter and baking spices and tastes like pear syrup and nutmeg. It has a mouth-coating texture, plenty of oak influence and a sense of near-sweetness on the finish.
title: Barra of Mendocino 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: This is a good medium-bodied wine that emphasizes fresh fruit flavors and a smooth, natural-feeling texture. There's not much oak or butter to trick it up, so pure apple and pear notes take the lead.
title: Abbeyville 2016 Tanner's Passage Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: This wine has fresh fruit and baking-spice aromas that lead to a supple texture and tangy apple-skin flavors. This medium-bodied wine is a sure crowd-pleaser.
title: Husch 2016 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Soft aromas of nectarine and lemon zest show on the nose of this appellation blend. There is decent grip to the sip, which is rather light in flavors, offering apple blossom and fresh pear flavors alongside a touch of tannic tension.
title: Roblar 2017 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Bruised apple and poached pear aromas show on the nose of this bottling from the Hearst family. It seems a bit sweet on the palate, with ripe apples and pears as well as a touch of roasted nuts.
title: Hearst Ranch 2017 Glacier Ridge Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Fleshy and robust in oak, this wine offers a rounded ripeness of tropical fruit and butterscotch, flavors that work well with each other and take on added richness in the glass.
title: Geyser Peak 2016 Water Bend Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Lime skins, guava and a hint of sourdough show on the nose of this bottling. Light honeydew and guava flavors show on the easy and clean sip, which doesn't offer too much texture or acid, but remains very pleasant.
title: Falkner 2017 Chardonnay (Temecula Valley)

description: This twist-top bottling is very pear-driven and tropical leaning on the nose, with edgier touches of citrus. It grabs hold of the palate with ripe apple and more pear flavors, but a lime peel element keeps it zesty.
title: Donati Family Vineyard 2017 Sisters Forever Un-Oaked Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Fermented in stainless steel, this wine opens in lime salt and stone, with a light texture and minimal structure. The oak takes on flavors of butterscotch and crème brûlée.
title: Joseph Cellars 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Light nectarine and vanilla cookies aromas are coated in a damp oak aroma on the nose of this appellation blend. There is a bright lemony edge to the palate, where the core is mostly dried apple and sandalwood flavors.
title: Alara 2015 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Zesty lime and citrus blossom aromas make for a very fresh take on the grape. There is a hint of sweetness at the tip of the sip, then come bright flavors of orange rind and squeezed citrus.
title: Sean Minor 2017 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling shows strong amounts of guava and tuberose on the nose, but also touches of chalk and citrus pith. There is racy acidity on the palate, where loads of bubblegum and lily flavors are quite powerful.
title: Ancient Peaks 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Margarita Ranch)

description: This wine slathers butter and vanilla aromas together with overripe pear and pineapple flavors for an assertive profile. It feels full bodied, tastes slightly sweet and has a cushy soft texture.
title: Criss Cross 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Dried lemon peels, key lime, white peach and strong wood aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's tangy and very flavorful on the palate with sharp lemon and grapefruit elements.
title: J Wilkes 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A fairly dark shade of yellow in the glass, this bottling starts with aromas of toasted nuts, lemon sorbet and clotted cream. The palate comes across as cleaner and crisper, tangy with orange rind but broad with toasted bread and more nutty qualities. It shows a touch of early oxidation.
title: Blair Estate 2015 The Matriarch Delfina's Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Lemon curd, apple sauce, mango and melon make for a pretty ripe nose on this bottling. There is a strong sizzle of acidity on the sip and then quite ripe flavor of pear, apple soda and tropical kiwi.
title: Magnolia Court Dorrian 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: The vineyard is far better known for Pinot Noir. In fact, this is the first Chardonnay I've had from it. It's a very dry, high-acid wine. Compared to lusher Chards, it's a lean wine, streamlined in zingy citrus, wintergreen and mineral flavors, with a richer edge of sweet oak.
title: Sanford 2003 La Rinconada Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A nice Chardonnay, delicious in tropical fruit, apricot and spice flavors boosted with crisp acidity, and well-oaked. Yet it's strangely one-dimensional. The fruit got so ripe that maybe it was stripped of complexity and nuance.
title: Testarossa 2005 Brosseau Vineyard Chardonnay (Chalone)

description: Better known for Cabernet, Pine Ridge has been doing an interesting job with Chardonnay. Every vintage is different, but usually worth a peek. The '05, from a cool year, is high in acidity, which gives the long hangtime peach, apricot and nectarine fruit a tart, jam-like boost.
title: Pine Ridge 2005 Dijon Clones Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: If you've never seen the winery's estate, it's wide open to the fog and winds of San Francisco/San Pablo Bay, so even in a hot vintage like this, their Chards possess keen acidity that gives them a steely minerality. It's not a particularly ripe wine, but shows tart citrus flavors, while new French oak adds a much-needed creamy richness. This is a terrific food Chardonnay, not one that needs to be appreciated by itself.
title: Gloria Ferrer 2004 Estate Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Crisp and zesty, this Chard has very bright, pure flavors of tangerines, limes, pineapples and vanilla-caramel oak. High acidity balances the honeyed sweetness.
title: Ventana 2005 Gold Stripe Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Pretty good Chard, not quite on a par with the winery's Upper Barn bottlings but close. The grapes come partially from the Upper Barn vineyard, but it's all mountain-grown, showing concentrated pear, pineapple and peach flavors, with a rich, tobacco herbaceousness.
title: Stonestreet 2005 Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: This is a pretty good Chard; the grapes come partially from the Upper Barn vineyard, but it's all mountain-grown, showing concentrated pear, pineapple and peach flavors, with a rich, tobacco herbaceousness.
title: Saintsbury 2005 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: One of the best values in Chard of the vintage. It's a rich, dramatically fruity wine, showing oodles of flamboyant pineapple, peach, cantaloupe and smoky, spicy flavors that keep on coming through a long, dry finish. Buy this by the case. Best Buy.
title: Hayes Ranch 2005 Best Foot Forward Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Tasted in a flight of far more expensive Chards, this one held its own. Creamy, with apple and peach flavors and a touch of oak and lees, it will satisfy your basic Chardonnay instincts at a good price.
title: Geyser Peak 2005 Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Another beautiful Chardonnay from Robert Young, although it's a step off the pace of recent years. Soft and intricately layered, it has tropical fruit pastry filling flavors accented with lots of toasty new French oak, which seems too strong for the underlying fruit.
title: Robert Young 2004 Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Fresh and crisp, this Chardonnay has an early-picked quality to it, or maybe the cool vintage is responsible for the citrusy, minerally character, enriched with toasty oak. Either way, it's a refreshing wine, vital in acidity, and a nice presence at the table.
title: Justin 2005 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: An interesting wine that marches to a different beat when it comes to today's buttery, ripe Chards. This one's austere and minerally, with a Meyer lemon drop taste, high acidity and a very dry finish. It's elegant and polished.
title: Stratton Lummis 2005 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Rich, ripe and oaky, maybe too oaky, with a mèlange of tropical fruit, peach and pear flavors that are well ripened and a little soft in acidity. The oak takes over in the form of sweet woodsap and vanilla char, through the spicy, oaky finish.
title: Pride Mountain 2005 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Miner has been doing one of the better jobs at non-Carneros Napa Chardonnay, and this pleasant wine continues that ride. It's a bit soft and earthy, but has rich pear and peach flavors and lots of toasty new oak.
title: Miner 2005 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: The best thing about this Chard is that refreshing Edna Valley backbone of acidity. Otherwise, it's just another ripe, oaky California Chard, with the usual tropical fruit and buttered toast flavors. But those juicy acids make it keen and vital.
title: Ortman Family 2005 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: I love the purity of this Chardonnay. Even though it was barrel fermented, the oak is hardly noticeable, swamped by the acid-boosted exotic melange of limes, kiwis, pineapples, tangerine, candied ginger and cinnamon. It adds up to a taste treat.
title: Husch 2005 Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Held back for an extra year longer than the winery's regular Chard, this bottling shows a smoky richness and fully mature, dried fruit flavors of apricots and pineapples. It's quite a complex wine whose zingy acidity adds balance and life.
title: Ironstone 2004 Reserve Chardonnay (Calaveras County)

description: With its polished acidity and herb-infused tropical fruit flavors, this is an especially nice Chard to have with food. It's thoroughly dry and very clean, with enough oak to provide an extra layer of vanilla cream and buttered toast.
title: Waterstone 2005 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: There's no oak to give fans their daily dose of buttered toast and vanilla. But there is plenty of pure, unadulterated fruit-apricots and peaches to be exact. It's a rich, spicy wine that advances the argument for no-oak Chard.
title: St. Supéry 2005 Estate Oak Free Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Few would hold a Chardonnay more than four years before release. Why does Josh Jensen? The acidity, apparently. His wines do start out on the tart side. Now, this one off the estate has passed its youth and is picking up that baked peach pie, coconut macaroon, dried autumn leaf thing. It's interesting, but drink fast before it slides into senescence.
title: Calera 2002 Chardonnay (Mt. Harlan)

description: Here's a rich Chardonnay with tropical fruit pastry flavors that have a dusty, dried herb edge, and lots of creamy oak. The wine is a bit soft. The fruit and spice flavors reprise on the long-lasting finish.
title: Clos du Val 2004 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is St. Supery's other Chardonnay, the oaked one. It's not super-oaky, but it does have buttercream and vanilla notes in addition to the wine's apricot, peach and tangerine flavors. It's a very dry, somewhat tart but elegant wine.
title: St. Supéry 2004 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Richer and tarter than Kenwood's regular '05 Chard, this wine shows the acidity and green apple flavors of the central part of the valley. Bosc pears, Meyer lemons and white peaches pleasantly complicate things as you continue to sip.
title: Kenwood 2005 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The big acidity on this wine and the citrus fruit flavors make it kind of austere and minerally. But partial new oak and sur lie aging add some richness. This is a very dry, elegant, structural Chard meant for food. Try with a firm white fish topped with a fruity salsa.
title: Handley 2004 Handley Vineyard Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Shows brisk acidity for this warmish appellation, with upfront, pineapple custard, peach tart and apricot cobbler flavors wrapped in a honeyed mouthfeel. Just when you think it's a simple Chard, it reveals all kinds of layers.
title: Summers 2005 Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Ripe and oaky, with powerful tropical fruit, candied pear, peach, apricot jam and pineapple custard flavors. Nice acidity balances the earthiness and makes the finish clean and lively.
title: Zahtila 2005 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Against a background of dusty earth and herbs, there's bright peach, pear and pineapple flavors and a rich tangerine streak that meshes with the sweet new oak. It's all on the surface, but what a deliciously polished surface it is.
title: Hess Collection 2004 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: The estate is in the southern end of the appellation, toward Paso Robles, and this full-bodied Chard smacks of apricot preserves, with a spicy, peppery edge. It's adequately acidic and oaked, with a rich, creamy texture.
title: Adelaida 2004 HMR Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Alderbrook's winemaker could have made a big, fruity wine in this warm vintage, but seems to have decided to make a more delicate, higher-acid Chard instead. This food-friendly sipper has nice peach, apple and pineapple flavors, and is balanced, dry and elegant.
title: Alderbrook 2004 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Streamlined, with mineral, Mandarin orange and oak flavors. This pleasant Chard, from estate vineyards in the warm Sonoma Valley, is dry and balanced.
title: Kunde 2003 Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Bright and tart in green apple and pink grapefruit flavors that have high, puckery acidity, this Chard from the Sonoma side of the appellation is softened with the buttercream of oak and lees. Try with lemon chicken.
title: Schug 2004 Heritage Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Shows real cool-climate character in the brisk acidity that titillates the mouth  and the bright, pure kiwi, lime and pineapple flavors, which are enriched with smoky oak. Could have greater depth, but it has plenty of upscale qualities.
title: Gainey 2004 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Crisp, bright acidity marks this dry, clean Chardonnay. It's bone dry, but rewardingly fruity, showing ripe peach, pear and pineapple flavors, with a richer streak of crème brûlée. Easy to find, with 23,544 cases made.
title: Bernardus 2004 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Very dry, and on the earthy side, this Chard is marked more by controlled elegance than by opulent fruit. There are flavors of lemons and limes and tart green apples, with additional complexities from barrel fermentation and sur lies aging. The finish is fairly acidic.
title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2004 Arcadia Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: So high in acidity that it creates a tingly burn on the palate, this dry wine is bright and forward in lemon and lime flavors, and a tangy minerality. Finishes fine and clean.
title: Ortman Family 2004 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: This is a very nice, stylish Chardonnay that's good in varietal character, yet balanced and elegant enough not to blow away any food it accompanies. Dry and crisp in acids, it shows citrus, peach and apple flavors that finish clean and zesty.
title: Barnett 2004 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: From the Pisoni family, a crisp, fruity Chard that's long and deep in jammy apricot, lemon drop and guava flavors that are set off by high acids. This is a big, in-your-face wine, but it has some fine complexities.
title: Lucia 2004 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Showing that earthy, dried herb character that so often marks Napa Chardonnays, this Oakville-grown wine is soft in acids and rich in spicy, creamy oak and lees notes. It has pleasantly ripe apple, peach and pineapple flavors.
title: Oakville Ranch 2004 Chardonnay (Oakville)

description: Flora Springs has made this wine for many years, keeping the price pretty much the same. It's still a sophisticated bottle of Chardonnay, dry and fruity and, as the designation suggests, rich in toasty oak notes.
title: Flora Springs 2004 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: It's refreshing to find this kind of high acidity in a California Chard, but that doesn't mean that this is a rich, fruity wine. It's tart in mineral and lime flavors, with a very dry finish. Try with mussels or oysters.
title: Casa Barranca 2004 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: So much richer than the '03, and a really nice example of Edna Valley terroir. The wine is brilliant in acidity, giving it an uplifted, bright mouthfeel. The flavors of kiwi, tangerine and smoky oak are delicious.
title: Talley 2004 Oliver's Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: The vineyard is in the northeastern Salinas Valley, in the Gavilan foothills, which makes it a cool climate. The wine has adequate acidity and oak, with flavors of peaches and cream and a rich, honeyed finish. Could have more depth and complexity, though, especially at this price.
title: Bernardus 2002 Cypress Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Handley's Anderson Valley bottling is always bright in acids, which are so nice and clean in a Chardonnay as fruity and rich as this. The flavors are a complex melange of pineapples, peaches and pears.
title: Handley 2003 Estate Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: Shows the distinctly high acidity and laser-pure lemon and lime flavors that are so typical of this chilly appellation. You'll also find enriching oak and lees influences in this clean Burgundian-style wine.
title: Concannon 2004 Reserve Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: High in alcohol, bone dry, and even a little tannic, this wine has citrus and mineral flavors with an edge of candied peach and sweet cured tobacco. Oak and sur lies aging add richness, but this is still an earthy wine. Could soften and improve in a couple years.
title: Williams Selyem 2003 Heintz Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This lovely, delicately powerful Chardonnay has a great balance of all its parts. The ripe fruit flavors are set off by crisp acids, while toasty oak and lees add complexity. The honeyed finish is rich.
title: Acacia 2004 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Mondavi's Chards never seem as ripe as most others, instead coming in with higher acids and a tinge of dusty tannins framing the fruit. So it is with this dry wine, with its touch of mineral and rich coating of oak.
title: Robert Mondavi 2003 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: It's hard to describe this as Chablisian, given the 15-percent-plus alcohol, but that word captures its minerality. There's a flintiness underlying the oak, citrus and peach flavors of this bone-dry wine. Similar to grand cru Chablis-it's tough in its youth. Hard to tell where it's going.
title: Williams Selyem 2003 Hawk Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Alexander Valley was the source of some great California Chardonnays back in the 70s, and this wine shows how well the appellation can do. It's a soft, opulent wine, with tropical fruit flavors complexed with the cream and spice of oak and lees.
title: Stuhlmuller Vineyards 2004 Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: There's a tart earthiness to this Chard that distinguishes it from fruitier bottlings. The flavors bring to mind cured tobacco, sweet dried herbs and apricots.
title: Grgich Hills 2003 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Tasted  with Talbott's wickedly decadent 2002 Cuvée Cynthia. This is a more eccentric wine, showing its extra year of age, and that is its strength and its weakness. The fruit is turning autumn leafy, with hints of oregano and dill, but is bone dry and clean.
title: Talbott 2001 Diamond T Estate Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: This is obviously a cool climate Chard, to judge from the brisk acids, citrusy flavors and hint of minerality that makes the wine bracing and strong. Yet oak and lees lend softening, complexing notes.
title: Turning Leaf 2003 Sonoma Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Hendry's vineyard, located west of Napa city, is in a cool location, and vital acidity marks this wine. It has green apple and cinnamon spice flavors, while oak adds the usual smoke and vanilla complexities.
title: Hendry 2004 Unoaked Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This powerfully flavored Chardonnay is laserlike in the intensity of its fruit. Mangoes, pineapples and lemon custard assault the palate, wrapped in a creamy smooth texture. Not particularly subtle, and not for the faint-hearted, this is a quintessentially ripe California wine.
title: Ceago Vinegarden 2004 Jeriko Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: There's lots of flamboyant, ripe fruit here, concentrated and intense in papayas, pineapples, pears and lime custard. The oak is of equal heft, sweet and spicy in vanilla and woodsap flavors. The wine's a little awkward at this time. It could knit together and turn elegant in a year or so.
title: Sequoia Grove 2003 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: It's rich in Chardonnay character, with tropical fruit, peach, pear and oak flavors set in a richly creamy, honeyed texture that's highlighted by brisk, South Coast acidity.
title: Meridian 2004 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Oak Knoll is in the southern Napa Valley, and this wine reflects its warmish origins in its softness. Although there are polished flavors of apples and peaches and a rich coating of oak, the wine could have greater brightness and a brisker mouthfeel. Still, it's pretty darned flavorful.
title: Corley Reserve 2003 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

description: This is a pretty good wine, clearly well made and balanced, with crisp, bright acids, a creamy texture, some nice oak, and restrained tropical fruit flavors.
title: Ledson 2004 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A combination of intensely ripe fruit and lavish oak has created explosive mango, pineapple custard and smoky vanilla flavors. This huge, New World Chard is almost over the top, but good acidity helps balance it.
title: Rideau 2003 Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Morgan's basic Chardonnay, rushed to market, shows the same vibrant acids and whistle clean mouthfeel of his more expensive bottlings. The flavors are of passion fruit, pineapple juice and lime zest, with a steely, stony minerality that finishes ultradry.
title: Morgan 2004 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: The entry on this single-vineyard Chard is strangely neutral. It's not until the middle palate that a blast of sweet, vanilla-y toasty oak hits, and also pear, mango and spice flavors. From then on, it's a satisfying wine, rich and elegant.
title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2003 Saralee's Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Here's a full-flavored Chardonnay in which toasty oak plays side by side with big, lush tropical fruit flavors to give plenty of mouth satisfaction. There's a vanilla custard and tapioca spice flavor on the finish that's especially rich.
title: Andretti 2004 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Here's a big, extravagant, unctuous Chard that leaves little to the imagination. Everything's oversized and upfront: the massive tropical fruit and spice flavors, the toasty, caramelized oak, the creamy, leesy texture, the finish. It's flashy, but seems to pall after a few sips.
title: Cuvaison 2002 ATS Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Made in a very dry, early-picked style, this wine shows a firm structure of acids and even some dusty tannins, framing tobacco, apple and spice flavors. Everything about it, including the oak, has been modulated.
title: Reynolds 2003 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Pretty good Chard, rich and creamy, with a vanilla custard thickness balanced by bright acidity. The flavors? Ripe and full, including pineapples, guavas, peaches and dusty spices.
title: Raymond 2003 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Very well oaked, this full-throttle Chard features smoky, vanilla-tinged buttered toast aromas leading to a fruity, spicy finish. The flavors suggest golden-skinned tree fruits and honey.
title: Murphy-Goode 2002 Island Block Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: With no wood, what you get are the pure fruit flavors of sweetly ripe peaches, pineapples and mangoes in this delightful wine, which has enough brisk acidity to balance. A very good value.
title: Jewel 2003 Un-Oaked Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: I'm always struck by Edna Valley acids, and so it is with this tart, tightly wound Chardonnay. It's got pretty peach and apple flavors, with a stoniness that must come from the terroir. It's also very dry.
title: Wolff 2003 Old Vines Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: This full-throttle Chard receives 100% malolactic fermentation and frequent lees-stirrings to build in even more richness. The result is a perfumed, full-bodied wine with flavors reminiscent of pear, melon and vanilla. There's a custardy texture to the warm, slightly woody finish.
title: St. Francis 2002 Behler Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: When I think of Husch wines I think of acidity, and this wine has lots of it. It's perfectly dry and tart, with ripe green-apple flavors and a pleasant spiciness.
title: Husch 2003 Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Bright in apple and citrus flavors, this pleasant Chard shows a crispness that's more akin to a coastal wine than an inland one. It's dry and rich on the finish.
title: EOS 2003 Reserve Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Tart, crisp and dry, in fact a minerally wine of considerable streamline and finesse. The flavors subtlely suggest limes, with vanilla and smoke.
title: Gallo of Sonoma 2002 Laguna Ranch Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Rather earthy for a Chardonnay, but it's extremely rich earth, with suggestions of apples, clover honey, butterscotch and toast. Something about this wine makes you reach for a second glass.
title: Beaucanon 2001 Selection Reserve Jacques de Coninck Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is a very dry, crisp Chard that shows mineral, sweet Meyer lemon and green apple aromas and flavors. It's polished and elegant, with a long, oaky-spicy finish.
title: Rusack 2003 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Pretty tart in acids, with citrusy flavors and a fair amount of oak, this Chard pleases for its easy drinkability. Not terribly complex, just a good, dry, fruity-flinty wine.
title: Bouchaine 2003 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: There are earthy, leesy and oaky-woody aromas and flavors to this wine. It's surprisingly unfruity, although there are notes of peaches and tropical fruits in the finish. Dry and crisp in acids.
title: Testarossa 2003 Michaud Vineyard Chardonnay (Chalone)

description: A little bitter in acidity, but that's by itself. A nice buttery lobster will certainly complement it. Otherwise, it has rich tropical fruit and a zesty minerality, and a long finish.
title: Fallbrook 2002 Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: You'll find all the toasty oak you want here, and plenty of ripe peach, Bosc pear and mango flavors too. The texture is creamy and smooth. It's a little sharp in the finish, but it's a nice Chard with some fancy features.
title: Taz 2003 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This is quite a dry Chard, rustic and earthy and even a bit austere, although the dryness is relieved both by pronounced oak and an underlying current of pear and peach fruit that shows up in the finish.
title: ZD 2002 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A very nice Russian River Chardonnay, with those pretty apple, pear and pineapple flavors, crisp, cool-climate acids, and spicy finish. There's a lot of toasty oak, too.
title: J. Lynne 2002 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a nice, rich Chard, with good peach and pineapple flavors and pronounced oak shadings. It's dry, with good acidity and a creamy mouthfeel.
title: Landmark 2002 Lorenzo Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Very good Chard, with plenty of upfront pineapple, pear, peach, apple and toasty oak flavors. Feels brisk and clean in acidity, with a creamy texture. Turns rather sweet on the finish.
title: Truchard 2002 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This ripe and oaky Chard shows crisp acids and subtlely charred oak, with flavors of apples and pears and a leesy finish. It's classically New World, with its obvious likeability and uncomplicated drinking.
title: Davis Family 2002 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: These Edna Valley Chards always seem to be tart in acids and fairly lean in apple and white peach fruit, with a strong minerality. Chablisian, if you will. This one fits the mold perfectly. Dry and crisp, it can easily accompany mussels or oysters.
title: Adelaida 2002 Chamisal Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: This wine is a bit tough and gritty, with an earthy, tobaccoey edge, but it has enough cream, green apple and peach flavors to satisfy. Finishes fully dry, with spices and apples.
title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2003 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: I actually like this wine more than Miner's more expensive '02 Wild Yeast Chard, with which it was simultaneously released. It's not as overwrought. Here, the tasty fruit takes over, with good results.
title: Miner 2003 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Offers lime, pineapple and mango flavors-even a hint of banana-with bright acidity and hints of vanilla and buttered toast. There's nothing subtle about this Chard.
title: Lighthouse 2002 Crescendo Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This is quite a sophisticated Chard, showing the quality of wines that cost far more. It's rich, with toasty oak that frames flavors of pineapples, buttered toast, spicy mango and ripe white peach. Feels creamy through a long, spicy finish.
title: Hayman & Hill 2003 Reserve Selection Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This cool Central Coast wine has tropical fruit and lemondrop  flavors as well as zesty acidity. Veteran winemaker Chuck Ortman has added a substantial amount of toasted oak. The result is a clean, flavorful wine.
title: Ortman Family 2002 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: All of this is barrel-fermented, 45% in new French oak, and it shows in the toasty, nutty scents. Buttery and creamy on the palate, with a plump mouthfeel and layered flavors of ripe pears and dried spices. Long and pineapple-y on the finish.
title: Clos du Bois 2003 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Cool-climate Chard, with crisp, outspoken acidity and flinty flavors. A scour of fresh lime and mineral hits in the middle, leading to sweet oak on the aftertaste.
title: Lincourt 2002 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: No malo in this tight, acidic young wine. It's one of those lemony, citrusy, flinty Chards that will reward aging for 5 or 6 years.
title: Godspeed 2001 Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)

description: In all objectivity, there is a problem growing Chardonnay in Rutherford. It's simply too hot. This is a good wine, even an interesting one, but it is not great and not worth the price. It has apple and pear flavors, soft acids, and an oaky, creamy finish.
title: El Molino 2002 Chardonnay (Rutherford)

description: Charming, with a good balance of ripe tree fruits, oak, and earthy, herbal notes. Satisfies your Chardonnay tooth, but it's understated enough not to swamp food
title: Alderbrook 2002 Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: This is an oaky Chard, brimming with vanilla, honey and smoky char, with underlying flavors of peaches and tropical fruits. There's also an earthy edge suggesting sweet dried herbs that suggests careful food pairing. A butter-sauteed filet of sole will be fine.
title: Benziger 2002 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Oaky and leesy, with a range of fruits from apples through peaches and pineapples, and tingly with dusty spices and acidity. This is a clean, food-friendly Chard, not too sweet
title: Rancho Sisquoc 2002 Flood Family Vineyards Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Lots of winemaker influence here in the leesy quality and oaky notes that have been added to an underlying wine tasting of apples and pears. The result is a dry, complex Chard that finishes with a bite of green apple acidity.
title: Paradise Ridge 2002 Nagasawa Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Rich and ripe in pineapple, mango, vanilla, spice and buttered toast, a smooth, succulent wine that finishes long and spicy. A tad soft and simple, but polished.
title: Beauregard 2002 Beauregard Ranch Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Tart and refreshing for its clean acids and silky mouth feel. You'll find mineral, lime sorbet and plenty of oaky, vanilla and smoke flavors. This balanced, elegant wine is a natural for food.
title: Domaine Chandon 2002 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Ripe in tropical fruit, peach, pear and spicy flavors, well-oaked, and with a creamy texture and crisp acidity, this pretty Chard offers plenty of pleasure.
title: Starry Night 2002 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Lots of toasty oak, plenty of ripe tropical fruit in this polished, friendly wine. The creamy texture and long, spicy finish bring it all together.
title: Eberle 2003 Estate Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Easy to like for its tropical fruit and pear flavors that are well oaked, and the rich, creamy texture. Fine, crisp acids follow on the long finish, leading to a clean, spicy mouth feel.
title: Kenwood 2003 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Clearly cool-climate, to judge from the tart, citrusy acidity and lemon-and-lime flavors. Would be lean if it weren't for the toasty oak and creamy texture. As it is, it's a great food wine.
title: Rosenthal-Malibu Estate 2003 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Three cheers to Raymond for producing a Chard this nice at such a great price. It's rich in tropical fruit, peach and oak flavors, with opulent spices, and is very dry. What a super value!
title: Raymond 2002 Estate Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: There's a wealth of rich, flamboyant pineapple and mango flavor here and a softly decadent note of bananas sauteed in butter. The vanilla and toast notes from oak are smoothly integrated. Yet this wine is dry.
title: Jewel 2002 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: This extremely ripe wine goes for big size at every turn. It's oozing with sweet tropical fruit flavors that drip with oaky vanillins and buttered toast, and has a creamy texture and spicy finish. From an up-and-coming appellation in Monterey County.
title: Seven Peaks 2003 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Ripe and tasty in tropical fruit flavors, this creamy wine is quite good, and would be even better with a little more focus and structure. It falls apart a bit, a fault at this price. Still, the smoky oak veneer is fancy.
title: Vine Cliff 2002 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A pretty wine, spicy and rich, with an array of vibrantly fruity flavors ranging from sweet citrus through apples and peaches to exotic mango. Winemaker bells and whistles such as barrel fermentation and lees add creamy, vanilla, buttered toast notes.
title: Benziger 2002 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Rich and ripe, this Chard brims with tropical fruit and Oriental spice flavors. It's pretty oaky, with splashy vanilla and toast notes that are perfectly in keeping with the size of the fruit.
title: Hess Collection 2002 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: There's an earthy, sweet herbaceousness surrounding the citrus and apple fruit flavors in this very dry wine, which is also generously oaked. It's not flamboyant or hedonistic, but it is balanced, with acidity that cries out for food.
title: Dutton-Goldfield 2002 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A fine job; this Chardonnay emphasizes structure and food compatibility rather than fruity extraction. There's good apple and peach flavor, bright acidity, enough oak to season and a sprinkling of dusty tannin.
title: Stags' Leap Winery 2002 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Quite a smooth and polished Chard. It impresses for its upfront apple and pear flavors, and is balanced, dry and crisp. Fills the mouth with spice through the finish.
title: Ledson 2002 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Here's a crisp and elegantly structured wine. The citrus and apple flavors have an earthy, mineral edge and are accompanied by good acidity, leading to a clean and vibrant mouthfeel. There is, however, an almost excessive dryness.
title: Carpe Diem 2002 Firepeak Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Intensely oaky and ripe, almost dessert-like with its crème brûlée, sweet pineapple tart and vanilla custard flavors and rich, creamy texture.
title: Wellington 2001 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A bit over-oaked, with those buttery, caramelly aromas and flavors dominating the underlying apple tart fruit. But it's rich and complicated, offering up an array of oriental spices that pack a real punch on the finish.
title: Merryvale 2002 Starmont Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Lemondrop candy, fresh ripe papaya, sun-ripened peach, toasted and sweetened coconut, cinnamon spice-there's enough flavor to go around a dozen wines. There's also lots of oak. This flashy, flamboyant wine has all that, but it's a little soft and one-dimensional.
title: Clos La Chance 2002 Vanumanutagi Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz County)

description: Comes down firmly on the earthy, leesy side, a wine with modulated fruit. There are suggestions of tahini, spice and apples, while oak provides the requisite buttered toast and vanilla cream. This wine is the opposite of opulent, and will be an unobtrusive food partner.
title: Robert Mondavi 2001 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Textbook all the way. Well-ripened apples, pears and peaches, crisp, citrusy acids, and oaky wood are what you get in this clean, well-made wine. The texture is rich and creamy.
title: St. Clement 2001 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Extraordinarily ripe from a hot vintage, this Chard takes spiced apple flavors and bakes them into a tart, sprinkled with toasted cinnamon and nutmeg. It's also really oaky. Too big for cracked crab, but try with poached salmon in a creamy aioli.
title: Mayo 2002 Laurel Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Here's a smooth, creamy Chard with flavors of apples, peaches, buttered toast, vanilla and plenty of oriental spices. The rich flavors last through a long finish. Has enough complexity to stand up to cracked crab, with a sourdough baguette.
title: Napa Creek 2002 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Lots of oak has drenched this wine, and it's good oak, too, filled with vanilla, smoky custard and meringue aromas and flavors. The fruit? It's on the citrusy side, although you'll find a pretty aftertaste of white peach.
title: Domaine Chandon 2001 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This fine Chard has the steely structure and citrusy acids of a cool climate wine. It's not a lush or hedonistic, but controlled, with its apple and pear flavors and touch of oak and lees.
title: Murphy-Goode 2001 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Loads of well-charred oak covers underlying peach, pear and tropical fruit flavors in this crisp wine. It's fully dry, but so sweet in ripe fruit, you'd think it had a little honey.
title: Patz & Hall 2002 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Smells very oaky and leesy, with smoky vanillins, buttered toast and a sweet-and-sour cream aroma that masks the fruit. In the mouth, the oak also dominates, although there's some good underlying white peach and tropical fruit. Give it another six months to knit together.
title: Deerfield Ranch 2001 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A clean, focused Chard, with tightly wound flavors of citrus fruits, apples and peaches. Oak adds notes of vanilla, buttered toast and smoke. Particularly nice for its crisp acids and firm balance.
title: Babcock 2002 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Ripe and fruity, this tasty wine is filled with flavors of pears and pineapples, apples and peaches and a sprinkling of Oriental spices. It is well oaked and creamy smooth, with a long, fruity finish.
title: Mazzocco 2001 River Lane Vineyards Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Firm and bright, with a clean, clear focus that features mineral, lemon, green apple and grapefruit. Fresh on the finish.
title: B.R. Cohn 2001 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: User-friendly Chard, with pleasant flavors of peaches and pears and enough oak to add a smoky, spicy edge. Has a nice, creamy exture, with crisp acids. Easy-drinking wine with lots of charm.
title: Montona 2002 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Almost as tight as the Aurora bottling, maybe a shade richer in pear fruit flavors. Still, it's a lean wine, a structural drink dominated by acids, alcohol and dusty tannins. Oak provides vanilla. The finish turns tart and earthy.
title: Von Strasser 2000 Rainin Vineyard Chardonnay (Diamond Mountain District)

description: A rich, New World-style Chard with very ripe, forward fruity flavors of tangerine, apricot, and tropical fruits. Well-framed in oak, and with refreshingly crisp acids, this full-bodied wine is well-priced for the quality.
title: J. Lohr 2001 Riverstone Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: From vintner Rob Talbott, a less expensive version of his single-vineyard Chard. It's crisp and oaky, with a suggestive leesy mouthfeel, and very dry. The flavors are complex, but highlighted by fresh pineapple and gingery spices.
title: Logan 2001 Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: A crowd-pleasing wine, with its oaky flavors of vanilla, smoke and buttered toast, and ripe fruity flavors of pears and tropical fruits. The texture is creamy smooth, with a rich edge of smoky honey. A nice value.
title: Clos du Bois 2002 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Declares itself firmly on the side of minerals, slate, steel, citrus fruits and acidity. You get the idea. It's on the opposite side of the spectrum from lush, tropical fruity renditions. Reminds you of those old California Chablis, in the best sense, although this wine has an incomparably better pedigree. Seems built for aging.
title: Landmark 2001 Overlook Chardonnay (Sonoma)

description: Made in Clos du Val's restrained style, this is a sleek, tight young wine. It has intense and concentrated flavors of citrus fruits that veer into apples and not-quite-ripe peaches, and is well oaked, with bright acidity. Seems designed to be a food wine, and may develop with a few years in the bottle.
title: Clos du Val 2001 Carneros Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Big, bold and rich from start to finish. They got the tropical fruit, pear and peach flavors ultraripe and then lavished it with what tastes like lots of new oak and lees. I kind of wish it was a little more elegant and balanced, though.
title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2000 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A nice, smooth Chard, solidly in the pop style with its pretty flavors of peaches, apples, sweet cream, vanilla and oak. It's smooth in the mouth, with a spicy aftertaste.
title: Andretti 2002 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: When you measure this against Testarossa's other single-vineyard wines, this release is earthy and lean, with citrus and tobacco flavors. Like all the rest, it's quite oaky. Doesn't share the rich opulence and hedonism of the others, although it's certainly a good wine.
title: Saddleback 2001 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: When you measure this against Testarossa's other single vineyard wines, this release is earthy and lean, with citrus and tobacco flavors. Like all the rest, it's quite oaky. Doesn't share the rich opulence and hedonism of the others, although it's certainly a good wine.
title: Testarossa 2001 Bien Nacido VIneyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: An interesting older wine, still in current release, that is picking up the bouquet and complexity of bottle age. Aromas include ripe pear, mineral, honey and smoke, while the rich, creamy mouthfeel carries flavors of aging white wine that is still fresh and slightly herbal.
title: Retzlaff 1999 Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: A well-oaked Chardonnay, brimming with smoky vanilla and buttered toast notes that ride high over ripe fruit flavors ranging from lemon zest to apple, peach, pear and pineapple. Tastes leesy, with a bright streak of acidity that is mouth-watering.
title: La Rochelle 2001 La Rochelle Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Tarter, drier and leaner than this winery's Carneros bottlings, with apple and peach flavors that blossom across the palate. The oak supports but doesn't overwhelm, while acidity provides crispness. Turns tart and short on the finish.
title: Diamond Oaks de Maniar 2001 Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)

description: No mistaking the chilly climate this tart, slightly bitter Chard hails from. Its flavors start with grapefruits and limes and manage to break through to green apples, although oak certainly adds softer, sweeter notes. It's a good, crisp wine that will be excellent with crab.
title: Baileyana 2001 Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo)

description: A fine young estate Chardonnay from these growers-turned-producers in the heart of the valley. Displays clean and pure apple and peach flavors, and enough oak to season with vanilla and woody spices. Balanced and pretty, and a good match for salmon or crab.
title: Kunde 2001 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Smells late-picked and ultraripe, opening with a blast of rich tangerine, lime and peach sorbet aromas, complexed with smoke and vanilla. Flamboyant in the mouth, too; a big, unctuous wine that's dry and rich at the same time. Crisp Salinas Valley acidity boosts the flavors.
title: Joullian 2000 RogerRose Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Smells great, with just the right mix of upfront green apples and the spicy vanillins of smoky oak. Enters the palate with apple and peach flavors and a rich, creamy texture that has extra weight from lees aging. This friendly, polished Chard is as good as many more expensive ones.
title: Hanna 2001 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Don't look for that deft, delicate touch here. This is a late-picked, extracted wine stuffed with tropical fruit flavors and lots of oak. A bit over the top, in Rosenblum fashion, but definitely with a personality and style all its own.
title: Rosenblum 2001 Lone Oak Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Smells young and fresh, with apple and pear flavors given a boost by bright underlying acidity. Not very oaky, so the fruit and acids take center stage. Almost delicate in weight, with persistent flavors on the finish.
title: Robert Mondavi 2001 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Monterey grapes star in this juicy wine, with its bright flavors of tropical and citrus fruits, steely acidity, and spicy notes of toasty oak and vanilla. The yummy flavors float in a creamy-smooth texture. Taft Street has long been known as an overlooked find. Its Chardonnays have consistently scored well in our tastings.
title: Taft Street 2001 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: This is the epitome of California Chardonnay, in all of its marvelous excess of butter, toast and richness. It's viscous and creamy on the palate, with modest apple and pear notes on the finish.
title: Geyser Peak 2001 Reserve Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: This is the "expensive" one on my list, but all net proceeds are donated to charity. In Latin, "humanitas" means "philanthropy," and winery founder Judd Wallenbrock has made giving back through fine wine his mission. A fragrant, melony front gives way to vanilla and spice overtones. It fans out to reveal hints of orange, lychee, grapefruit and lemon flavors, and finishes with moderate length.
title: Humanitas 2001 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Creamy smooth, with moderate acidity and a pleasant array of apple, mineral, melon and herb flavors. The finish is clean, with a lemony edge.
title: Liparita 2000 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is a pretty nice wine, well-crafted and rich, sort of a junior version of bigger, more expensive Chards. Fruity flavors range through ripe peaches to tropical fruits, and there's a thick overlay of smoky oak. The texture is creamy and smooth.
title: St. Francis 2001 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Dark and jammy, a big, youthful wine brimming with blackberry and other thorny berry flavors. Drinks full and rich in the mouth, with sharp acidity that creates some bitterness. Tame this puppy with at least a year or two of cellaring.
title: Rosenblum 2000 RustRidge Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Rich, full-throttle Chard, bursting with tropical fruit flavors and gorgeous acidity. Tastes barrel fermented and leesy, with layers of sweet cream tapering into a spicy finish.
title: Mount Eden Vineyards 2001 West Slope Edna Ranch Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Dry Creek Chards ask for a certain indulgence. They're never opulent or over the top, and have rather earthy flavors that bring to mind sweet, cured tobacco. This wine, which is a fine example, features winemaker interventions, like lees and oak, and finishes with some tannins. If you're adventurous, try aging it.
title: Michel-Schlumberger 2001 La Brume Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: A very fruity, exceptionally ripe wine, filled with sun-pure flavors of green apple, white peach, pear, and nutmeg. Oak plays a supporting role throughout. Finishes with a honey and pepper richness.
title: Arrowood 2001 Grand Archer Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Much leaner than the â"˜99 vintage. This release shows mineral, slate, and citrus fruit  flavors and high acidity, and is very dry. Feels like liquid steel gliding over the palate, ultra-clean and tart. No creme brulee this year, but nonetheless a distinguished wine.
title: Cambria 2000 Bench Break Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Hard, lean and minerally, with mouth-tingling acidity and flavors of stone, herbs and citrus fruits. This is not one of your fat, hedonistic monsters, but will pair better with foods. The finish turns honeyed, with hints of peaches.
title: La Crema 2001 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: From Gallo's Central Coast brand, a lean, tart and minerally Chardonnay marked by flavors of flint and lime just veering into tart green apple. Extremely well made, and not without interest, but if big, blowsy Chards are your thing, look elsewhere.
title: Anapamu 2001 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: An interesting wine with tight acids and tannins and compressed fruit, the result of austere mountain growing conditions. Flavors range from lemons to green apples, but the overlay of oak is strong, with a powerful toasty note.
title: Atlas Peak 2001 Chardonnay (Atlas Peak)

description: This plump Napa Chard shows off plenty of ripe fruit, ranging from apples to pears and lemons to limes. A hint of vanilla emerges as it sits in the glass. A fruity, pleasant drink that finishes with food-friendly lean and lemony flavors.
title: Freemark Abbey 2001 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Rutherford)

description: A full-bodied, strongly flavored wine, with green apples and citrus fruits powerfully dosed with smoky oak and lees. Very dry and well-structured. The finish is spicy and tobaccoey, and turns yeasty-sour.
title: Baystone 2000 Saralee's Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Kind of tart and lean, with citrus flavors just nudging into green apples. Oak adds considerable richness and viscosity, and most of the barrels underwent malolactic fermentation, but it's still an angular Chardonnay. The finish is lemony.
title: Silverado 2001 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A well-made, attractive Chardonnay from a veteran Chard guy, this wine is fully ripened, with delicious peach and pear flavors. It's a bit soft, but sturdy oak helps to contribute structure to this polished, eminently drinkable wine.
title: Arrowood 2001 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Lots of herbal and leafy notes in this cool vintage wine, with flavors ranging from mint and oregano to riper apples and white peach. A dash of Viognier plumps it up with floral fruit. Dry and crisp.
title: Zaca Mesa 2000 Zaca Vineyards Chardonnay (Santa Barbara)

description: On the lean side, with apple and citrus flavors typical of the appellation. Acidity is sharp and mouth-watering. This is not a big, fat Chardonnay but it is a well-structured, foodworthy wine, with oaky influences. This tight structure is very clean.
title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2000 DCV4 Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: A streamlined Chard, with flinty-appley flavors and a rich dose of lees and toasty oak. Comes alive on the long, peppery finish.
title: Sebastopol 2000 Dutton Ranch Dutton Palms Vineyard Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: A big bells-and-whistles wine whose tropical fruit flavors are enhanced by large quantities of smoky oak and lees. Vanilla, buttered toast and that sour flavor that comes from sur lies aging take front stage at the cost of some subtlety. -S.H.
title: Villa Mt. Eden 2000 Grand Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: . Creamy-rich, with melon, peach, toast and honey flavors. Full on the finish, with a slightly woody aftertaste. -J.M.
title: St. Supéry 2000 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Brims with pronounced peach, oak and lees notes. Big, full-bodied and rich, it's marked by scads of new smoky oak and opulently ripe fruit. A shade obvious in all its respects, it could use more subtlety and finesse. -S.H.
title: Simi 1999 Goldfields Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Never big or flashy, Trefethen's Chardonnays are usually good representatives of their vintage. This wine is lean and tight, with citrusy flavors, hefty acids and an overlay of oak. It's swift, clean and steely. Try with shellfish, goat cheese or roast chicken. -S.H.
title: Trefethen 2000 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: The underlying fruit is tight and lean, with apple and citrus flavors, although it's fattened up with winemaker bells and whistles. Oak adds a creamy texture and smoky vanilla, while lees contribute more cream. The finish turns acidic and tart.
title: Von Strasser 2000 Aurora Vineyard Chardonnay (Diamond Mountain District)

description: After all these years, Mayacamas still marches to a different drummer. Not for them flamboyant fruit or a heavy plaster of oak. You won't find tropical fruits, scads of spices and vanilla. This wine is tight and earthy, and the dryness is not offset with glycerin or other pseudo-sugars. It's earthy and austere. The point is ageability, if you care to cellar it.
title: Mayacamas 1999 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Jam-packed with bright fruit flavors of peaches, pears and tropical fruits, and spiced up with the vanilla and toast notes of oak. This is a rich wine, big and bold, and a real crowd pleaser.
title: Kunde 2000 Wildwood Vineyard - Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: This is a hands-on wine filled with everything toasty oak and lees can add. The underlying flavors are fairly lean, suggesting citrus fruits and a hint of green apple. The result is not a big, fat Chard, but a tight, crisp and elegant one. Perfect with roasted chicken.
title: Newlan 2000 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is a tight, taut Chard, grown very close to the Pacific Ocean. Acidity is the chief palate impression, high and tart, and the flavors veer toward minerals, stone, herbs and citrus fruits. But this austerity is rich, complex and interesting. Seems likely to develop, but these coastal Chards are still experiments.
title: Bannister 1999 Porter-Bass Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Sweet stuff, with flavors of butterscotch, vanilla and custard. The basic fruit flavors are peaches and pears. No problem getting the grapes superripe in this warm California region. Nice on its own as a sipper, or good with barbecued scallops in a rich butter sauce.
title: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2000 Wetzel Family Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: The underlying fruit suggests flavors of citrus and peaches, but the wine is so oaky, it floods the palate with woody spice, smoke, vanilla and caramel, and the creamy, nutty notes of barrels and sur lie aging. The finish is steely enough to support the richness.
title: Folie à Deux 2000 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Opens with a blast of well-toasted oak, vanilla, caramel and char, and oak dominates the palate through the finish. Underneath is some ripe peach and pear fruit. The texture is soft and creamy.
title: Kenwood 2001 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Extremely well-oaked, this wine has flavors of apples and citrus fruits that veer into peaches. It's a big, fleshy wine, a bit of a bruiser that trades elegance for sheer power.
title: Rodney Strong 1999 Chalk Hill Vineyard Reseve Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Steely and firm on the palate, with a marked bend toward citrus and herb flavors. Bright and clean on the finish.
title: Nickel & Nickel 2000 John's Creek Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Very rich and fruity, stuffed with pear, peach and mango flavors that go on and on. Oak and yielding acids give this Chard a smooth, creamy mouthfeel.
title: Kunde 2000 C.S. Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Light and lemony, with a zippy mineral core that leaves the palate bright and refreshed.
title: Justin 2000 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: A pretty wine, with tangy apple and pear flavors that are backed by a core of citrus and herb notes.
title: Chateau St. Jean 2000 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: From the cool Green Valley, a wine that didn't get quite ripe this year. There are citrus flavors alongside bell pepper ones and the taste of various herbs. Plenty of oak and lees makes things more complex, but it's still a lean wine that demands foods to wake it up.
title: Dutton-Goldfield 2000 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Another good value from this winery. The apple and peach flavors have something dusty about them, like dry, red California dirt on a hot summer day. Just a little oak spices up this dry and crisp wine.
title: Wild Horse 2000 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Another winner from this undervalued winery. Consistent with past vintages, this one is ripely fruity, with tasty flavors of apples and peaches and a rich overlay of vanilla and smoke from oak. Crisp acidity keeps it clean and vibrant on the palate.
title: Valley of the Moon 2001 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A very rich, oaky-toasty wine with oodles of upfront peach and tropical fruit flavors, but not a lot of depth or complexity. The fruit is big and ripely sweet and impressive, and the oak barrels provide layers of vanilla, smoke and sweet wood-sap nuances. It's all on the surface, but it's a very pretty surface.
title: R.H. Phillips 1999 Toasted Head Giguiere Ranch Chardonnay (Dunnigan Hills)

description: Only 30% malolactic fermentation gives the wine some creaminess but maintains the freshness of the fruit. With aromas of pear, pineapple and toast, it has smoky, rich, flavors that end in a soft nutty finish.
title: Staglin 2000 Salus Chardonnay (Rutherford)

description: Smells bright, citrusy and clean, but the bouquet is dominated by oak. A charry, penetrating scent of vanilla, with almost a hint of white chocolate, leads to a rich, creamy wine. It's a bit on the sweet side, and tastes strongly of lees. Pretty good stuff-at this price, it's a swell value.
title: Gallo of Sonoma 2000 Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Lush, with butterscotch, vanilla, apple, pear and peach overtones. A tangy mineral edge adds balance, albeit perhaps too brightly. Clean at the end.
title: Château Souverain 2000 Winemaker's Reserve Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Clean flint and citrus qualities sit behind a smoldering curtain of heavily toasted oak. Finishes warm, with a white-pepper zing.
title: Ferrari-Carano 2000 TreMonte Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: A toasty, buttery nose is the result of 70% new, medium-toast Vosges oak, but the fruit is all California Chardonnay, with Golden Delicious apple and tropical fruit flavors. This wine is medium- to full- bodied and slightly oily in texture.
title: Ferrari-Carano 2000 Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)
Cambria 1999 Katherine's Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Textbook RRV Chard reveals green apple and intense spice, white peach and honey flavors, generously wrapped in smoky oak. Has a real richness and creaminess to the texture. Finishes too sugary, but has a lip-smacking quality many will admire. -S.H.
title: McIlroy 2000 Aquarius Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Buttered toast, yeast and a hint of nut wrap around warm fruit aromas. A creamy blend of peach and citrus brighten this viscous, full-bodied wine that closes with a clean flinty zip. It is this acidity that well pairs the wine to any summertime fare.
title: Domaine Chandon 2000 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Seems somewhat crisper and less weighty than prior vintages, with the custardy mouthfeel buttressed by lemony acids. You'll also find apples, sweet plums and the obligatory toast and vanilla. -J.C.
title: Gallo of Sonoma 1999 Laguna Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Another sweet, oaky Chardonnay joins the ever-growing line. Not that it's an indifferent wine. This family produces nothing but impeccably tailored wines, and this one is among the best of class at this price point. -S.H.
title: Kunde 2000 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: This is a good wine that's weakened by a lack of harmony. The fruit veers toward mangoes and breadfruit. The acids are fine. A gentle overlay of oak and pronounced lees add textural complexity. Yet the parts don't come together smoothly; it feels jagged in the mouth. -S.H.
title: Joseph Phelps 2000 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: It's all about extract in this kick-in-the-pants Chard. Assaults the palate with oversized fruit and the sting of peppery spice. Words like bright, electric and bold come to mind. It's also sweet and oaky. -S.H.
title: Raymond 2000 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Barrel fermentation, malolactic fermentation and lees aging add buttery, creamy, spicy complexities to this clean, steely wine. The underlying fruity flavors are not intense and veer toward leaner citrus and green apple flavors. It's a focused wine, not overblown. -S.H.
title: Ventana 1999 Reserve Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Hits all the right notes, from the rich, sweet tropical fruit to the butter and toast accents, but like the third violin in the symphony, lacks that extra flair to really stand out. The oak is well proportioned, and some zesty lime notes that should make it reasonably versatile with food grace the finish. -J.C.
title: Rutherford Hill 2000 26th Anniversary Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Tight and sulky right now, showing little more than earth and minerals on the nose. Later, it opens up to reveal apple and pear fruit along with some oily flavors. Finishes with citrus and green apple. Hang out the "Do Not Disturb" sign; this crisp, flavorful Chard could use another year or two of cellaring.
title: Thunder Mountain 1999 Ciardella Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Another day, another oaky, rich Chard. Or three. You'll find apples and peaches, you'll find spices and creaminess, and you'll find a broad, delicious Chardonnay that says, drink me. It's easy to comply. If you're curious, the Napa Valley AVA. doesn't cover the entire county; hence the appellation. -S.H.
title: M. Cosentino 2000 Chardonnay (Napa County)

description: Very ripe apple and peach fruit stands out in this nice wine. It's got a honeyed richness that extends through the clean, spicy finish. Dry and crisp, it's a great value in a complex, varietally true Chardonnay. -S.H.
title: Dreyer Sonoma 2000 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Peaches, pears and herbs run the roost in this medium-bodied wine. It's fresh and clean on the finish, and ends on a lemon-lime note. -J.M.
title: Rosenthal 2000 The Malibu Estate Chardonnay (Malibu-Newton Canyon)

description: Aims for the fences with ripe fruit, and certainly with oak. In fact the barrels dominate, giving peppery, spicy, vanilla notes and that unmistakable oaky flavor. It's a pretty wine, and a big one, but you wish they'd let the fruit speak for itself. Still, it will impress a lot of people. -S.H.
title: Varner 2000 Spring Ridge Vineyard Amphitheater Block Chardonnay (Santa Cruz County)

description: A bit earthy for fans of brightly fruity coastal Chards, but nice enough, and there's plenty of toasted oak to frame the tobacco, dried leaf and citrus flavors. It's also quite a bit drier than coastal versions, and is versatile enough for a range of foods. -S.H.
title: Thornton 2000 Dos Vinedos Cuvee Coastal Reserve Chardonnay (South Coast)

description: Richer than this winery's other two current releases, in terms of lavish oak, but still curiously lean in fruit. Lemons and grapefruits form the underlying theme. French oak adds vanilla, smoke and spicy sweetness, but a lean tartness persists throughout. Yet it's impeccable in its way. -S.H.
title: Schug 2000 Heritage Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Very ripe and spicy, the fruit dominates all other aspects. Peaches and cream flavors are rich and delicious, while oak contributes spice, sweetness and smoke. A long, semi-sweet finish adds interest. This is a crowd-pleasing Chardonnay made to appeal to the widest possible audience. -S.H.
title: Hanna 2000 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Toasty oak, citrus, peach and pear flavors find their stride in this medium-bodied wine. Though not seamless, it serves up plenty of bold character. -J.M.
title: Valley of the Moon 2000 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: From this cool-climate region, a crisp, dry wine that veers toward apple flavors. It feels lively and perky in the mouth, with good acids that come from chilly weather. A touch of oak adds spicy nuances. It's a good value in a lean Chardonnay. -S.H.
title: Jekel 2000 Gravelstone Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: This wine may have the highest acidity of any California Chardonnay on the market, to judge by the mouthfeel. Boom-a real blast of tartness. The fruit is lean, even austere, and from the aroma to the finish there's a steely, mineral note. Call it Chablis-like. It's well made and clean and needs the right foods. -S.H.
title: Esterlina 1999 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: Tastes like orange cream yogurt, full of rich, bold tangerine, vanilla, honey and smoke, and creamy-smooth in texture. What's not to like? Made in the popular style, and with grace, style and finesse. -S.H.
title: Parducci 2000 Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: A pleasing and delicate wine, with hints of pear, apple and citrus flavors. The ensemble is framed by light toast and herbs. Moderate on the finish. -J.M.
title: Acacia 2000 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Smoky oak and restrained fruit mark the nose of this smooth yet tangy offering. The nut and dried fruit flavors are understated-even reserved-and wrapped in spicy oak. Though tasty, it wants a little for integration and stuffing in the midpalate. Still, it has all the right parts, and it's not about sweetness. Drink now through 2003.
title: EOS 1999 Reserve Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: A light and fruity wine. Ripe apple and peach flavors are accented by peppery ginger and cinnamon, and the wine feels round and supple in the mouth. This likeable wine is clean and refreshing, with real varietal character. Best Buy. -S.H.
