title: Filsinger 2000 Special Reserve Chardonnay (Temecula)

description: Here's a very deeply scented wine.  Fruit aromas are peach, ripe pear and tropical fruit, accented by oriental spices.  The flavors are massive and persistent.  It's as fruity as wine gets, but the balance of crisp acidity, fine tannins and integrated oak creates harmony.  It's a bit sweet in the finish.
title: Cobblestone 1999 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: From the Sonoma side of appellation, this is a ripe, fruity wine brimming with polished peach and breadfruit flavors.  Some may find the lees dominating the aroma and palate.  Give it six months or so and let it calm down.
title: Castle 1999 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Ripely fruity, with peach, tangerine and tropical fruit flavors and a solid dose of spicy,smoky oak.  There's also a strong, leesy note.  On the palate, it's round and full-bodied, with a rich, honeyed texture and a long finish.
title: Paradise Ridge 2000 Nagasawa Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Has tangerine and smoke aromas, plus hints of oak and lees.  It's quite fruity, with brilliant acidity, which makes it more brittle than, say, a Sonoma Chard.  It's dryish, with a very long, spicy finish.  Enjoy it now with rich, spicy, buttery foods.
title: Navarro 1999 Premiere Reserve Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: Meridian strikes again with this spiffy Chard packed with well-ripened tropical fruits and spices, and a solid dose of smoky oak.  It's clean, crisp and intense, with a honeyed texture and long finish.
title: Meridian 2000 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Explosive leesy notes dominate the aromas and flavors, with plenty of charred oak, too.  Under these winemaker bells and whistles is some ripe peach and apple fruit, and the finish is long, sweet and spicy.  Emphasizes sheer size over finesse.
title: Artesa 1999 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This wine open with aromas of anise, green apples and white peaches, plus plenty of leesy and oaky notes, including vanilla, smoke and buttered toast.  The spicy flavors are full throttle, the texture round and creamy.  Picks up some leesy bitterness in the finish.
title: Imagery 1999 Ricci Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Vanilla and butterscotch aromas call forth in this surprisingly bright-textured Chardonnay.  Zingy lemon notes leave a searingly clean finish, marked by hints of minerals and herbs.
title: Murphy-Goode 1999 Island Block Reserve Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Concentrated and intense, it's marked by stylish tropical fruit flavors and quite a dose of smoky oak. There's a mineral streak right down the middle that gives it a steely spine, and refreshing acidity adds to the structural integrity.
title: Babcock 2000 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This one shows off hints of butterscotch, vanilla and citrus in the nose, followed by pretty pear, lemon and toast notes on the palate. The wine is medium-bodied and quite refreshing. Clean on the finish.
title: Lake Sonoma 1999 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: All kinds of tropical fruits in the pleasant aroma, plus buttery, creamy notes and smoky, spicy oak. Tastes fat and opulent, with intense tropical fruit flavors and nervy acidity. This is very nice wine and easily the equal of others costing twice as much.
title: Jekel 1999 Gravelstone Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: An affordable wine from this Napa veteran, it's made in a tight Chablis style, with mineral, lime peel and smoke aromas, and a rich fruitiness on the palate. Pretty oak notes add vanilla and sweetness.
title: Raymond 1999 Estates Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Concentrated and intense, it's marked by stylish tropical fruit flavors and quite a dose of smoky oak. There's a mineral streak right down the middle that gives it a steely spine, and refreshing acidity adds to the structural integrity.
title: Buffalo Ridge 1999 French Camp Vineyard Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Toasty oak and cinnamon aromas team up with lovely pear, apple, citrus and spice flavors. Fleshy-textured, with a moderate finish.
title: La Crema 1999 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: The understated pear and pineapple flavors of this medium- weight Chardonnay have pleasant spice accents. It finishes stylishly with slightly tart pineapple and citrus notes.
title: De Loach 1999 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The full fresh-bread aromas of yeast, honey, oats promise much body, but the palate delivers a dry citrus-mineral mouthful of flavors. Mouthfeel is dry and briskly acid-but with a nice chalky note, too. Chalk shows again on the finish, where it somewhat checks the sharp lemony-metallic notes.
title: Hartford 1999 Seascape Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This Chard displays a slightly unusual but appealing sweet and sour streak. The bouquet shows tart green apples, grapefruit, stewed fruit and sweet herbs, plus tangy green oak shadings. The palate delivers more of the same, with zingy citrus and crisp apple flavors, but also dry, leesy notes. There's both cream and pepper on the back end of this likeable, split-personality wine.
title: Bernardus 1996 Sangiacomo Vineyards Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This sunny, medium-gold wine opens with caramel and apple aromas. More candy apple-like flavors appear in the mouth, accompanied by tropical fruit and toasty accents with a rich caramel tone. It verges on too-sweet, but it's nonetheless pleasing in an uncomplicated way.
title: Matanzas Creek 1998 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A full and creamy bouquet announces a palate laden with ripe golden delicious apple, vanilla, and melon flavors, with chalk, mineral and earth elements. The dry finish carries some length and builds in intensity. A straightforward wine that's ready to drink right now.
title: Arcadian 1998 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This very rare, single-vineyard Chardonnay has distinct vanilla, golden delicious apple, banana and peach flavors-a nice mix of sweet and sour, but some tasters found searing acidity and a sharp metallic note. Finishes tart, dry and long with a bracing edge capable of cutting right through your fried calamari and spicy sauce. Only 132 cases produced.
title: Foley 1999 Dierberg Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A big nose of toasty oak, vanilla and butterscotch opens this offering. There are hints of pear and apple fruit, but the palate has a dominating oakiness and a custardy fatness. It's slightly hot, with dominant butterscotch and vanillin oaky flavors.
title: Stonestreet 1998 Upper Barn Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: From the smoky, spicy nose through the spicy apple notes in the mouth, this bottling has an intriguing earth and mineral streak from start to finish. Medium-bodied, the wine offers some lemon and mineral tang and a lot of smoky oak on the finish.
title: Galleron 1999 Trio Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Big and easy with caramel and creamy notes to spare, this has good apple, spice and toast elements and an appealing nutty-leesy aspect. Still, it seems already quite mature, like it needs to be drunk now. Enjoy it soon for its full mouthfeel and ripe baked apple flavors.
title: Lafond 1998 Lafond Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: The historic estate's 1998 is characteristically lean, angular and fairly closed. The bouquet of apple cider, anise, and fragrant jasmine-like notes opens to a trim palate of green apple and toast flavors, and a taut mouthfeel. Tart apple and oak, plus a flinty, mineral element play on the finish. Notoriously tight when young, this wine often opens incredibly with cellaring.
title: Chateau Montelena 1998 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Some very appealing apple, asian pear, mint, smoke and toast notes mark the nose of this even, medium-weight wine. It has fine fruit-to-acid balance and offers apple-peach flavors with a mild but evident butterscotch element. The tangy oak that's present from the start shows most prominently on the spicy finish.
title: Rudd 1998 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The bouquet of Farrell's wine is a mixed bag of buttered popcorn, minerals, herbs, citrus fruit, pineapple and melon stuffed in an oak envelope. Similarly attractive flavors mark the palate, which is fairly full and has an almost rustic quality. Has all the body and length you could want, if not quite all the balance and finesse.
title: Gary Farrell 1998 Rochioli Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This light and elegant wine opens with orange and mild tropical fruit aromas. Easy peach and pear flavors bear dry vanilla and toasty oak accents. Even and soft on the palate, the nutty-leesy-chalky finish brings the wine to a pleasing close.
title: Pine Ridge 1999 Chardonnay (Stags Leap District)

description: Tasters pegged apples, anise, crème brûlée and cinnamon in the lively nose of this rich wine-one that also sparked some controversy. The straight-ahead flavor profile is appealing, with solid apple, clove and butterscotch offset by the attractive anise streak. But is it native yeast or heavy malolactic fermentation that's responsible for the mixed feelings some panelists expressed? Concerns were noted about a dairy-like note on the nose and also a slick, yet gummy texture. Nevertheless, the winning aromas and flavors kept the overall take positive.
title: Château Potelle 1997 VGS Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)

description: Pear, pineapple and herb aromas intrigued some tasters, but others found an odd note in this wine's nose. Vanilla, pear, apple and sweet spices mark the medium-weight and round palate. The back end of this wine has tangy wood and a slight chalkiness.
title: Beaulieu Vineyard 1999 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: We enjoyed the vanilla, pear, butter and toasty flavors on this classy Chard, but the high alcohol it contains almost does it in. The nice acid backbone holds it together though and leaves a good overall impression. Enjoy it with grilled seafood.
title: Saintsbury 1999 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Restraint and elegance are not what you usually find in a Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay, but this one offers tart apple, citrus, and peach flavors along with a dose of toasty new oak. Clean and understated style.
title: Testarossa 1999 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Another one of Jed Steele's many single-vineyard offerings this wine from Santa Barbara is big and perfumey. Pineapple, banana and caramel flavors are cloaked in sweetness that may be a bit heavy for some.
title: Steele 1998 Goodchild Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Lavishly oaked from the first whiff on the nose and palate, dense toasty notes envelope the pineapple and tropical fruit. Plenty of vanilla and both a tangy nuttiness and a creaminess from the oak, provide a nice mouthfeel tension. Panelists had two schools of thought about this wine: The oak totally dominates-certainly now-and how you feel about that determines your take on the wine. Lacking fruit? Or just tight and needing a year or two to open? Only time will tell.
title: Jarvis 1999 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This Napa Valley mainstay's offering shows a firm acid backbone and crisp, bright green apple flavors with lemony accents. Overall a bit on the lean side, but it shows just a hint of butteriness and some tangy new oak spice on the long, tart finish.
title: Grgich Hills 1998 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Smooth apple-pear and buttery, toasty aromas open to like flavors. That fruit core is offset by mild mango accents and lots of spicy oak, which continue through the long finish. For fans of rich, oaky full-bodied Chardonnay.
title: Wattle Creek 1999 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: The apple, earth and mild tropical fruit aromas, good mouthfeel and apple-pear and caramel flavors are all right on target. Lockwood's largest volume bottling, this hits all the right notes. Toasty, spicy oak mingles with apple, spice and butterscotch on the close. Drink now.
title: Lockwood 1998 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: A likable, easy-drinking Chard that won't bust your budget, with plenty of ripe flavors and winemaker bells and whistles. It's got spicy, vanilla-accented peach aromas, and while it drinks a bit thin, it's got some class and style. The finish lasts for a pretty long time, with oaky, spicy flavors. This is a good value, especially from a top winery. Best Buy.
title: St. Francis 1999 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A rich, complex Chardonnay with apple and peach notes and a strong mineral component. A scent of something like gunmetal or flint follows through in the flavors and helps give the wine a steely backbone. A distinctive wine; very dry and crisp.
title: Rutz 1998 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Classic Highlands Chard, with very bright, pure, focused aromas and flavors of tropical fruits and spices. The flavors are strong and clean. Oak adds shadings of smoke, vanilla and buttered toast, and there's something creamy and leesy in the texture. A fine wine of some complexity, at a fair price.
title: Cloninger 1999 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: If the grapes were any riper, they'd be doing chin-ups in the glass. A blast of pungent peach, green apple and cantaloupe notes is accented by new oak. That power carries over to the flavors. It might almost be too ripe for food. Definitely in the California style, like it or not.
title: Philip Staley 1999 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Super-ripe grapes put their shoulder to the wheel for a highly extracted wine characterized by masses of peach and pear flavors. Oak contributes added spice, vanilla and smoke. It's as plush as could be, but it's also soft and a bit flabby. An impression of sweetness lingers in the finish.
title: Rodney Strong 1999 Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)

description: Here's another good Chard from a vintage that produced a lot of them. It's ripe and aromatic, with a depth of peach-apple fruit, spices and smoky oak. A hint of lees and a creamy texture add complexity.
title: Atlas Peak 1999 Chardonnay (Atlas Peak)

description: A rich, creamy wine, loaded with personality. Spicy, oaky aromas ride over tropical fruit and peach scents, and it drinks crisp and spicy, although the midpalate is a little thin in fruit. The oaky sweetness is very nice, and so is the whistle-clean finish.
title: Fritz 1998 Dutton Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Shows the class of its terroir in the nutty, tropical fruit and spice aromas, and steely, almost stately quality of the fruit. Drinks dry and crisp, with some complexity of fruit, spice, and oak, and finishes fairly long and ripe.
title: Villa Mt. Eden 1998 Bien Nacido Vineyard Grand Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A very fine wine brimming with tropical fruits, vanilla, exotic spices, dark honey, and plenty of charred oak. The immediate palate attack is intensely fruity and spicy, with a penetrating acidity that spreads across the tongue. Strong, lots of flair, and none too subtle-the sort of wine that will please a crowd.
title: Jekel 1998 F.O.S. Reserve Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Crystal-clear California Chardonnay, with its trademark pineapple, pear and citrus flavors offset by a hit of creamy oak and buttery notes. Toast and butterscotch marry with faint lemon flavors on the finish.
title: Sebastiani 1998 Sonoma Cask Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Offers up complex apple, lemon peel, and even caramel aromas, along with some spicy vanilla. The apple flavors are accompanied by spicy, butterscotchy oak, although the flavors could be more concentrated. A friendly, likable wine.
title: Vine Cliff 1997 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Complex, with pears, sweet grass, apples, citrus, jasmine, and chalk all apparent on the nose. Creamy and full in the mouth, like a good milkshake. Some toast notes come on at the end.
title: Sebastiani 1998 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Light and friendly aromas of green apple, pear, vanilla and slate. Apples and pear flavors are touched up by a slight nuttiness. Finishes a bit heavy, with oak and toast stepping on and over the fruit. Full acidity keeps it tight.
title: Trefethen 1998 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Ripe tropical fruit, bananas, some heat still, and roughness from the barrel fermentation. It needs some time to smooth out, but it's a very consumer-friendly style of Chardonnay. Best Buy.
title: Bonterra 1999 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: Opening with pear, earth and toast on the nose, this medium-weight Chardonnay displays attractive tropical fruit, apple and spice flavors, and a decent mouthfeel. Enjoyable for its natural profile and decent finish, where a touch of pineapple sweetness creeps in. Best Buy.
title: Monterra 1998 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Interesting aromas of earth, pear and cinnamon toast are accompanied by a slight sour note that yields with a little time. A nice palate of pear follows. Medium weight, with a melony, almost slick mouthfeel. Oak rises on the finish with a reprise of the early earthy note.
title: Rosenblum 1998 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: A good medium-weight Chardonnay offering mild vanilla, toast and caramel aromas. In the mouth the flavors are light green apple, orange and lemon. The mouthfeel is full and balanced. A slight bitter note creeps in on the end.
title: Rodney Strong 1998 Chalk Hill Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)

description: The complex toasty-smoky nose also holds hints of apples and white peaches. Medium-bodied and verging on oily in texture, with a long, buttery finish.
title: Estancia 1998 Single Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: An interesting nose of lemony fruit and earth, then round appley flavors accented by spice and a distant note of something citrusy. Has length and buttered toast on the finish. Workmanlike and solid.
title: Ferrari-Carano 1998 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Fine fresh fruit marks the nose of this attractive medium-weight contender. The flavors are round and appley, but with a slight crispness that adds some edge. Finishes clean, with a likable tartness.
title: Gundlach Bundschu 1998 Sangiacomo Ranch Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: One whiff and you know this has been exposed to heavily charred oak. It has apples and citrus, but also a lot of heft, which causes some clumsiness. Maybe a little awkward; its appeal will not be obvious to all.
title: Mayo 1998 Barrel Select Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: A mainstream Napa cruiser with butter, apple and faint pineapple aromas. Medium fruit and citrus flavors mark the fairly lively, tangy palate. Finish of modest length but with a nice spiciness.
title: Miner 1998 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: More than half the fruit is from San Diego, where Orfila is based. Full, earthy aromas and palate qualities set the stage for a long, woody finish. It's on the heavy-chunky side of the fence, and thus scores few points for elegance.
title: Orfila 1997 Ambassador's Reserve Limited B Chardonnay (San Diego County)

description: Not another cookie-cutter Chardonnay, this wine emphasizes citrus and mineral notes. Some herb or floral aromas add complexity. On the lean side; it's piquant, clean and crisp.
title: Qupé 1998 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Apple and spice are the dominant aromatics, and then some butter steps in to play a supporting role to the apple-fruit palate. A solid, enjoyable mainstream white with all the driving fruit and oak you need to say, "hey, this is pretty good."
title: Beaucanon 1998 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Apricot, pear and menthol aromas open this full-bodied, almost fat wine. It displays ripe pear and apple flavors and a buttery mouthfeel-perhaps a bit more acidity would increase flavor definition here. Ends with a smooth finish of medium length.
title: Justin 1998 Reserve Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Smoky, herbal aromas on the nose have an off-putting edge. The palate, however, displays very good weight, balance and citrusy flavors with earth and mineral notes. A big, mouth-filling wine with positive flavors offset by some difficult aromas.
title: Longoria 1998 Santa Rita Cuvée Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Apple and earth aromas with musky notes announce this solid, slightly fat Chardonnay. Possessed of good balance and moderate acidity, it closes long with a slightly sharp tartness.
title: Morgan 1998 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Big tropical fruit and some caramel apple set the stage for a sharper palate of tart apples, lemony herbs and vanilla. It covers a lot of ground flavor-wise, touching lime and toast at points in between. Ultimately it settles down nicely.
title: Alexander Valley Vineyards 1997 Wetzel Family Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Tight and herbal upfront, the nose is hard to read. The palate is leaner and crisper than most, with a medium mouthfeel. The finish is long and a bit tart, but it remains polished and delivers ample weight and smoke.
title: Dry Creek Vineyard 1998 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Engaging and complex toasty, leesy, hazelnut aromas predominate on the nose. The palate is earthy in a positive sense, with nutty and lemon-pineapple flavors. The finish is medium-long and very dry. Well-structured, in a heavily oaked style. More intellectual than hedonistic.
title: Grgich Hills 1997 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A solid performance from a solid performer. Bosc pears and nectarines flesh out a lemon-lime backbone. Finishes well, with lemon and nutmeg nuances. On the lean side, but crisp and clean.
title: Simi 1998 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Nutty and toasty, but balanced by melon, lemon and green-apple fruit. Tangy, with a mineral-herb element that keeps it interesting through the chalky finish.
title: Robert Mondavi 1997 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Heavily oaked, with smoky, toasty aromas dominating the nose. Green apples, citrus fruits, and herbs complete the package. Finishes with lemony acidity and toast.
title: Renaissance 1997 Premiere Cuvée Chardonnay (North Yuba)

description: Melon and tangerine aromas. Citrusy, racy mouthfeel displaying good sweet apple and mandarin orange flavors. Very fruity from stem to stern, but one of the nicest "sweeties" we tasted. Pleasing and easy to like.
title: Taft Street 1998 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Heavy, very ripe pineapple aromas and baked-apple flavors. It suffers a little in the mouthfeel category, as it seems slightly flat. But it comes on late, showing ample oak in the finish. Dense in the middle, it's not unlike lemon poundcake.
title: Philippe-Lorraine 1998 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Old for a new release, but nonetheless it seems alive and well, with buttery components mixed with appley fruit and proper oak. Some spiciness comes up on the fairly short finish in the form of cinnamon and nutmeg. Ready to drink now.
title: Napa Creek 1996 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Mixes in a boatload of fruit aromas - apple, pear, pineapple - along with honey and vanilla. Takes on a definite orange-tangerine flavor, and finishes with juicy citrus notes.
title: Fess Parker 1998 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: A clean, typical California Chardonnay, with nice balance between pear and apple fruit, citrus, and creamy vanilla. Nothing at all wrong here, and if you like some very mild oak in support of sweetness, Acacia has one here for you.
title: Acacia 1998 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Opens with apple, butter, and toasty oak aromas. Adds mild spices and butterscotch in the mouth, which is of medium weight and fairly round in feel. Long tangy finsh. A solid and straight-ahead wine.
title: Byington 1998 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Shows an herbal edge of basil and oregano to its otherwise straightforward pear fruit. Finishes with an intriguing chalky note and slight astringency.
title: B.R. Cohn 1998 Reserve Joseph Herman Vyd Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: The nose is big and bold-this is not about subtlety but instead it's focused on heavy pineapple and other tropical fruits. The palate is loaded with bright lemony notes and softer pear and apple accents. Hefty and forward; not terribly deft.
title: Indian Springs 1998 Chardonnay (Nevada County)

description: Big, with juicy fruit aromas-apple and pear predominating. Citrus and apple flavors on the medium-weight palate. Mild apple and toast on the lengthy finish, which feels a touch heavy, maybe even hot.
title: Kendall-Jackson 1997 Paradise Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Heady pineapple aromas set the stage for intense, almost overpowering pear and pineapple flavors that are balanced by a streak of tart grapefruit. The finish is long and is marked by mint, lime and a hint of mineral.
title: Guenoc 1998 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: Intensely smoky and earthy aromas, with a deeply toasted, almost burnt-match quality. There are pear, lemon and nutty flavors on the palate. Long finish with earthy, nutty, spicy elements. Large-scaled and refreshingly unique, if not uniformly liked. A challenging and controversial wine for our panel.
title: Windemere 1997 Cathy MacGregor Vyd Signature Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Offers an interesting nose of earth, vanilla, oak and apple fruit. Apple and tropical fruit flavors with spice accents reign on the palate, with a full mouthfeel. Long toasty finish. The right elements are there, it just doesn't come together as well as it could.
title: Beaulieu Vineyard 1997 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: The nose offers aromas of crème brûlée and tropical fruits, with a touch of earth. Oak is apparent on the palate, where an earthy, slightly musty note appears. Ends with toast and minerals over mild fruit.
title: Byron 1998 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Shows plenty of oak influence on the nose, with toast, coffee and crème brûlée notes. Mixes in a nice dose of apple and lemon in the mouth, where it's lush and mouth-coating. Finishes with juicy acids that keep it from being overdone.
title: Mount Eden Vineyards 1998 Mac Gregor Vyd Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Full nose of butter, toast and cloves, with an attractive nutty quality. Looks mature, even has a slight oxidized quality, but is still very appealing. Good balance. Buttered popcorn finish. Drink now for sure.
title: Lafond 1997 Sweeney Canyon Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: A solid fruit-fest from the aromas to the close. Apple, grape, mild tropical fruit, tangerine, and orange in a delicious fruit mélange. Focused and refreshing. Honestly fruity, with just enough acidity to balance.
title: Sterling 1998 Winery Lake Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Loads of wood-imparted spice mark the nose, which also features some ripe apple and bosc pear aromas. May integrate with time, but for now the wood and fruit elements seem a bit at odds with each other.
title: Steele 1998 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Opens with lots of peach and grapefruit aromas. Light and bright citrus flavors with grassy notes and a tart mouthfeel make it read almost like a Sauvignon Blanc, or some would say like a good inexpensive white Burgundy. Has a nice chalk/mineral finish.
title: Sonoma-Cutrer 1998 Russian River Ranches Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: A slight early funkiness blows off to reveal apple, butter and lime aromas. Round flavors, with baked apple, pear and caramel prevailing. Full and soft mouthfeel; perhaps lacks a little backbone. Leans a bit to sweetness, but with flavorful, good fruit.
title: Cobblestone 1997 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Smells ripe and succulent, with juicy peach, pineapple and vanilla aromas. Tastes sweet and rich. Features great texture-creamy and smooth-with a spicy, slightly oaky finish that seems a little sugary.
title: Schug 1998 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Ripe, fruity and zesty, with not too much oak. Pretty citrus flavors of lemon and tangerine. Quite dry, with a steely backbone. A food wine, in the best sense of the term.
title: Husch 1998 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: Chardonnay from several respected Sonoma vineyard sites. Floral, pear, apple cider, herbal and smoky elements. Displays a toasty, leesy quality and fairly good neo-Burgundian complexity in the mouth, but also some unevenness.
title: Dutton-Goldfield 1998 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A simple, likeable, unoaky wine, with enough apple, peach, and pear fruit to satisfy, and a jolt of refreshing acidity. A clean, pure, Chablis-like white. Best with food.
title: Keenan 1997 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A pretty, everyday wine with ripe peach and fruity flavors. Dry, rich and supple, and not overly oaky. Will satisfy most palates with its easy charm.
title: Lambert Bridge 1997 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A fat, creamy, rich, peach-scented rendition-plump and soft. Shows lots of buttery aromas from 80% malolactic fermentation, and a long, spicy-oaky finish.
title: Geyser Peak 1997 Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: There are layers of tangerine and lime, with a backup of butter, cream and lightly toasted oak. It's a blend of Alexander Valley and Dry Creek Valley fruit that lacks a bit of finesse but makes up for it in power.
title: Mazzocco 1998 River Lane Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: An open, friendly sort of wine with juicy ripe apple fruit rounded by apple pie spices. Balance is good with crisp acidity and a refreshing finish.
title: Clos du Bois 1998 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: The bigger the ship the slower it turns, they say. Nevertheless, the new generation at Gallo has done wonders in a short time with both wine and image. Another winner here, with a rich core of juicy Russian River fruit framed nicely by tasty oak. Solid, persistent fruit flavors continue through the lengthy finish.
title: Gallo of Sonoma 1997 Russian River Valley Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Lots to like in this pretty, easy drinking, spicy wine. Plenty of citrus fruit; clean and supple. Has a nice acid bite, which should make it a natural with food.
title: Wild Horse 1998 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This is a tight Chardonnay from the Carneros region, brimming with lemony aromas and flavors. Oak notes add complexity, but it's far from plush. Lean is more like it, but stylish.
title: Carmenet 1997 Sangiacomo Vyd Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Pineapple, pear and buttery notes on the nose segue into a lush, oaky, low-acid impression on the palate. The vanilla and spice notes taper off quickly on the finish, but it's a solid wine nonetheless.
title: Chappellet 1997 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Pretty nose of oak, citrus and tropical fruits, and a pungent anise or minty note. Nice rich flavors, very forward in fruit and spice, clean, with some complexity. Turns oaky on the finish.
title: Raymond 1997 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Part of the Sonoma Cask series, this is a full-bodied, typical Sonoma Chard with some pine and green-apple aromas. Nicely balanced, with some toasted oak on the moderate, citrus-tinged finish. Plenty of ripe fruit here, and warmth. Overall not too complex or layered, but a lot to like.
title: Sebastiani 1997 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Pale gold color. The nose shows a lot of pear and pineapple fruit and some creamy vanilla notes from barrel fermentation. Medium-bodied, it finishes with some spicy oak notes. Attractive wine, drink now.
title: Armida 1997 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Two-thirds Chardonnay, one-third Viognier. An unusual blend that brings forth Chard's apple, peach and vanilla aromas and flavors, and Viognier's more exotic tropical fruit and floral notes. Well-crafted and ripe; dry and with good structure. Try serving it blind and seeing if your friends can guess what it is.
title: Qupé 1997 Bien Nacido Cuvée Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: A pretty Chard, with apple, peach, pear and grapefruit aromas and similarly succulent, juicy flavors. Impeccable styling at a fair price. Not in the league of this winery's flagship Carpy Ranch bottling, but rich enough.
title: Freemark Abbey 1997 Napa Valley Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A brisk and un-sappy Chardonnay that announces its origins with a classic Carneros nose. Citrus and pineapple   aromas and flavors predominate, accompanied by a tangy acidity. Finishes with more citrusy flavors softened by a touch of butterscotch. Great for grilled seafood and chicken.
title: Buena Vista 1996 Estate Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: What a pretty wine, and such a nice price. Peach, green apple, citrus and smoke dominate the nose, while the flavors are fruity and spicy. Clean and well made, it's a good everyday Chard. Best Buy.
title: Firestone 1997 Santa Ynez Valley Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: A nice, easy-drinking Chardonnay. You'll like the fresh apple and peach fruit with a touch of spicy oak. Drinks clean, dry and with some richness and complexity. The price isn't bad, either. Best Buy.
title: Geyser Peak 1997 Sonoma Valley Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: This stylish, racy Central Coast Chard has ultraripe tropical fruit, peaches and cream, and buttered-toast notes. High acidity makes it sing on the palate. A tad rough on the finish, but it's rich enough.
title: Mirassou 1996 Harvest Reserve Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: This mild-mannered wine offers moderate acidity, a stony texture and Gravenstein apple and lemon highlights. Medium bodied, it finishes clean and simple.
title: Fritz 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: There's a cotton candy aroma on the nose of this bottling that builds toward tropical fruit scents, such as guava, papaya and cherimoya. Apple pie, mango and coconut cream notes cling to a steely line of structure, feeling clean and crisp on the palate. A pop of bubblegum shows on the finish.
title: Ancient Peaks 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Margarita Ranch)

description: This wine's oaky entry derives from 10 months aging in French and American oak. It's creamy and voluptuous in style, with simple flavors of apple and a moderately long finish.
title: Rutherford Ranch 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Fermented and aged entirely in stainless steel, this wine is dominated by tropical fruit, swimming in pineapple and banana aromas and flavors. Unfettered by oak, it boasts sizzling acidity and, while tasty, is somewhat one-dimensional.
title: Tamber Bey 2016 Unoaked Chardonnay (Yountville)

description: Nutty, with a note of baked lemon, this affordable, approachable wine is robust in tropical ripeness yet retains enough acidity to remain fresh and fruity throughout.
title: Kirkland Signature 2015 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This lighter-style wine smells like baked apples and has a straightforward fruity flavor backed by crisp acidity. It's not oaky and has plenty of refreshing qualities without a big personality.
title: Shooting Star 2015 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: Polished aromas of roasted nuts, sea salt, Meyer lemon peel and onion skin show on the nose of this widely available bottling from the Chardonnay kings. The sip is a little bit flat in terms of texture and acidity, but there are compelling and satisfying flavors of roasted walnuts and pecans, with a citrusy acidity that rises toward the finish.
title: Kendall-Jackson 2015 Jackson Estate Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This is a very good, reserved and light-bodied wine with mostly tangy citrus and a bit of riper apple flavor, but it's not at all oaky. It will make an excellent wine before or during a meal, and should be versatile in pairings.
title: Hirsch 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: There's a noticeably sweet quality to this bottling that will appeal to some but turn off others. Spun sugar, buttercream, honeysuckle and orange mousse show on the nose, while the palate offers flavors of apple butter, brown sugar and lemon custard.
title: Boekenoogen 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Lemon-candy aromas are rounded with white peach, marshmallow and honeysuckle on the slightly sweet-leaning nose of this bottling. The sip is straightforward with lemon peel, slight marzipan, Gala apple and Bosc pear flavors.
title: Martin Ranch 2015 J.D. Hurley Griva Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: There's a strong peachy scent to the nose of this bottling, but it's bolstered by sea salt and a scratched lime-skin freshness. The lime flavor is prominent on the sip, from pith to juice, and there is decent tension along with honeydew flavors.
title: Midnight 2016 Chardonnay (Willow Creek)

description: A rich broad texture is the hallmark of this full-bodied yet moderately flavorful wine. It follows mild aromas of butter and pear with light vanilla and melon flavors and a luxurious mouthfeel.
title: Scotto Family Cellars 2015 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: This bottling shows its 88% stainless steel aging with bountiful tropicality, including guava and tuberose on the nose as well as toasted nuts and honeydew. Crisp lime peels start the sip, and then come more guava touches as well as mango. It's quite fruity.
title: Lucas & Lewellen 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This wine is mild in acidity and simple in structure, a light-bodied take on the variety that shows flavors of green apple and green olive tapenade.
title: Rutherford Ranch 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Stone fruit-fuzz and sugar apple combine along a freeway of thick texture and voluptuous flavor in this full-bodied white, aged in both new and neutral French barrels. Creamy vanilla adds additional richness and texture as it finishes strong and ripe.
title: Foppiano 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine offers simple richness around a full-bodied frame, dotted in well-defined flavors of golden apple and white flower. Honey and toasted oak provide added concentration and texture in this tiny production wine from a small producer.
title: Belharra 2015 Chardonnay (Knights Valley)

description: Tight-grained acidity features prominently in this lightly bodied wine, which has an oaky backdrop against concentrated flavors of dusty apple.
title: Dreyer Sonoma 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This wine opens with a rich nose of graham cracker and a concentrated midpalate, which becomes full bodied and toasty in oak. Around a gravelly texture are flavors of green olive, brine and baked pear, a mix of savory and sweet that finishes with a dash of nutmeg.
title: B.R. Cohn 2015 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Woody oak shows the 50% barrel fermentation behind this wine, sourced largely from the Dry Creek Valley. Baked apple and vanilla cream accent a thickly concentrated frame of big flavor and soft lush texture.
title: Wild Thing 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Exceptionally light, this acid-driven wine is all flowers and green apple, with just the slightest reach out to honeycomb-like texture and weight. It'll do well at the table in its unfussy approach and crispness.
title: Uptick Vineyards 2014 Estate Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A very evenly made Chardonnay, this shows all the expected notes of poached apples, Anjou pear skins and lemon-lime freshness. There is decent acidity to the sip, presenting flavors of candied Key-lime peels, tangy tangerine and grapefruit pith.
title: Twisted Paso 2015 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: The nose on this bottling is rather sweet-smelling, with white-peach syrup aromas cut by a touch of Key-lime pith. It dries up a tad on the sip, showing honeysuckle, Bosc pear and Gala apple flavors.
title: Soulmate 2015 Lester Family Vineyards Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Subtle aromatics ride a steely frame of straightforward acidity and subtle oak, the wine medium in build and layers. It finishes in a flourish of salty brine.
title: Bravium 2015 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: With its strong green olive aroma, this wine evolves into richly concentrated palate of anise, pineapple and pear, the fruit layered with vanilla. Light-bodied and supported by oak, it finishes bright.
title: Joseph Carr 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Sweet apple blossom scents combine with a botanical element on the nose of this bottling, which also offers a grassy note. The crisp palate offers lemongrass at first, opening into riper pear flesh flavor and finishing with a touch of salt and candied lime tang.
title: Chamisal Vineyards 2015 Stainless Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Big, bold and oaky, this wine smells like buttered toast and wood smoke, tastes rich but dry, and brings out pear, marzipan and pineapple flavors. It's full bodied and has a thick mouthfeel and lingering, smoky finish.
title: Tierra y Mar 2013 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: Given the popularity of the HBO series associated with this wine, it would sell like hot cakes no matter what it tastes like. Luckily, it's decent stuff, albeit a bit aggressive and youthful. Anjou pear, key lime, underripe guava and honeydew aromas lead into a sweet palate loaded with guava and bubblegum flavors. It finishes clean and very juicy.
title: Game of Thrones 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Crisp pear, baked orange, sandalwood and smoke show on the nose of this bottling. Sweet ripe peach permeates the palate, but a lemon wedge and savory sea salt sprinkling brings everything into balance.
title: AronHill 2015 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This bottling from the Dwarf Oak Vineyard offers pear, struck flint and smoked nut aromas, with the slightest hint of tropicality. The palate is rich with melted butter and roasted macadamia nut flavors-due, perhaps, to the warmer valley climate.
title: Sarah's Vineyard 2014 Chardonnay (Santa Clara Valley)

description: This lightly ripe wine shows slight reduction on the nose, which presents as toasted oak and salty brine. It's fresher on the palate, recalling green apple and melon.
title: Oberon 2015 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: This wine's lean fennel and dried herb aromas segue to richer buttery, vanilla-laced flavors from its time in oak. A lightly spicy, white pepper flavor comes through on the finish.
title: Parducci 2015 True Grit Reserve Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: This rounded, likable wine is integrated in oak and offers aromas of clarified butter, its fruitiness more tropical and stone fruit-driven than anything else. Concentrated, it finishes with simplicity.
title: Black Stallion 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Boldly oaked, this moderately rounded and rich wine offers a ripeness of apple, fig and butter.
title: Sequoia Grove 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Rounded and likable, this is a bang-up deal for a wine of fine quality, textured, light and fruity in stone fruit and pineapple.
title: Kenwood 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: There's a lot of green citrus and acidic sizzle on the nose of this brisk, stainless steel bottling, with touches of blood orange peel, pear blossom and lots of florality. Racy acidity frames the sip, where strong jasmine, stonefruit and apple blossom flavors show, like a flower bouquet in the mouth.
title: Cru 2015 Unoaked Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: This wine hails from the family's Eastside Road vineyard, planted to old Wente Chardonnay in 1982. It boldly opens in a robust, full-bodied explosion of ripe tropical mango and dried apricot, with an oaky underbelly that gives the texture grip and additional density.
title: Rock Wall 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Round and ripe yellow melon and baked apple aromas make for a voluptuous nose in this bottling, which also shows a touch of vanilla. The palate is more restrained, with kumquat and lemon flavors cut by a smoky character.
title: Flor De Campo 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This wine is full bodied and rich on the palate, with a woody reminder of oak. Spicy apple notes are lifted by spritzy acidity.
title: Broadway Vineyards 2014 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Apple mash and salty oak are on offer in this light-styled estate wine sourced from several of the producer's single vineyards. Mellow in texture, it's intense on the finish, with a snap of anise and nutmeg.
title: Thomas George 2014 Estate Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Dark gold in color, this is a viscous, buttery and robust wine, with pear, vanilla and stony flavors that keep it from feeling overly dense and rich.
title: Nicholson Ranch 2014 Cuvée Natalie Estate Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Very rich in texture and lightly sweet in flavor, this wine smells citrusy and crisp but tastes full and soft. It has ripe pear and peach flavors and a lingering, honey-like finish.
title: Gregory Graham 2014 Wedge Block Chardonnay (Lake County)

description: Light oak and butter aromas add complexity to this fresh and fruity wine. It has medium body, crisp acidity, mild citrus and green apple flavors with a tangy finish.
title: Ironstone 2015 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Sharp acidity and intense oak meet in this deeply concentrated, tropically-influenced white. Peach, apple pie, and faint pineapple flavors all figure in.
title: Thomas George 2014 Cresta Ridge Vineyard Estate Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Dried apple and pear aromas meet with touches of oak, macadamia nut and wet cement on the nose of this bottling. Similar dried apple and pear flavors show on the palate, which is lifted by citrus pith and a touch of smoke on the finish.
title: Vinum 2015 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Honeysuckle and jasmine punctuate the pretty aromas on the nose of this wine, which is tart and lemony on the palate. Intensely flavored, the oak is subtle and supportive.
title: Hawley 2015 Hopkins River Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Well composed with a steely palate of green apple and lemon complemented by apple blossom aromas, this is a medium-bodied white that's easygoing and not overly complex.
title: Thomas George 2014 Starr Ridge Vineyard Estate Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A touch of smoke and walnut in the aroma make this wine stand out, while apple and butter flavors fill in the palate. It's medium-bodied, dry and attractive in an Old World, slightly austere style.
title: Girasole 2015 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: This wine shows power and ripeness on the palate, with an oaky nuttiness on the nose. Lemony pear and stony minerality combine with a graham cracker creaminess, providing weight and length.
title: Medlock Ames 2014 Lower Slope Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a balanced, steely white, showing minimal oak and simple layers of apple, pear and vanilla.
title: Carneros Ranch 2014 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Fresh and citrus-driven on the nose, this bottling-comprised of 88% Los Alamos estate fruit and 12% from Goodchild in the Santa Maria Valley-offers grapefruit, lemongrass, and key lime on the nose. On the palate, it's sour at first with pink grapefruit tones, opening up into riper orange and tangerine flavors.
title: Lucas & Lewellen 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This is a very solid wine for its price, with floral scents of apple blossom, key lime and honeysuckle on the nose. Asian pear, apple and nectarine show on the palate, where touches of jasmine round out a decently tense sip.
title: SeaGlass 2015 Unoaked Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Meyer lemon pith and grapefruit scents meet with sliced pear, chalk and wet slate on the nose of this bottling. The palate sizzles with acidity and tension-almost too much so-with lemon peel and tart kumquat flavors.
title: De Tierra 2014 Vindegard Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Poached pears, yellow apples and a touch of butter show on the classic nose of this Chardonnay that holds to steely frame. Very sharp acidity kicks off the sip, where Pink Lady apples and warm vanilla surround a tight minerality. It's both sharp and slightly sweet.
title: Pull 2013 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Lemon rind, orange juice and chalk show on the nose of this bottling, which is a tad simple but very quaffable. Lemon wedge, green and yellow apples, and a bit of citrus pith show on the sip.
title: Layer Cake 2015 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Sugary peach and a taste of stone surround a lifted, floral undercurrent in this wine that takes on a richer, creamier midpalate and hearty oak as it finishes.
title: The Federalist 2014 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Butter and honey make for a rich, hedonistic tone to this mildly structured white. A soft, malleable texture provides creaminess without complexity.
title: Alyris 2014 The Audition Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Perfumed in a heavy dose of jasmine, this wine is aromatically curious, more Muscat-like than Chardonnay. Bold and low in oak, it offers a simplicity of white flower, wet stone and nectarine.
title: Ernest 2014 The Farmer Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Very dry and not overly fruity, this medium-bodied wine brings subtle earthy, savory flavors and a firm, straightforward mouthfeel, with a touch of astringency on the finish.
title: Barra of Mendocino 2015 Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Grapefruit aromas, extroverted fruit flavors and a fresh, crisp mouthfeel make this medium-bodied wine easy to enjoy.
title: Five Rows 2015 Marmont Vineyards Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: This appellation white is light in tart acidity, with a taste of sour lemon that persists on the palate and provides freshness and bite. Concentrated flavors of pineapple ride a creamy texture along a medium-bodied frame.
title: Buena Vista 2014 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This smooth, tasty and medium-bodied wine smells like fresh apples and baking spices. Vanilla and a hint of coconut come out in the flavors, leaving a sweet-seeming finish.
title: Criss Cross 2014 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Fresh-sliced Anjou and Asian pears aromas meet with sharper lemon oil and honeydew-melon notes on the nose of this bottling. Seared lime rinds, green pears and graphite combine on the sour and tart palate.
title: Castoro Cellars 2015 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Francis Coppola's wine sings in an intensity of baked apple and caramel, buoyed by high acidity and a stony quality. Layered and creamy, it satisfies fans of a richer mouthfeel while offering a lightness on the finish.
title: Director's Cut 2014 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: With a richness to the nose, this wine possesses a medium-sized body and moderate acidity, showcasing ripe apple, pear and tropical elements. The finish is focused in simple notions of preserved lemon and pineapple.
title: Vine Cliff 2014 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: Director's sources from vineyards across the county to offer an intensity of fruit flavor that tends lush and ripe. Melon and vanilla appear on the nose and palate, with a side tone of pineapple, nutmeg and even clove, finishing clean and with simplicity.
title: Francis Coppola 2014 Director's Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Full and ripe with broad aromas of jasmine, cooked apple and lilies, this wine gets a twist from brown spice on the nose. The rich palate reflects a touch of cinnamon sprinkled on baked apples, along with flint, sandstone, pineapple and a smoky character.
title: The Archivist 2014 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: The nose on this bottling is very smoky and flinty, but also shows underlying pear and apple aromas. There's an intriguing lime-zest character to the palate, with a base of dried apples and a smoked-wood character that's hard to ignore.
title: Cameron Hughes 2014 Lot 526 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Dense aromas consume the nose of this bottling, showing orange liqueur, apple juice and concentrated lemon syrup. The palate is nicely sharp in mouthwatering acidity, offering juicy stone-fruit flavors.
title: Jason-Stephens 2014 Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Clara Valley)

description: Light vanilla, buttered toast, Gravenstein apple and orange-cream aromas make for a very broad entry to the nose of this wine. The acidity is a tad lacking, but flavors of poached pear and lemon juice work fine on the sip.
title: Magistrate 2014 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: An extremely caramelized nose kicks off this wine's aromatic profile, with touches of butter toast, cotton candy and lightly melted marshmallow. The palate is oily and nutty with marzipan and an orange-rind bitterness.
title: Soulmate 2014 Lester Family Vineyards Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Very light aromas of apricot and apple blossom show on this appellation blend by the single-vineyard specialists, whose winery is based in Los Gatos. A nice touch of acid marks the palate, where lemon zest meets with ripe Pink Lady apple flavors.
title: Testarossa 2014 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Lemon candy and banana-chip aromas on the nose of this bottling lean into the tropical realm, and yet an orange-juice freshness keeps it light. Flavors of marzipan, bubblegum and banana cream make for a ripe palate, enhanced by a sea-salt richness and a clean finish.
title: Maddalena 2014 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: This wine has bright fruit-salad aromas, ripe pear and apple flavors and some attractive hints of butter and vanilla. It feels medium bodied, mouthfilling and smooth in texture.
title: McManis 2015 River Junction Chardonnay (River Junction)

description: Fresh jasmine flowers and orange blossoms give way to a tropical-leaning, guava-inflected nose on this bottling, boosted by a citrus twist. Once sipped, the tropical touch shows again, but it's fairly restrained, with light apple and mandarin-orange flavors prominent.
title: Las Palmeras 2014 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: The nose on this bottling leans slightly sweet and simple, with aromas of ripe poached pears and lemon syrup. A decent sizzle of acidity on the tip of the sip leads to yellow-apple flavors that show clean and crisp. A riper apple-cream element marks the finish.
title: Sisters Forever 2015 Un-oaked Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Butterscotch aromas, buttery, nutty flavors and full body make a pretty big impact as this dry and full-bodied wine pulls them all together.
title: Silver Palm 2014 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: Dried lemon rind, ripe apple blossom and lime-soaked honeydew aromas show on the nose of this bottling from the team behind Villa San-Juliette. It's simple on the palate, with very drinkable flavors of tangerine juice and caramelized almonds.
title: Fat Monk 2013 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This is a simply rendered, nicely light-bodied version of the variety, round and fleshy in mouthfeel with a taste of sugar-rimmed lime.
title: William Hill Estate 2014 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Golden orange in color, this wine shows honey, apple and pineapple, veering into a lushness of tropical proportion. Pronounced oak provides additional heft and the perception of sweetness.
title: Trinitas 2013 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Strong Gravenstein and red apple and fleshy Asian pear aromas show on the sweet-leaning nose of this bottling from two vineyards in Arroyo Seco and one in Santa Lucia Highlands. Crisp apple and pear-cider notes lead into flavors of browner stone fruit, poached pear and drying apple blossoms.
title: Joullian 2014 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: This wine has a bright, lively texture and tasty, ripe fruit flavors that don't overdo it. A sense of crispness and tanginess will make it versatile for food pairing.
title: Gen5 2014 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Aromas of lemon-lime soda, chalk, underripe nectarine and kumquat show on the nose of this bottling from Southern California. Tangy citrus and a wet-cement minerality show through on the sip, where ripe Gravenstein-apple flavors trend toward sour stone-fruit rinds on the finish.
title: Falkner 2015 Chardonnay (Temecula Valley)

description: There's a healthy dose of oak cradling the fruit-forwardness of this wine, made entirely from estate vineyards within the Chalk Hill appellation near the winery. Anise and honeyed caramel vie for attention against a rich texture and lemony finish.
title: Rodney Strong 2014 Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)

description: Seared yellow apple, lemon rinds and pressed white flowers show on the nose of this bottling from the pioneering winery, which was recently acquired by the Gallo family. The texture is quite steely with bountiful acidity, but the flavors are a little flat on the sip, where stone fruit and squeezed citrus show.
title: Talbott 2014 Logan Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Fermented in both oak and stainless steel, this serviceable white is salty and smooth, with plenty of Gravenstein apple on offer. Lingering acidity keeps it crisp and refreshing, before there's a touch of buttery oak.
title: River Road 2014 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Peach and honeysuckle aromas rise out of the glass in this floral and inviting medium-bodied white that was fermented in stainless steel, then aged in French oak barrels, 20% of them new. Never over the top, it offers a richness on the finish.
title: Hungry Blonde 2014 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A light straw color in the glass, this wine shows smoked-chicken, stone-fruit and pineapple aromas on the nose. It's delicate on the palate, with easy apple, oak and vanilla flavors.
title: Concannon 2014 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: A healthy portion of barrel influence is felt in this reserve wine, amid medium acidity. This makes for a robust, full-bodied experience, highlighted by caramel apple pie and pineapple, with muddles of butterscotch.
title: Ca' Momi 2013 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros-Napa Valley)

description: From Schug Estate, Wildcat Mountain and other nearby vineyards, this wine is made in larger quantities and intended for casual consumption with its soft, juicy personality bursting in tropical mango and pear. A touch of clove and nutmeg shine through a persistence of oak.
title: Schug 2014 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A full-bodied, quite ripe expression of the variety with an abundance of baked apple offset by a zest of lime, this wine is rich in vanilla and marshmallow.
title: Krupp Brothers 2014 Stagecoach Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Weighty but polished, this wine is full bodied, moderately flavorful and very smooth in texture. It has mild pear, butter and vanilla accents, subtle acidity and a plush mouthfeel.
title: Hoopes 2014 Genny's Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A vibrant yellow-gold color and a good blend of delicate citrus and butter in the aroma and flavor give this understated and medium-bodied wine the balance and interest to satisfy.
title: Hirsch 2013 Estate Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Squeezed lemon rinds and pith, wound up wet concrete notes, a touch of toasted almond and a slight show of nectarine flesh comprise the nose of this bottling. Classic Cali Chard buttery notes lead the sip, with ripe stonefruit, sea salt, caramel and jasmine, uplited by a decent acidity.
title: Byington 2014 Wrights Station Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Creamy vanilla and pear pie provide a fleshy and full-bodied texture to this wine, which leans tropical in guava and melon. Aged in entirely neutral oak, the fruit shows well within a wave of ripeness.
title: Sanglier Cellars 2014 River Tusque Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Warm and clean seared-apple notes greet the nose on this bottling, with white peach, apple blossom and concrete aromas. The palate is complex, with lemon-skin and herbal lemon-verbena flavors, bound together in tight acidity.
title: La Merika 2014 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Citrus and green apple flavors give this dry and nicely tangy wine a versatile, tasty character that turns richer with each sip. It has excellent balance between crisp fruit and a generous texture.
title: Heron 2014 Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Gorgeously perfumed in a bouquet of floral goodness, this wine then takes on more barrel influence on the palate with sizable caramel, toffee and vanilla spikes. It becomes more full-bodied and heavy on the palate.
title: Artesa 2013 Limited Release Chardonnay (Carneros-Napa Valley)

description: Steely lemon and low oak star in this unfussy wine, which remains light bodied in spirit despite a rich finish of marshmallow and vanilla.
title: JAQK Cellars 2013 High Roller Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Lean and rich at the same time, this wine offers a brightness of citrus and pear at the entry. The midpalate becomes heavier in oak and ripe in tropical flavor.
title: Saddleback 2014 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A flinty smoke aroma greets the nose first on this well-priced bottling from the Jackson family, with roasted Marcona almond, toasted brioche and seared lemon also showing. A bright energy bolsters the palate, where Meyer lemon ripeness gains pencil shavings and chipped oak flavors in the midpalate.
title: Cambria 2014 Benchbreak Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Light, appley aromas and lively apple and citrus flavors brighten this unoaky wine. It has refreshing acidity, an elegant texture and crisp finish.
title: Peltier 2014 Hybrid Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Grapefruit, pear and vanilla mark this medium-bodied, moderately dense and youthful wine that also offers peeks of caramel and toffee midpalate. The weight and length give way to a zesty, pithy finish.
title: Cambridge California 2014 CCR Single Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This closed, youthful wine is wrapped up in the ripeness and grippy nature of the vintage. It has a tropical edge to the fruit, a mix of pineapple and guava supported by juicy peach that finishes full bodied and lush on the palate.
title: Corner 103 2013 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Though this bottling saw no malolactic fermentation or oak, the aromas are well rounded, with smoked lemon and kiwi notes. The palate offers lemon curd and apple-sauce flavors, with hints of smokiness, even without the oak.
title: Clos La Chance 2014 Pure Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Spicy in a complexity of ginger and vanilla-kissed oak, this wine is made from 15-year-old Wente selection vines. Layered in lemon, lime and green apple, it features a slab of tropical pineapple on the finish. Buttery dishes will pair well.
title: Kunde 2014 Wildwood Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Coming in a bottle adorned with an informational treasure map of the region, this wine conveys bubble gum, honeysuckle and Pink Lady apples on the nose. A similar apple character shows on the palate, along with riper grapefruit notes, Anjou pear slices and graphite. The apples get more sour as the sip lingers.
title: Inconceivable 2014 Queen of Tides Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: The chef returns to wine in this blend of mostly Chardonnay with 4% Viognier. A smooth, round and ripely agreeable quaff, it's thick in oak with a taste of vanilla.
title: Tyler Florence 2014 Blending Sessions Blend No. 3 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Named after the matriarch of the Riboli wine family, who founded what may be the first tasting room in California, this shows light yellow fruits on the nose. The palate combines lemon and apple with a slight hue of brown spice, offering plump fruit with a tang.
title: Maddalena 2013 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: The winemaker aged a majority of this wine on the lees in new French oak, and the rest in stainless steel. This combination is easygoing and very fruity in aroma and flavor. The body is medium while the texture is soft and agreeable.
title: Michael David 2014 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: From estate-grown grapes, this is a fulsome, generously expansive wine, rich in honeyed vanilla, caramel and toffee, and intense in oak. Peach and hazelnut figure into the mix, as does a taste of nutmeg, making for a warm, lengthy finish.
title: Chalk Hill 2013 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)

description: Caramelized pear, candied lemon, honeydew melon and a touch of vanilla show on the nose of this rich take on the grape. The palate starts light, with a decent buzz of acidity, before settling into tropical flavors of dried pear and fruit-flavored bubblegum.
title: Consilience 2014 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Closed and youthful, this wine is medium in build and subtle in oak. It conveys a briny streak throughout the palate, and a distinct taste of candied lemon.
title: Previous 2013 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Browned butter, roasted almonds and walnuts, kumquat cream and iodine show on the nose of this oxidative style from Bill Foley's large portfolio. The palate is rich with toasty brioche and peanut-butter notes.
title: Foley 2013 Bar Lazy S Ranch Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Fleshy and full-figured, this wine is made in a big, expansive style. It's rounded in vanillin oak and a bite of honeycomb, with lighter accompaniments of mango and pear.
title: Lawer 2014 Cannon Block Estate Grown Chardonnay (Knights Valley)

description: Thick, rich and ripe in vanilla, the American oak in this wine is pronounced and intense, wrapping itself around notes of candied apple and toffee-caramel.
title: Roche 2013 Barrel Select American Oak Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A darker shade of yellow, this wine shows poached apple, orange peel and slight roasted-nut aromas on the clean nose. The palate is medium bodied, touching on flavors of almond oil, preserved lemons, chamomile tea and coconut.
title: EOS 2013 Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This wine shows wet cement, lime rinds, light honeysuckle and fragrant minerality on the nose. The texture is solidly grippy and intriguing once sipped, with flavors of yellow grapefruit pith and Gala apples in the midpalate, sliding into a lime-rind tang on the finish.
title: La Crema 2013 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Quite grassy in aromas for a Chardonnay, this wine shows lemongrass, fennel, Gala apple and light honeydew melon on the nose. The palate is light and tight, with flavors of grapefruit and apples.
title: Castoro Cellars 2014 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Lemon and Key lime star on the nose in this wine, alongside aromas of tropical pineapple. A voluptuous, creamy vanilla crème brûlée suggests itself on the palate, threatening to become over the top before the wine finishes lean.
title: Michael Pozzan 2013 Annabella Special Selection Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is not a showy wine, but the sense of reserve, good acidity, fresh flavors and good balance form an enjoyable picture that will be versatile with food.
title: Ironstone 2013 Reserve Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sierra Foothills)

description: Reserved aromas of lemon zest, shaved butter and wet stone greet the nose on this ready-to-drink bottling from West Paso. The palate shows poached apple and cooked pear tones, with a slightly sour tang keeping it lively.
title: Midnight 2014 Estate Chardonnay (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

description: This has value written all over it, offering fleshy, ripe tropical aromas and flavors. The personality is large and in charge, yet the wine itself remains reasonably balanced and firm in structure.
title: Broken Clouds 2014 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This white is a mix of tropical pineapple, tangerine and marshmallow, offering a creamy, doughy and yeasty texture on the palate. Chalky, it is medium bodied with a hint of richness, finishing more steely than stuffy.
title: Myka 2014 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A rich, thick and oaky 100% varietal, this comes from the Green Valley area, and possesses power and flavor in abundance. Baked apple and pear dance around lighter remembrances of lemon soufflé, finishing in a touch of ginger and nutmeg.
title: Migration 2013 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The barrel speaks loudly here, fortressing deep, full-bodied layers of vanilla, tropical guava and pineapple. Creamy and textured, it finishes in more vanilla.
title: Orogeny 2013 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Ripe butterscotch and a notable flank of big vanilla and oak greet the entry of this vineyard-designate. It makes for a luxurious wine reflective of a warm vintage and approach.
title: Keller 2013 La Cruz Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: A dense vanilla-bean character coats a nose of seared white peach and toasted nuts. The palate features thick, ripe fruits, preserved lemon, a touch of walnut and a rocky grip.
title: Inception 2013 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This stainless bottling shows fresh-squeezed lemons, yellow melon and canned pear on the fresh, clean and not overly tropical nose. The palate is smooth and plush down the middle, but sharply tight on the edges, with flavors of pear, lime and apple that prove a bit sour and tart toward the finish.
title: Bernardus 2014 Precis Unoaked Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Salted grapefruit skins, browned butter and a toasted-nut element arise on the nose of this wine from a vineyard near the tiny Salinas Valley town of San Ardo. It offers acidic energy and tight minerality on the palate, with ripe aromatic apples showing midway through the sip.
title: Paris Valley Road 2013 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Tahitian vanilla and white flowers mark the opening bouquet of this wine, followed by rich, full-bodied flavors of apple tart, pear and caramelized minerality. A tart, ripe finish caps things off.
title: Clos du Bois 2013 Calcaire Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Fruity, buttery aromas are followed by a generously fruit-filled flavor, smooth texture and buttery aftertaste. It's a well-balanced and well-rounded wine of medium body, and has a tasty finish.
title: Cartlidge & Browne 2013 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: Given time to ferment and age in a majority of neutral oak, this wine still offers thickness and viscosity. It's rich and lush in tropical pineapple, mango and sliced peach, buoyed by acidity and a focused approach.
title: Pride Mountain 2013 Vintner Select Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Dark golden in color, this wine was given a small amount of skin contact prior to fermentation and then 11 months in a small percentage of new French oak. The aromatics are muted and a tad austere, with a subtle hint of white flowers and Meyer lemon. It finishes dry in a coat of oak.
title: Kuleto Estate 2012 Estate Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Sunny aromas of golden pear, caramelized red apples and toasted oak arise on the nose of this bottling from a winery near Morgan Hill. Dried grapefruits, smoked green apples and a jasmine-extract character show on the ripe palate.
title: Clos La Chance 2013 Murphy's Choice Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This clonal study leans into a quite tropical area, blending aromas of honeysuckle and other white flowers with guava fruit. There is good energy on the palate, with a sour apple-cider character midway, dried pears throughout, stony minerality and a bitter aftertaste.
title: Lafond 2013 Lafond Vineyard Musqué Clone Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: With a large dose of Russian River Valley grapes, this delirious and delicious white is dark gold in color, medium to almost full bodied, with a richness overridden by bright floral notes of apple blossom and pear. It finishes in a flurry of oak and vanilla, and was aged in new and used French and American oak.
title: Chloe 2013 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Apple custard, green apple peels and a bit of barrel warmth entertain the nose on this reasonably priced wine from a highly reliable appellation. Flavors are straightforward, with ripe golden pears and lemon peels.
title: J Wilkes 2013 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This dry wine has a nice sense of reserve along with subtle lemony, earthy and milky flavors that linger on the finish. The texture has a nip of acidity and the body is light to medium.
title: Senses 2013 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Medium bodied, this wine offers softened tannins that are appealing on the palate. The co-mingling of pear, lemon, lime and oak will work well on the table. Restrained and approachable, it's well made and easy to like.
title: Franciscan 2013 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Ripe fruit flavors advance from apple to pear to honey as you sniff and sip this wine. It tastes clean and fruity, with a medium body and a smooth texture that allows the fruitiness to linger on the finish.
title: Cosentino 2013 The Chard Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Ripe but rather light aromas of pear cider, honeydew melon and cherimoya make for an approachable, familiar nose on this appellation blend wine. Lots of soft nectarine and melon elements define the palate, with a pinch of sweet herbs, proving light, pleasant and playful.
title: Bargetto 2013 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Generous and very flavorful, this full-bodied wine resembles honey and pear in the aroma, and pear syrup in the flavor. While sweet-seeming, it has a dash of apple-like acidity to keep it lively.
title: McManis 2014 Chardonnay (River Junction)

description: Creamy vanilla complements a medium use of oak in this weighty, tropical wine, given to pineapple, peach and Meyer lemon flavor. Straightforward, inexpensive and intended to be a crowd pleaser, it hits those marks, finishing ripe and layered.
title: Cannonball 2013 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A well-crafted wine made in relatively large quantity, this has a tropical edge, sidelining stone fruit and apple. It also offers a lightness of pear skin, atop light, ripe layers of vanilla and oak. The finish puts memorable touches to a generous, expressive palate.
title: Olema 2013 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This vineyard-designate has a richness of baked and dried fruit on the nose and palate, making it reminiscent of an apple and almond tart, laced in honey. The minerality and bite of ripe apple keep it grounded and complete, finishing with a touch of oak.
title: Kunde 2013 C.S. Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: This is a pretty taut wine that combines a rich style with good, vibrant acidity. Yet it is described as 100% fermented in stainless steel rather than oak barrels. The aromas resemble toasted baguette, butter and toasted walnut, while the flavors are like ripe apple and almonds.
title: Chatom Vineyards 2013 Chardonnay (Calaveras County)

description: Sizzling in high-toned citrus and a helping of freshly squeezed pineapple, this wine combines delicate floral aromas and refreshment with a more weighty complexity of caramelized oak, finding a sense of leanness on the finish.
title: Pezzi King 2013 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: From a variety of coastal vineyard locations, this wine, an inaugural offering from the producer, opens in zesty lemon and tangerine, before developing into a fuller-bodied, unctuous experience on the palate. It offers tamped-down acidity and briny back note on the finish.
title: The Forager 2013 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: There's the slightest touch of oxidation on the nose of this wine, with aromas of roasted walnut and seared lemons. The palate is quite interesting, with lemon oil, hints of toasted nuts and a faint marshmallow element on the finish.
title: Dark Earth 2012 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Honeysuckle and Good & Plenty combine on the entry of this fruity, floral wine, full-bodied and intriguing on the palate in ripe apple and vanilla. A funkiness on the finish gives it an earthy ending.
title: Mazzocco 2013 Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Oaky on the nose, this is a lean, crisp wine on the palate, straightforward and balanced in its combination of green apple, pear and Meyer lemon characteristics. Medium bodied, it'll work wonders with midweek meals.
title: Kenwood 2013 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Roasted apples, toasted peanuts and just a touch of buttercream combine for an inviting nose on this wine from the Terravant facility in Buellton. Oak is quite noticeable on the palate, where flavors of buttered toast, white peach jam, orange marmalade and marzipan shine.
title: Fire and Oak 2012 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Ripe aromas of apple flesh and apple blossoms trend toward guava on the nose of this wine from the legendary California family. There is a chalk-driven energy on the palate, though ripe fruits are prominent, with more apples and guava as well as steamed peaches.
title: Hearst Ranch 2013 Glacier Ridge Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: A vivid gold color and spice-rack aromas like nutmeg and cardamom add a different twist to this medium-bodied and rather rich-textured wine. Those are probably characteristics from aging with oak, and they enhance the clean, fresh fruit flavors in a good way.
title: Table No. 7 2012 Winemaker's Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: A mineral layering of waxy pear gives this wine a light, crisp complexion, punctuated by subtle, oaky spice and plenty of vibrant lemon. Light on the palate, it'll serve well for larger gatherings.
title: Arrowood 2013 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Intensely concentrated, this wine offers minerally petrol and hazelnut, particularly on the nose. A salinity marks it on the medium-bodied palate, giving it an intriguing edge before finishing in a squeeze of lemon.
title: Hawley 2013 Hoot Owl Creek Vineyard Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Slightly sour and funky in earth, this is a restrained white aged in a majority of stainless steel, in addition to smaller percentages of oak and acacia. Crisp and minerally, marked by stone fruit as well as citrus, it finishes rich in caramel and vanilla.
title: Prime 2013 Chardonnay (Coombsville)

description: A heavy bottle holds a wine that's dark gold in color and exuberant in lemon curd and vanilla. Surprisingly light on the palate, given the color, it has a relatively low oak presence and layered, caramel-apple finish.
title: Nicholson Ranch 2012 Cuvée Natalie Estate Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
