description: A nice Chardonnay to drink now, with rich tropical fruit, apple and pear flavors, enhanced with vanilla and smoky oak. One of the more successful Silverado Chardonnays of recent years.
title: Silverado 2009 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Sweet in jammy apricot and tangerine fruit, with lots of sweet caramel, honey and buttered toast flavors from oak, this Chardonnay is a good example of the modern style of ripeness.
title: Calera 2010 Thirty-Fifth Anniversary Chardonnay (Mt. Harlan)

description: Lots of richness in this Chardonnay. Will appeal to anyone who likes the modern California style of ripe tropical fruit, buttered toast and honey flavors. Brisk acidity gives it a balanced brightness.
title: Navarro 2009 Premiere Reserve Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: Chard fans will exult in this spicy wine. It packs a potent punch of pineapples, apricots, tangerines and honey, and is nicely balanced with crisp acidity.
title: Parkers Estate 2010 Blue Ash Road Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Tremendously rich in tangerine flavors, brightened with crisp citrus acidity, this is a Chardonnay to drink as an afternoon cocktail, with savory little appetizers. It's not complicated, but it sure is easy to like.
title: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2010 Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

description: Tight acidity and minerality mark this bone-dry Chardonnay. It's stubborn now, offering hints of tangerines, apricots and limes, with lots of new oak and leesy cream and vanilla. Give it a few hours in a decanter.
title: Moone-Tsai 2009 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Dry and acidic. If you're looking for a rich, opulent Chardonnay, go elsewhere. This one's citrusy and minerally, in the manner of an elegant Chablis. It offers a useful alternative to the modern, ultraripe, oaky style.
title: Holman Ranch 2010 Estate Chardonnay (Carmel Valley)

description: Flirts with being overoaked, with a flood of buttered toast, vanilla and butterscotch notes that dominate. After that some powerful flavors of Asian pears, tangerines and pineapples kick in, brightened with acidity. Drink it now.
title: Dutton Estate 2009 Kyndall's Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Dry and crisp, with a fine, clean minerality, this Chardonnay is dominated by the vanilla and toast of oak. The underlying wine shows pineapple, Asian pear and lime flavors. It's elegant, but a little thin.
title: Sonoma-Cutrer 2007 Les Pierres Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This inexpensive Chardonnay has a fair amount of oaky depth to it, unexpectedly since only 5% of it was aged in American oak, the rest in stainless steel. Nonetheless it has toasty vanilla flavors and aromas of lime, apple and cantaloupe and tastes refreshing and clean.
title: Parducci 2009 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: A rich, ripe, oaky style of Chardonnay. Explosive in pineapple, tangerine, lemon and apricot jam flavors with buttered toast and honey. It's almost as sweet as a dessert wine.
title: Sea Mist 2010 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Extravagantly rich and oaky, this Chardonnay detonates on the palate with pineapple, lemon and orange jam, buttered toast and vanilla cream flavors. Finishes honey sweet, but a nice edge of acidity provides needed balance.
title: Gary Farrell 2009 Westside Farms Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: With savory acidity and a nice, dry finish, this three-year-old Chardonnay tastes as fresh and rich as a brand-new release. It has pineapple, tangerine, lemon, lime and apricot flavors, enhanced with the vanilla and buttered toast of oak. Drink now for sheer opulence.
title: Gary Farrell 2008 Starr Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Made in the modern California style, new oak dominates this Chardonnay. Even though unused French barrels accounts for only 30% of the blend, the aromas and flavors of buttered toast, vanilla and caramel swamp what otherwise seems like a good, crisp, tropically fruited wine. Earns an extra point for fine minerality, the result of its pedigreed vineyard originis.
title: De Loach 2009 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine doesn't offer a lot aromatically at first but opens nicely to lemon, lime and vanilla flavors. The moderately priced, moderate in alcohol Chardonnay is bright and clean overall and a very good value.
title: Cartlidge & Browne 2009 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: A touch of oak adds smoky vanilla and toast to this Chardonnay, but what stars is the fruit. Pineapples, limes, green apples and kiwis blast through to a spicy finish, brightened by crisp acidity.
title: Kenwood 2010 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Showing the tight tannins and minerality of this mountain appellation, this Chardonnay also displays concentrated pineapple and tangerine fruit flavors. Oak adds buttered toast and caramel sweetness. Seems best now, so drink up.
title: Keenan 2009 Chardonnay (Spring Mountain District)

description: It's just two years old, but this Chardonnay already is losing fruit, turning nutty and herbal and dry. There still are traces of oranges and pineapples, but they won't last much longer. Drink up.
title: Ghostwriter 2009 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: A first release from this well-regarded vineyard, owned by the Millers of Bien Nacido. The wine is very rich and oaky, with 50% new French wood on top of sautéed bananas and pineapples. A little heavy handed.
title: Solomon Hills 2008 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: A dry, tannic Chardonnay, with pineapple, herb, vanilla and oak flavors and a good hit of acidity. Fine to drink now with grilled tuna.
title: Schug 2009 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Your basic Chardonnay, albeit quite a good one. Fine and dry, with a cream mouthfeel housing citrus, tropical fruit and spice flavors. A good buy for the quality.
title: Au Bon Climat 2009 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Shows the zestiness and long hangtime flavors of Monterey Chardonnay, with strong pineapple, lime, kiwi and white peach fruit. Turns honey-sweet in the finish, but basically dry, and saved by a scour of acidity.
title: Ahlgren 2009 Ventana Vineyards Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Oak gives this wine buttered toast richness, while crisp Central Coast acidity makes it bright and clean. The flavors are pure Edna Valley Chardonnay, of limes, kiwi fruits, tangerines and minerals. Flashy and exotic, if a little direct.
title: Tolosa 2009 Edna Ranch Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Dryness and acidity characterize this Chardonnay, as well as the superripe apricot fruit that marks this chilly vineyard, in the coolest part of the Highlands. It's a brittle wine, enriched with caramelized oak. If you age it, expect the fruit to drop out rapidly.
title: Cinnabar 2008 Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Bright acidity gives the tangerine and citron flavors of this Chardonnay a bite. It's very dry, clean and minerally, and finishes with a mouthwatering scour.
title: Schug 2009 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Lots of tangy acidity in this Chard, and tannins too. It has a grainy, stubborn mouthfeel. Shows plenty of pineapple, orange, apricot and lime flavors, with sweet oak essence, but cant quite overcome that resistant tug. Drink now.
title: 32 Winds 2008 Monument Tree Vineyard Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: A fine, elegant Chardonnay for drinking now. It has rich, honeyed layers of buttercream, citrus and tropical fruits and spices, brightened with crisp acidity.
title: Babcock 2009 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Lots to like in this rich, creamy Chardonnay. It has very ripe flavors of oranges, green apples and pineapples, with a touch of oak and some firm minerality. Zesty acidity provides balance.
title: Robert Hall 2010 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Ripe and full-bodied in pineapple, lemon, pear and green apple flavors, this Chardonnay also shows a good coating of oak, as well as a blast of acidity. It's not terribly complicated, but clean and brisk, and the price isn't bad.
title: Handley 2009 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: Rich and sweet in pineapples, limes, kiwi fruit, honey and caramelized oak, but bracing acidity and a firm minerality prevent it from being a mere fruit bomb. Drink now.
title: Francis Ford Coppola 2009 Director's Cut Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Modest, with citrus, spice and tobacco flavors, but nicely dry and crisp in acidity. You'll find tantalizing flavors of oranges, bananas, green melons and figs. A polished wine to drink now.
title: Handley 2008 Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: If you know Chardonnays from the Edna Valley, on California's Central Coast, this tastes like one. It's bright in acidity and forward in jammy lime, kiwi and vanilla fruit, with a stony minerality. It's a pretty wine to drink now.
title: El Roy 2009 Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Lots of tropical fruit, pear, peach, green apple, vanilla, honey and creamy flavors in this Chardonnay. Also lots of zesty acidity, which brightens the flavors and makes the wine finish clean. Drink it now.
title: Shiloh Road 2009 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Delicious and sweet in caramel, vanilla, pineapple jam, tangerine, lime and butterscotch flavors, this dramatic Chardonnay is made to drink now.
title: Paradise Ridge 2009 Nagasawa Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Similar to the 2006 vintage, this '09 is rather sweet and candied in new oaky vanilla, buttered toast, honey and caramel flavors. Underneath is plenty of ripe citrus and tropical fruit. The sweetness detracts from what otherwise is a fine, crisp, minerally wine.
title: Freeman 2009 Ryo-Fu Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a rich, oaky Chardonnay, filled with upfront flavors of tropical fruits, buttercream, vanilla and toast. It's made in the modern, appealing style to drink now.
title: Michael Bernard 2009 Orsi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A rich wine, flamboyant and generous, but there's too much oak. It reeks of butterscotch, caramel, crème brûlée and vanilla flavors. Underneath all that is fine good pineapple and pear fruit.
title: Robledo 2008 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: Rich and showy, but a little too strong in everything, showing flamboyant tropical fruit, caramelized oak, butterscotch and sweet vanilla cream flavors. It's all quite delicious, but the wine ultimately lacks subtlety and distinction, especially at this price.
title: Hestan 2008 Chardonnay (San Francisco Bay)

description: Deliciously ripe and forward in pineapple, tangerine and peach flavors, this Chardonnay also has winemaker elaborations of buttered toast and sweet, smoky oak. It's made in the popular style, rich, honeyed and flamboyant.
title: Expression 38 2009 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Lots of sweet, smoky oak on this wine, with flavors of pineapples, peaches, limes, vanilla and honey. It's balanced with crisp acidity. Drink now.
title: Sanford 2009 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: A rich, oaky Chardonnay, overwhelming in buttered toast, caramel, pineapple jam, crème brûlée and cinnamon spice flavors. If you're looking for a big, strong Chardonnnay, it's for you.
title: Talbott 2009 Kali Hart Estate Grown Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Rich and fruity, with tons of pineapple, mango, lime, peach, pear, nectarine and honey flavors. Lots of sweet smoky oak, too. Not particularly complex, but flashy. Drink now.
title: Pride Mountain 2009 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Total California style here, a rich, sweet, honeyed Chardonnay marked by tiers of pineapples, mangos, pears and limes. It's all flash and dazzle for drinking now.
title: Rutz 2009 Maison Grand Cru Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A good, rich Chardonnay, showing fine acidity and plenty of ripe pineapple, Asian pear, lime and green apple flavors, with a rich coating of sweet, caramelized oak.
title: Davis Bynum 2008 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Here's a big, rich, ripe and oaky Chardonnay that will appeal to fans of sheer power. It's potent in pineapple jam and vanilla caramel flavors, with bright acidity. Impressive, but could use greater subtlety and complexity.
title: Morgan 2009 Double L Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: With no oak added, this wine offers only itself. It's ripe and fruity in pineapples, limes and tangerines, with crisp Edna Valley acidity. Likeable for its clean, brisk profile.
title: Tolosa 2009 No Oak Estate Edna Ranch Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: A clean, crisp Chardonnay, rich in pineapple, green apple, peach and mineral flavors. Shows some real elegance, with its acidity and dry, Chablis-style finish.
title: Shipwreck 2008 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Ripe, rich and oaky, made in the California style you either like or don't. It's an opulent wine brimming with pineapple jam, buttered toast and vanilla flavors, balanced with crisp acidity.
title: Sebastiani 2008 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Takes the rich, oaky style of Chardonnay and finesses it right down the middle, with balancing minerality and a blast of acidity. The flavors are of apricots and tangerines.
title: Work 2008 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Rich but over-worked, with a heavy application of oak, giving dominating aromas and flavors of caramel, buttered toast and vanilla. Underneath is a crisp Chardonnay with pineapple, Asian pear and green apple fruit. Drink now.
title: De Loach 2008 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Bright, brisk acidity saves the day with this Chardonnay, giving it a zesty crunch and making the pineapple, orange and oak flavors, which are pretty sweet, taste drier than they really are. An easy-drinking Chard at a fair price.
title: Cameron Hughes 2009 Lot 238 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: With brisk Edna Valley acidity and intensely pure Chardonnay fruit flavors of tangerines, limes and sweet Meyer lemon sour candy, this is a pleasant sipper with roasted or grilled salmon, or a barbecue chicken or pork skewer with pineapples, green peppers and onions.
title: Center of Effort 2008 Effort Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Grown in the cooler western part of San Luis Obispo, outside the Paso Robles line, this Chardonnay has good acidity. It's rich in Key lime pie, tangerine jam and maple syrup flavors. A little sweet, but easy to drink.
title: Calcareous 2009 Chardonnay (York Mountain)

description: Lots of crunchy acidity in this Chardonnay, and smoky oak too, with buttered toast and pineapple jam flavors. Tastes rich, clean, fine and opulent, in the California style. fine and opulent, in the California style.
title: Roth 2009 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Made in the modern way of very ripe fruit and lots of oak, this Chardonnay certainly delivers plenty of pineapple jam, tangerine, Meyer lemon tart, vanilla and buttered toast flavors. It's fortunately balanced with crisp acidity. Designed for the Chard crowd that likes this popular style.
title: Wrath 2008 San Saba Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Loads of pineapple jam and roasted peach flavors in this rich, oaky Chardonnay. Nothing shy about its fruity power, with rich vanilla and caramel oak barrel influences. Could use greater complexity and nuance.
title: Venge 2009 Maldonado Vineyard Dijon Clones Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Strong in fruit and powerful in oak, made in the popular California style. Impresses with pineapple jam, buttered popcorn and vanilla flavors, in a creamy texture. Needs greater complexity and nuance.
title: Koehler 2009 Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Shows the Farrell mark of elegance, with balanced ripeness and acidity. Bigtime flavors of pineapples and tangerines mingle with caramelized oak, with additional buttered toast and vanilla richness. A crowd-pleasing Chardonnay that shouldn't be consumed too cold.
title: Gary Farrell 2008 Russian River Selection Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Hard to say just why this Chard isn't better. It's nicely dry, with decent acidity, good oak and a mineral background to the citrus and peach flavors. There's just a heaviness that keeps the wine from getting airborne.
title: Clos du Val 2008 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Made in the popular style, with loads of sweet, smoky oak that dominate everything. Shows buttered toast and vanilla flavors plastered over the perfectly pleasant pineapples, lemons and minerals.
title: Novy 2009 Keefer Ranch Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: Soft and creamy, with flavors of buttered toast, pineapple marmalade and candy corn. Made in the ripe, oaky, drink-me-now modern style.
title: Robert Mondavi 2008 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A vibrantly acidic, fresh young Chardonnay, clean and oaky, with sweet, candied flavors of tangerines, vanilla, minerals and buttered toast. Could be a little more complex and challenging. Let it breathe for a while.
title: Bartz-Allen 2009 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: New oak provides rich vanilla and buttered toast flavors to this Chardonnay, which comes from Markham's vineyard in the Oak Knoll District. The wine is brisk in acidity, with citrus fruit and papaya flavors.
title: Markham 2009 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Tight and dry, with mineral-laden citrus fruit flavors enriched with oak and creamy lees. This is an elegantly constructed Chardonnay marked by crisp sleekness, and is showing its best now.
title: Thomas Fogarty 2007 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Plenty of flavor in this unoaked Chardonnay, which the winery says comes from an Oakville vineyard. It's packed with pineapples and lemondrop candy, with fine acidity and a touch of mineral.
title: SKN 2009 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is an appealing Chardonnay. It's a little sweet in apricot jam, peach, green apple, honey and buttered toast flavors, but the sweetness is balanced with crisp, citrusy acidity and a nice cut of minerality.
title: Grove Street 2009 Dijon Clone Block Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: A brisk, bright Chardonnay, made in the Testarossa style of ripe fruit and oakiness. What it lacks in subtlety it makes up for in the sheer power of tangerine, pineapple and tropical fruit flavors, elaborated with vanilla cream and caramelized oak.
title: Testarossa 2009 Cuvee Katelyn Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Shows classic Edna Valley character in the vibrant acidity, dryness and steely minerals that back up the Meyer lemon, lime and pineapple flavors. It's a finely elegant Chardonnay for drinking now.
title: Ortman Family 2008 Firepeak Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: A little sweet in pineapple and orange jam flavor, but nicely acidic, which gives the wine a clean, tart mouthfeel that balances the fruit. Enjoyable as a cocktail sipper, or with fresh cracked crab.
title: Frostwatch 2008 Chardonnay (Bennett Valley)

description: Brisk in acids, with lush, long hangtime lemon, kiwi, tangerine and vanilla flavors. It's all upfront in this drily delicious Chardonnay.
title: Manzoni 2008 Lucia Highland Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Dry, creamy and crisp, with pleasant citrus, tropical fruit and oak flavors, this Chardonnay shows a lot of upscale character at a price under $20. Easy to find, with 200,000 cases produced.
title: Simi 2009 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Made in the ripely fruity, jammy, oaky style, this wine is almost over the top in pineapple tart, lemon meringue pie, vanilla cream, butterscotch and buttered toast flavors that approach popcorn. It will appeal to those who like these huge, powerful Chardonnays.
title: Ministry of the Vinterior 2009 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Made in a dry, lean style, this Chard has plenty of elegance. It has citrus, pear and mineral flavors, with a touch of oak and bright, brisk, coastal acidity.
title: Lincourt 2008 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Good price for a dry, crisp and flavor Chardonnay with some real fancy character. Flatters the palate with opulent pineapple jam, pear, lemon and orange fruit flavors, finished with rich oak.
title: Liberty School 2008 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Here's an oaky, ripe Chardonnay for those who like these strong, direct hits. It's powerful in tropical fruit, citrus, pear and green apple flavors, with a creamy overlay of buttery oak. Drink now.
title: Girard 2009 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A big, lush Chardonnay from the Wente family's Ernest Wente Vineyard, this is barrel fermented and aged on lees for a long 18 months in new American and French oak. A successful layering of ripe apples, a tinge of pineapple and hearty bread with tons of texture and length made in an opulent California style.
title: Steven Kent 2007 Merrillie, EWV Block 32220 Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Rich as can be, but oak dominates, giving the wine buttered toast and caramelized vanilla flavors, and you'll even find notes of buttered popcorn. Although there's lovely pineapple and citron fruit and fine Carneros acidity, this Chardonnay tastes overly manipulated.
title: Patz & Hall 2008 Hudson Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Drink this with very rich foods, such as shellfish in a buttery cream sauce. It's a big, oaky, caramelly wine, with ripe pineapples beneath the oak. A little soft, but smooth and silky. An elegant Chardonnay for drinking now.
title: Lafond 2008 SRH Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A little obvious in its appeal to our liking for oak and ripe fruit. Who can criticize the pineapples, citrons, tangerines and green apples, with their overlay of caramel and buttered toast? Rich as it is, you find yourself wishing it were more subtle and nuanced. Drink now.
title: Patz & Hall 2008 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Oak overpowers this wine, dominating with buttered toast and caramel flavors. Underneath is pineapple and peach fruit and zesty acidity. It would be nice to have the winemaker back off on the barrels and emphasize the underlying wine.
title: La Feníªtre 2008 Los Alamos Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Packs plenty of punch into an inexpensive, everyday Chardonnay. With brisk, tangy acidity, it offers rich, appealing flavors of pineapples, green apples, vanilla and sweet, creamy butter.
title: Q 2009 Discovery Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A solid Chardonnay, dry, oaky and rich, with nice, crisp acidity. Satisfies for its creamy wealth of pinapples, limes, pears and minerals.
title: Foppiano 2009 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A good, everyday Chard. It's sweet in caramelly oak, vanilla, buttered toast, pineapple jam and butterscotch flavors, with just in time acidity to make it finish clean and brisk.
title: Frog's Leap 2009 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This rich, oaky Chardonnay has aromas and flavors of buttered toast, buttered popcorn, vanilla and pineapple jam. It's very rich and creamy, and appeals for sheer deliciouness.
title: Perception 2008 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: An exotic, dry and crisp Chardonnay, with plenty of toasty oak. Shows a mélange of dried orange, pineapple and pear fruit, with a minerally note. There's a feral quality that may be the result of native yeasts. Drink now.
title: Old World 2008 Tweek Block Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: A delicious Chardonnay made in the California style of ripeness. It's fortunately balanced with acidity, which balances the sweet pineapple and honey flavors, but needs to be a bit drier.
title: Carneros Highway 2009 Nueva Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is a big, rich, oaky Chardonnay. It's a little heavy with all that caramel and buttered toast, but acidity brightens the pineapple and peach flavors, and the finish is clean and spicy.
title: Arrowood 2007 Réserve Spéciale Unfined Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Very ripe in fruit, with good acidity and lots of smoky oak. Made in the jammy style of California Chardonnay, it has sweet flavors of pineapples, papayas and buttered toast. Drink now as a cocktail, or try with a rich shellfish risotto.
title: Mueller 2007 LB Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Tart in acidity, this has strong flavors of caramelized oak, pineapple jam, green apples and buttered toast. It will satisfy your Chardonnay sweet tooth.
title: Martin Ray 2009 Herrick Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Finished with a little oak, this Chardonnay features buttered toast and vanilla flavors on top of the pineapple, tropical fruit and sweet honey notes. It's a nice, stylishly rich wine to drink now.
title: Hook & Ladder 2009 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: For the price, this is a good deal in a rich California Chardonnay from a major producer. The wine is dry and crisp, with rich flavors of citrus fruits, peaches, mangoes and honeysuckle, and the minerally edge that a Calera Chardonnay usually shows.
title: Calera 2009 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This is a good wine to drink if you want a modestly elegant Chardonnay to serve alongside food, instead of a big, oaky sweetie. It's dry and crisp and clean, with pleasantly rich flavors of citrus fruits, peaches, green apples, minerals and vanilla. Easy to find, with 17,000 cases produced.
title: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2009 Estate Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Here's a softly rich Chardonnay that shows lots of appeal at a pretty good price. It's honeyed in pineapple, nectarine, guava and vanilla cream flavors, with a pretty overlay of sweetly smoked oak.
title: Charles Krug 2009 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Clean and crisp in acidity, with a rich overlay of smoky, caramelized oak, this Chardonnay has appealing pineapple, peach and lime fruit flavors. There's a honey sweet finish, although the wine itself is totally dry. Good price for all this opulence.
title: EOS 2008 Reserve Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: This is a strong, direct Chardonnay that offers no subtlety, but impresses for sheer power. It dazzles with tangerine, pineapple and peach flavors, with plenty of new oak. Ready now.
title: Monticello Vineyards 2008 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

description: Defined by sheer richness and opulence, this oaky Chardonnay is meant to be opened now. It's rich and forward in pineapple and guava fruit, buttered toast, caramel and honey flavors.
title: Coquelicot 2008 Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: The aromas and tastes of oak dominate this Chardonnay, with buttered toast and sweet caramel riding high over the pineapple, mango and pear flavors. But crisp acidity provides needed balance, and there's a fine minerality that gives a tang of stone. A good price for a Chard this complicated.
title: Ventana 2008 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: A good Chardonnay, rich and creamy in pineapple, lime, Asian pear, vanilla and new oak flavors. It's balanced with crisp acidity. Drink now.
title: Husch 2009 Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Superrich, offering waves of pineapple, mango, buttered toast and vanilla flavors. The brilliantly crisp acidity of Edna Valley makes it all clean and brisk. Not much going on below the appealing surface, so drink now. Ahi tuna tartare comes to mind.
title: Courtney Benham 2009 Reserve Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Except for some excessive sweetness, this is a brilliant wine. It's bright and clean in acidity, offering pineapple, lime and golden mango flavors that go on and on into the spicy finish. No question how delicious it is, but could be a bit drier and firmer.
title: Kynsi 2008 Clone 76 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Lots of bright, fresh fruit in this jammy wine. Bursts with pineapples, nectarines, sweet lemon chiffon pie, green-apple jelly, buttered toast and honey vanilla, wrapped into a creamy texture. Production was 3,100 cases.
title: Martin Ray 2009 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Made in the modern California Chardonnay style you'll either love or hate. It's enormously extracted in pineapple tart, crème brûlée and honey-drizzled buttered toast flavors, and the acidity is bright and clean. The superrichness would benefit from greater control.
title: Sonoma-Loeb 2008 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Shows brilliantly crisp acidity giving a jammy brightness to the pineapple, lemon and lime fruit flavors, and the finish is totally dry. Not particularly complex, but an easy-drinking Chardonnay.
title: Casa de la Cruz 2009 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Fans of the ripe, modern style of Chardonnay will fall in love with this bottling. It's strong in toast, buttered popcorn, vanilla cream and peach, pear and pineapple jam flavors that dazzle and wow the palate. Easy to find, with nearly 17,000 cases produced.
title: Hess 2008 Suscol Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is a very rich, oaky Chardonnay, ripe and forward in the California style. Although it's dry, it's so fruity and honeyed, it's almost like a dessert wine. Swamps the palate with pineapple jam, buttered toast and vanilla cream flavors, which are nicely balanced with crisp acidity.
title: EOS 2008 Cupa Grandis Grand Barrel Reserve Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Very ripe and bright in lemon, lime, apricot, apple, pear, vanilla, buttered toast and honeysuckle flavors. The acidity is strong and bright. It's a good, rich Chardonnay despite needing more subtlety and complexity.
title: Paradise Ridge 2008 Nagasawa Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Even people who like lots of buttered toast and smoky vanilla in their Chards might find this one a little over the top. It's a good, rich wine, with lots of bright tropical fruit, but it would score higher if it were just a little less oaky.
title: Magness 2009 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A gigantically flavored wine, massive in pineapple, guava and apricot flavors, liberally accented with 65% new French oak. Although it's dry, it may even have a touch of botrytis, to judge from the honeyed concentration. Defines a particular style, but it doesn't seem to have a future, so drink up.
title: Firefly Night 2008 Split Rock Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Here's a rich Chardonnay notable for plenty of fruit, and also for brisk acidity. It's creamy smooth, with pineapple, Meyer lemon and lime flavors that are almost sweet in the finish, but pull back in favor of minerality.
title: Perbacco Cellars 2008 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: A nice Chardonnay that shows ripe pineapple, green apple and pear flavors, with added smoky richness from oak, and the finish is dry and crisp. A good price for a wine of this quality.
title: Lake Sonoma 2009 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The apricot and pear flavors are obviously very ripe, but they're balanced by brisk acidity, and a certain stong minerality you often find in Carneros Chardonnays. Oak plays its part. A bit obvious, but for the price, there's plenty of opulence.
title: RouteStock 2009 Route 121 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A very nice Chardonnay for fans of the ripe, oaky style, at a great price. It's rich in pineapple, cream and vanilla flavors, with zesty acidity and a honeyed finish.
title: Line 39 2009 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: The vineyard is on the Sonoma side of the Carneros. The wine is very dry and brisk in acidity, and its pineapple fruit flavors are grounded with minerals. Oak plays a subtle role. The winemaker calls it a premier cru Chablis-style wine, which is not a bad description, although it's only ageable for 2-3 years before it plunges downhill.
title: Gofessel 2009 Edina Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is one of the drier Chardonnays out there. You won't find that fat, opulent Alexander Valley tropical fruit, but something more akin to Chablis. The flavors are of minerals and dried herbs, with background notes of pineapples, pears and oak.
title: Biltmore Estate 2008 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: You won't miss the influence of oak barrels at all on this Chardonnay because it's so rich in fruit. Dazzles the mouth with waves of pineapples, golden mangoes, ripe limes and sweet pears, balanced with crisp acidity.
title: Valley of the Moon 2009 Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Made in the modern style of ripe fruit and elaborate oak, this rich, creamy Chardonnay features pineapple jam, peach pie and toasty vanilla flavors. It's a bit obvious, but lipsmackingly delicious.
title: Buena Vista 2007 Dijon Clones Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Very bright and acidic, with the savory taste of a sour lemondrop candy. If you're sensitive to acidity you'll find it tart. But it's deliciously layered, with tiers of buttered toast, vanilla and spice.
title: Brophy Clark 2008 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This is a good, sound, everyday Chardonnay. It's very dry and crisp in Central Coast acidity, with mineral-laded flavors of lemons, limes, apples and pineapples, touched with vanilla and buttered toast.
title: Carmel Road 2008 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Clean, brisk and balanced, with good varietal flavors of pineapples, limes, peaches and exotic tropical fruits, brightened with zesty acidity. This is a good price for a classic California Chardonnay.
title: Irony 2008 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Made in the popular style of ripe fruit, oak and soft creaminess. The pineapple jam, buttered popcorn and vanilla flavors are attractive, and brightened by crisp acidity.
title: Clos La Chance 2008 Liebler Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This is a good, dry Chardonnay, marked by brisk acidity and a steely minerality. The fruit veers toward pineapples and apricots, while oak adds notes of buttered toast and caramel. Feels like it wants to be richer than it is, but it's elegant.
title: Castello di Amorosa 2008 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Lean and minerally, this Chard offers lime and white peach flavors that finish bone dry and clean. It's not a rich wine, but it is very elegant, with a good scour of bracing acidity.
title: Rutherford Hill 2008 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Not very Chardonnay-like, more like a Viognier or Pinot Gris with its aromatic floral, tropical fruit, citrus, melon and spice aromas and flavors. Still, it's very tasty, and dry as well, with a crisp spine of minerally acidity.
title: Villa Andretti 2009 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Made in a food-friendly fashion, this Chard is dry, acidic and minerally. It was obviously picked at lower ripeness, but still shows a warm core of pineapples and green apples. Quite a nice wine for Chardonnay fans to drink with roasted chicken, fleshy fish, or even a white meat such as pork.
title: Baron Herzog 2008 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: A nicely drinkable Chardonnay marked by vigorous acidity and creamy-smooth flavors of pineapple tart, Key lime pie and lemongrass. Good as an inexpensive alternative to coastal bottlings that cost far more.
title: Chatom 2008 Chardonnay (Calaveras County)

description: Rich in oaky, fruity flavor, this wine satisfies with pineapples and other citrus fruits, buttered cinnamon toast and vanilla. It's pretty direct, but the price is right for a clean, crisp Chard made in the popular style.
title: Kenwood 2009 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Very tightly wound in high acidity and even some tannins, with austere, aloof citrus flavors. There's not a lot of appeal to this wine now, except a certain dry, yeasty elegance. It's like a sparkling blanc de blancs without the bubbles.
title: Ghostwriter 2008 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Made in the modern, ripe California stlyle, this Chardonnay offers immediately appealing flavors of pineapple jam, peach, lime, kiwi and vanilla oak. It's balanced with crisp acidity. Ready now for sheer richness.
title: Peter Paul Wines 2008 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Very rich and ripe, showing pineapple tart and oak-infused vanilla, meringue and buttered toast aromas and flavors. A bit lacking in structure, though, with a soft, melted mouthfeel. Could be firmer and crisper to balance all that decadence.
title: Tantara 2008 Talley Rincon Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: A very nice cocktail wine for its dryness and crispness. Although it's Chardonnay, it's not a big, rich wine, but a sleek, bone-dry one, with citrus and mineral flavors and strong acidity. A dash of Viognier adds an exotic, flowery note.
title: Francis Ford Coppola 2008 Black Label Pavilion Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: A very nice, super-drinkable Chardonnay marked by brisk, cool-climate acidity and a bracing minerality. The pineapple, peach and apple flavors have the slight herbality you often find in Napa Chardonnay.
title: Bouchaine 2008 Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa-Carneros)

description: Pretty oaky, with vanilla, buttered toast and charred wood aromas and tastes dominating. Under that are grilled pineapples and peaches, balanced with fine, tart acids. A little off around the edges, but a promising Chardonnay grown in this coastal L.A. climate.
title: Rosenthal-Malibu Estate 2008 Chardonnay (Malibu-Newton Canyon)

description: Rich, ripe and oaky, this pleasant Chard offers pineapple, kumquat, honeysuckle and buttered toast flavors, with bracing acidity.
title: Bernardus 2008 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Doesn't seem to have much, if any, oak on it, but it doesn't matter, because the underlying wine is so good, at such a nice price. Crisp and steely, it shows rich flavors of pineapples, apricots, tangerines and pears.
title: Lyeth 2008 L de Lyeth Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: The underlying wine is very good, showing brisk acidity, a cool-climate minerality and long hangtime, ripe flavors of pineapples, crisp green apples, mangoes and limes. Yet the oak is heavy-handed, overwhelming the fruit with caramel, and making the finish too sweet.
title: Heintz 2008 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Combines crisp, clean acidity, a bracing minerality and rich pineapple, peach and buttered toast flavors to produce a dry Chardonnay of great appeal. Defines the California style, in a classic, accessible way.
title: Sean Minor 2008 4 B Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: A good, rich Chardonnay, marked by pleasantly crisp acidity and a buttercreamy texture housing fruity flavors of pineapples, peaches, green apples and kiwi. Shows good Russian River character. Don't drink it too cold.
title: White Oak 2008 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: As the name suggests, this wine comes from a variety of different types of barrels and toast levels. It comes across as very oaky and buttery-popcorny, with a creamy texture housing pineapple marmalade flavors.
title: Cambria 2007 Oak Trial Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Shows the dryness, crisp acidity, flowers and minerality that often mark Carneros Chadonnays, which makes it elegant and sleek. With a touch of Meyer lemons and limes, it rises to richness.
title: Highway 12 2007 Carneros Highway Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: With no oak, there's nothing but bright, searing acidity and pure, intense flavors of limes and kiwis in this dry Chardonnay. There's an undertow of minerals, like the tang of cold steel. A very clean and pure expression of Edna Valley terroir.
title: Tolosa 2008 No Oak Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: No oak to interfere with the ripe, opulent flavors of pineapples, lemons, limes and tangerines, which are brightened and heightened by crisp acidity. The price is right on this balanced, savory Chardonnay.
title: Toad Hollow 2008 Francine's Selection Unoaked Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: Ripeness of fruit characterizes this Chardonnay. It brims with pineapple tart, green apple, vanilla, meringue, buttercream and cinnamon flavors, with a good cut of acidity.
title: Flora Springs 2008 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Pretty oaky, with a flood of caramel and buttered toast, and you have to wonder why they plastered so much barrel influence, because the underlying wine is pretty good. Buried under the wood is a dry, crisp Chardonnay with pineapple, pear, floral and mineral flavors. Give it a good decant and don't serve too cold.
title: Artesa 2008 Limited Release Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Enormously rich in pineapple jam, crème brûlée, buttercream, toast and cinnamon spice flavors, this wine's richness is balanced with crisp, citrusy acidity. It offers direct appeal now.
title: Barnett 2008 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A bit heavy on the oak, with vanilla, caramel and buttered toast aromas and flavors. But the pineapple and apple fruit is nice and ripe, and the finish is rich in spicy honey.
title: In Re 2008 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Shows the dry earthiness that often marks Carneros Chardonnay, with an herb and tobacco grounding to the riper pineapples and peaches. Oak, of course, adds sweet notes of vanilla and buttercream. There's also a cut of acidity.
title: Truchard 2008 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Strong and ripe and oaky. Not showing much subtlety, but a very good example of the modern California style. It's a clean, vibrant Chardonnay starring massive flavors of pineapple tart, Meyer lemon custard and tangerines, brightened with zesty acidity.
title: Langtry 2008 Genevieve Vineyard Chardonnay (Guenoc Valley)

description: Good tropical fruit, green apple and buttercream flavors in this bone-dry wine. It has a slightly rugged, earthy taste as well, of dried herbs and tobacco. A sound Chardonnay.
title: Hawley 2007 Smith Ranch Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Shows the extreme dryness, crisp acidity, flowers and minerality that often mark Carneros Chadonnays, which makes it elegant and sleek. With a touch of Meyer lemons and limes, it rises to richness. Drink now.
title: Carneros Highway 2008 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: There's lots to like about this cool-climate Chardonnay, from the ripe pineapple, kiwi and lime flavors to the rich touch of lees and vanilla. It has a sharp cut of acidity that's almost Champagne-like, and calls for extremely rich fare to balance. Try with shrimp risotto.
title: Coastview 2008 The Terraces Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Buena Vista has a good reputation for this bottling, and the great '07 vintage has resulted in another fine Chardonnay, at a good price. Racy in acidity, the wine shows mineral-infused citrus fruit, apple and honeysuckle notes that finish with a touch of off-dry sweetness.
title: Buena Vista 2007 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is Geyser Peak's barrel-fermented Chardonnay. It shows classic Alexander Valley ripeness, with rich tropical fruit, green apple, pear, buttered popcorn and vanilla flavors, accented with racy acidity. Very nice now with roast salmon, crab or a simple roast chicken.
title: Geyser Peak 2008 Block Collection Water Bend Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: It's all there in this Chardonnay, with barrel influences of butterscotch and toast, crisp Russian River acidity, and ripe flavors of pineapples, Meyer lemons, limes and green apples. Feels a bit sharp, so don't over-chill, and you can even give it a decant.
title: Bourassa Vineyards 2008 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Shows the very dry herbal, floral and tobacco flavors that often mark Napa Chardonnays (and the vineyard is on the Napa side of Carneros). But there's a good core of tropical citrus fruits, while oak adds needed richness of smoky vanilla and buttered toast. Drink now.
title: Kazmer & Blaise 2007 Boon Fly's Hill Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Very ripe and fruity, a Chardonnay that trades sheer opulence for subtlety or complexity. Offers oak-inspired flavors of buttered toast, pineapple Lifesaver candy, lemondrop and vanilla crème brûlée in a creamy texture.
title: Bianchi 2008 El Camino Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: A very rich, somewhat jammy Chardonnay, brimming with pie-filling flavors of pineapples, pears and peaches. Oak adds even richer notes of crème brûlée and buttered toast. Drink now.
title: Calera 2008 Chardonnay (Mt. Harlan)

description: This unoaked Chardonnay offers great complexity at an affordable everyday price. It's dry and elegantly balanced with crisp acids. Rich flavors of pineapples, Meyer lemons, limes and vanilla  hardly need wood for richness.
title: Kopriva 2008 Cassidy Ranch Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A very nice Chardonnay marked by crisp dryness and fine structure, which highlights the pleasant varietal flavors. Offers a nice array of pineapples, peaches, apricots and green apples, accented by the smoky vanilla of oak and grounded in minerals.
title: Matchbook 2008 Old Head Chardonnay (Dunnigan Hills)

description: Shows slightly sweet flavors of pineapple marmalade, green apple tart, honeysuckle and buttered toast, fortunately balanced with crisp, citrusy acidity. It was made from grapes grown in the Los Alamos region of Santa Barbara County.
title: Acre 2008 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Ultradry and tart in acidity, this is not a Chardonnay for those looking for richness. With citrus and mineral flavors, it's suggestive of a young, minor Chablis. Clean and vibrant. Drink now.
title: Trione 2007 River Road Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Shows nice pineapple tart, lemondrop, buttered toast and vanilla oak flavors, brightened with crisp acidity. Finishes quick and could be more concentrated, but it's a very good, elegant Chardonnay at a fair price.
title: Rodney Strong 2008 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Very dry and somewhat lean, with citrus, mineral and peach flavors. Oak adds a rich coating of buttered toast and smoky caramel. An elegant wine that's at its best now.
title: Groth 2007 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Lean and minerally, with dry, crisp Meyer lemon, pineapple and toasty oak flavors. Starts off a bit sulfury and seems rushed to market. Better by mid-2010.
title: Longboard 2008 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: With pineapple crème brûlée, Key lime pie and kiwi flavors that are accented with sweet, smoky oak, this Chardonnay offers an uptown sip compromised only by a certain herbaceousness. Drink now.
title: Handley 2007 Handley Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: A solid Chardonnay that will satisfy fans of the variety. It's a sleekly tart, streamlined wine, with vanilla oak and buttered toast influences acting on the pineapples and green apples. Finishes a little sweet, but crisp.
title: Frei Brothers 2007 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is what good, cool-climate Chardonnay tastes like without oak barrel influence. It's a dry, crisply acidic and strongly flavored wine, bursting with ripe pineapples, peaches, green apples and vanilla.
title: Morgan 2008 Metallico Un-Oaked Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: New oak dominates the aromas and flavors, with buttered toast, buttered popcorn and caramel overwhelming the underlying fruit, which suggests pineapples and green apples. Although the wine is dry and acidity is fine, the fruit lacks the richness to support the oak.
title: Rodney Strong 2007 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The word No refers to no oak and no malolactic fermentation. The wine is sharp in acids and totally dry, but with super-ripe flavors of pineapple, pear, peach and green apple marmalade. Very clean and mouth-cleansing.
title: No 2008 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: A rich, fruity Chardonnay with lots of flavor and bright, mouthwatering acidity. Made sur lie, but with no oak, it has yeasty notes accenting pineapples, Asian pears, green apples, honeysuckle, cinnamon and vanilla.
title: Patianna 2008 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: This is a lemony oaky white, rich in baked apple and tropical notes. Full bodied and concentrated in powerful ripeness, it finishes clean and big.
title: Luna 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Like a liquid fruit salad, this medium-bodied wine spills over with pear, apple, peach and pineapple flavors on a rather soft texture. There is no obvious oak component, however a light vanilla accent adds interest.
title: Tortoise Creek 2016 Jam's Blend Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Muted in floral aromatics, this simple, approachable and rounded wine is thick in tropical flavor and baked apple, with a wild tease of fennel within its medium-bodied concentration.
title: B.R. Cohn 2016 Silver Label Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Crushed chalk, crisp honeysuckle and a gunmetal aroma show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is more rich, with full flavors of marzipan and lemon curd, very much in the classic California Chardonnay vein.
title: Muirwood 2016 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: This wine has an unusually deep gold color, lots of butter and butterscotch aromas, medium body and attractive peach and pear flavors. It looks pretty mature and tastes pretty good.
title: Wise Villa 2015 Sur Lies Estate Chardonnay (Sierra Foothills)

description: Toasted vanilla and lemony pear provide a focused palate of one-dimensional flavor in this fleshy, grainy wine that's robustly ripe and rich.
title: V. Sattui 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Floral and confectionery on the nose, this wine has a steely sensibility that suggest light oak and high acidity, with a strong flavor profile of freshly squeezed citrus.
title: Sequoia Grove 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This straightforward approachable wine offers a friendly sense of richness, rounded in lush apple, mango and integrated oak. The finish is bright and fresh.
title: Tuli 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: The nose on this bottling is extremely shy and reserved at this stage of its life, showing light aromas of damp oak and lanolin. There is decent tension to the sip, where flavors of nectarine, Gravenstein apple and a chalky minerality barely start to show.
title: Sarah's Vineyard 2016 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Clara Valley)

description: Given 16 months in French oak, half of it new, this is an oaky, buttery and intensely full-bodied wine, thick and rich in baked apple and brioche flavors.
title: Merryvale 2015 Silhouette Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Tight, integrated oak forms around a core of pineapple, sweet vanilla and pear in this robust, full-bodied white. Richly textured and layered, it satisfies in its boldness and lush, plush toastiness.
title: Robert Mondavi 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Rounded aromas of Asian pear and citrus show on the nose of this bottling. The flavors combine lemon juice with tart green apple and a bit of nutty warmth.
title: Bianchi 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Pungent in oak and strong, warm aromas of crème brûlée, this wine offers a lush profile of mango, papaya and baked peach, slightly tropical and rich while being moderately balanced and the right kind of rich.
title: Taken Wine Co. 2016 Complicated Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Dark and golden in color, this 100% stainless-steel fermented white is steely on the midpalate, with an integrated, rich thread of vanilla that gives it a tropical tease of sweetness, though the wine finishes dry and defiantly light.
title: River Road 2016 Un-oaked Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Heady in honeysuckle aromas, this wine is thick and concentrated in crème brûlée richness, interwoven in baked apple and pear with pronounced oak.
title: MacRostie 2016 Wildcat Mountain Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Fermented in both oak and stainless steel tanks, this wine invites in jasmine and apple blossom aromas before offering supple and substantial layers of creamy vanilla, baked apple, melon and oak.
title: River Road 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is majority stainless steel fermented, offering a highly floral experience that's steely and stony on the palate. Vanilla and melon flavors expand on the broadly defined body of the wine.
title: River Road 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: There's a solid crispness to the clean citrusy nose of this bottling, which also offers a bit of honeysuckle and white lily. The palate offers simple, nearly sweet flavors of red pear with a hint of bubblegum, framed by a chalky structure.
title: Europa Village 2016 C'est La Vie Chardonnay (Temecula Valley)

description: This wine is lightly stylized, made to showcase a baseline of fresh tart acidity, which it does well. The flavors are elusive, a mix of fig and brine.
title: Red Car 2014 Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Fort Ross-Seaview)

description: A strong aroma of toasted hazelnut shows on the nose of this single-vineyard expression, along with hints of scratched orange rind and cashew cream. It's broad and a tad flat on the palate, where baked apple, rounded citrus and a hint of marshmallow flavors arise.
title: Montemar Wines 2015 Rita's Crown Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Pineapple juice and baked mango mark this pleasing, straightforward and approachable wine, which takes a full-bodied approach to its ripeness, with minimal oak.
title: Tuli 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Baked tropical flavors highlight a broad, expansive and full-bodied white with a buttery oaky component that works well with the rich robust fruit.
title: Smith Devereux 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: There's the slightest pink tint to the color of this bottling, which shows baked apple and poached pear aromas on the ripe but pleasant nose. The palate is also quite ripe, showing more cooked pome fruit and squeezed lime, with a decent texture.
title: Vinum 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: This full-bodied wine is loaded with aromas of pear nectar and grilled baguette, and very ripe fruit flavors. It has a warmly oaky personality, showing vanilla and coconut in addition to generous pear notes.
title: Black's Station 2016 Chardonnay (Yolo County)

description: Lemon and orange pith aromas meet with toasted brioche and lemongrass on the intriguing nose of this bottling. The palate mixes apples, nuts and spice into a charoseth-like flavor profile, with hints of guava paste and yeasty sourdough rounding out the unique experience.
title: Cottonwood Canyon 2013 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Full bodied and intensely ripe, this wine is expansive and juicy, with pronounced oak across the palate and fully sketched flavors of baked pear, apple and peach. The structure is moderate and the finish sweet in vanilla.
title: Outlot 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This is a promising wine for SoCal Chardonnay, starting with aromas of lemon peels, sea salt, cream and honeysuckle. The palate is a tad sweet, with apple syrup and candied lemon flavors, but the mouthfeel is creamy and the acidity is good.
title: Hungry Hawk 2016 Chardonnay (San Diego County)

description: Fresh Key lime aromas meet with touches of guava, plumeria and lemongrass on the steely nose of this bottling. There's a great sizzle of acidity to the sip, leaning a bit more toward Sauvignon Blanc than Chardonnay, with flavors of guava gum, green papaya, lime and grass.
title: Hess 2016 Select Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Fresh lemon and lime zest aromas are sharp in the nose of this bottling, cutting into the oak smoke character. The mouthfeel is round and creamy, with more oak as well as melted butter, apple and lemon flavors. It is a solid midweek Chard.
title: District 7 Wines 2015 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: This wine pulls from across the wider appellation to combine cool-climate grapes with warmer regions. Round and easygoing, it offers fleshy fine flavors of pineapple and peach, its oak integrated and unobtrusive.
title: Decoy 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Florally perfumed in orange blossom, this plush, medium-bodied white is awash in pineapple and a strong taste of cinnamon stick, its oak pronounced and supportive.
title: Markham 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Dried lemon peels and a hint of butter-fried apples show on the nose. Strong lemon acidity drives the palate, with a touch of sea salt and stone fruit proving very familiar.
title: Cooper-Garrod 2014 Gravel Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This concentrated white is a mix of green olive and fig flavors that punctuate a thick full-bodied palate of toasted salty oak and lingering heat.
title: Terlato 2015 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The nose of this widely available bottling is very lively with pear-cider aromas as well as kaffir lime, lemongrass and coconut, reminiscent of Thai food. The sip starts with strong acidic energy and then slides into a flood of dried apples and ripe pears, proving a tad unctuous.
title: Concannon 2015 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Quite yellow in the glass, this twist-top bottling shows a slight hint of reduction, with aromas of beeswax, lemon peel and yellow grapefruit pith. There's a good sizzle of acidity to the palate and a steely texture, but it's a tad ripe with lemon candy and spun-sugar flavors.
title: Hug 2015 Rancho Vinedo Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: A rich nose of sweet orange mousse, lemon syrup and ripe apple flesh shows on this bottling from the Paso Robles producer. Lemon peels, pineapple and coconut flesh show on the sip, which is dusted with a touch of sea salt.
title: Vina Robles 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Forward aromas and flavors of vanilla and melted butter give a lot of richness to this medium-bodied wine. It has a candy-like quality and a creamy sweet-seeming finish.
title: Bliss 2016 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Made in the popular style, this is an enormously ripe, oaky wine. It floods the mouth with flavors of pineapple jam, vanilla custard, crème brûlée and smoky meringue flavors, brightened with acidity. Drink now.
title: Cosentino 2007 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Shows the combination of ripe pineapple and tropical fruit flavors with smoky oak that makes Chardonnay so popular. There's lots of buttered popcorn and creamy vanilla, balanced with crisp coastal acidity.
title: Kenwood 2008 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A rich, fruity Chardonnay. Shows dry, acid-inspired flavors of grilled pineapples and smoky new oak. Could be smoother and more nuanced, but a very good wine.
title: Talley 2007 Oliver's Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Here's a clean, steely Chardonnay with good varietal character. It's dry and crisp, with a creamy texture housing flavors of pineapples, vanilla and smoky oak. Nice with roast salmon, corn risotto or a simple broiled chicken.
title: Simi 2008 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Rich in fruit and oak, but balanced with crisp acidity. It's strongly flavored, brimming with pineapple jam, white peach, apricot, buttered toast and vanilla. Gets the Chardonnay job done with some elegance.
title: Arrowood 2007 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Rich and fruit-forward. Shows ripe flavors of pineapples, pears and apples, enriched with the smoke and buttered toast notes of oak, and the creamy, yeasty edge of lees. Best now for its flamboyance. From the Sangiacomo (83%) and Truchard (17%) vineyards.
title: X 2008 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Here's a nice, rich white wine. It gets the Chard job done in a direct way, offering creamy flavors of pineapples, peaches, pears, vanilla bean and buttered toast, along with mouthwatering acidity. Tastes a little sweet, but it's really easy to drink.
title: Murphy-Goode 2007 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Doesn't quite show the depth and complexity that can come from this vineyard, but pretty good. Ripe and oaky, with pineapple fruit flavors elaborated with vanilla, caramel, buttered popcorn and spice.
title: Chateau St. Jean 2007 Robert Young Vineyard Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Rich and savory, this Chardonnay displays lots of fruit and oak, balanced with crisp acidity. The flavors of pineapples and pears have an edge of smoke and buttered toast. Ready now.
title: Simi 2007 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This unoaked Chardonnay lets the fruit shine, and how rich it is. Offers waves of ripe pineapples and crisp green apples and hints of pears, papayas and spicy vanilla. Succulent and dry.
title: Rossi Wallace 2007 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Very ripe in pineapple tart, pear, green apple butter, crème brûlée and vanilla flavors in a buttery texture. There's a nice oily suggestion of cashews. Rather direct now, but should gain traction by mid-2010.
title: RustRidge 2007 Racehorse White Chardonnay (Chiles Valley)

description: Lots of people will like this smoky, vanilla-infused Chardonnay for its flavors of pineapples and buttered popcorn, and the creamy texture. It's ready to drink now.
title: Chateau St. Jean 2007 Belle Terre Vineyard Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Good structure on this wine, with fine acidity providing clean balance. It sure is fruity, though, with massive pineapple, peach, apple and smoky oak flavors that could use a bit more finesse and subtlety.
title: Ridge 2007 Monte Bello Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Very tart, with sour lemon candy, pineapple, buttered popcorn and honeysuckle flavors, wrapped into a creamy texture.
title: Hideaway Creek 2007 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Shows bright, crisp Central Coast acidity brightening pure flavors of limes, kiwis, pineapples and tropical papaya fruits, in a creamy texture. Textbook cool-climate Chardonnay.
title: Deep Sea 2008 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Shows the herbal, sweet green pea quality that often marks Chards from the central Napa Valley, but that gives it an interesting twist. Otherwise, you'll find tropical fruits, cream, buttered popcorn and zesty acidity.
title: El Molino 2007 Chardonnay (Rutherford)

description: Rich and creamy, if a little direct. Shows powerhouse pineapple, pear, pineapple and vanilla spice flavors, boosted with clean, citrusy acids.
title: Thomas George 2007 Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: Very rich and fruity, offering waves of ripe crushed pineapples, pears, vanilla bean, buttered popcorn and spices. What it lacks in subtlety it makes up for in sheer power.
title: Thomas George 2008 Stuhlmuller Vineyard INOX Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Delicious and powerful, and a great value. Can stand beside Chards twice its price, with ripe tropical fruit flavors, smoky oak and crisp coastal acidity. And the alcohol is modest.
title: Sean Minor 2007 Four Bears Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Rich in oak, ripe in fruit, this Chard shows impressively ripe flavors of pineapple jam, pears and buttered toast. It's soft and ready to drink now.
title: Huge Bear 2007 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Clean, creamy and crisp, this Chard offers flavors of pineapples, pears and peaches, in a coating of buttery, smoky oak. Nice with grilled salmon on a buttery polenta.
title: Calistoga Cellars 2007 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: High in acidity, this bone dry Chard has a brisk, mouthwatering quality. It offers ripe flavors of pineapples, Key lime pie, kiwi fruit and minerals. Easy to find, with 380,000 cases produced.
title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2007 Paragon Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)

description: Oaky and sweet, this Chard will appeal to fans of the extracted style. It tastes of butterscotch, buttered toast, grilled pineapples, honey and spices, with hints of exotic tropical fruits. Drink now.
title: Calera 2007 Chardonnay (Mt. Harlan)

description: Fruity and oaky, with easy flavors of grilled pineapples, buttered toast, vanilla and smoky oak. Shows real fanciness for the price.
title: De Loach 2007 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A good Chardonnay with some special qualities. It's dry, creamy and crisp, and you'll find a stony minerality grounding the pear, vanilla and buttered toast flavors.
title: Monterey Vineyard 2007 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Great price for a crisp, dry, clean Chardonnay that's so friendly with food. Tart acidity and a touch of smoky oak bring a smoky, vanilla richness to the tangerine, pineapple and pear flavors. Nice with grilled shrimp or mushroom and asiago cheese risotto.
title: Moon Mountain Vineyard 2007 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A polished, pretty Chardonnay with few winemaker interventions, so the grapes themselves can star. Shows kiwi, lime and vanilla flavors, brightened with crisp, citrusy acidity.
title: Joullian 2007 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: A bit tart and disjointed now, and dominated by oak, with flavors of butterscotch, pineapples, green apples and cinnamon spice. But it's young. Give it time. Should knit together in early 2010.
title: Paul Mathew 2007 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Awfully good for the price, with crisp, Carneros acidity and a creamy texture framing nice flavors of pineapples, peaches, green apples, cinnamon spice and minerals.
title: Cameron Hughes 2007 Lot 127 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: Rich and sweetly crisp, this is the kind of Chardonnay millions of people love. It has opulent, creamy flavors of pineapples, pears, vanilla, buttered toast, cinnamon and smoky oak. Totally Californian, and a good buy.
title: Château Julien 2007 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: A bit soft and direct, but appeals for its rich flavors of pineapples, buttered toast, cinnamon and smoke. Shows a firm minerality at its core. Drink now.
title: Summerland 2006 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Showing crisp, lemony acidity, this unoaked Chardonnay brims with citrus, gooseberry, pear and vanilla flavors. A fine example of the stainless steel style.
title: St. Supéry 2008 Oak Free Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Soft and smoky, with ripe flavors of pineapple tart, sweet lemon custard, vanilla and cinnamon. Pretty and polished, an easy wine to like.
title: Addamo 2007 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Dry and earthy, this Chard is made in a more restrained style that emphasizes herbs and minerals as much as lemons, limes and pears. Crisp acidity makes the mouthfeel vibrant and clean.
title: Clos du Val 2007 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: If there's any oak on this wine, it doesn't show. Instead, it brims with ripe, pure flavors of pineapples, kiwi fruit, limes and cinnamon spice. Crisp and bright.
title: Bin 36 2007 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Crisp in acidity, with ripe flavors of pineapple jam, apricots and sweet spicy oak.
title: Summerland 2007 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This wine is rich in tropical fruit, pear, green apple and lemon-lime flavors, but dry, with a touch of butterscotchy oak. Shows a deftly clean mouthfeel with fine, coastal acidity.
title: Brander 2008 Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Lime-peel acidity marks this bone-dry, tart wine. The other flavors include steely minerals, pineapple crème brûlée and buttered toast. Drink now.
title: Beauregard 2006 Bald Mountain Vineyard Chardonnay (Ben Lomond Mountain)

description: Made in the softly ripe, oaky style, this Chard shows flavors of pineapple cream, lemon zest, vanilla custard and cinnamon spice. It's a crowd pleaser.
title: Luke Donald 2007 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Crisp and direct, showing bright, flamboyant pineapples, kiwis, figs, Meyer lemons and vanilla.
title: Surfrider 2007 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Lemony, light-bodied, bone dry and acidically crisp, its citrus and mineral flavors are easy and elegant, and will play well against shrimp scampi.
title: Rosenthal 2007 Chardonnay (Malibu-Newton Canyon)

description: There's a lot of crisp, vibrant acidity in this wine, which gives the pineapple, apricot and peach flavors a jamminess that lasts through the finish. With its creamy texture, it's a wine to drink now.
title: Buena Vista 2006 Clone 17 RY Ramal Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Sharp and crisp in citrusy acidity, this Chard has jammy flavors of apricots, pineapples and vanilla oak. A little direct, but dry and creamy, and easy to drink.
title: Buena Vista 2006 Dijon Clones Ramal Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Offers a good modern interpretation of Chardonnay, with its ripe, oaky flavors and creamy texture. Grilled pineapples, mashed green pears, buttered toast, caramel and vanilla, brightened with crisp acidity.
title: Truchard 2007 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A very nice Chardonnay that continues the winery's success with this bottling. Dry and creamy, it has rich flavors of pineapples, pears, vanilla and spices.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2007 Select Vineyard Series Ghost Oak Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Dry and crisp in acidity, with butterscotchy new oak notes that frame flavors of apricots, lychee, pineapple, pear and papaya. Drink this delicious Chardonnay now.
title: Morgan 2007 Highland Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: A brisk, clean Chardonnay with a firm footing of minerals undergirding polished pineapple, pear and cedar flavors. Offers lots of sophisticated pleasure at a good price.
title: Toasted Head 2006 Barrel Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Shows the bright acidity and long hangtime fruit flavors of Edna Valley, with rich notes of kiwis, limes, pineapples, green apples and spices. Oak adds softer complexities of vanilla cream.
title: Ortman Family 2007 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: This powerfully ripe, direct Chardonnay shows massive flavors of pineapples, nectarines, green apples, vanilla and oaky buttered toast, brightened with crisp, coastal acidity. Nice with scallops in a saffron and coconut cream sauce.
title: Vino V 2006 Solomon Hills Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This is a crisp, fruity Chardonnay that shows real cool-climate terroir. It's dry and fairly oaky, with pineapple, papaya and buttered toast flavors wrapped into a creamy mouthfeel.
title: Solaire by Robert Mondavi 2007 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Very rich and oaky, with bigtime flavors of grilled pineapples and peaches, pears, buttered toast and oak spices. Only 250 cases produced.
title: Sunstone 2007 Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This is a very ripe and rather oaky Chardonnay that shows off how well the vintage perfected the grapes. Brims with smoky flavors of pineapple custard, Meyer lemon pie filling, butterscotch and cinnamon spices. Calls for rich fare, such as scallops.
title: Summers 2007 Reserve Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Shows the crisp acidity and delicately silky mouthfeel of Carneros Chard, with ripe flavors of pineapples, guavas, kiwis and minerals. Could be a tad drier, but it's a pretty nice wine.
title: MacRostie 2007 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Here's a nice Chardonnay with enough elegance to have with lobster, scallops, grilled salmon and other upscale dishes. It has ripe flavors of pineapple jam, Meyer lemon tart, vanilla and smoky oak, with oaky, yeasty complexities.
title: Schug 2007 Heritage Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Very Chablis-like, this coastal Chardonnay has high acidity that makes it clean and vibrant. The flavors are marked by minerals and Meyer lemons, with a touch of smoky oak. It's a fine, dry white wine that will pair well with a wide range of foods, and it's from Francis Ford Coppola.
title: Francis Ford Coppola 2007 Votre Santé Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: True to this negociant's style, this Chardonnay offers lots of bang for the buck. It delivers true varietal character, offering flavors of pineapples, pears and oak, wrapped into a creamy texture that finishes dry and spicy.
title: Cameron Hughes 2007 Lot 108 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Very rich, with freshly crushed pineapple, grilled ripe peach, buttered toast and caramelized vanilla cream flavors. Could have greater structure, as it's a little soft for all that weight, but it's a fancy Chardonnay.
title: Alpha Omega 2006 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: The vineyard source is in the cooler part of the valley. The wine is nicely crisp, giving a refreshingly clean mouthfeel that balances the very rich, extracted pineapples, apricots, pears, green apples and peaches. Lots of new oak adds vanilla, butterscotch and sweet cream.
title: David Arthur 2007 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Rich and creamy, with fruit-forward flavors of pineapple jam, oranges, ripe peaches, vanilla and buttered toast. Crisp acidity gives balance and clean liveliness.
title: Dominican Oaks 2007 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A creamy texture houses vivid flavors of pineapple jam, lemon pie, vanilla custard and buttered toast in this rich wine. It's an opulent Chardonnay made for elegant fare.
title: Windsor Sonoma 2007 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: If you like lots of smoky vanilla and buttercream on a big, California-ripe Chardonnay that's stuffed with pineapples and mangoes, then this is the wine for you. It's direct and dry and crisp, at a fair price.
title: Tangley Oaks 2006 Lot #3 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Sweetly ripe and oaky, with pineapple marmalade, lemon custard, vanilla and smoky meringue flavors. The alcohol is a refreshingly low 13.9%.
title: Girard 2007 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: There's an earthiness to this Chard, reminiscent of sweet fresh sage, along with savory flavors of oranges, pineapples and vanilla. It's a nice, easy wine for drinking now.
title: Raymond 2007 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A good, rich, oaky Chardonnay that will satisfy your sweet tooth. It's bursting in ripe pineapple jam, lime, pear and buttered toast flavors, with clean, zesty acidity for balance.
title: Wellington 2007 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Talbott's style is always exotic and eccentric, with the grapes tasting so ripe, they have an almost botrytised, apricotty flavor. So it is with this '06, which also brims with grilled pineapple and sweet smoky oak. Best now.
title: Talbott 2006 Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Plenty of smoky, spicy oak on this Chard, along with ripe, orange, pineapple and apricot flavors. It's a little rough around the edges, though. Drink now.
title: Testarossa 2007 Castello Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: With its vanilla buttercream and spicy, smoky overtones, this Chard also shows underlying fruit flavors of pineapples, peaches, pears and green apples. It's a crisp, supple young wine, and this is a good price to pay.
title: Gallo Family Vineyards 2007 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Good price for a California Chard of this sophistication. It's dry, creamy and a little soft, with textbook Chardonnay flavors of peaches, pears, pineapples and smoky spices.
title: Wild Horse 2007 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Tastes sweet, almost like a dessert wine. Brings to mind a tart with smoky dough, pineapple, mascarpone cheese, apricot cream and orange liqueur flavors. Exotic, and probably better as a cocktail sipper than paired with food.
title: Tandem 2006 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This unoaked Chardonnay is marked by quite crisp acidity, as the malolactic fermentation was prevented. It's the opposite of opulent, a flinty wine with hints of Meyer lemons and Kaffir limes. Try with shellfish.
title: Wente 2006 Eric's Small Lot Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Tastes like it comes from Edna Valley, with its dryness, great burst of juicy acidity and jammy Mandarin orange, lime, kiwi and Meyer lemon flavors. Great with crab cakes dressed in a mango salsa.
title: Fog Alley 2007 Unoaked Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Elegant rather than powerful, this Chard has tropical fruit, apricot and oak flavors wrapped into a creamy texture. It turns sweet and spicy, like vanilla custard, on the finish.
title: Wild Horse 2007 Bien Nacido Vineyard Unbridled Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Shows some of the tropical fruit character that Alexander Valley Chard is famous for, and finishes dry and crisp. Could be a little more concentrated for the price, but it's a pretty nice bottle of wine.
title: Simi 2006 Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Very oaky, with sweet caramel and butterscotch flavors overshadowing the underlying pineapples, pears and limes. But crisp acidity makes for balance, and a firm, stony minerality uplifts and provides structure.
title: Tandem 2006 Sangiacomo Vineyards Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a very rich Chardonnay, bursting with Key lime pie, ripe golden kiwi, pineapple, buttered toast and crème brûlée flavors. That fine, crisp coastal acidity makes it brisk and clean. Drink now.
title: Estancia 2006 Reserve Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Here's a rich Chardonnay. It's upfront in pineapple pie, peach cobbler, pear jam, apple butter and caramelly oak flavors, yet is dry and pleasantly crisp in acidity. Drink now.
title: Sonoma-Cutrer 2006 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: For all the richness, and there's plenty of it in the pineapple, Meyer lemondrop and vanilla notes, this Chard has a gunmetal minerality that grounds it. The "Nu" designation indicates that it's unoaked.
title: Kunde 2007 Estate Grown Nu Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Very dry, this elegantly structured Chard is made in a leaner, Chablisian style. It has flavors of minerals and dried herbs, with suggestions of citrus fruits, peaches, green apples and vanilla cream.
title: Kokomo 2006 Peters Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Almost a repeat of the â"˜05, in which the oak dominated everything else. Those waves of caramel and buttered toast taste good, and together with the pineapples and pears, give the wine an exotic taste of some creamy, spicy, honey-rich mashed fruit pudding.
title: Chateau St. Jean 2006 Robert Young Vineyard Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Showing ripe peach, pineapple and honeysuckle flavors, this Chard, from the cooler southern part of the valley, is balanced with crisp acidity. Oak plays a prominent role, offering spicy crème brûlée complexities.
title: Liparita 2006 Chardonnay (Yountville)
