description: The high acidity on this Chard makes your mouth water. It's not a lush, opulent wine, but it is complex, with green apple, lime zest and mineral flavors enriched with oak and lees. Elegant and well-structured. Drink now.
title: Gallo Family Vineyards 2005 Laguna Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The winery turned to Edna Valley for this '07 Chard, which shows all the fine qualities of that Central Coast region. The wine is high in acidity, dry and ultra-clean, with powerful flavors of golden kiwi fruit, limes and vanilla honey.
title: 10 Knots 2007 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Firm and minerally, with green apple butter, pineapple tart and highly charred oak flavors that finish with a caramelized, slightly burnt aftertaste. Drink now.
title: JCB 2006 No. 8 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is Martin Ray's best non-reserve Chard in years. In fact, it's as good as some of their reserves. It shows real richness, with fancy oak and lees influences and complex the peach and pear fruit flavors.
title: Martin Ray 2006 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Quite a good wine, but the powerful oak is a bit intrusive at this time. It swamps the mouth with caramel and crème brûlée. Below all that seems to be a fine, pineapple-flavored Chardonnay. Everything may knit together in a year or so.
title: Vine Cliff 2006 Proprietress Reserve Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: Tastes riper and oakier than in previous vintages, giving it a somewhat flamboyant personality, but lovers of this California style will be impressed by the pineapple custard, butterscotch, crème brûlée and smoky oak flavors.
title: Acacia 2006 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Made in an immediately appealing, oaky way, this Chard has appealing peach, pear, green apple and honey flavors that taste like they were baked into a pie. Easy to find, with more than a million bottles in circulation.
title: Frei Brothers 2006 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Although many will find this Chard fancy and worth the price, the oak sticks out too much, giving it outsized butterscotch and toast flavors. Maybe something less than 40% new oak would have let the tropical fruit, citrus and pear flavors express themselves more purely. Excessive oak has marred Patz & Hall Chardonnays in the past.
title: Patz & Hall 2006 Hyde Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Made in a very ripe way, this Chardonnay offers a blast of jammy pineapples, pears, white peach, white nectarine and honey flavors, with a delicious coating of smoky, caramelized oak. Almost over-the-top, but balanced with crisp acidity.
title: Acacia 2006 Winery Lake Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: You won't miss the taste of oak one bit, because this Chard is so rich and crisply stimulating on its own. It floods the palate with pineapple jam, peach pie, green apple butter, vanilla and cinnamon-honey granola flavors that are clean and pure.
title: St. Supéry 2007 Oak Free Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Here's a textbook California Chardonnay made in a ripe, oaky style that pleases for its richness. The pineapple pie flavors have a toasted meringue edge, and the finish is dry and spicy.
title: Cosentino 2006 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Crisp and flavorful, a delicious Chardonnay designed for rich fare like scallops or shrimp in saffron, coconut milk and butter sauce. The flavors of pineapples, mangoes, nectarines, peaches and smoky oak are complex and have a honey-sweet finish.
title: Fernwood 2006 Estate Vanumanutagi Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: A nice Chardonnay, with enough elegance to drink with fine food. Dry and crisp, it shows mineral-infused peach, lemon and pineapple flavors that are wrapped into quite a bit of smoky oak. Drink now.
title: Frostwatch 2006 Chardonnay (Bennett Valley)

description: This has been a consistent bottling from Wolff. The '06 shows classic Edna Valley acidity and very ripe, long hangtime fruit flavors of pineapples, Key limes, papayas and mangoes. It finishes with rich honey, but the wine is thoroughly dry.
title: Wolff 2006 Old Vines Estate Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: As the name implies, this is Foley's unoaked Chardonnay. It's amazing how much the grapes pack in without any help from barrels. Pineapple jam, peach pie, lemons and limes, figs, vanilla and clove spice, it all rushes together into a swirl of acid-brightened flavor.
title: Foley 2007 Steel Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Here's a rich, opulent wine. It's definitely high in acidity, which gives it a citrusy bite, but that zippiness provides a firm counterpoint to the lush tropical fruit, buttered toast and spice flavors.
title: C&T 2006 Backyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is the kind of Chardonnay that consumers love. It's forward in peaches-and-cream, tangerine and tropical fruit flavors, with smoky, vanilla-scented accents from oak, and is full-bodied and dry.
title: Cameron Hughes 2007 Lot 91 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Lots of oak on this toasty, spicy-sweet wine, but if you like those touches of caramel, honey and buttered toast, you love it. The underlying fruit is ripe pineapples and pears.
title: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2007 Estate Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Marked by penetrating acidity that's almost stinging, this Chard is balanced with a creamy, buttery texture framing rich flavors of pineapple tart, Key lime pie and smoky butterscotch. Good price for a wine of this depth and complexity.
title: Laetitia 2007 Estate Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Shows the ripeness and oakiness that have characterized previous vintages, but considerably greater structure. The jammy pears and pineapples are there, but the wine isn't as sweet as last year, and is firmer in acidity. Good value for the price.
title: Mia's Playground 2006 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Lots of sweet oak in this ripe, fruity Chardonnay, which is made very much in the California style. Bursting with jammy pineapple, lime, nectarine and tropical fruit, it has extra layers of crème brûlée, buttered toast and creamy lees. A bit obvious, but very opulent.
title: Oakville Ranch 2006 Chardonnay (Oakville)

description: Shows the brisk, mouth-watering acidity and ripe, citrusy flavors that invariably mark Edna Valley-grown Chardonnay. Oak brings a vanilla and smoke richness, but the wine is all about the grapes, which are forward in lemon and lime flavors.
title: Carpe Diem 2006 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: A solid double-to-left-center, this clean, tasty Chard has good balance and fine flavors of peaches, pears, pineapples, smoky vanilla and buttercream.
title: Eagle Castle 2007 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Sonoma Chard costing far more, this one showed off really well. Not as powerful in fruit, but dry and smooth, with delightful pineapple, crème brûlée, peaches and cream, and caramelized oak aromas and flavors.
title: Hilltown 2006 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Sparkling wine specialist Scharffenberger turns its hand to Chardonnay with interesting results. Acidity is the most notable feature, higher or at least more pronounced than in most California Chards. There's also a mineral undergirding to the lemon preserves and orange zest flavors. This is one of those Chards that will likely take to aging.
title: Scharffenberger 2005 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: Here's a ripe, juicy Chardonnay. Grown in a warm climate, it shows powerful pear jam, baked apple pie and smoky vanilla flavors, with a note of sweetened jasmine tea and a dry, spicy finish of cloves and pepper.
title: Amista 2006 Farrow Home Ranch Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: In the explosion of unoaked Chards lately, the Central Coast has proved itself as the go-to region. Domaine Alfred's bottling is just super, a rich, zesty wine whose acidity makes your palate dance to the music of tangerines, limes, kiwis and pineapples.
title: Domaine Alfred 2007 Stainless Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: The Australian golf legend now makes wine in California. Compared to your usual fruity Chard, this one's lean and minerally and high in acidity. But it's very clean, with tantalizing suggestions of lemon meringue and Key lime pie, and actually has a lot going for it.
title: Greg Norman California Estates 2006 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Here's an elegant, crisp Chardonnay marked by the smoke and wood tannins of oak. The underlying wine has flavors of green apples and nectarines. It's bone dry and sleek, a wine made to accompany food, not overwhelm it.
title: Dutton-Goldfield 2006 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Balanced and dry, this Chardonnay has pleasant flavors of green apples and pineapples, with creamy, yeasty complexities achieved through barrel fermentation and lees aging. The price is fair for the quality.
title: Robert Hall 2007 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Shows a lot of finesse for a Chard at this price, meaning there's a combination of balance and elegance that this wine has in spades. That makes the pear, peach and buttercream flavors all the better to taste.
title: Paul Dolan 2006 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: Firm and minerally, with zippy acids framing oak-touched mango, pear and sautéed banana flavors. Not a big Chard, but an elegant, crisply dry one.
title: Martin Ray 2006 Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Made in a spare, angular style, this has citrus zest, mineral and pear flavors, brightened by acidity. It's an elegant wine with a creamy, buttery texture.
title: Breggo 2006 Savoy Vineyard Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: Dry and balanced, this young wine has a steely mineral tang to the fruitier flavors of ripe yellow apricots, tangerines and baked green apples. Oak adds smoky, spicy wood notes. A very nice Chard at a good price.
title: Clos du Bois 2006 Sonoma Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Very forward and mouth-filling in pineapples, mangoes, nectarines, guavas and figs. Yet the wine is dry and crisp. Shows flamboyance rather than complexity, and will appeal to fans of this hedonistic style.
title: Saxon Brown 2006 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: New oak accounts for about one-third of this wine, but the wood really stands out. The underlying wine is rather dry, lean and citrusy. It's eleganty structured, not an opulent palate seducer but a companionable wine for food.
title: Barnett 2006 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A nice, dry Chard, a bit on the earthy, tobaccoey side, with pleasantly acidic mineral flavors and hints of lemons, limes and pineapples.
title: Gainey 2006 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Here's a sleek, citrusy Chardonnay, showing lime and pineapple flavors and a touch of smoky oak. It's balanced and elegant, with good acidity. Nice with barbecued salmon or roast pork.
title: Charles Creek 2006 Las Patolitas Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A very nice, fairly rich Chardonnay, showing tropical fruit, pear, nectarine, citrus and mineral flavors. The acidity is racy, giving the wine a crisp, bright mouthfeel.
title: Hawkes 2005 Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Former Wild Horse proprietor Ken Volk is back with his own personal brand after selling the winery. He's sourced his fruit from this very famous old vineyard. It's a good start, a deep golden wine showing ripe apricot, pear and sweet smoky oak flavors.
title: Kenneth Volk 2005 Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A nice, crisp Chard that has pineapple, peach, pear and caramel-vanilla flavors that turn honeyed and spicy on the finish. From the Sonoma producer Ty Caton.
title: Racchus 2005 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Here's a bright young Chardonnay marked by the crisp, tingly acids that you so often find in Edna Valley wines. The fruit is vibrant, offering a burst of Meyer lemons, limes, kiwis and figs, and the finish is thoroughly dry. The alcohol level, by the way, is a relatively low 13.5%.
title: Kynsi 2006 Edna Ranch Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Stainless- steel fermented, this Chard comes from a very cool part of Russian River Valley. You can taste that in the crisp acids that frame the green apple, pineapple, pear, lime and mineral flavors.
title: Balletto 2006 Teresa's Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A pretty good price for a single-vineyard Chard from a great appellation. Unoaked, the wine is very crisp in acidity, with citrus, apricot and mineral flavors that finish dry and clean.
title: Kopriva 2006 Cassidy Ranch Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Nothing subtle about this big, ripe, oaky Chardonnay. It shows the tropical fruit richness of a fine Alexander Valley Chard, flamboyant in pineapple custard flavor, with a flinty minerality. The sweet overlay of smoky oak is perfectly in keeping with the wine's volume.
title: Dutcher Crossing 2006 Stuhlmuller Vineyard Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Earthy, like some Napa Chards, with a sage and thyme edge to the pear and peach fruit. The wine also is a little soft. But there's an interesting minerality. Could develop bottle complexity over the next few years.
title: Testarossa 2006 Brosseau Vineyard Chardonnay (Chalone)

description: This makes you wonder why it took so long for California vintners to understand that Chard doesn't have to be drenched in oak to be succulent. The wine is crisp and dry in pineapple, pink grapefruit, green apple and cinnamon spice flavors. Great with shellfish and grilled chicken.
title: Domaine Alfred 2006 Stainless Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Ed Sbragia loves new oak, and this one has 100% of it, which makes it toasty and woody. The underlying wine is dry and crisp, with peach, apple and pear flavors, but the oak is very heavy, leading to a crème brûlée finish without the sweetness.
title: Sbragia 2005 Gamble Ranch Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Shows the crisp acidity that usually marks Carneros Chards, and also an earthy, freshly picked herb quality to the jammy peach, pineapple and green apple flavors. Consider it a food-worthy Chardonnay. Drink now.
title: Schug 2006 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This Chard is straightforward and tasty, showing the bright acidity and laser-pure fruit that Edna Valley is known for. The Meyer lemon, lime and kiwi flavors are firmed up with brilliant acidity leading to an impressively long, spicy finish.
title: Ortman Family 2006 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: This is a blend of several vineyards, instead of the winery's usual single-vineyard Chards. It's been tastefully assembled, and displays good Central Coast acidity framing tropical fruit and oak flavors with a stony, minerally edge.
title: Testarossa 2006 Castello Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Here's a county-appellated Chardonnay that shows how the art of blending can produce a really nice Chardonnay at a fair price. It shows bracing, cool-climate acidity and is quite dry, with a rich spicing of oak that gives a vanilla-cream smokiness to the peach and pineapple fruit.
title: Valley of the Moon 2006 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This unoaked Chard is bright and exuberant in ripe green fruits, such as Granny Smith apples, kiwis, limes, table grapes and mangoes. Acidity in this cool vintage is very high, and when I tasted it, it still had some fizzy fermentation. Technically this is a flaw, but it didn't interefere with my enjoyment.
title: Marimar Estate 2006 Acero Don Miguel Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Shows classic Edna Valley acidity, upfront and zesty, that stimulates the palate and brightens the modest lime, kiwi and vanilla oak flavors. This is a pleasant, easy Chardonnay to drink now.
title: Talley 2005 Oliver's Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: There's very little if any oak on this wine, which has a classic Central Coast profile of high acidity and bright, intense fruit. The flavors of limes, kiwis, passionfruit and vanilla finish long and bright. Good value in a classy, superdrinkable Chardonnay.
title: Hess 2006 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: The underlying wine in Beringer's '05 Reserve is a rich blend of tropical fruit, peach, pear and apple flavors. But the wine is overoaked, with 75% new wood in the barrel fermentation. Anyone sensitive to the taste of new oak will instantly recognize the immense cosmetic of smoky char, sweet vanilla, buttered toast and spicy, sappy wood essence, which seems excessive and not really needed.
title: Beringer 2005 Private Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Easily the best Chard from Stevenot I've tasted, for the quality of the structure. The wine is very dry and crisp, with mineral, lime, pink grapefruit and dried herb flavors. A great food wine.
title: Stevenot 2005 Gran Reserva Chardonnay (Calaveras County)

description: This is Iron Horse's first foray into native yeast winemaking, and the wine does have a yeasty, leesy quality, in addition to the usual dryness and minerality. In fact, this Chard is a little austere. Try giving it some years in the cellar.
title: Iron Horse 2005 Native Yeast Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: It's all about acidity and long hangtime with this Chard. The acids come from chilly, foggy nights, the ripeness from long, warm, sunny days. What you get is oodles of bright, pure pineapple, Granny Smith apple, Meyer lemon and spicy clove flavor, with a touch of caramelized oak for richness.
title: Husch 2006 Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: This is a new, reserve-style wine from veteran Ferrari-Carano. It shows its cool-climate origins in the brisk acidity that boosts well-ripened pineapple tart, green apple sauce, and Key lime pie flavors. It's also extremely oaky, and would be a better wine if it had less barrel influence.
title: Ferrari-Carano 2005 Tré Terre Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Tastes of new oak and is also acidic, a combo that makes the mouthfeel rather harsh and salty, despite obviously well-ripened fruit. May settle down and show softer, lusher notes in a year or so.
title: Ferrari-Carano 2005 Dominique Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Lots of rich, ripe, forward fruit in this well-oaked wine, with tart green apple, pineapple, lime and kiwi flavors. It's stylishly dry, with a nice, creamy finish.
title: Blackstone 2005 Sonoma Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: There's a minerality to this pleasantly dry Chard, a stony tang that dominates, although you'll find pineapple underpinnings. It's a leaner, more elegant style, and the winemaker has tried to enrich it with oak, sur lie aging and 50% malolactic fermentation.
title: Ferrari-Carano 2005 Fiorella Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Shows classic Edna Valley Chardonnay structure and flavor, a brightly acidic, minerally wine with a great burst of Key lime pie, ripe kiwi, pineapple custard, honey and vanilla oak flavors.
title: Tolosa 2005 Edna Ranch Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: From a cool appellation in a cool vintage, a balanced, drily crisp Chardonnay. Oak dominates, with toast, butterscotch and vanilla notes riding high over underlying green apple and kiwi fruit.
title: Carpe Diem 2005 Firepeak Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: I found the winery's regular '04 disappointing. This commemorative bottling is oakier and much riper in tropical fruit flavors, with non-malolactic crisp acidity and a buttercream texture. Somehow, though, it lacks the power and follow-through a great Chard should have, especially at this price.
title: Grgich Hills 2004 30th Anniversary Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: The vineyard is on the Carneros border, and this Chard has lots of juicy acidity, which may also be due to the winemaker picking the grapes at a relatively low ripeness level. The pepper- and mineral-infused flavors suggest peaches and grapefruits, enriched with new oak and lees. This is an extremely dry, food-friendly wine.
title: Gundlach Bundschu 2005 Rhinefarm Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Almost sweet in pineapple custard, marzipan and butterscotch flavors, and there may even be a bit of residual sugar in this honey-rich Chard. Saved by a crisp backbone of acidity.
title: De Loach 2005 OFS Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A little one-dimensional and on the soft side, but enormously rich in apple butter, pineapple custard, apricot jam, gingerbread, vanilla honey and sweet oak flavors.
title: Lolonis 2005 Chardonnay (Redwood Valley)

description: Here's a minerally, acidic, very dry Chard with a firm structure. Slightly earthy, it has citrus fruit, smoky oak and spice flavors, with a wet stone, metallic tang in the finish.
title: Stephen's 2005 MacBride Vineyard Chardonnay (York Mountain)

description: Lots of ripe tropical fruit in this wine, with pastry-filling pineapple, peach, butterscotch and vanilla spice flavors. Although technically dry, it has a richly honeyed finish.
title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2005 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: There aren't many Chards from this hilly Mendocino area. This wine shows dryness and ripeness, with a stony minerality undergirding peach custard and pineapple tart flavors, enriched with a satisfying touch of smoky oak.
title: Steele 2005 DuPratt Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino Ridge)

description: Shows rich, racy acidity in a dry wine whose flavors veer toward ripe pineapple-tart filling, cinnamon spice and butterscotch, wrapped in a creamy texture. Would score far higher if the fruit were more concentrated.
title: Schug 2005 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: The reserve Chardonnay is primarily taken from Atlas Peak, but like the regular Chardonnay is entirely barrel-fermented. Hints of butter, marshmallow and spice on the nose give way to flavors of citrus custard and melon on the palate. Finishes with some spicy oak notes.
title: William Hill Estate 2005 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Rewards for its rich, spicy oak, flamboyant flavors, and the crisp, juicy acidity that characterizes this cool coastal appellation. Pineapples, guavas, kiwis, limes and ripe peaches flood the mouth, leading to a dry, clean finish.
title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2004 Paragon Reserve Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Alderbrook is one of those insider wineries that does a good job at a fair price. This crisp, dry Chard is an elegant example of the long hangtime '05 vintage, with spicy tropical fruit, butterscotch and vanilla cream flavors.
title: Alderbrook 2005 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Brisk and dry, this Chard show an acidic brittleness to the tropical fruit, citrus and hay flavors. It makes up for in balance and elegance what it near misses in sheer pizzazz.
title: Rusack 2005 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Big, bold and a little obvious, this Chard's main feature is oak, and plenty of it. Smoky and charry, the wine also has big fruit, along the lines of apricot jam, peach cobbler and pineapples. Don't drink it too cold.
title: ZD 2005 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: After variable experience with Chardonnay, Peju is getting a grip. This wine, with nearly two-thirds new French oak, is fruity and crisp, with smooth, long pineapple and peaches and cream flavors.
title: Peju 2005 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: There's a firm minerality and an acidic mouthfeel to this that suggests some cellaring. The oak dominates, all smoky vanillins and wood-sweet, but the underlying fruit is enormously ripe. Give it a year or so to knit together.
title: Beauregard 2004 Beauregard Ranch Vineyard Chardonnay (Ben Lomond Mountain)

description: From the east side of Salinas Valley, this Chard hows great Central Coast Chard character, with crisp, clean acidity brightening the kiwi and lime flavors. Some  new oak adds welcome buttered toast and smoky vanilla complexities. Restaurateurs should scoop this up.
title: Estancia 2005 Pinnacles Ranches Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Lots of oak on this dry wine, which is clean despite its age. Crisp acidity frames tropical fruit flavors, wrapped into a creamy texture. Drink now.
title: Cottonwood Canyon 2001 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This bottling of Chardonnay, from one of the best white wine sites in Monterey, has kept its quality as well as its price over the years. Dry and zesty in acidity, it has a firm, stony minerality that underlies the apricot, white peach and grapefruit juice flavors. Shows real elegance, at a fair price.
title: J. Lohr 2005 Riverstone Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: From the large Vinco vineyard, in the middle of the appellation right on the River Road wine trail, comes this brisk, refreshing Chard. It's zippy in acids and very ripe, with apricot and nectarine flavors. The wine has had no malo, and the oak is fairly neutral.
title: De Tierra 2005 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is a moderately structured, lushly layered and unabashedly ripe white wine, rich and full-bodied in every way. Tropical mango and pineapple veer into baked flavors of additional concentration and voluptuousness.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 2016 Bow Tie Vineyard Estate Grown Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Lemon peels and apple rinds meet with steely, almost ashy aromas on the nose of this bottling. There is a good sizzle at first to the palate, which moves into apple-blossom, sour lime and toasted nuts flavors.
title: Sola 2016 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: This full-bodied, ripe and rich wine swells with melon and pineapple flavors and feels soft and lazy in texture. It has low acidity and a buttery thread running through it.
title: Iron Hub 2016 Small Lot Chardonnay (Sierra Foothills)

description: This medium-bodied white has soft rounded corners of structure and flavor, a mix of tangy lemon and crunchy Gravenstein apple. The oak is helpful and well incorporated.
title: Kokomo 2016 Mukaida Vineyard Winemaker's Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Hints of butterscotch and caramel in the aroma of this full-bodied wine are followed by baked apple and brown-sugar flavors and a rich soft texture. It has an appealing creaminess both in the flavors and the mouthfeel.
title: Jeremy Wine Co 2017 Shinn Vineyard Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Very light in color in the glass, this single-vineyard expression shows light chalky aromas on the nose alongside lemon peel and candied honeysuckle. Green-apple-flesh flavors pop on the palate with bright citrus flashes.
title: CrÅ« 2016 Paraiso Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is an amazing price point for a wine of quality and great vineyard sourcing. Steely high-toned acidity girds a midpalate that's low in oak and subdued in crisp apple fruit, with just a touch of tannin on the finish.
title: Amici 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: With a steely core of apple, pear and lemon, this wine takes on a considerable concentration of richness midpalate, with subtle oak playing a supporting role. The texture is creamy and voluptuously lush.
title: Char Char 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is estate-grown wine, crisp and sharply tense in acidity, the flavors marked by a distinction of green apple, pear and pineapple. The oak is measured and unobtrusive.
title: Etude 2016 Grace Benoist Ranch Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Robust on the palate, this wine opens in floral aromatics of jasmine and apple blossom. It follows flavorfully in Meyer lemon zest, tangerine and pineapple, combining firm structure with rounded approachability.
title: Folie à Deux 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This full-bodied white has an intensity of oak and baked fruit, which is a combination of apple and pear. Aromas of nutmeg accentuate the richness and warmth of the overall experience.
title: J. McClelland 2015 Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

description: Strong aromas of Anjou pear, honeysuckle and almond make for an aromatic entry to the nose of this bottling, which halts malolactic fermentation halfway through to preserve freshness. The palate is indeed fresh, with flavors of apple and white flowers.
title: Wrath 2016 Fermata Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Clean aromas of Asian pear rind, lime and chalk make for a very tightly woven nose on this bottling. Apple and pear-juice flavors dominate the broad palate.
title: Lucas & Lewellen 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Very floral aromas of honeysuckle, apple cream and tuberose show on the nose of this bottling from the Gallo-owned winery. There is also intense florality on the sip, where honeysuckle cream flavors meet with a chalky mouthfeel.
title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2017 Fleur de Edna Winemaker Series Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Ripe orchard fruit, apple blossoms and warm melon flesh show on the nose of this widely available bottling. Rounded flavors of lemon cream and salted cashew show on the palate, where acidity is prime.
title: Castle Rock 2017 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Loads of fresh and tropical aromas of pineapple, orange, pear and a hint of guava show on the nose of this bottling by the Riboli family. The palate is also a very showy style of Chardonnay, with solid acid and structure delivering flavors of guava, tuberose, mango and more pineapple.
title: Maddalena 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Fleshy and lush in baked apple, pear and fig, this wine has a balanced backbone of acidity that gives it a freshness around the fruit. It seriously overdelivers on price.
title: Josh Cellars 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This wine opens in high-toned aromas of jasmine and apple blossom and is textured on the palate. It takes on a full-bodied ripe concentration of baked apple and tropical flavors wrapped in sweet oak.
title: Artesa 2016 Estate Vineyard Block 92 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: Made of grapes sourced from several vineyards, including a few that the producer uses in single bottlings, this is a round and rich wine tasting of custard, vanilla and sweet pineapple.
title: Migration 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Moderate in acidity and midweight in ripeness and power, this offers lush flavors of caramel and baked apple before finishing simply and without much fuss.
title: Burt Street Cellars 2015 Herman Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Tart and tangy in apple and lemon, this white has a juicy midpalate of layered vanilla crème brûlée. It finishes dry and focused with a twist of lasting freshness.
title: Kunde 2016 Wildwood Vineyard Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: This is a delightfully crisp, seamless and simple white, the only wine made by this producer. Grapefruit, lemon and lime flavors contribute freshness to a crisp, floral personality that's unfussy and fun.
title: Kopriva 2017 Ricci Vineyard Unoaked Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Aromas of crisp apple, poached pear and a hint of chalk show on the nose of this widely available, reliable bottling. It's tightly wound on the palate, with pungent lime, pear and honeysuckle flavors.
title: Gnarly Head 2017 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: A an earthy streak adds a twist to the generous fruit and butter notes in this medium-bodied wine. It has smoky, wet-earth aromas, peach and apricot flavors and lively acidity.
title: Domaine Anderson 2016 Estate Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: This is a full-bodied white made in a bigger style, its flavors leaning into caramel apple, vanilla and sweet oak. It benefits from accents of gingersnap and nutmeg.
title: Artesa 2016 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: Aromas of fresh bread and baking spices lead to buttery appley flavors in this well-balanced and reasonably crisp wine. It is light to medium in body, but has a good sense of ripeness.
title: Bee Hunter 2016 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: This is a crisp, lemony and green apple-laden white with moderate oak and a bright streak of acidity that keeps it balanced and refreshing.
title: Vokel 2016 Starscape Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Broad peach, guava jelly and ripe apple aromas meet with botanical touches of gardenia and jasmine on the nose of this bottling. Crisp apple and edgy lime flavors show on the sip, which is pleasant but doesn't demonstrate as much barrel influence as the brand's name implies.
title: Art of the Cooper 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: This wine is very smooth and flavorful, on the oaky, buttery side of the spectrum but doing it well. Aromas like untoasted oak and butterscotch are vivid but not too strong and the flavors add in ample pear and baking spices.
title: Girasole 2017 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: Clean aromas of peach, lemon and pineapple move toward tropical ripeness on the nose of this bottling-a well-balanced white from the warm region. It's bright and fresh on the palate with guava, tuberose and sweet cream flavors.
title: Wilson Creek 2017 Yes Dear Happy Wife Vineyard Chardonnay (Temecula Valley)

description: Entirely barrel-fermented, then aged in French oak, this is a fully fleshy, robust white, plentiful in oak and power. The fruit-forward components are a mix of fig, mango and cinnamon toast.
title: Simi 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Apple syrup, lime rind and orange Creamsicle aromas show on the nose of this wine. It's rather ripe on the sip at first, with heavy oak-soaked apple flavors, but then a sharp lemon-juice acidity slices through, giving balance.
title: Riverbench 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This is tightly wound in its youth and shows great potential for further development. A reduced entry shows generous oak, burnt sugar and pineapple aromas and flavors, a rich, decadent expression of the vineyard that still needs time to come around.
title: Patz & Hall 2016 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Heady in vanilla brioche and sugary aromas, this wine has a steely midpalate that takes on a lushness toward the finish, a mix of baked apple and sweet cinnamon.
title: Mahoney 2016 Gavin Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Loads of pear and a lean hint of guava show on the nose of this bottling. Fleshy aromas of ripe pears and apples meet with a touch of tropicality on the clean palate.
title: Roblar 2017 Gold Collection Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Subtle aromas of lemon bar, white peach, passion fruit soda and chalk show on the nose of this bottling, which comes from one of the region's older properties. It's very zippy and fresh on the palate, and that racy character fades into Pink Lady apple and mandarin orange flavors.
title: Rancho Sisquoc 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Robust in pineapple and guava, with a generosity of oak, this is a concentrated, ripe and full-bodied white, that is fleshy and voluptuous in style. It offers a sweetness of tannin that emphasizes the ripe nature of the fruit.
title: VGS 2016 Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)

description: Sour lemon aromas meet with strong sandalwood and charred oak on the very woody nose of this bottling. Tangy lemon skin, lighter lemon blossom and viscous, nearly sweet oak flavors show on the palate, which is dominated by wood.
title: Byron 2015 Nielson Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Oaky, big and bold in flavor, this appellation wine is textured with highlights of lemon peel, pineapple and stone fruit.
title: Sonoma-Loeb 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Ripe apple and honeysuckle aromas meet with gunmetal on the nose of this bottling. Fresh citrusy flavors meet with toasted hazelnut, a hint of flint and chilled apple flesh on the palate.
title: Pali 2016 Highlands Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Fresh aromas of apple and pear juice meet with a touch of lemon rinds on the fruit-driven nose of this bottling by winemaker Nicolas Vonderheyden. It's crisp on the palate and easy to quaff with touches of seared lemon and peanut brittle.
title: Maison Areion 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Grainy and dense in caramelized oak, this robust wine shows ample ripeness and body on the palate, with a lasting taste of vanilla.
title: Della 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Aged in 100% stainless steel, this will appeal to fans of the style-a sleek, straightforward expression of tropical fruit and floral aromas. It has a smooth rounded palate of easygoing texture and light-bodied ripeness.
title: Bucher 2017 Bucher Vineyard Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Clean and familiar aromas of butter and lemon preserves make for a somewhat simple but very straightforward and crowd-pleasing take on Chardonnay. The same goes for the palate, where the buttery middle is cut by lemon rind on the edges, making for a mellow but tasty experience.
title: The Archivist 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Standard aromas of Pink Lady and Gala apples meet with seared pear on the nose of this bottling. There's a hint of sweetness to the palate, where pan-seared apples, butter, sea salt and warm peach tones make for a fairly rich experience.
title: San Simeon 2016 Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Upfront oak is tight-grained on the palate, before allowing layers of fennel and pear to come into focus. Medium bodied, the vineyard site shows both the character of a warm, even vintage and the excellence of the site.
title: Saintsbury 2016 Sangiacomo Green Acres Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Rounded Pink Lady apple aromas meet with pear blossom and chalk on the nose of this stainless steel wine brand by Wrath and winemaker Sabrine Rodems. Ripe apple and pear flavors show on the chalky sip, which is a solid option for lovers of the style.
title: Ex 2017 Unoaked Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Broad aromas of poached pear and coconut oil prove fairly ripe but clean and inviting on the nose of this bottling. Ripe apples and pears show on the palate, along with another flash of coconut flake.
title: Midnight 2017 Chardonnay (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

description: Honey and chamomile aromas are prominent on the mellow nose of this single-vineyard bottling. The flavors are quite subdued, with touches of honeysuckle and squeezed lemon.
title: Mansfield-Dunne 2016 Peterson Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling shows plenty of poached pear and tuberose on the fairly exuberant nose. The palate is quite tropical with flavors of coconut, papaya, mango and much more pear.
title: Koehler 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Extremely light in the glass, this single-vineyard expression shows pear, chalk, honeysuckle and lily aromas on the clean focused nose. There is grippy texture and bright acidity on the palate, where the flavors are quite tropical, with guava being dominant.
title: Kitá 2017 Hilliard Bruce Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: The college kids did well in this bottling, which offers Asian and Bosc pear on the delicate nose alongside hints of white flowers and toast. There is tension to the palate, showing flavors of toasted sourdough with lemon preserves.
title: Allan Hancock 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This is a thick, dense white with earthy floral and herbal characteristics. Stone fruit and vanilla make themselves known on the palate, evolving in the glass to show a richness of tropical flavor.
title: Fulcrum 2016 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: A broad pear aroma meets with lemon blossom, chalk and a steely minerality on the nose of this fairly priced bottling. There's a flash of ripe apple on the tip of the palate, then it fades into zesty melon rind. The acid is also strong in front, but flatter by the end.
title: Ballard Lane 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Hazelnut, browned butter, honeysuckle and strong orangesicle aromas show on the nose of this bottling, which fits into the classic California Chardonnay category. There's a rounded entry to the palate, offering flavors of Gravenstein apple and poached pear that are carried on chalky backbone.
title: Kendall-Jackson 2016 Jackson Estate Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Apple-skin aromas, lively fruit flavors and an almost chewy texture give a lot of presence to this medium-bodied wine. It has good structure, an appetizing mouthfeel and pleasant apple and lemon notes.
title: Sketchbook 2016 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: Soft lemon pith, light butter and a hint of marshmallow show on the nose of this bottling by the rock 'n' roll star Zac Brown. There is good grip at the tip of the sip and then lemon-lime sorbet flavors, which are pleasant if not overly complex.
title: Z. Alexander Brown 2016 Uncaged Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: With a strong opening note of matchstick, this wine offers an abundance of toasted oak on the nose as well, following up on the palate in buttery, rich and ripe flavors.
title: Hestan 2015 Chardonnay (San Francisco Bay)

description: This bottling is quite shy on the nose at this point of its life, offering faint aromas of pear flesh, chalk and preserved lemon. There is fairly light acid on the palate, which shows pear, nectarine, vanilla and toast flavors.
title: Sanford 2014 La Rinconada Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Caramel oak and toast come first to the nose, which shows a touch of reduction. Robustly rich in apple, pear and mango flavors, it also imparts a balance of high-toned acidity that helps keep the wine fresh in the glass.
title: Kenwood 2016 Green Valley Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a great price for a single vineyard Chardonnay, and is sure to be a crowd-pleaser, thanks to the familiar buttered toast and singed oak aromas, which are cut but a lemon-curd-pastry element. The palate falls in line with traditional California style, but done well and balanced, with oak, vanilla and marshmallow flavors.
title: Wente 2016 Riva Ranch Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Crème brûlée and oak dominate on the nose of this wine, which follows through with a ripe, viscous midpalate that's robustly abundant in fennel and spicy nutmeg.
title: Septentrio 2015 Special Reserve Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

description: Grainy, this wine is youthfully grippy and textured, with moderate acidity and layers of green apple, stone fruit and melon. Light on its feet, it's fresh and fleshy.
title: Saintsbury 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A light herbal aroma leads to fresh and tangy but subdued citrus flavors in this light-bodied wine. It was made without oak aging, so the lean lemon and crisp apple notes and light but firm texture define it.
designation: Unoaked Ernest Wente Vineyard Micro-Lot Reserve
title: Nottingham Cellars 2017 Unoaked Ernest Wente Vineyard Micro-Lot Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Delicate aromas of key lime, squeezed lemon and wet cement show on the nose of this widely available, affordably priced wine from the Center of Effort team. It's a lighter take on the palate as well, where fresh citrus spray, grapefruit and wet cement show.
title: Fossil Point 2016 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Broad aromas of yellow pear and nectarine meld with hints of butter and gunmetal on the nose. There is decent tension to the palate, where Bosc pear and Gravenstein apple flavors arise.
title: Clos LaChance 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Floral with a pretty nose of jasmine and apple blossom, this hearty full-bodied white has an underlying freshness of acidity that evolves into a thicker midpalate of ripe pineapple and mango. Its finish flourishes in nutmeg and ginger.
title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2016 DVC Estate Block 10 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The nose on this bottling starts with alkaline and quinine touches before evolving into fresh lemon blossoms, almonds and toast. The palate is toasty and nutty as well, set against a fresh citrus backdrop.
title: Talbott 2016 Logan Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Hazelnut and lemon-butter aromas make for a familiar and classic style on the nose of this bottling, yet there is a vibrant citrus twist and touch of herbs that add complexity. The palate is full of lime zest along with a touch of lanolin flavors.
title: Talbott 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is a cleanly made wine but done in such a powerfully classic Chardonnay style that it will please some but dissuade others. Golden in the glass, it shows aromas of ripe Gravenstein apples, lemon syrup, buttered toast and plumeria on the big nose. The palate is loaded with toasted oak, vanilla, caramel, hazelnut and marshmallow flavors, yet has zesty acidity.
title: Muirwood 2016 Zanetta Reserve Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: This is a smoky bottling, with wafts of hickory and oak overcoming the lemon blossoms, yet remaining quite inviting. The palate starts floral, with honeysuckle and orange blossom flavors, then moves toward lemon curd and sandalwood on the finish.
title: Noble Vines 2016 446 Chardonnay (San Bernabe)

description: The name comes from Hop Kiln, an old winery now reinventing itself, and this is a good start. Made partly from Dutton fuit, this Chard is dry and crisply acidic, with polished green apple, lime, kiwi and oak flavors.
title: HK Generations 2005 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Made from three prime growing regions, Russian River, Chalk Hill and Sonoma Coast, this Chard offers lots of complexity at a good price. It's a forthright wine, rich in peach pie flavors, including the smoky, buttery pie crust, and is entirely dry. Amazingly good when you consider the massive production: 185,000 cases.
title: Rodney Strong 2005 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Shows lots of sophistication at a good price. Brimming with ripe peach and mango fruit, there's a richer streak of butter-sautéed banana, finishing with caramelized honey. The wine is quite dry, even minerally, and modest in alcohol, only 13.5%. Best Buy.
title: Wente 2005 Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: The winery's name comes from the limestone that is found in this part of San Luis Obispo, and you can indeed detect a chalky minerality, not to mention high acidity that makes the fruit clean and bright. Shows tart green apple and peach flavors, and lots of Asian spice.
title: Calcareous 2004 Chardonnay (York Mountain)

description: There's plenty of tropical fruit and peach flavor in this wine, but also a rich, herbal earthiness, not to mention oaky barrel influences. It's a Chard to have with food.
title: Kent Rasmussen 2005 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: It must be the clone that lends a slightly heavy, earthy weight and flavor to this Chard, which is softer and more rustic than Foley's other '05s. The pineapple, lemon, guava and nectarine have a stewed or baked pie-filling quality. Quite good, but not really my favorite of the lineup.
title: Foley 2005 Rancho Santa Rosa Clone 76 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: I'm not sure what makes this Chard taste unbalanced, or maybe unready is a better word. All the pieces seem correct, especially the hedonistically ripe fruit, which spans the gamut from green apples and peaches to pineapples, guavas and nectarines. The oak is gorgeously creamy. Give it two to four years in the bottle, to let the parts knit together.
title: Testarossa 2005 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This deeply-flavored Chard comes from one of the coolest growing areas in California, and in this warm vintage, the grapes are perfectly ripe. They brim with white peach, pineapple, vanilla custard, tangerine and kiwi flavors, heightened and brightened with crisp acidity.
title: Mount Eden Vineyards 2004 Wolff Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: There's a streak of tart green apple running through this Chard that gives it a sweet and sour tang. Minerals, too, with a suggestion of lemony gunmetal or flint; you can almost taste chalk. This is a very good price for a dry, Chablis-style wine of real style and elegance.
title: Avila 2005 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Oaky and deeply flavored, with a wealth of passionfruit, mango and pineapple custard flavors, this Chard hails from a cool part of the mountains, but it's from a hot vintage. The combination of ripeness and acidity works well.
title: Thomas Fogarty 2004 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Bright acids liven up very ripe papaya, pineapple and Key lime pie flavors, wrapped in a rich, creamy texture. The wine finishes with lots of spicy, smoky oak.
title: Gloria Ferrer 2003 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Rich and full bodied, this is a tremendously ripe Chardonnay that explodes with peach custard, orange popsicle, pineapple, crème brûlée and cinnamon spice flavors, leading to a long, fruity finish.
title: Valley of the Moon 2005 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Acidity saves this wine. It's ripe in pineapple and peach pie filling flavors; the grapes soar to high sugars, compounded by a good amount of custardy oak. But that crispness balances it completely.
title: Russian Hill 2004 Gail Ann's Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Here's a stainless steel-fermented Chard that features nothing but cool-climate varietal flavor. It's a floral wine, reminiscent of unoaked New Zealand Chardonnay, with overtones of kiwi, lime, nectarine and vanilla, accented by bright acidity.
title: Keller Estate 2005 Oro de Plata Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Classic RRV Chard, bright in minerally acids, with a spectrum of flavors including pineapples, green apples, peaches and papayas. Lots of spicy, toasty oak, too.
title: Waugh Cellars 2005 Indindoli Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This cool-climate wine needs a warm vintage to show its best, and it certainly got heat in 2004. The result is a big, opulent wine with masses of tropical fruit flavors slathered in spicy oak. Yet it retains crisp, citrusy acidity, and has an elegant streak of minerality.
title: Cambria 2004 Katherine's Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: I like the oak on this wine, also the crispness, the tropical fruit flavors, but the creamy mouthfeel, and the way the fruit is yielding to a sweet nutty character. It's just beginning a slow down and should remain interesting through 2007.
title: Michaud 2002 The Pinnacles Chardonnay (Chalone)

description: With crushed pineapple flavors enhanced with a bit of oak, this wine gets the tastebuds watering. It has fine balance, elegance and varietal character. The winemaker recommends poached salmon, which, with a sprig of dill and a squirt of lemon, seems perfect.
title: Raymond 2004 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Here's a high-acid, minerally Chard, that's clean in citrus zest, pink grapefruit and richer peach and pear flavors. With a touch of smoky oak, it's balanced elegance.
title: Scherrer 2003 Scherrer Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Outwardly fruity, offering up a wealth of tropical papaya, mango and nectarine flavors, complete with a baked, buttery, vanilla-tinged base. Give it a little time to breathe or warm up; it seems to balance it.
title: Roche 2004 Reserve French Oak Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Quite a distinguished Chardonnay, with a streak of steely minerality that undergirds the Key lime pie and buttery, smoky oak flavors. The wine is very dry and has bright acidity.
title: Pellegrini 2004 Olivet Lane Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Very ripe and zingy in fresh kiwi, Key lime pie and vanilla flavors, with great acidity, this Chard could be mistaken for an Edna Valley. But it's a blend of six Santa Barbara vineyards. A bit of barrel fermentation makes it creamy and pie-crust buttery.
title: Babcock 2005 Rita's Earth Cuvée Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: With racy acidity, this palate-cleansing Chard shows a firm minerality undergirding Key lime pie filling and oaky, vanilla flavors. Fully dry, it's a good food Chard. Try with a creamy mushroom risotto.
title: Domaine Alfred 2004 Chamisal Vineyards Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: This junior version of Rusack's reserve is ripe in tropical fruit flavors and well-oaked, and the acids are bright and clean. Shows lots of sophisticated cool-climate Santa Barbara character at a fair price.
title: Rusack 2004 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Even at three-plus years, this Chard still tastes young and tight. It's perfectly dry, with high acidity and an earthiness that covers citrus and peach flavors. It will never be a big, over-the-top wine, but it's a fine one that should develop additional complexities over the next five years.
title: Merryvale 2002 Silhouette Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: White Oak has done a good job with Chard over the years, and this fruit-forward bottling offers lots of pleasure. Apples, peaches, kiwis and limes star in this crisply tart, dry wine, which is only lightly oaked.
title: White Oak 2004 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Fans of acidity will like this wine for its bright crispness that really gets  the tastebuds whistling. It's a very dry, streamlined wine, with citrus zest and vanilla flavors that will play well off a nice cracked crab and sourdough baguette.
title: Wolff 2004 Old Vines Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Like all Edna Valley Chards, this bottling is bone dry, with high acidity. The flavors are very citrusy, with richer notes of honeydew melon and sweet, oaky vanilla. This is a polished, elegant wine.
title: York Mountain Winery 2003 Unfiltered Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: A fresh, clean wine with lively acidity. This Chardonnay has lifted tangerine and pineapple flavors, plus a rich coat of oak that adds vanilla and buttered toast flavors. Drink now.
title: Cobblestone 2004 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: There's real consistency to Hendry's array of block-designated Chardonnays. This one shares those qualities of earthy, herbal, even tobaccoey notes along with apple and peach flavors. It shares also the dryness and softness. These are very distinct wines, and they have their place in the menu of California Chardonnay.
title: Hendry 2003 Blocks 9 & 21 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is a balanced, easy to drink Chardonnay, with citrus, peach and green apple flavors that have been finished with a veneer of smoky oak. It's totally dry. Do not overchill it, as it's a delicate wine that needs some warmth to open up.
title: De Loach 2004 OFS Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: If you're looking for a kosher Chard, try this one. It's a fine wine, rich in fruit, well-oaked and balanced, with the creamy, full-bodied mouthfeel you want in this varietal. The peach custard, pineapple and kiwi flavors are simply delicious.
title: Weinstock Cellars 2003 Cellar Select Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Here's a compact, young Chard that's tight in minerals and acidity, riding high over well-oaked tropical fruit and peach flavors. It's closed now, and should be allowed to breathe for a while. Drink now through 2009.
title: Merryvale 2003 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Byron's regular Chardonnay has historically been a very good wine. This continues that tradition, rich in tropical fruits, but extremely dry, with a stony minerality and high acids that stimulate the taste buds and call for rich fare.
title: Byron 2003 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: What's likeable about this wine is that it doesn't go for the cheap thrills of superripe fruit and form of oak flavoring so common in Chards of this price. What you get is a dry, minerally wine, with a firm spine and just enough peach and oak to make it rich and complex.
title: Moon Mountain Vineyard 2004 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A nice, basic Santa Rita Chard, very high in acids, with complex citrus peel, mineral and oak flavors. It's a clean, refreshing and balanced wine.
title: Melville 2004 Estate Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Ripe, rich and frankly delicious, this well-oaked Chard shows cool-climate acidity. The peach and pear flavors mesh perfectly with the vanilla and buttered toast from the barrels, creating a lush, complex wine.
title: Hanna 2004 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Made from organic grapes, this Chard has tremendously forward fruit flavors, ranging from ripe white peaches to tropical mangoes and guava. It's also well-oaked and juicy in acids. It's a powerhouse that, despite its age, tastes fresh and lively.
title: Silver Mountain 2001 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: A nice blended Chardonnay that displays finely ripe tropical fruit flavors and bright acids, as well as a rich coating of oak. This is the winery's basic Chard and showcases their flamboyant, New World style.
title: Testarossa 2004 Castello Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Intense and focused in peach, pineapple and lime fruit, with a liberal coating of smoky oak and a creamy, leesy texture, this Chard has bright, high acidity that cleanses the palate. It finishes with powerfully ripe fruit.
title: Husch 2004 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: This small appellation is a good, but little-known source of wonderfully crisp white wines. This Chard is dry but ripe in pineapple and vanilla cream flavors, with a rich coating of smoky oak. This is a good price for a wine of this complexity.
title: J. Lohr 2004 Riverstone Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: The regular Chard was released last spring. The Reserve, out now, is quite a better wine. It's rich, oaky and creamy, with a great big burst of tropical fruit and peach flavors and scads of sweet cinnamon and vanilla on the finish.
title: William Hill Estate 2003 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Apple sauce, peach purée, buttercream, vanilla and cinnamon spice flavors characterize this tasty Napa Chard. It has a scour of refreshing acidity and a long, pleasant, fairly complex finish.
title: Stags' Leap Winery 2004 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: There's an elegant balance to this wine, a mellowness that's partly due to its age, and partly to the winemaking talents of Dick Arrowood. Belies its price with real richness of fruit, oak, cream, acids and lees that impress.
title: Arrowood 2002 Grand Archer Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Here's a soft, full-bodied Chardonnay that has a distinct tang of minerality to it. It's also rich in green apple and white peach flavors, with a coat of toasty oak and a lingering trace of dried herbs on the finish.
title: Chalone Vineyard 2003 Chardonnay (Chalone)

description: Winemaker bells and whistles, such as smoky oak and creamy lees, star in this earthy wine, which has been re-released after two years. It doesn't seem at all old. There's enough peach and apple flavor to make it balanced.
title: Montona 2002 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: From one of the state's coolest growing areas comes this acid-filled, streamlined Chard. The flavors are of lime and tropical fruit, with a bracing streak of minerality. This balanced wine will be great with shellfish.
title: Rancho Arroyo Grande 2003 Estate Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Peaches and cream, buttered toast, a squeeze of vanilla and a dusting of cinnamon pretty much describes this tasty Chard. It has extra layers of complexity in the balance and long finish.
title: Kenwood 2004 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Very forward in ripe tangerine, peaches and cream, Key lime pie and Asian spices, this pretty Chard also has a coat of smoky oak. Those fruity flavors last through a long, rich finish.
title: Sanford 2003 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Here's a super-drinkable Chard. It's rich in jazzy lime custard, mango, peach and vanilla honey flavors, accompanied by bright acidity, all of it wrapped in a creamy texture. This is a great price for such a good wine.
title: Raymond 2003 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: By far the softest of Scherrer's Chards, this one's slightly earthy, like sautéed peach slices wrapped in grape leaves. It also shows its oak treatment in the char and vanilla notes, and tons of spice.
title: Scherrer 2002 Scherrer Vineyard Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: This Chard, from two famous vineyards, is a little too tart now for enjoyment. It has a roughness that detracts from the underlying fruit, while the oak sticks out. My hunch is that three or four years will reward your patience.
title: Bannister 2002 Rochioli & Allen Vineyards Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Very young now, with powerful acids and tightly wound white peach fruit, just nudging into pineapples. Accentuated with oak and lees. Finishes with a punch of minerality.
title: Nickel & Nickel 2003 John's Creek Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Rich, creamy and well-oaked, this Chard oozes tropical fruit, caramel and spicy vanilla flavors. It's sweetish in honey on the finish.
title: M. Cosentino 2003 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Not showing well now, but might be an ager. Tart and closed, with youthful acids, lees and oak crowding out the pear, litchi and hazelnut flavors. Could well become interesting after 2007.
title: Testarossa 2003 Brosseau Vineyard Chardonnay (Chalone)

description: Nice and crisp in acids, with a sleek oak coat that adds smoke and vanilla notes, this Chard sure tastes good by itself. But it's balanced and food-friendly, with flavors of perfectly ripened white peaches.
title: Smith-Madrone 2002 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Well-oaked, brimming with vanilla, buttered toast and sweet wood flavors, but the fruit below is big enough to take it. Spicy mango, guava, pineapple and honey, in a creamy, full-bodied texture. Not a bad price for a wine of this quality.
title: Belvedere 2003 Healdsburg Ranches Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Ripe in peaches, pineapples, crème brûlée, buttered toast, vanilla, and other big Chard notes, with a super-creamy texture. Finishes a bit hot and peppery.
title: M. Cosentino 2003 CE2V Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Lack of oak is not the problem here. There's scads of it, dripping with vanilla, buttered toast, caramelly char, the works. The fruit? Appley and pineappley, with a creamy texture and a hit of acids.
title: Dutcher Crossing 2003 Stuhlmuller Vineyard Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: More manipulated than Belvedere's Healdsburg Ranches bottling, showing the impact of sur lie aging in the slightly sour note that lends complexity to the oak and fruit. Dry and well-acidified, this needs something like cracked Dungeness crab to make it sing.
title: Belvedere 2002 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Crisp acidity marks this cool-climate wine. The acids balance out the sweet vanilla and oak, and the fruity flavors, which veer toward pineapple, mango and peach. There's a rich swirl of Asian spice throughout.
title: Testarossa 2003 Castello Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: A controversial wine with our panel. Some loved it for its idiosyncratic aromas and thick, unctuous mouthfeel, while others penalized it for the same characteristics. One reviewer's complex, hard-to-describe aroma was canceled out by another's earthy, mulchy scents. There is a solid core of peach and pineapple fruit, so on balance, our rating is positive.
title: Signorello 2003 Vielles Vignes Estate Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: There's an earthy tightness to this wine (as well as high acidity and a mineral-laden stoniness) that will not appeal to fans of big, ripe Chards. Consumers need to know that before buying. That said, it is elegant.
title: Foley 2002 Rancho Santa Rosa Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Less rich than the Heritage Reserve, but has much in common with it. It's crisp with toasty oak, pear and pineapple flavors, a creamy texture and a long finish.
title: Schug 2003 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Toasty and ripe in tropical fruit, vanilla and buttered toast, this is a fancy Chard at an everyday price. Stays clean with fresh acidity.
title: Two Tone Farm 2002 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Unoaked, and  with no malolactic fermentation, this clean, refreshing wine is bright in apple, peach and pear flavors. It has a rich vein of acidity.
title: Chatom 2003 Chardonnay (Calaveras County)

description: Long on fruity extract, rich in oak, this complex wine is packed with mango, papaya, apricot, peach, tapioca, vanilla and smoky aromas and flavors. The creamy texture is smooth.
title: Beauregard 2002 Bald Mountain Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Here's a cool climate Chard with bright, citrusy acidity that boosts its tropical fruit flavors. With a smoky edge of oak, and lots of tangy spices, it's clean and refreshing.
title: Laetitia 2003 Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Comes down firmly on the steely, cool-climate side, with high acidity and flavors of apples and citrus fruits. Sur lies aging adds richer, creamy and yeasty notes, while oak does its smoky, vanilla thing. An interesting, complex food wine.
title: Thomas Fogarty 2002 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Here's a ripe Chard that detonates the palate with tangerine, pineapple, peach and green apple, and a spicy seasoning of oak. It has a creamy texture and a sweet, fruity intensity that finishes with a scour of orange peel. Delicious.
title: Hawley 2003 Foppoli Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Brimming with zesty, citrusy acidity, this Chard is bright and a bit earthy. The underlying flavors of limes and apples are sweetened with toasty oak. Finishes spicy and long.
title: Peters Family 2002 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Here's a great food Chard. It's not one of those overblown, oaky wines, but has apple and white peach flavors with overtones of stony minerals and dried herbs. Finishes with a scour of tart acidity.
title: Flora Springs 2002 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Here's a Chard with lots of ripe apple, pear and fig flavors and zesty acidity. Oak adds vanilla and buttered toast notes. This great food wine is subtle and very enjoyable.
title: Sterling 2002 Winery Lake Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: From the cooler Oak Knoll district, a spicy, ripe Chard that's big in everything. Super tropical fruit flavors, lavishly toasted new oak, lots of lees and all the other bells and whistles.
title: M. Cosentino 2002 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Shows some nicely ripened pear and peach flavors that are enriched with sweet vanillins and toasty oak and a hit of yeasty lees. A firm spine of acidity provides cleanliness and balance to this tasty Chard.
title: Rodney Strong 2002 Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)

description: It explodes with vanilla, buttered toast and smoke, but there's a lot of apple and pear fruit, too. The texture is creamy and the finish is spicy on this lovely, complex wine.
title: Geyser Peak 2002 Reserve Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: From chilly Green Valley, this wine was released at the same time as the winery's regular Dutton Ranch bottling. It's a shade richer, infused with a streak of mango that fattens and sweetens the earthy, herbal flavors. Marked by bright acids.
title: Dutton-Goldfield 2002 Dutton Ranch Rued Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Earns its stripes with ripe flavors of passion fruit, guava, mango and other tropical fruits whose sweetness is balanced by crisp acidity. They really jammed the oak on, so there's a ton of toast, spice and vanilla.
title: Three Saints 2002 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: You'll find a wine that's tight and shut down right now. It has strong acids and even some tannins, with citrusy flavors that have a hint of pear. Could use more generosity.
title: Taylor 2002 Hillside Chardonnay (Stags Leap District)

description: Nobody ages Chardonnay, but maybe they should, as the profile of these coastal Chards emerges. This  wine is high in acidity, metallic and lemony in fruit. There's a toughness that the softening, sweetening qualities of oak cannot blur. It's a gamble, but try cellaring until 2005 and try again.
title: Sullivan Birney 2002 Sonoma Coast Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Here's a fat wine, plump in juicy citrus, pear and tropical fruit flavors, a little soft in acid but rich in smoky oak and Asian spice. It's gooey, like lemon meringue pie, and finishes a bit sweet, in the current fashion.
title: Sullivan Birney 2002 Sonoma Mt. Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)

description: Walter Schug likes his "Chards creamy, not buttery," and this one fits the bill. Yellow peach, banana and toast flavors complement the creamy, fat mouthfeel. Finishes clean and bright. Aged six months sur lie.
title: Schug 2002 Barrel Fermented Sur Lie Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Tutti-frutti  and jammy flavors mingle with plenty of toasty oak to provide for a rich, satisfying Chard. You'll find peaches and pears, apples and pineapples and lots of spices, especially in the long, crisp finish.
title: Clos Pegase 2002 Mitsuko's Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Oak and lees add extra layers of complex interest to this smooth wine. It has pretty flavors of apples, peaches and honeydew, and those Monterey acids are firm and bright. The finish is notable for its rich spices and length.
title: Joullian 2001 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: A smooth textured wine, with pretty caramel, apricot, peach, melon, butterscotch, herb and citrus flavors. Fairly rich, yet clean on the finish.
title: Foley 2001 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This is a bold, rich Chard with flavors ranging from apples and pears through hints of pineapple. Oak brings nuances of smoke, vanilla and buttered toast. The crisp mouthfeel leads to a long, spicy finish.
title: Stuhlmuller Vineyards 2001 Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: If you like them rich and oaky, this Chard's for you. Tropical fruit, pear and peach flavors are mingled with smoke, vanilla and buttered toast to forge a strong, flashy wine.
title: Charles Creek 2002 Las Patolitas Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Creamy and smooth, a wine with the texture of taffeta, and for those who like their Chards toward the citrusy, appley side. The extra lees aging gives it a sour mash flavor that, combined with the brisk acids, is distinctive.
title: Marimar Torres 2001 Dobles Lias Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Lots of extracted fruit in this spicy, oaky wine, including mango, papaya and pineapple, with notes of ripe pear and banana. Oak barrels and malolactic fermentation add a creamy, buttery texture. Lavish, although it could use more complexity.
title: Diamond Oaks de Maniar 2000 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A delicious, easy-drinking Chard with plenty of complexity to boot. The apple and pear flavors are accented with toasty oak and a dash of creamy lees. It's a dryish wine, with an harmonious flourish of ripe green apple on the finish.
title: Benziger 2001 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Oaky and tart, a big wine with strong flavors of citrus fruits, green apples and dusty brown spices. Crisp acidity adds a steeliness that is almost minerally. This sleek wine is not a big, fat opulent blockbuster, but is refined and controlled through the spicy, oaky finish.
title: St. Francis 2001 Behler Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: This year's release is young, tight and oaky. Hard to smell much beyond well toasted oak, lees and roasted hazelnut, but there's a suggestion of tropical fruits. In the mouth, the flavor of sweet, smoky oak dominates. Hard to tell where it's going. Give it a few months in the cellar to knit together.
title: Franciscan 2001 Cuvée Sauvage Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Hand it to Navarro to make satisfying wines and keep the prices modest. This is a well-structured Chard with flavors ranging from citrus through tart green apples to tropical fruits, and has a firm streak of acid. The ginger-cinnamon finish is very long.
title: Navarro 2001 Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: A "winery within a winery" from Talbott vineyards, and a good value. The intensely ripe tropical fruit flavors have a spicy edge, and have been well oaked and aged on the lees. Before the recent glut, you would have paid a lot more money for a wine of this quality.
title: Kali Hart 2001 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Crisper and brighter than Schug's Sonoma Valley bottling, with more upfront acids, its flavors veer more toward citrus fruits, although there are touches of exotic nectarine and guava. The creamy richness comes from oak and lees. Feels long and rich in the mouth; a wine to savor and enjoy.
title: Schug 2001 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Less fruity, more minerally, it's more restrained than the Upper Barn, with melon and citrus playing supporting roles before toasty oak comes on in a rush at the finish.
title: Stonestreet 1999 Block 66 Alexander Mountain Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Held back probably to tame fierce acidity, and it's still a young, lean, tart wine. Fresh, juicy flavors of lemons drink very clean and vibrant, but it's austere stuff. Try with goat cheese on toast.
title: Kendall-Jackson 1999 Great Estates Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This year the wine displays a tight structure of high acidity framing flavors of minerals, stones, and lime. On the finish a rich vein of tropical fruit and spice shows up. This young, steely wine possesses great authority and style, and may be an ager.
title: Wente 2001 Riva Ranch Reserve Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Milla Handley's estate wine is firmer and more acidic than her Sonoma bottling. It is a racy wine that brightens the palate with a malic acid edge of mineral. The flavor profile is thoroughly tart green apple. This crisp young wine will pair well with a wide range of food.
title: Handley 2001 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: Loads of sweet pineapple and vanilla mark this richly succulent wine. Super-concentrated fruity flavors blast the palate, leading to a long finish. For all its ripeness, the wine is dry. Strong and tasty stuff!
title: Le Vin 2000 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A pleasant, citrusy Chardonnay, but one that is well-oaked, with the resulting aromas and flavors of vanilla and buttered toast. Lemon and lime flavors veer into riper peach, and are wrapped in a creamy texture. Acidity is quite high and bursts on the palate with a mouthwatering zest.
title: Saintsbury 2001 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: The underlying fruit has flavors that veer toward green apple tart, with the baked, sweet taste of pie crust. Acids are crisp and uplifting. A generous overlay of oak and lees adds the final touches of buttercream and a rich texture to this nice, foodworthy wine.
title: WillowBrook Cellars 2001 Owl Ridge Vineyards Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This isn't a big, blowsy wine, but a balanced and elegant one, with everything in its proper place. Apple and peach flavors are restrained, and so is the oak. The wine is dry, and crisp acids leave the palate clean and ready for food.
title: Clos du Val 2001 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Good, rich Chard, nicely packed with ripe flavors of white peach, apple and pear. A solid overlay of toasty oak adds smoky, spicy notes and a creamy texture. Finishes smooth and polished.
title: Charles Krug 2001 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Made from best barrels, this wine offers more richness and satisfaction than Merryvale's Reserve bottling, although it's far from a big wine. Flavors of peaches and apples are restrained. Oak plays a vital role here in enriching and fattening the wine.
title: Merryvale 2000 Silhouette Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A wine of considerable interest and depth. The flavors are lemon-and-limey, with notes of fig and cinnamon and smoky scents from oak. Drinks tart in acids, with some bitterness in the finish. However the balance and elegance are attractive.
title: Chateau St. Jean 2001 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A good Chard that balances ripe, forward flavors with a degree of delicacy and balance. The flavors veer toward sweet citrus fruits, peaches and pears, spiced up with a touch of smoky oak. Crisp acids and peppery spices hit on the long finish.
title: Bouchaine 2001 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Here's a tight, lemon-and-lime flavored wine with crisp acidity, for those who like their Chards on the steely, minerally side. It's very clean,refreshing and sleek, and the winemaker did not slather a ton of oak on the fresh, pretty fruit.
title: White Oak 2000 Myers Limited Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Quite bright, with zippy acidity. The fruit flavors lean toward melon, peach, pear, lemon and spice flavors. Pretty vanilla aromas are up front, but the style is leaner than this winery's other single vineyard Chardonnays. A first release from this vineyard. -J.M.
title: Gallo of Sonoma 2001 Two Rock Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Here's a good, rich Chardonnay, distinctive for its ripe array of tropical fruits, pears, peaches and oriental spices. It feels crisp and clean in the mouth, and finishes rich and spicy.
title: Cloninger 2000 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: A clean Chard exhibiting rich South Coast characteristics of high acidity and tropical fruit. Oak plays a supporting role and provides a creamy texture. The wine is tight, but should improve.
title: Kendall-Jackson 2000 Great Estates Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Ripe, oaky and rich, a good example of Russian River Chard with its green apple, mineral and spicy flavors, crisp acids, ripe tannins and firm, polished structure. Balanced and clean, a very pretty wine.
title: Huntington 2000 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A fresh, vibrant wine that displays lemon and tart green apple flavors and a great heap of acid. Steely and clean, it cleanses the mouth. Try cellaring for a year or two and see what happens.
title: Kendall-Jackson 2000 Great Estates Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Lush and full-bodied, this is a fruit-driven wine made complex by charry oak and creamy lees. Ripe peach and pear flavors are buoyed by refreshing acidity. Possesses elegance and harmony, making it very drinkable. -S.H.
title: Buena Vista 1999 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Opens with citrus and apple flavors backed up with considerable acidity. Not very oaky or big, but dry and balanced, with a steely, minerally finish. -S.H.
