description: This ultrapremium Chardonnay is laden with pineapples, nectarines and the buttered toast and caramel of oak. It tries hard to make a statement, and is actually quite rich and flashy, but it could come from anywhere.
title: Bratcher 2010 Mary Ellis Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Groth's Chardonnays are never brilliant, as their red wines dependably are. But they are consistent. This '11 is on a par with recent vintages, showing ripe, drink-me-now pineapple, lemondrop candy and oak flavors.
title: Groth 2011 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is a fun Chardonnay to drink. It tastes of honey, tropical fruit and orange flavors, with the buttered toast and vanilla of oak barrels. It also has an interesting minerality. Gets better as it warms in the glass, so don't drink it too cold.
title: MacMurray Ranch 2011 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The combination of a cool growing region and a cool vintage have made this wine very tart, with low alcohol. Don't look for fat, opulent tropical fruits here. Instead, you'll find lemons, limes and mangoes, complex and mouthwatering.
title: Stolo 2011 Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)

description: The oak is strong on this blend of three of the winery's best vineyards. It shows up as buttered toast, with a distinctive, charry-sweet note of toasted marshmallows. The wine is strong in pineapples and oranges. An eccentric Chardonnay for drinking now.
title: Joseph Swan Vineyards 2011 Cuvée de Trois Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Shows lots of structure, with brisk acids, firm, granitic minerals and even a dusting of tannins. The flavors are evenly divided between sweet citrus fruits and new oak. Not an ager, but a wine of finesse and elegance.
title: Joyce 2011 Black Mountain Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Tastes rich and flashy now, with a rich array of oranges, pineapples and peaches, accented with oak. The acidity is just fine. Hanzell Chardonnays have a history of aging, so try stashing it for six years and see what happens.
title: Hanzell 2010 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Comprised of equal parts sweet, toasty oak, brisk acidity and ripe tropical fruit and citrus flavors, this Chardonnay is successfully made in the popular style. It's creamy and rich, with a vanilla honey sweetness. Easily Ventana's best Chard ever.
title: Ventana 2011 Estate Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Lots of ripe pineapple, peach and tropical fruit flavors in this Chard, as well as a nice hit of sweet, smoky oak, with a honeyed finish. It's certainly rich, but the acidity is strong.
title: Fritz 2009 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A light, lemony and crisp Chardonnay with a long, lemony finish begging for fresh seafood and spice-think fish tacos-Husch's Vine One has a hint of just-ripe pear layered in, too. Refreshing and aromatic, this is an all-around great value that'll pair well with a wide range of foods.
title: Husch 2011 Vine One Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: This rich, ripe wine hits all your Chardonnay sweet spots. It's honeyed in tropical fruits, with oaky notes of buttered toast and vanilla. The best thing is the clean, zesty acidity.
title: Firestone 2011 Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This is sort of a junior version of Talbott's more expensive Sleepy Hollow Chardonnay. It resembles it in many ways, offering concentrated tropical and citrus fruit flavors, highlighted by brisk acidity and wrapped into a creamy texture.
title: Talbott 2011 Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Logan Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: A great value from Wente, this is a layered, bright and intensely lemon-tinged Chardonnay, worth stocking up for simple dinners and get togethers where you know a lot of people will want to drink white.
title: Wente 2011 Morning Fog Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Lynmar has released this, the first of their 2012 Chardonnays, early, in order to let the fruit star. It's flashy, like a conga line of pineapples, oranges, mangoes, limes and papayas. Tasty, direct and appealing, it would be amazing with bacon-wrapped shrimp.
title: Lynmar 2012 Laguna Ridge Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Winemaker Greg Morthole plays all the bells and whistles on this Burgundian-style Chardonnay. Barrel fermentation brings toast and sweet vanilla to the tropical fruit and green apple flavors, while the full malolactic fermentation adds notes of buttered popcorn. The acidity is racy and clean.
title: Davis Bynum 2011 River West Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Very ripe and fruity, offering wave after wave of pineapple, orange, mango, peach, green apple and vanilla. Tastes honeyed and ripe in fruity essence, but fundamentally this is a dry wine. Brilliant acidity helps to provide a clean balance.
title: Balletto 2011 Teresa's Unoaked Estate Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Attractive for its rich creaminess, this Chard aims for the popular style and succeeds. It's soft and rich in orange, peach, apricot and mango fruit, with sweet-oak overtones of vanilla and buttered toast.
title: La Crema 2011 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Lean, dry and minerally, with tart flavors of grapefruit, lemon peel and Asian pear. The acidity is refreshingly crisp. This is a bottling that rarely does well in blind tastings because it's so austere. But it is elegant.
title: Mayacamas 2010 Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)

description: This bottling is showing its age, with the fruit character picking up a hazelnut, brown butter, honey and mushroom character. A very interesting wine, and worth the price to see how a proper Chardonnay ages. Drink over the next year or two before it falls apart.
title: Hideaway Creek 2008 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Made in a more popular style than Calera's Mt. Harlan bottling, this Chard features lush flavors of pineapple and orange jam, honey and vanilla. The acidity is bright and mouthwatering.
title: Calera 2011 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This is one of Lynmar's most expensive Chardonnays, of their six 2011s. It's also one of the most forward and oakiest. Your first impression is of sweet buttered toast, sprinkled with brown sugar and drizzled with melted butterscotch. Then the tropical fruits kick in, brightened with citrusy acids. It's an impressive feat, but the wine feels overworked, and lacks the sustaining interest of Lynmar's other bottlings.
title: Lynmar 2011 Monastery Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Good price for a Chard this balanced and easy to drink. It's dry and finely balanced in acids and oak, with pleasant citrus, pear and tropical fruit flavors. Enjoy with a simple but luxurious meal of cracked crab and buttered bread.
title: Eberle 2011 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Honey, lemon-drop candy, vanilla and buttered toast are the flavors on this fine, crisply acidic Chardonnay. Clean and easy to sip, at a good price for the quality.
title: Francis Coppola 2011 Director's Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: How about a pizza with prosciutto, mushrooms and mozzarella cheese with this dry, tart Chardonnay? The keen acidity will cut through the richness, while the suggestion of sweet, toasted oak will play well with the meat's umami smokiness.
title: Tolosa 2010 Estate Tolosa Vineyards Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: A fine Chardonnay, filled with ripe flavors yet minerally and tart in acidity. Waves of citrus and tropical fruits wash over the palate, enriched with toasty oak. Offers lots of bang for your buck in a ripe, flashy California Chard.
title: Testarossa 2011 Cuvée 107 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: A good example of how well the Central Coast can make Chardonnays that satisfy even without oak barrel aging. The wine is clean and brisk in acidity, with ripe flavors of limes, kiwis and green melons.
title: Tolosa 2011 No Oak Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This isn't a rich, knock-your-socks-off Chardonnay, but it is extremely elegant and tailored. Brisk with acidity and fine minerality, it's bone dry, with Asian pear and lime flavors. Call it Chablisian.
title: Alma Sol 2011 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Though not much Chardonnay is grown in Rutherford, this one's pretty good with rich citrus and tropical fruit flavors accented with buttered toast. It's a little soft and herbal, but feels festive.
title: D.R. Stephens 2011 Chardonnay (Rutherford)

description: Shows the herbal quality that often marks this winery's Napa Chardonnay, with a tobacco and sage edge to the citrus fruit and Asian pear flavors. The structure is balanced with brisk acidity and even some oaky wood tannins.
title: Grgich Hills 2010 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: An extreme wine from an extremely cool site in an extremely cool vintage, Handley's estate Chardonnay is intriguingly tart, crisp and low in alcohol, yet textured and unique. Sip it on its own or pair with buttery shellfish or goat cheese on crackers.
title: Handley 2011 Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: Great price for a Chardonnay this good. This displays a creamy, buttery framework, with vanilla, lime, peach and mango flavors, highlighted by zesty acidity.
title: Rancho Sisquoc 2010 Flood Family Vineyards Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Good price for a Chardonnay this sophisticated. It shows ripe tropical and citrus fruit, honey and oak flavors, with delicate acidity. Perfect with crab and buttered sourdough bread. Drink it now, but not too cold.
title: Isabel Mondavi 2011 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Made from fruit sourced from McFadden's certified-organic vineyard, this bright Chardonnay is a zesty mix of kiwi, lime and fig flavors that are layered with acidity.
title: Horse & Plow 2011 McFadden Farm Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Trading opulence for elegance, this Chardonnay tastes dry and streamlined, with tart acidity. It's spicy, fresh and lithe, and it offers subtle citrus and flower notes.This should develop creamy, nutty tones over the next six years.
title: La Feníªtre 2010 Los Alamos Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This has brisk, tingly acidity and rich, toasty new oak flavors, plus mineral and fruit notes. Try this in 2015 as it could become surprisingly complex.
title: La Feníªtre 2010 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This has a rich note of caramel, plus undertones of baked apple and tropical fruit. The acidity is keen and the finish is long, with vanilla and butter notes. It's aged in 40% new French oak, and it has the roundness to show for it.
title: Nottingham Cellars 2011 Fraser-Howard Vineyard Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: With its keen acidity and mineral-dominated flavors, this currently tastes a bit austere. It also has a core of orange, apricot and mango flavors that are sweetened by oak. Don't drink it too cold, and allow it to breathe before consuming.
title: Keenan 2011 Chardonnay (Spring Mountain District)

description: This is a complex Chardonnay, with flavors of honey, tangerine, apricot and toffee that are balanced by the crisp, citrusy acidity.
title: Geyser Peak 2010 Block Collection Water Bend Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: This Chardonnay has crisp acidity, plus notes of pineapple-orange jam, vanilla custard and lees. For drinking now, this will pair well with shellfish.
title: Dutton-Goldfield 2011 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This boasts citrus fruit, lemongrass and buttercream flavors that are brightened by zesty acidity. It's clean and complex, and it's a fine wine to drink with shellfish in rich buttery sauces.
title: Kalaris 2011 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: An ultrazesty, lemony Chardonnay, this has razor-sharp acidity that should mellow out when paired with the right foods, like seafood in a creamy sauce.
title: Navarro 2010 Premiere Reserve Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: Rich and ripe, this wine has orange, mango, apricot and vanilla flavors, accented by bright acidity. It offers immediate appeal to fans of the oak-driven Chardonnay style.
title: JCB 2011 No. 81 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Leaner and earthier than many Chardonnays, with notes of green and dried herbs alongside the citrus and tropical fruits. Oak plays a modest role. All in all, this discrete wine is best enjoyed now.
title: Clos du Val 2011 Lone Cypress Ranch Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Lots of orange, mango, vanilla cream, buttered toast and cinnamon spice flavors characterize this Chardonnay, which uses grapes that are sourced mostly from the Arroyo Seco region. It tastes candied, but refreshing acidity and a keen minerality lift it above the ordinary.
title: San Simeon 2010 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Strong in citrus and tropical fruit flavors, powerful in oak, with a blast of acidity, this is an ambitious Chardonnay, but it's a bit aggressive. It may calm down in a year or two. Meanwhile, decant it and enjoy with lobster or scallop dishes.
title: Tuck Beckstoffer 2010 Semper Ulises Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a very pretty, polished wine for drinking now. It has rich, creamy flavors of tropical fruit and sweet, smoky oak that are brightened by crisp acidity.
title: Simi 2010 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a strongly flavored Chardonnay, with powerful notes of ripe mango, pineapple, papaya and oak. Its intensity of fruit is impressive. What it lacks in subtlety, it makes up for in sheer power.
title: Ram's Gate 2010 Sangiacomo Vineyards Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This Chardonnay emphasizes structural elegance and mineral-driven acidity, rather than opulence, although you'll find good citrus and tropical fruit flavors. With a dry finish, it's a fine Chardonnay to drink with chicken, ham, salmon or pork, or a nice dish of buttery pasta with peas and Parmesan.
title: Bargetto 2010 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This takes ripe fruit and oak influence to the limits, with powerful flavors of buttered toast, pineapple, orange jam and vanilla-cream. This defines the flashy style of California Chardonnay, with a honeyed finish.
title: Pont de Chevalier 2010 Chardonnay (Knights Valley)

description: Dry, creamy and crisp in acidity, this has rich pineapple, lemon, lime and buttered toast flavors. It's easy to drink and enjoy.
title: Martin Ray 2011 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Crisp and lean, with mineral, lemon and ripe grapefruit flavors, this is enriched with a sweet note of honey. The acidity is keen, and while the wine is a little severe, it's so elegant. Drink now.
title: Amos Cellars 2010 Churner Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Brisk acidity and a steely, minerally dryness make this Chardonnay particularly savory. The citrus flavors suggest limes and Meyer lemons, with suggestions of toast and vanilla. It's an elegant wine and easily worth the price.
title: Shale Canyon 2010 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Fine acidity, dryness and a cold minerality undergird the tropical fruit flavors, making it particularly likeable and food friendly. It showcases the ability of this little appellation in the middle of the Salinas Valley, just below the Santa Lucia Highlands, to ripen white wines.
title: Joullian 2010 RogerRose Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Here's a racy, chiseled Chardonnay, with a pleasant veneer of smoky, buttered toast from new oak that enriches the lime and peach fruit. Elegant rather than powerful, it's a food-friendly wine. Try with lobster risotto.
title: The Federalist 2010 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Bone dry, acidic and subtle in citrus and tropical fruit flavors, this is a Chardonnay that doesn't insist on standing on its own. Instead, it's perfectly content to let the food star, remaining in a supporting role. For pairings, lobster risotto comes to mind, or just a delicious mayonnaise-based sandwich.
title: Justin 2011 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Everything in this wine is strong and obvious: With its powerful tropical fruit, sweet oak and intense finish, this is what many Americans like in Chardonnay. But as impressive as the winemaker's art is here, the flash is all on the surface. Drink up.
title: Freeman 2010 Ryo-Fu Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description:
This shows a deft touch in its balance of ripe tropical and pear fruit and sweet oak 
influence. This is varietally proper and marked by brisk Monterey acidity, lending itself to drinking with a wide variety of foods.
title: J. Lohr 2010 Arroyo Vista Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: There's lots of citrusy acidity in this vineyard-designated Chardonnay, giving it the fresh bite of a green apple, pineapple and Meyer lemon. This is pleasantly rich and creamy, with oak aging imparting a buttered toast note.
title: Bernardus 2010 Soberanes Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: There are lots of pineapple, peach and buttered toast flavors in this opulent wine, brightened by crisp acidity. It has a purity of fruit that makes it attractive.
title: Schug 2010 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is dry, crisp and minerally; it's made in a lighter style that makes it especially food friendly. The flavors suggest oranges, apricots and tart Meyer lemons.
title: Chalone Vineyard 2010 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: A light-golden Chardonnay that does its county proud. It's lively and bright, with medium weight and flavors of sweet lemon custard, apple, and a lime-zest-dominated finish. This is a very good wine at a very fair price that should pair with an assortment of dinner fare.
title: Parducci 2010 Small Lot Blend Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: A solid wine, rich in oak-inspired orange, apricot and Asian pear flavors, with a spicy, creamy finish. The acidity is notable, making this Chardonnay brisk and clean.
title: Girard 2010 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A big improvement over the '08 bottling, the winery's '09 is dry and tart in Central Coast acidity, with pure, clean flavors of tangerine, vanilla and buttered toast. It's a lovely Chardonnay; drink now.
title: Center of Effort 2009 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: This wine continues to be big, with bold fruit and notable oak and lees influence. It's as full bodied as a red wine, with flavors of apricot, orange, buttered toast and yeasty cream flavors. Drink up.
title: Signaterra 2010 West Rows Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Here's a smooth, creamy Chardonnay for drinking now. It has good weight, with a deep center of citrus, peach and buttered toast flavors. Russian River Valley acidity makes it racy and clean.
title: Arrowood 2009 Alary Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Bone dry and strong, this Chardonnay displays concentrated citrus, apricot and peach flavors that are heavily influenced by the toast of oak barrels. It's flashy, although a touch heavy and meant for consuming now.
title: Pride Mountain 2010 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: An exotic Chardonnay, this is reminiscent of a Rhône white wine, with its honeysuckle, mineral, apricot, tangerine and sautéed banana flavors. It's certainly savory. Don't drink it too cold.
title: Stark 2009 Windsor Oaks Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Apricot jam and late-harvest botrytis flavors are often characteristic of this vineyard. This is bone dry, with brisk acidity and stony minerality. It will gradually lose fruit over the years.
title: Arcadian 2007 Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: An interesting and even somewhat eccentric wine. There are notes of green tea and herbs, but enough pure orange fruit to make it rich. Lots of zingy acidity, too.
title: Fontes & Phillips 2009 Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Oak dominates this Chardonnay in its buttered toast, caramel and butterscotch flavors. Buried under that are pleasantly ripe pineapples and lemons. The winery suggests it will age through 2020, but that seems doubtful.
title: Sarah's Vineyard 2010 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Clara Valley)

description: New oak sticks out on this Chardonnay, with buttered toast and vanilla dominating the tropical fruit, orange and Meyer lemon flavors. It's finely constructed, with deft acidity and a stony minerality. Drink now-2013.
title: Melville 2010 Verna's Estate Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Bonterra excels with this leaner, lighter, brighter form of Chardonnay. Made out of organically grown grapes, it's crisp as a green apple, with just a trace of butterscotch on the otherwise lemony finish.
title: Bonterra 2010 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: Lush, creamy and smooth, with buttered toast, lemon custard, críªme brulée and spice flavors. Maybe a little overworked, but it satisfies Chardonnay cravings.
title: J. Wilkes 2008 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: With just a bit of oak adding a note of buttered toast, this bone-dry, high-acid Chardonnay tantalizes with savory citrus fruit enriched with pear and honeysuckle. From Talley, and made from their vineyards in the Edna and Arroyo Grande valleys. Good price for a Chardonnay this elegant.
title: Bishop's Peak 2010 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: If the modern California style of exceptionally ripe fruit and sweet, smoky oak appeals to you, you'll love this wine. It's an explosion of pineapple jam, tangerine and vanilla cream flavors, brightened with crisp acidity. Not very subtle, but flamboyant. Calling all shellfish to the dance floor.
title: Alysian 2009 Russian River Selection Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Strongly flavored, in the way of certain Santa Lucia Highlands Chardonnays, with dried apricot, pineapple and oak flavors. There may even be some botrytis, although the finish is very dry. This is a wine to challenge sommeliers and home chefs.
title: Boekenoogen 2009 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: A crowd-pleasing Chardonnay from Wente, working in the Monterey area, the result all caramel, vanilla and lemon-lime with a sweet tropical chaser on the finish. The oak is subtle. This wine will pair deliciously with a range of food, particularly chicken and seafood.
title: Wente 2010 Riva Ranch Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: New oak dominates this Chardonnay, lending buttered toast, vanilla and caramel aromas and flavors, while the underlying fruit veers toward very ripe, sweet pineapples. Made in the modern style, it will appeal to Chardonnay lovers of flash, but ultimately palls for too much upfront sweetness.
title: Keller Estate 2009 La Cruz Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: A rich, oaky Chardonnay, brimming with pure, ripe flavors of oranges, pears, limes and spicy tropical fruits. Has a creamy, honeyed taste that make it almost sweet, but it's fundamentally a dry table wine.
title: Kenneth Volk 2008 Santa Marie Cuvée Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A fully rich yet integrated Chardonnay that offers great value and clean flavors of golden apple and yellow fig and plenty of crisp acidity on the finish.
title: Concannon 2010 Conservancy Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Dry, acidic and austere, this is a minerally Chardonnay just approaching citrus fruit flavors. It's distinguished in its Burgundian way, although it falls far short of richness if you're used to the California style.
title: La Feníªtre 2009 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Lots of leesy, vanilla richness in this New World-style Chardonnay. It brims with mango, orange and cinnamon spice flavors. Will satisfy fans of this sweet, creamy approach.
title: Fog Crest 2008 Level 6 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This $13 wine is quite fine, deep in color with a rich, flinty nose. It's big and full with drops of honey throughout and a layer of acidity on the finish. Modest in alcohol too.
title: Pavillion Crossing 2010 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: A very rich Chardonnay, explosive in lemon custard, grilled pineapple and the ripest peaches imaginable. At the same time, there's a firm, tangy minerality. Some will find, however, that the oak dominates it all with a blast of buttered toast and caramel.
title: Gary Farrell 2009 Keefer Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This Demeter-certified Biodynamic Chardonnay has nice color and full apple aromas, as well as a lot of depth and texture. The finish veers into caramel and vanilla, no stranger to oak.
title: Jeriko 2010 Dijon Clone Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: At this price, this is one of the Chardonnay steals of the year. It's made in the popular style, rich in ripe tropical fruit flavors, with a stony core of minerals, and liberally enhanced with sweet, smoky oak.
title: Cameron Hughes 2009 Lot 242 Chardonnay (Atlas Peak)

description: Oakier and sweeter than the fine '08, with the result that buttered toast and butterscotch flavors dominate. On the other hand, there's a dynamic core of tropical fruit as well as a firm minerality that helps to balance the oak, providing structure. Definitely made in the New World style, and not shy about it.
title: Knights Bridge 2009 West Block Chardonnay (Knights Valley)

description: Good price for a clean, briskly acidic Chardonnay of such elegance and balance. Far from a fruit bomb, its pineapple, lime and guava flavors are evened out by minerals and slightly sour lees, and the oak has been minimally applied.
title: Husch 2010 Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Oak dominates this Chardonnay, with buttered toast and butterscotch flavors. Underneath is a ripe wine, with pineapple and tangerine fruit, brightened with crisp acidity. Made in the popular style and pretty good, but the oak is a little too much.
title: Silver 2009 White Hawk Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: A lovely Foothills Chardonnay from longtime area winemaker Chuck Hovey, who also makes the Stevenot wines. With strong apple and cinnamon personality the wine also has an intriguing creaminess to it, with lilting lemon meringue. Let it open slowly or place it in the cellar for 2-5 years to let the tartness on the finish disappear.
title: Hovey 2010 Duende Chardonnay (Calaveras County)

description: A rich, full-bodied, oaky Chardonnay, with the pleasing texture of cream. It's spicy and very flavorful in pears, mangoes, vanilla custard and buttered toast. Could be a little livelier, though.
title: Stephen Ross 2009 Bien Nacido Vineyards Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A fine, balanced Chardonnay, with plenty of richness and sophistication, at a good price. It shows satisfying complexities of ripe pineapples and tangerines, accented with creamy lees and the vanilla and buttered toast flavors of oak barrel fermentation.
title: Firestone 2009 Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Made by Karl Wente for golfer Annika Sorenstam, this Chardonnay is luxuriously big, oaky and full of vanilla, caramel, ripe apple and lime characters and very good for its style. Textured and looking for buttery lobster rolls or similar such fare to pair itself with.
title: Annika Vineyards 2009 Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: With notes of buttered toast, honey and vanilla cream, this Chardonnay is overpowered by new oak barrel influences. Beneath that are delicious fruit flavors of pineapples, oranges, pears and apricots. Rich and flashy in the popular style, with good acidity, but the heavy hand of oak limits the score.
title: De Loach 2009 Hawk Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A crowd pleaser, made from grapes in the Santa Ynez and Santa Maria valleys. Shows lots of ripe balance, with rich, spicy flavors of tropical fruit and buttered toast. An easy, elegant wine for drinking now.
title: Demetria 2009 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Tastes like a white Rhône blend, with tangerine, white peach, nectarine and mineral flavors, but surprise, it's Chardonnay. Crisp acidity provides balance, and the finish is clean and elegant. Great price for a full-bodied white wine this rich.
title: Fat Monk 2009 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: The vineyard sourcing here is half Le Bon Climat and half Bien Nacido. It's a fleshy, flashy Chardonnay, big and opulent, if a little obvious in crowd appeal. Shows rich, flamboyant pineapple, honey, vanilla, crème brûlée and buttered toast flavors.
title: Au Bon Climat 2008 Renewel Nuits-Blanches au Barge Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Ryan Deovlet was winemaker at Stephen Ross, now doing his own thing with purchased grapes from this cool-climate vineyard, in sight of the Pacific. The wine is rather sweet, with a yeasty, leesy taste behind the tropical and citrus fruits.
title: Deovlet 2009 Solomon Hills Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Lots of modern, New World elaboration in this rich Chardonnay, with tropical fruit, pear, peach and apple jam flavors. Oak adds even richer notes of vanilla and buttered toast. The sweet finish is balanced by a scour of acidity and minerals.
title: Robert Mondavi 2009 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Dark gold with a big, opulent nose, this is a rich, creamy, hedonistic Chardonnay from Lava Cap that stands up to its oaky style with, well, style. Lemon zest, toffee and even a whiff of charcuterie emanate from its big bones.
title: Lava Cap 2009 Reserve Chardonnay (El Dorado)

description: Massively ripe fruit and brisk, zesty acidity are the hallmarks of this wine, which comes from the western benches of the Salinas Valley. It's enormous in tangerine fruit, with a firm minerality that comes from the big rocks that gird the soil. A friendly, impressive Chard to drink now.
title: Mercy 2009 Griva Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: The best Chardonnay from this brand so far. With crisp, clean acidity, it shows rich layers of tropical fruits and pears, with a stony minerality. Tastes fat and sweet in the middle, but finishes dry and zesty.
title: Fog Head 2009 Highland Series Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Dolan continues to produce stellar whites and reds from organically grown grapes in Mendocino County. This Chardonnay is ripe and full of minerality, a liquid form of crisp apple with vanilla on the finish.
title: Paul Dolan 2009 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: A good value for the richness. Even though there's no oak, the wine is opulently sweet in pineapples, green apples, pears, bananas, mangoes, limes, honey and vanilla. Drink now with roast salmon and summer corn on the cob.
title: Valley of the Moon 2010 Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Good price for an elegant Chardonnay with such richness. The pineapple, lime and smoky oak flavors have a caramelized sweetness, but acidity is brisk, and there's a fine minerality that makes the wine finish dry.
title: Frei Brothers 2009 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Drink this polished Chardonnay now with shellfish or chicken stew. It's crisp and minerally, with a hit of acidity backing up the citrus fruit, honey and vanilla oak flavors.
title: Simi 2009 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Packs a lot of bang for your buck. Explodes in pineapple jam, vanilla cream and buttered toast flavors. Could be a little more subtle, but it has the richness people like in a Chardonnay.
title: Rancho Sisquoc 2009 Flood Family Vineyards Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Many wineries have dipped into this Petaluma Gap-grown vineyard for grapes, and now MacPhail does. The wine shows the cool-climate crispness of the region, with zesty acidity. It's bone dry and minerally, a Chablis-style Chardonnay with tangerine fruit and some new oak sweetness.
title: MacPhail 2009 Gap's Crown Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: A pleasantly rich Chardonnay, brimming with white peach, pineapple, lemon tart and buttered toast flavors. Gets better as it breathes in the glass. Drink now.
title: Tayson Pierce 2008 Alder Springs Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Exotic, with tropical fruit, orange, peach, white flower, roasted marshmallow and spice flavors. Doesn't really taste like Chardonnay, more like Roussanne. The structure is a bit soft, but it's an interesting wine.
title: Staglin 2008 Chardonnay (Rutherford)

description: Crisp, delicate and clean Chardonnay, with zesty citrus acidity, like a squeeze of lime. Tastes savory, with lime, white flower and mineral flavors. A likeable young wine that's a good pairing with shellfish.
title: Arrowood 2009 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Great price for a Chardonnay that tastes like it costs a lot more. Although it's unoaked, it's very rich in passionfruit, pineapple, peach and vanilla cream flavors, with a honeyed finish. Easy to find, with 5,000 cases produced.
title: Healdsburg Ranches 2009 Unoaked Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A classy Chardonnay for sipping now. Dry and zesty in acidity, it has appealing tangerine, Meyer lemon, white flower, honey and mineral flavors.
title: Matanzas Creek 2009 Journey Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This pretty, polished young Chardonnay comes from the sprawling Santa Maria Valley of Santa Barbara County. It's a good, dry wine, rich in acidity, with mineral-infused apple, pineapple and pear flavors, lavished with sweet, smoky oak. Drink now.
title: Migration 2009 Dierberg Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Soft and honeyed, an unctuous Chardonnay with pleasant citrus fruit and buttered toast flavors. Finishes a bit quick, but earns kudos for dryness and a clean, spicy finish. Easy to find, with more than 50,000 cases produced.
title: Kendall-Jackson 2009 Grand Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Barbara-Monterey)

description: A difficult vintage for the winery, and not the most successful Robert Young Chardonnay. But it does show the elegance of the vineyard. Rich in acids and oak, its underlying flavors are of oranges and pineapples. Drink now, not too cold.
title: Robert Young 2008 Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Rich and creamy, showing tangerine, apricot, buttered toast, cinnamon spice and herb flavors. A solid wine for drinking with roast salmon, seared tuna or a salad of bitter greens with goat cheese and orange slices.
title: Truchard 2009 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Shows some of the richness and complexity of Migration's single-vineyard Chardonnays, but at much less money. The wine is dry, crisp and flavorful in pineapples, green apples, limes and honeysuckle, with oaky notes of buttered toast. Drink now.
title: Migration 2009 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This polished Napa Chardonnay would have benefited from brisker acidity, as it's somewhat soft. But the orange popsicle, lemon cream and buttered toast flavors are very rich.
title: Ideology Cellars 2009 Blondie Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

description: This is a nice Chardonnay to drink with shellfish, particularly grilled shrimp. It's dry and crisp in acidity, with rich pineapple, green apple and pear flavors, accented with sweet, toasty oak.
title: Valley of the Moon 2009 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Bone dry and complex, with terroir-infused mineral, citrus, pear and sweet green mint flavors. A streamlined, layered wine, although it's just a bit hot in alcohol.
title: Kessler-Haak 2009 Kessler-Haak Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Made in a very ripe, very oaky manner, this Chardonnay is extraordinarily rich now, if not very subtle. It's all about power. Buttered toast, caramel cream, pineapple marmalade, lime, orange and spice flavors flood the mouth, snapping to an oaky finish.
title: Patz & Hall 2008 Zio Tony Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Very rich, ripe, oaky and delicious. Dazzles with waves of buttercream, buttered toast, buttered popcorn and butter-drizzled bananas, with plenty of underlying pineapple fruit and honey. Could be more subtle, though. It's all on the surface.
title: Santa Barbara Winery 2008 Reserve Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Shows lots of new oak in the buttery toast and sweet vanilla char flavors that ride high over the pineapple jam, soft ripe pear and papayas. A clean, creamy Chardonnay for drinking now.
title: Perception 2007 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Superoaky in vanilla, buttered toast, honey and smoky flavors, this Chardonnay stands up to all that wood power with ripe pineapples, pears and lemons. It's a delicious, New World wine meant to dazzle, and it largely succeeds.
title: William Hill Estate 2008 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Very ripe and rich in the modern style, a fruit-forward Chardonnay with pineapple, lemon and lime pie, buttered toast and spice flavors that are accented with crisp Central Coast acidity. Drink now.
title: Pessagno 2008 Intrinity Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This very rich Chardonnay oozes showy flavors of pineapples, pears and golden mangoes, with winemaking notes of buttered toast, crème brûlée and a slight taste of yeast. It's not particularly subtle, projecting power instead.
title: Costa de Oro 2008 Gold Coast Vineyard Reserva Dorada Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Very dry, with mouth-watering acidity, but the palate also searches for a little more fruit than the wine offers. Still, the pineapples, peaches and apricots are pleasant enough.
title: Kunde 2008 Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: There's little if any oak on this Chardonnay, which allows brisk Central Coast acidity and bright, long hangtime fruit to star. And that fruit is rich, suggesting tangerines, nectarines, Meyer lemons and Asian pears. Very nice with crab risotto, or with a beautiful roasted chicken.
title: Ortman Family 2009 O2 Series Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This is a good, rich Chardonnay showing lots of tropical fruit and vanilla, smoky oak flavors, and a creamy texture. It's made in the modern style. Not especially complex, but rich and opulent. Drink now.
title: Foggy Bridge 2008 G.E.O. Chardonnay (San Francisco Bay)

description: A blend from two well-regarded vineyards, this Chardonnay is ultrarich in pineapple, mango, pear and green apple fruit flavors that are liberally accented with sweet, caramelized oak. Crisp acidity and a steely minerality fortunately provide balance. Drink now.
title: X 2009 Sangiacomo Vineyard-Truchard Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Superrich in vanilla cream, buttered toast, pineapple jam and tangerine sorbet flavors, with a honeyed finish. Is it dry or sweet? Seems both at the same time, accented with bright, Central Coast acidity. Drink now.
title: Inocencio 2009 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This is a decadently rich Chardonnay, although it depends for its appeal mainly on oak and ripe fruit, rather than nuance. Explodes with pineapple jam, golden mango, crème brûlée, buttered toast, honey and cinnamon spice flavors. Ready now.
title: Riverbench 2008 Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Oak sticks out in the form of buttered toast and caramel, while the pineapple, golden mango and honey flavors are very strong. The wine also is marked by notable acidity. Seems like all the parts need a little time to meld into harmony. Give it until mid-2011.
title: Foxen 2009 Bien Nacido Vineyard Block UU Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: New oak gives a vanilla cream and buttered toast accent to this pretty wine, but the basic fruit flavors also are nice, offering varietal waves of pineapples, pears and green apples. It's a super-drinkable Chardonnay whose richness suggests elaborate fare, like shellfish.
title: La Crema 2008 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: New oak (38%) vies with green apple butter and pineapple críªme brulée flavors to dominate this wine, with neither winning out, suggesting that it's balanced. It's a very pretty, creamy, slightly sweet Chardonnay, balanced with brisk acidity.
title: La Crema 2008 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: New oak dominates this pleasant Chardonnay, with buttered toast, vanilla and caramelized buttercream notes that are almost sweet, although the wine is technically dry. The underlying flavors are of pineapples, pears and green apples. It's holding up well for a 2007. From La Crema.
title: Nine Barrel 2007 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Dry, tart and citrusy. Offers streamlined flavors of lemons, limes, tannic herb tea and minerals, with oak and lees adding much-needed richness. It's elegant in a Chablisian way, but trades fruity opulence for a more complex, connoisseur's austerity. Drink now, and don't over-chill.
title: Tor Kenward 2008 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A clean, brisk Chardonnay made from this small, cool part of Monterey County's Salinas Valley. Shows its region's bright acidity, and also its long hangtime flavors of pineapples, peaches, green apples, limes and minerals. Nothing fancy or showy, just a really nice Chard at a fair price.
title: Jekel 2008 Gravelstone Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: A pretty good Chardonnay, dry and crisp and minerally. It comes from this famous vineyard in the heart of the southern valley, and shows proper flavors of green apples and peaches, with a firm minerality and fine acidity. Not particularly rich, but interesting and complex, and a good companion to food.
title: Francis Ford Coppola 2008 Saralee's Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Made in the popular style of ripe fruit and plenty of oak, this Chard is rich in pineapple, pear, buttered toast and vanilla flavors. It's fortunately balanced with crisp acidity and a touch of minerals. Drink with rich fare, like lobster salad.
title: William Hill Estate 2007 Bench Blend Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Classy Chardonnay. Shows ripe, savory pineapple, Meyer lemon, lime and mineral flavors, brightened with crisp acidity and enriched with a touch of sweet oak. As rich as it is, it feels elegant and refined in the mouth.
title: Rodney Strong 2008 Estate Vineyards Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)

description: Crisp, vital acidity marks this ultrarich wine with a mouthwatering bite of tartness. The flavors are enormous, suggesting long hang time fruit that ripened to pineapple, lime and mango perfection. Not particularly subtle, but flamboyant in the California style.
title: Wrath 2009 Ex Anima Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Very rich, creamy and oaky, made in the ripe, California style of Chardonnay. Brims with buttered toast, vanilla cream, and caramelized wood aromas and flavors riding over underlying pineapples, pears and limes. Flamboyant, if a little top-heavy. Ready now.
title: Tantara 2007 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Strong in every sense, with ripe pineapple, lemon and peach flavors and strong oak. Lacks subtlety, but it's crisp in acidity and shows a nice streak of minerals. Ready now.
title: Cuvaison 2008 S Block Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is a big, rich, showy Chardonnay. Barrel fermented and aged in 80% new French oak, it shows buttered toast and charry vanilla bean aromas and flavors. The fruit below is good, if a little heavy and ripe, suggesting apricots and pears. Best now in its youth.
title: Alpha Omega 2007 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Here's a good, rich and super-drinkable Chardonnay. It shows oak-inspired flavors of pineapples, peaches and green apples that taste like they were baked into a pie. Finishes clean and zesty in acidity.
title: Cuvaison 2008 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: It's all in your face in this modern-style Chardonnay. Vastly ripe pineapple jam and tangerine flavors, enhanced with sweet vanilla oak and creamy lees, flood the mouth, making the wine superrich, although it's bright in citrusy acidity. Ready to drink now.
title: Signaterra Benziger 2008 Sangiacomo Vineyard West Rows Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Shows the purity of flavor and structure that Bonterra wines are famous for. Ultraclean and racy in acidity, this Chardonnay stars ripe varietal flavors of pineapples, oranges and limes. A touch of oak adds welcome richness.
title: Bonterra 2008 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: Very ripe, rich and oaky, made solidly in the California style. Doesn't leave much to the imagination, but rewards for decadent pineapple, pear, crème brûlée, buttered popcorn and vanilla flavors.
title: Bonneau 2008 Catherine's Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Here's a brisk, bright and very flavorful Chardonnay for drinking with rich fare, like crab, pork, scallops or chicken in a buttery cream sauce. It's strong in acidity, with honeyed, creamy flavors of kiwi fruit, limes, pineapples and vanilla.
title: Tolosa 2007 Estate Edna Ranch Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Not much oak is evident in this polished Chardonnay. What stars is fruit, all pineapples, pears, tangerines, green apples and papayas, and the acidity that makes it all bright and clean. Great with pasta in a butter sauce with garlic and pepper.
title: Egret 2008 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A sleekly dry, minerally Chardonnay that shows a fine, steely structure, yet doesn't stint on fruit. The pineapple, pear and flowery honeysuckle flavors are accented with richer touches of buttered toast from oak barrels.
title: Deerfield Ranch 2008 Los Chamizal Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Oak sticks out on this Chardonnay, with the aroma and flavor of buttered white toast dominating. But there comes an immediate rush of pineapples, limes and peaches, giving the wine a good balance of wood and fruit, and it's very dry and crisp. At its best now, but don't serve too cold.
title: Artesa 2008 Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Made in the modern, ripe California style of exceptionally ripe fruit, accented with strong oak. Not especially subtle, but flattering to the palate, with opulent flavors of pineapple crème brûlée, peaches, cream, buttered toast, vanilla bean and honeysuckle.
title: Barnett 2008 Savoy Vineyard Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: All the buttered toast, vanilla bean, apricot jam and pineapple crème brûlée you could want is here, but this lovely Chardonnay is lifted above the ordinary by a minerality that gives it a refreshing tang. Crisp acidity also helps to provide structure to the richness. Will have a short life as evidenced by some overripeness on the finish, so enjoy now.
title: Demetria 2007 Eighteen Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Doesn't say so on the label, but the grapes are from Dry Creek Valley. It's a sleek, sophisticated and different sort of Chardonnay, drier and earthier than most, with pleasant pineapple, pear, green apple and herb flavors.
title: Raymond Burr 2007 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This oaky, ripe, fruit-forward Chardonnay will appeal to fans of the California style. It's massive in pineapple jam, lemondrop candy and vanilla crème brûlée flavors, brightened with crisp acidity. A little obvious, but delicious.
title: Rockroom Winemaking Cooperative 2008 Alder Springs Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Tight, dry and acidic, this Chard is marked by herb and mineral flavors. It is not one of those big, fat, gooey Chards, although it does show elegantly ripe Meyer lemons, buttered toast and spices. Could age for up to five years.
title: Keenan 2008 Chardonnay (Spring Mountain District)

description: Shows the richness of fruit, as well as oak, that has lately characterized this Monterey-grown Chardonnay, with very ripe pineapple and crème brûlée flavors. Feels somewhat obvious, lacking the subtle appeal of the 2007. Drink now.
title: McIntyre Vineyards 2008 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Made in the modern style, this Chardonnay is very ripe and rich in jammy pineapples, green apples and limes, enhanced with smoky, caramelized oak and a creamy, slightly sour note of lees. It's fortunately balanced with crisp acidity. Best now and through 2012 before the fruit goes south.
title: Robert Mondavi 2007 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Strong in flavor, showing the ripeness and crispness of all Bjornstad's Chardonnays, with lemondrop, lime tart, vanilla and buttered toast flavors. Very good, but doesn't quite have the elegance and refinement of the vineyard bottlings.
title: Bjornstad 2007 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: The wine brims with pineapples, Asian pears and papayas, dusted with every spice in your pantry. It's bone dry, with a crisp bite of acidity. A touch of oak and lees gives it a rich edge of cream and buttered toast.
title: Kunde 2007 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Very rich, oaky and acidic, showing the crisp, minerally profile that usually marks white wines from this Monterey appellation. The flavors veer toward lemons, limes and Asian pears. Drink this drily elegant Chardonnay now.
title: J. Lohr 2007 Arroyo Vista Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Very ripe and bright in acidity, with clean, vibrant flavors of Meyer lemon custard, Key lime pie, vanilla sorbet and crème brûlée flavors. Could be more elegant, but it's certainly not shy.
title: Terra Sávia 2008 Reserve Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Rounded and creamy with a touch of citrus, this floral aromatic wine is simple in its approachable layering of lemon zest and tropical pineapple. The oak is supportive and spicy in vanilla bean and nutmeg.
title: Rodney Strong 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Toast, butter, lemon spray and a hint of smoke show on the nose of this widely available and reliable wine. It's fresh and zesty on the palate with lime peels and Meyer lemon juice, yet there are also creamy butter and blanched almond flavors to round out the palate.
title: La Crema 2015 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Tropical and nutty in tone, this full-bodied concentrated wine offers robust foundations of oak with creamy fulfilling layers of pineapple and papaya. There's a hint of reduction on the nose that invites.
title: Black Stallion 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Made primarily from estate fruit, this is a full and fleshy wine, with robustly integrated offerings of rich apple, mango and pear. It has a fresh, layered finish that sparks the palate for more.
title: Schug 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This youthful wine comes out of the gate hugely concentrated and big in reduced aromas of oak. Voluptously lush in dense flavors of crème brûlée, it finds a balance midpalate, buoyed by juicy citrus-backed acidity.
title: Neyers 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Sandalwood, smoke, lemongrass and lime skins make for an intriguing entry to this appellation blend. There is good vibrancy to the sip although it is quite ripe, with flavors of baked apple and slightly sweet nectarine.
title: Sarah's Vineyard 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Warm aromas of white peach meet with blanched almonds and toast on the clean and inviting nose of this bottling. There's a strong and likable toasty quality to the palate, topped with butter and marmalade. It's rich, but not overly done, cut by a spray of lemon juice.
title: Chamisal Vineyards 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Los Angeles Dodgers longtime manager Tommy Lasorda's family is making wine now, starting with this bottling that's loaded with aromas of Asian pear, salted lemon, peach blossom and custard on the nose. The palate is rounded with flavors of creamed pear and then cut with brisk lemony acidity.
title: Lasorda Family WInes 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Rounded aromas of ripe pear, orange skins, poached apple and buttered toast with marmalade show on the nose of this bottling. Lemon rinds and dried apple slices arise on the sip.
title: La Crema 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Rich and buttery all the way through, this full-bodied wine smells like butterscotch and cream, tastes ripe, oaky and full of vanilla, and has butter and fig flavors. The texture is extremely soft and mouthfilling.
title: Truett Hurst 2015 California Square Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: This is likely to become a very popular wine, thanks to an inviting nose of lemon candy, white peach, pineapple, plumeria and a hint of guava, all leveled by a chalky minerality. The palate is zippy and tense, yet also somewhat crowd-pleasingly sweet with ripe apple and pear flavors.
title: Barrel Burner 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Lemongrass and orange wedge meet with a touch of damp wood and a hint of butterscotch on the nose of this bottling. Rounded flavors of apple, citrus and a kiss of oak show on the sip, which is framed by decent acidity and chalky structure.
title: Integrity 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Shy on the nose, this is a thick concentrated white blended with 7% Roussanne that shows big flavors of baked pineapple, papaya and melon. Broad shouldered, it was barrel-fermented entirely in French oak, and integrates the wood well.
title: Carol Shelton 2016 Wild Thing Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: From Etude's North Canyon and Cat Canyon vineyards, this fresh bottling offers guava and plumeria notes on the slightly tropical nose. The texture is taut and the flavors are ripe with more guava and Key lime pie.
title: Lyric by Etude 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Simple and light aromas of cut apple and apple blossom open up with time on the nose of this bottling. There is decent grip to the sip and a strong tactile sensation, giving depth to the flavors of tuberose and poached pears. It is a solid example of unoaked Chardonnay.
title: SeaGlass 2016 Unoaked Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Very restrained on the nose, this bottling shows light aromas of honeysuckle, blanched almond and lemon rinds. There is good tension on the sip, where fresh and clean citrus and stone fruit flavors ride a steely texture.
title: Morgan 2016 Highland Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Very showy and rich, this full-bodied wine smells like melted butter, caramel and meringue and tastes extremely buttery too. It has lots of sweet-oak influence, lemon and pineapple flavors and a syrupy finish.
title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2015 Hoffman Vineyard Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Caramelized lemon wedge, poached apples and a touch of citrus pith show on the nose of this bottling. There is solid zip to the sip, where ripe rich flavors of pear, apple and cooked lemons arise.
title: Ultima Tulie 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This winery has been making Chardonnay in Temecula for many decades, and it shows. Restrained aromas of pear skins, white flowers and a touch of butterscotch lead into a familiar, somewhat zippy Chardonnay palate of almond paste, fresh citrus and sea salt. A solid effort for the warmer region.
title: Callaway 2016 Winemaker's Reserve Chardonnay (Temecula Valley)

description: Light in color, this pretty wine offers floral aromatics around crisp persistent acidity dipped in fresh lemon, tangerine, peach and wet stone. The finish shows some oak.
title: Bennett Valley Cellars 2014 Simpatico Ranch Chardonnay (Bennett Valley)

description: Yellow grapefruit, lime pith and a whiff of daffodil make for a tight and fresh nose on this estate bottling. There's a quick sweetness to the palate, reminiscent of Lemonhead candies, followed by zippy acidity and a lime-tangerine tang.
title: Tolosa 2016 1772 Edna Ranch Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Honeysuckle and lily aromas meet with crushed chalk, citrus pith and sliced pears on the nose of this bottling. There's a solid sizzle and crispness to the palate, where cut pears, pineapple and lemongrass flavors arise.
title: Talbott 2016 Kali Hart Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: A rather stunning deal for the price, this bottling shows creamy lemon, lime blossom and a hint of hazelnut, set against a chalky backbone. The palate shows a flash of sweetness then tightens around a steely core, offering orange skin tang, zingy lime rind and slightly richer hints of cashew cream.
title: Beckon 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This is a big-shouldered wine on the entry, a full-bodied and fleshy experience of concentrated, tropical mango and pineapple flavor that pleases the palate without any overt fussiness.
title: Sojourn 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: There's a strong, slightly bitter walnut quality to the nose of this bottling, along with toasted oak, lemon zest and cream. That nutty note carries to the sip as well, where the oak is quite prominent but well integrated, giving warm toast flavors that are cut by lemon-peel acidity. A strong potential for South Coast Chardonnay shows.
title: Robert Renzoni 2016 Barile Chardonnay (Temecula Valley)

description: Exotic plumeria flowers, toasted hazelnut and a dollop of custard show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard just miles from the Pismo coastline. The palate sizzles with acidity, which cuts through ripe flavors of pineapple and caramelized pears.
title: Peloton 2016 Spanish Springs Vineyard Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo)

description: Earthy, buttery aromas join good fruity ones in this medium-bodied and mineral-tinged wine. It has firm acidity and a slightly astringent texture that give it a lean, bracing quality.
title: Chacewater 2016 Chardonnay (Lake County)

description: This is an unctuous tale on Chardonnay, very much in line with the classic Californian style. Aromas of baked Asian pear, oak, butterscotch and caramel show on the nose, leading into a broad, buttery and viscous palate of lemon balm and coconut cream.
title: Tolosa 2016 Poletti Edna Ranch Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Bold and oaky, this full-bodied wine layers wood smoke and butter aromas over baked pear and almond flavors, while hints of new oak run through it. The wine has a mouth-coating texture and tastes warm and spicy on the finish.
title: Van Ruiten 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: This dramatic, hefty wine has strong oaky, spicy aromas, a rich and honeyed fruit flavor and a texture that's almost thick, making it cling to the sides of the mouth. A touch of sweetness registers on the finish.
title: Mt. Konocti Winery 2016 Barrel Select Chardonnay (Lake County)

description: This bottling explores a richer tropical side of the grape, with aromas of plumeria, guava, coconut oil, passion fruit and fresh tangerines. The palate combines mango and coconut flavors that are cut by zesty Key lime juice.
title: Rendarrio Vineyards 2016 Baja-Ha Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Tropical and voluptuously full bodied, this wine is oak-laden and ripe in apple, pineapple and mango, with a lemony aftertaste of uplifting acidity.
title: La Storia by Trentadue 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This 50-50 blend of Santa Maria Valley and Santa Cruz Mountains fruit shows candied lemon rind and Gala apple on the approachable, familiar nose. There is a touch of zip to the palate, where lime cream and salted citrus flavors arise.
title: Mignanelli 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Fresh apples, pear flesh, squeezed lemon and spring blossoms show on the nose of this bottling by musician Zac Brown. There is a strong sizzle of acidity to the sip, where zesty flavors of Key lime spray and Pink Lady apples arise.
title: Z. Alexander Brown 2016 Uncaged Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: With a giant fleur-de-lis on the bottle, the nature of this wine is matched in intensity and outward fruit-forwardness. It's a mix of noble reduction, salty oak and baked apple and pineapple richness.
title: De Loach 2015 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A hit of pungent oak spice, a mix of nutmeg and vanilla, permeates the nose and palate of this full-bodied wine, moderately structured with fruit-forward flavors of green apple and Meyer lemon. It offers heat on the finish.
title: Buena Vista 2015 Private Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This is a solid reliable wine for the price, with aromas of chamomile, seared lemon peels and butter-poached nectarine. The palate is well rounded with lemon wedge and white peach flavors, presented with decent zip and structure.
title: Firefly Ridge 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: A bronze-orange in color, this "orange" wine is quite interesting, with burnt orange peels, light maraschino cherry and liquor-like aromas on the nose, which is reminiscent of an old-fashioned cocktail. Rusty, sherry-like flavors show on the sip alongside more burnt orange and toasted barley. It's unique but worth trying.
title: Reyes 2015 Amber Chardonnay (Sierra Pelona Valley)

description: This full-bodied wine has toasty, peppery aromas and rather smoky flavors, for a personality that's more oaky than fruity. But the wine pulls it off well and is flavorful, mouth-filling and yet well-balanced.
title: Parducci 2016 Small Lot Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: Lime pith and sharp apple aromas show on the nose of this bottling from the extremely coastal Spanish Springs Vineyard, and there is a touch of a vinous quality as well. Ripe pear flavors show on the tip of the sip, where acidic energy cuts through the somewhat sweet characteristics of the midpalate.
title: Oceano 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This wine is straightforward, refreshing and non-oaky in style, offering citrus aromas, rather lean and savory flavors and a nice underpinning of acidity to keep it crisp and appetizing.
title: La Follette 2015 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: This no-oak white is well-integrated in acidity and offers layers of flavor and texture. Highlights of white peach, lemon curd and vanilla bean give it a fruity substance within a refreshingly crisp, clean context.
title: Kopriva 2016 Ricci Vineyard Unoaked Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Properly restrained on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of chalk, honeysuckle and sliced tangerine. There is good zip and freshness to the sip, where lemon rinds and squeezed grapefruit flavors ride an energetic structure.
title: Santa Barbara Winery 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: A confectionery nose of cotton candy and honey-baked apple permeates through the rich palate and nose of this wine. Firm in oak, it's fleshy and round with moderate acidity and a finishing touch of coconut shavings.
title: Napa Cellars 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is an intensely thick and concentrated wine, richly ripe in caramelized apple, tropical mango and hugely grippy toasted oak. There's a thread of jasmine that pierces through beautifully on the nose.
title: Alyris 2015 The Audition Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Sourced from Dutton Ranches and Heintz Vineyard, this wine employs a hearty helping of oak, which supports a core of juicy pear and pineapple. With additional richness from secondary elements of crème brûlée and coconut flakes, it finishes boldly ripe and full bodied.
title: Sanctuary 2015 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Perfumed in apple and orange blossom aromas, this is a robust, fleshy wine that leans into an intensity of apple, melon and pineapple flavor, finishing focused and steeped in oak.
title: Ferrari-Carano 2015 Emilia's Cuvée Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a hearty, full-bodied wine with some age on it. It is robust in a popular style that offers bold layers of anise, baked peach and pineapple.
title: Annabella 2014 Special Selection Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Thick and moderate in structure, this wine is fleshy, lush and tropical in nature. Swirled in butterscotch, vanilla and caramel, the oak is toasty and supportive.
title: Ferrari-Carano 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Melon aromas of honeydew and cantaloupe meet with crisp stone fruit and Key lime pie on the nose of this bottling. There is a chalky grip to the sip, with mellow flavors of Meyer lemon juice and Asian pear.
title: Castoro Cellars 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: On the reserved side, this trim wine has subtle fruit and vanilla aromas, mild apple and butter flavors and a good balance between acidity and ripeness. It's a good value and a great choice for a non-showy wine.
title: Girasole 2016 Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Candied pineapple, spun sugar, ripe key lime peels and lemongrass show on the nose of this stainless steel-aged wine. The expected crispness shows on the sip as does an energetic and lively acidity, though the honeysuckle and lemon syrup flavors trend toward sweetness.
title: Foley 2015 Steel Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Fresh and light aromas of lemongrass, Pink Lady apples, guava soda and a hint of pineapple make for a slightly tropical but clean approach to this bottling. It's fresh on the sip with spritzy acidity and more tropical flavors of guava, mango, pineapple and tuberose.
title: La Crema 2015 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Melted butter aromas meet with hints of white peach, orangesicle and toasted oak on the nose of this bottling. The palate is soft and easy, with lemon, orange cream and more stone-fruit flavors, framed by long-simmering, lime-laced acidity.
title: Mansfield-Dunne 2015 Petersen Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: The nose on this bottling is full of fresh Asian pear aromas along with hints of guava and ripe oranges, showing restraint from a warmer climate. There's a good sizzle of acidity to start the sip, with flavors of poached pear, apple cream and citrus rinds rounding out the palate.
title: Midnight 2016 Chardonnay (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

description: Aged in neutral French oak for a year, this wine is dark gold in color and tingly in acidity. Apple skin, a low impact of oak and lemon meringue wrap around a lush palate.
title: Fallon Place 2015 La Cruz Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Oaky in flavor and broad in mouthfeel, this wine has plenty of butter, wood-smoke and toasted-nut aromas followed by ripe pear and butter on the palate. It is full bodied and has a touch of astringency on the finish.
title: Michael David 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Very tropical but fresh and clean aromas of pineapple, guava and lemongrass show on the nose of this bottling. It's a bit fat on the sip with prominent guava and tropical flowers like plumeria, yet it's a zesty well-made wine.
title: Falkner 2016 Chardonnay (Temecula Valley)

description: This popular bottling offers the tropical fruit salad array it always has, with honeydew, cantaloupe, pineapple, guava and banana aromas. Yet, this particular vintage has a refreshing zestiness. Steely structure and lime-like acidity drive the palate, balancing its buttercream and peach custard flavors.
title: Chamisal Vineyards 2016 Stainless Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Beautiful even without oak. Shows crisp, tart flavors of green apples, limes and white peaches, with a spicy edge of vanilla, cinnamon and clove, leading to a dry, clean finish.
title: Valley of the Moon 2008 Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A fine Chardonnay, especially at this price. Shows flashy pineapple, pear and guava flavors, enriched with smoky vanilla and buttered toast. Crisp acidity makes it all bright and clean.
title: Aquinas 2007 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A lovely, dry Chardonnay that balances richness with acidity, making it food-friendly. Shows pineapple, pear and smoky vanilla flavors, balanced with crispness. Drinks well now.
title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2007 Paragon Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Packs a punch with intense flavors of ripe pineapple purée, papaya, butterscotch, vanilla and cinnamon spice, as well as the minerality that wines from Edna Valley often display. All this is offset by crisp coastal acidity.
title: Carpe Diem 2007 Firepeak Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Lots of new oak on this ripe, fruity Chard. It brims with buttered toast and caramel flavors riding alongside the pineapples, peaches, apples and pears. All that richness is brightened and balanced with crisp Carneros acidity.
title: Artesa 2007 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Rich and opulent, a Chardonnay that swings for a home run and hits a solid double. Shows oak-inspired flavors of grilled pineapples, peaches, pears and minerals, balanced by crisp acidity, with a dry finish.
title: Gofessel 2008 Edina Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Just shows that a great Chardonnay doesn't need oak to be delicious. Packed with pineapples, pears, apples, honeysuckle, vanilla and butter, it's firmed and toned by crisp acidity.
title: Martin Ray 2008 Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Very rich in oak, with massive buttered toast, caramel and crème brûlée flavors. The underlying fruit is good, suggesting pineapples and ripe peaches, but misses a beat for all that winemaker intervention. Drink now.
title: Far Niente 2007 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A dry, slightly herbal Chardonnay, with oak-inspired pear, peach and pineapple flavors. Feels elegant and sophisticated. Drink now.
title: Corley 2007 Reserve Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

description: A pure, young Chardonnay made in a Chablis style, but you don't want to drink it now. Shows the acidic minerality of Carneros, with citrus, tropical fruit, wildflower and honey flavors. Too tight and unyielding. Give it until mid-2010 to mellow.
title: Nickel & Nickel 2007 Truchard Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Superrich in pears, pineapples and green apples, and oaky, with butterscotch, buttered toast and buttered popcorn flavors. Massive and direct, but balanced with crisp acidity. Drink now.
title: Dutton Estate 2007 Dutton Ranch Kyndall's Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Oaky, with lots of buttered toast, vanilla and caramel flavors riding high on top of the underlying pineapple jam and minerals. With crisp acidity, this Chardonnay could improve with a few years in the cellar.
title: Sierra Madre 2007 Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Another lovely, expressive Carneros Chardonnay from Beaulieu. They've actually lowered the price over the years, which makes this rich wine a value. Dry, crisp and creamy, it offers flavors of pineapples, pears, honeysuckle flower, vanilla and cinnamon spice, with a minerally grounding.
title: Beaulieu Vineyard 2007 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Unoaked, so the pure flavors of Monterey shine through. With bright, zesty acidity, the tastes are of limes, kiwi fruit and vanilla, with a firm minerality. This Chard is so rich, it doesn't even need barrel notes.
title: Summers 2008 La Nude Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: About as oaky as a Chardonnay can get without crossing the line, although some will think it has. Shows strong flavors of buttered toast, smoky caramel and crème brûlée, with underlying fruit notes of grilled pineapples and pear preserves. Good, but the winemaker might pull it back a little in the future.
title: Wrath 2007 San Saba Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Made in an elaborately flamboyant style, this Chard is enormously ripe with pineapple-infused crème brûlée, peach custard, toasted meringue and cinnamon flavors. Delicious, but could be crisper.
title: Tantara 2006 Bien Nacido Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Custardy and yeasty, with tropical fruit, Meyer lemon and mineral flavors, accented with a strong taste of slightly bitter lees.
title: Stephen Ross 2007 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A bit on the soft side, but very delicious, with melted butter, ripe pineapple, lemondrop and cinnamon spice flavors that finish long and dry.
title: Addamo 2007 Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This bottling needs a good vintage to succeed, which it got in 2007. It's dry and crisp, but very rich in tropical fruit, pear, mineral and smoky oak flavors. Easy to find, with 18,000 cases produced.
title: Carmel Road 2007 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Sweet in smoky oak, with sweet cream flavors, this pleasant Chardonnay is rich in pineapples. Yet it's dry, with a minerally tang and fine acidity. Drink now.
title: La Crema 2007 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: Dry and richly oaked, with ripe flavors, this is a big Chardonnay. It shows massive flavors of pineapple custard, pear jam, butterscotch, buttered toast and caramel. A bit direct, but a crowd pleaser.
title: La Crema 2007 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is an enomoursly rich Chardonnay that positively explodes in apricot jam, pineapple, vanilla custard and butterscotch flavors. It's balanced with crisp, cool-climate Carneros acidity that makes it tangy and clean. Easy to find, with 33,000 cases produced.
title: Artesa 2007 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: There's not much, if any, oak on this Chardonnay, leaving the fresh, clean fruit flavors to star. Shows a rich array of pineapples, Meyer lemons, yellow apricots and peaches, with spicy, vanilla overtones. Elegant, and a good buy at this price.
title: Rued 2007 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Oak and lees give rich, yeasty, butterscotchy complexities, and a creamy texture, to this fine young Chardonnay. Fortunately, the underlying varietal flavors are strong in pineapple, apple, honeydew and papaya. Only 500 cases were produced.
title: Concannon 2007 Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: A fine Monterey Chard to showcase with crab cakes or roast salmon. Dry and crisp in cool-climate acidity, it shows vibrant flavors of grilled pineapples, apricots, butterscotch and tangy spice.
title: Bernardus 2007 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: The fact that this Chard isn't super-fruity and doesn't have a ton of oak is exactly what makes it so pretty. As pretty, in fact, as the flower label. It's dry, tart and minerally, with suggestions of lemon zest, pears and sweet kefir limes. Very Chablisian.
title: Fleur de California 2007 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: Very dry, acidic and minerally, this is not one of those lush, decadent Chardonnays. It shows controlled flavors of citrus fruits, pears, wet stones and spices. The malolactic fermentation was prevented, giving it tangy acidity. Give it a try with shellfish and roast salmon.
title: De Sante 2007 Old Vine Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is a strong, oaky Chardonnay. It's crisp in acidity and forward in pineapple jam, lemon custard and vanilla meringue flavors. If you like the ripe, California style, it's for you.
title: Manzoni 2006 Lucia Highland Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is a typical Sonoma Coast Chard in the bright acidity that firms up the ripe, long hangtime flavors. Pineapples, pears, peaches, nectarines and subtle papaya notes are joined with buttercream and cinnamon spices. Drink now.
title: Anaba 2007 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: An enormously rich Chard brimming with Mandarin orange, tangerine, pineapple, butterscotch and toasty oak flavors. Cool-climate acidity provides a brisk sense of balance to this charming, affordable wine.
title: Lyeth 2007 L de Lyeth Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Clos du Bois has done a good job producing what might be called a Chablis-style Chard. It's bone dry and crisp, with a spine of minerals and granite and other stony, earthy qualities. Fruit-wise, there are subtle suggestions of Meyer lemons, limes and pears.
title: Clos du Bois 2006 Calcaire Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Ripe and oaky, with luscious flavors of pineapples, green apple butter, buttered toast and caramel, undergirded by a stony minerality. Drink now.
title: Molnar Family 2006 Poseidon's Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Oak stands out, making smoky caramel and butterscotch the dominant flavors in this Chardonnay. Below that are fruity flavors of pineapples, green apple jam and peach preserves, finished with awesome Asian spices. Just 90 cases produced.
title: Kazmer & Blaise 2006 Boonfly's Hill Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Sourced from three great Chardonnay vineyards (Stanly Ranch, Hyde and Silverado-Suscol), this Chard is enormously flavorful in fruit custard flavors and new oak. It's delicious, but a little obvious, especially on the oak side, and could have more complex nuances and angles. Drink now.
title: Merryvale 2005 Silhouette Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Clean, lean and elegant, with mineral-infused citrus and green apple flavors set off by crisp acidity. There's no oak, but somehow the wine has a vanilla and honey richness.
title: Ceago Vinegarden 2007 Del Lago Chardonnay (Clear Lake)

description: Shows a welcome return to form, with lush, oak-inspired flavors of grilled pineapples, apricots and mulled green apple cider. This is a very good price for a Chardonnay of this quality.
title: Villa Mt. Eden 2006 Grand Reserve Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Very dry, tartly acidic and lemony, almost like a Sauvignon Blanc, but with richer notes of pineapple cream. Super-drinkable, and the low alcohol won't overpower a delicate dish, like sole in a garlicky butter sauce.
title: Lorena Garcia 2006 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: A very detailed Chard showing flashy layers of ripe tropical fruits, tangerines, pastry crust, minerals and lees. The grapes are from the winery's estate vineyard in Carneros, and the wine's acidity is bright and zesty.
title: Clos du Val 2006 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A fine Chard, richly oaked and ripely forward in tropical fruit, pear and green apple flavors wrapped into a spicy, buttercreamy mouthfeel. Really nails the California style.
title: Roche 2006 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Generously oaked, with crème caramel and butterscotch from the barrels, this Chard also features very ripe underlying fruit flavors of golden mango and pineapple marmalade. It's fancy and generous, if a bit straightforward.
title: Babcock 2007 Grand Cuvée Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This cleverly named Chard is a good example of the unoaked style. It's quite crisp and dry, and shows the grape's pure flavors of pineapples and Meyer lemons. But the wine was aged on the lees, which gives it rich layers of yeast and cream.
title: Summers 2007 LeNude Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Oak and lees aging complicate this wine, giving it smoky vanilla-spice and creamy, yeasty notes that add to the pineapple, pear and peach flavors. It's a good, rich, easy-drinking Chardonnay that's at its best now.
title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2006 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
