description: Ripe and juicy, this has flavors of tangerine and tropical fruit, plus notes of creamy lees and smoky, sweet oak. It would feel heavy if not for the brisk acidity that provides balance and elegance.
title: Vino V 2010 Solomon Hills VIneyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This Anderson Valley Chardonnay is creamy with a caramel-lemon imprint, yet  textured and vibrant with bright acidity. A bite of lime marks the finish.
title: Navarro 2011 Table Wine Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: Showing sweet toasty oak, brisk acidity and pure flavors of citrus fruit and apricot, this is a very rich, dry Chardonnay, although all of its parts haven't quite come together. While it's not an ager, it will benefit from holding until mid-2013, but not any longer.
title: Occidental Road Cellars 2010 Horseshoe Bend Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Grown on the east side of the Salinas Valley, opposite the Santa Lucia Highlands, this Chardonnay shows excellent Monterey acidity and dryness. The pineapple, green apple and peach fruit flavors are nice and streamlined, making the wine elegant and food friendly.
title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2011 West Pinnacles Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Lots of acidity gives this Chardonnay a real bite, while the fruit is very ripe, expressive of pineapples, tangerines and Meyer lemons. The result is a flavor of sour yellow candy, enriched with the creaminess of lees and a buttered toast note from the oak barrels. Drink with rich, buttery shellfish entrées.
title: Clos La Chance 2010 Murphy's Choice Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Exceptionally ripe, this has notes of tropical fruits, apricots and pears, with a glorious coating of sweet, smoky, buttered toast from the oak. It's pretty obvious in its appeal, and it will be enjoyed by many for its vast richness.
title: Chalk Hill 2010 Estate Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)

description: This shows the two classic markers of this vineyard: brisk, mouthwatering acidity and superripe flavors. The orange and peach notes meld with an apricot tone, which may have a touch of botrytis, lending a hint of honey. For all the richness, it's bone dry and minerally. Lovely now, but these Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnays age interestingly, gradually losing fruit and gaining nut and earthy notes.
title: Joullian 2010 Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Rich, forward and delicious, this has pineapple and peach jam flavors, with elaborate notes of buttered toast and caramel from the oak aging. It finishes dry.
title: Stephen Ross 2010 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: A very good Chardonnay, with oak-enhanced citrus and peach flavors. It's dry and quite acidic, biting into the tongue and making the tastebuds whistle. Made in a leaner style, it will appeal to fans of Chablis-style Chardonnays.
title: Jeff Gordon 2010 Leo Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A rich Chardonnay-this is packed with apricot, orange jam, buttered toast and spice flavors that are wrapped into a creamy texture. It's a dry wine, boosted with bright, citrusy acidity.
title: Armida 2010 Dutton Ranch - Mill Station Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Oak, acidity and tropical fruit comprise this dry Chardonnay. It's one of Armida's better efforts, showing ripe, flashy mango, buttered toast and mineral flavors that finish bright and spicy.
title: Armida 2011 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a flashy Chardonnay that's meant to impress. Big, oaky and ripe, this bears opulent waves of mangoes, papayas and apricots, with notes of buttered toast and sweet caramel. Not particularly subtle, but a crowd pleaser.
title: Armida 2010 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is really easy to like for its rich tropical-fruit, apple and peach flavors; buttery, creamy texture; vibrant acidity; and the delicious coating of smoky oak. Appeals immediately to the senses. This is easily Wellington's best Chardonnay in a decade.
title: Wellington 2010 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Strong, ripe fruit and oak characterize this opulent young Chardonnay. It's flavors of pineapples, oranges and mangoes are rich, dry, honeyed and accented with a note of buttered toast. Drink now.
title: Schug 2010 Heritage Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Sweet, smoky oak and ultraripe flavors of tropical fruits mark this Chardonnay. It's strong and obvious in its appeal, but bright acidity and a stony minerality ground it, and the finish is thoroughly dry.
title: Bernardus 2010 Sierra Mar Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Marked by strong acidity and minerality, this is an austere Chardonnay for drinking now. With a citrus flavor and a dry, honeyed richness, this sits on the elegant side of the Chardonnay spectrum.
title: Bryter 2010 Affiné Split Rock Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a lovely combination of stone fruit and grapefruit flavors, with a creaminess that makes the wine very inviting. Pleasing and balanced, this shows minerality and a tinge of vanilla on the finish. Pair it with fish or light meats off the grill.
title: Handley 2010 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: Crisp and refreshing, this is attractive with notes of fresh lemon, lime and pear from cooler-climate vineyards. It's like a breath of fresh air, and it should pair beautifully with a wide range of meals.
title: Wente 2010 Morning Fog Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: The lime, kiwi, orange and lemon fruit flavors are so delicious, you won't miss the oak accents at all. Its bright, vital acidity makes it shine like polished silver. This is a very good food win at a reasonable price. With 20,000 cases produced, it should be relatively easy to find.
title: Chamisal Vineyards 2011 Stainless Unoaked Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This is a minerally and oaky wine, but it's balanced with fine acidity. Despite the ripe pineapple and orange flavors, this finishes thoroughly dry. Don't drink it too cold.
title: Gallo Signature Series 2009 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Big, rich and oaky, this is packed with flavors of buttered toast, buttered popcorn, honey and tropical fruit flavors. It's a ripe, flashy wine, with broad appeal. Drink with opulent fare, like shellfish risotto or crab in drawn butter.
title: Staglin 2009 Chardonnay (Rutherford)

description: Made in the modern style of oaky creaminess and very flashy fruit, this Chardonnay erupts in a burst of oranges and rum punch, buttered toast and honey. It's rich and layered, if a little soft.
title: Porter Family Vineyards 2009 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Very much like the fine 2009, the winery's new Chardonnay is bone dry and austere, like a Chablis. Highly minerally, with mouthwatering acidity, the fruit flavors veer toward Meyer lemons and limes.
title: Kessler-Haak 2010 Kessler-Haak Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: An eccentric Chardonnay, although it's well made and has intellectual appeal. Bone dry and acidic, this has intense flavors of apricots, pineapples and honey. It should age for up to 8 years, gradually losing fruit and gaining earthy, minerally qualities.
title: Lucia 2010 Soberanes Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is rich and oaky, with ripe orange, pineapple and pear flavors and the buttered toast of oak barrel aging. Almost too much of a good thing, it trades nuance for sheer power, but it's certainly a good example of the California style.
title: Fort Ross Winery 2010 Bicentennial Commemorative Bottling Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a wine that offers lots of class at a very good price. It's marked by flavors of streamlined citrus fruit, Asian pear, honey and a hint of buttered toast. It finishes thoroughly dry. With nearly 37,000 cases produced, this should be relatively easy to find.
title: Starmont 2010 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Made in the Ojai style of modest alcohol, dryness and delicacy, this offers subtle citrus, tropical fruit and mineral flavors. It's not terribly complex, but it is streamlined and elegant. Drink up.
title: Ojai 2009 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: A good, fairly complex California Chardonnay, marked by ripe, jammy orange, pear and apricot fruit flavors. Winemaker interventions also play roles, with the malolactic fermentation adding buttery notes and French oak contributing sweet caramel.
title: Dutton-Goldfield 2010 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Lots of zesty, mouthwatering acidity in this Chardonnay. The pineapple, crème brûlée, buttered toast and vanilla flavors are so rich that they require balance, which the zippy acidity provides. Maybe a touch too oaky, but that's a matter of personal preference.
title: JCB 2010 No. 81 Sonoma Collection Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Made in a bone dry, acidic style, what this Chardonnay lacks in richness it makes up for in elegance. Fans of sweet, buttery Chards won't like it, but true aficionados will appreciate the austere citrus and mineral flavors.
title: Deep Sea 2009 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Rich and oaky, with pineapple jam, tangerine juice, buttered toast and vanilla spice flavors. It's a big, opulent wine, but a little in your face. Drink now.
title: Cakebread 2010 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Made in the popular style, this Chardonnay has flavors of buttered toast, pineapple jam, vanilla and cinnamon spice. At the age of three-plus years, it's soft and mellow. Not likely to improve, so drink up.
title: Bennett Lane 2008 Reserve Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A lovely Chardonnay that straddles a welcome balance between ripeness and holding back. Made unoaked, it stars ripe Alexander Valley fruit, with pineapple, Meyer lemon, tangerine and tropical fruit flavors, brightened with acidity, and finishing dry and spicy.
title: Summers 2009 La Nude Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Another solid Chardonnay from Gloria, continuing a string of recent successes. At more than three years of age, the wine is holding nicely, with oak, buttered toast, pineapple, críªme brulée and custard spice flavors, brightened with exceptionally brisk acidity.
title: Gloria Ferrer 2008 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Quite a good Chardonnay, but not without some problems. It's as rich as anything out there, with massive pineapple jam, crème brûlée and buttered toast flavors. The acidity feels slightly alien, especially on the finish.
title: Sbragia 2009 Gamble Ranch Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: The underlying wine, before the winemaker put it into oak barrels, was delicious in tangerine and pineapple fruit, brightened with brilliantly crisp acidity and a fine, steely minerality. The oak, which is modest, adds a richer coating of buttered toast. A great price for a Chardonnay this drinkable.
title: Carmel Road 2010 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Exceeds in ripe flavors of tropical fruits, tangerine and kiwi fruits, with an elaborate coating of sweet, caramelized oak. Brisk acidity brings a vitality to balance the richness. A flamboyant wine made in a popularly appealing style.
title: Sbragia 2009 Home Ranch Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Brilliantly ripe pineapple, tangerine and lemon fruit flavors mark this savory young Chardonnay. It shows the citrusy acidity of the cool-climate Edna Valley, with a long, spicy finish. Clean and mouthwatering, it offers a lot for the price.
title: Courtney Benham 2010 Reserve Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Very rich aromatically in golden Santa Rosa plum, raisins and lemon chiffon, this new producer's Chardonnay has a touch of caramel popcorn and is delicately dense with a nice lift on the finish.
title: Most Wanted Winery 2009 Indindoli Family Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Horse & Plow continues to make nice wines from organic grapes. This vintage shows a subtle lemon streak with a tiny smidge of tropical guava and is all-around balanced, steely and meaty at the same time without overdone oak. Golden honey and lemon finish things off.
title: Horse & Plow 2010 McFadden Farm Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Occasio, which has made a nice Fume Blanc for a couple of vintages now, is giving the world this, its first Chardonnay, a true to its French-oak-fermented style that's quite citrus-laden, tart, lean and mean and yet voluptuous, with its barrel age showing, and toasty on the finish.
title: Occasio 2010 Del Arroyo Vineyard Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Opens aromatically exhibiting lemon cheesecake, then delves into the rightful amount of apple and pear, finishing with a hearty helping of vanilla and caramel. Del Arroyo remains a source to watch in Livermore, especially for Chardonnay.
title: Nottingham Cellars 2010 Del Arroyo Vineyard Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: A really good value in a California Chardonnay. Blended with a touch of Viognier to add brightness, and fermented in a little new oak, it hits just the right notes for today's popular taste. Slightly sweet in buttered toast and pineapple jam flavors, it's balanced with crisp acidity and a stony minerality.
title: Liberty School 2010 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: There's beautiful fruit from a beautiful vineyard in here somewhere but first let there be oak, lots of it (100% new French), giving the wine a dark golden hue and the nose an interesting meaty, baked apple quality. Taste-wise the wine is almost savory and leathery, full of ripe, exotic fruit, hugely creamy with a smackdown finish. Not for the meek but with time could get quite lovely.
title: Knights Bridge 2009 Alder Springs Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Ripe and flashy in the California style, with pineapple, pear, crème brûlée and buttered toast aromas and flavors. Quite good, but a little too much of everything, including alcohol, and would benefit from some restraint.
title: Chalk Hill 2009 Musque Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)

description: Presents with equal parts crisp acidity, buttered toast new oak and ripe pineapple and kumquat fruit. The result is big and flashy, but a little Frankensteinian.
title: Freestone 2009 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: One of the best unoaked Chardonnays out there. So brilliantly ripe and pure in pineapples, tangerines, green apples and peaches, you won't miss the oak at all. With crisp acidity, it's a wonderful wine to drink with shellfish.
title: Martin Ray 2010 Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Classic in color and well layered with apple and pear, this is made by a new, young producer in the Livermore Valley who is trying to hit new heights in quality. The wine's acidity is subtle and ideal for pairing with roast chicken and the like.
title: Nottingham Cellars 2009 Del Arroyo Vineyard Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: The fruit on this drily complex Chardonnay is starting to fall out, giving an herb, cashew nut edge to the pineapples, tangerines and apricots. The wine retains its sweet coating of buttered toast and vanilla honey. Will continue to dry and become earthier over the next several years.
title: Harbison Wines 2007 Le Bon Climat Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Nothing but fruit in this Chardonnay, and what pretty fruit it is. Really delicious in pineapple, peach, lemon, lime, green melon and vanilla flavors, with fine acidity.
title: Pietra Santa 2010 Unoaked Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)

description: As rich as Chardonnay gets in California, offering massive waves of pineapple jam, apricots, tangerines and tropical notes of papayas and guavas. Without oak, the fruit stars, along with tantalizing acidity.
title: Dierberg 2009 Steel Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: From the Napa side of Carneros comes this crisp, fruity young Chardonnay. It's tart in savory acidity and bone dry, with pleasantly nuanced flavors of lemons, limes and tangerines, accented with a touch of sweet oak. An elegant wine to drink now.
title: Cuvaison 2009 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Twenty-five percent new oak shows in the aromas of buttered toast, butterscotch and caramel that superimpose over ripe notes of pineapple jam. Purists might object to all that oak, but others will go gaga.
title: Au Bon Climat 2009 Los Alamos Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: The winery has held this wine back for nearly three years, but it's still briskly acidic and clean. Grown in the Arroyo Seco appellation, it shows forward, bright flavors of tangerines, mangoes and Asian pears, with complexities from oak and lees aging.
title: San Simeon 2008 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: A steely, acidic wine, marked by minerals and a lick of metal. What fruit there is veers toward limes and peaches. Polished and sophisticated.
title: Chandon 2009 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A non-oaked, non-ML Chardonnay from a new producer in inland Mendocino, the wine has lots of green apple, custard and key lime, is easy-drinking and straightforward with clearly no oak influence and a noticeable finish. Definitely clean and crisp.
title: Rivino 2009 Estate, Schrader Ranch Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Tremendously pretty with honeysuckle and apricot highlights and memorable texture as well as a bright, crisp finish, this Chardonnay makes for a very good food wine, its cool-climate grapes grown organically along the banks of the Russian River.
title: Patianna 2009 Estate Vineyards Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Sweet in caramelized oak and vanilla, with ripe pineapple tart, guava fruit and honey flavors, this Chardonnay is pretty sweet. But it's saved by crisp acidity and a good scour of minerals.
title: Expression 38 2009 Goldrock Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Grown on the Montebello estate, this Chardonnay shows good acidity and a stony minerality from the rocks and soil. It's very ripe and forward in pineapple, orange and peach jam fruit, and while only 10% of the mostly American barrels were new, it also tastes quite oaky and sweet in caramel. A flamboyant, sweetly flashy wine for drinking now.
title: Ridge 2009 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: A light-colored, lemon-zesty, cool-vintage Chardonnay that's fruit forward but has great balance and finish, light on the tongue and easygoing all around. With stone fruit and a hint of vanilla, this affordable white should also be fairly easy to find (almost 4,000 cases made) and a successful pairing with a range of lighter salads and seafood dishes.
title: Guenoc 2009 Chardonnay (Lake County)

description: Rich and dramatic, if a little overworked. It's superripe in pineapple and orange jam fruit, with a strong application of sweet oak that layers vanilla and buttered toast. Brings Chardonnay to its ultimate deliciousness, but would benefit from greater nuance. Drink now.
title: Keller 2008 Precioso Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: A very rich, ripe, oaky Chardonnay. Made in an appealing style, with likeable pineapple jam, golden mango, buttered toast and spice flavors. It's an opulent wine to drink now.
title: Lobo 2009 Wulff Vineyards Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

description: Lots of crisp, crunchy acidity in this Chardonnay, with distinct flavors of pineapples. Oak adds vanilla and buttered toast. Rich and elaborate, although lacking complexity. Drink now.
title: Dutton-Goldfield 2009 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: Shows lots of flamboyant pineapple, pear and green apple flavors, with a deft touch of smoky oak. But the wine is uplifted by a firm, steely minerality, as well as fine acids. It finishes a little sweet. Drink now.
title: Cambria 2008 Katherine's Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Here's a nice, bright Chardonnay that can be described as Chablisian. It's bone dry and very bright in tangy acidity, with a squirt of lime juice over Meyer lemons, pineapples and green apples. A touch of oak adds just the right note of buttered toast. Easy to find, with 73,000 cases produced.
title: Francis Coppola 2009 Diamond Collection Gold Label Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: A rich, buttery Chardonnay, brimming with well-oaked pineapple, honey, créme brûlée and spice flavors, brightened with acidity. A real crowd pleaser.
title: Laird 2008 Cold Creek Ranch Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: With no oak, there's nothing here but natural grape flavors of oranges, limes, green apples, pears and golden mangoes. The acidity is high and racy. Ready now, but don't drink it too cold.
title: Marimar Estate 2008 Acero Don Miguel Vineyard Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Lush in pineapple cream, Key lime pie, kiwi fruit, white peach and apricot flavors, this Chardonnay is as rich as they come. There's also a welcome overlay of zesty, citrusy acidity. The finish is honey sweet, in the modern style.
title: Kokomo 2008 Peters Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Lincourt's grapes are so rich and well grown that they don't even need oak to make a delicious Chardonnay. The wine is dry and crisp, with appealing flavors of pineapples, tangerines and Meyer lemons. The savory creaminess seems to come from aging on the lees. What a great food wine.
title: Lincourt 2009 Steel Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This impressive Chardonnay from a small Livermore Valley producer is on the austere side of Chardonnay, with notes of just-ripe pear, tiny hints of wet stone, a nice, nutty finish and enough body to go with a wealth of foods. Good balance too.
title: Wood Family Vineyards 2009 Para Mas Amigas Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Fresh tropical fruit, peach and apricot flavors star in this flashy young wine. Oak also plays a prominent role, giving buttered toast and caramel notes. And the texture is creamy and smooth. The overall impression is very rich and powerful, but the wine could have more finesse. Drink now.
title: Matanzas Creek 2008 Journey Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This is a very rich Chardonnay, almost too elaborated and overworked. It's tremendous in oak-infused fruit, with dominating buttered toast, crème brûlée and pineapple pie flavors. Very crisp coastal acidity provides a pleasant balance of tartness. Drink now.
title: La Feníªtre 2008 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Horse & Plow sourced organic grapes to craft this excellent Chardonnay, giving it the luxe treatment-handpicked, whole-cluster pressed, French oak barrel fermentation and aging nine months sur lee-and it shows. The wine is pretty, with a tropical bouquet that gives way to just enough oak-driven vanilla. Will age nicely but is also ready to drink now.
title: Horse & Plow 2009 McFadden Farm Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Searing acidity marks this wine, which tastes like it has a lot of Edna Valley fruit in the blend. It also shows bright, strong, long hangtime flavors of limes and pineapples. It's actually quite a fine Chardonnay, dry and low in alcohol. A great value at this price.
title: Bishop's Peak 2009 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: With just a hint of oak, this Chardonnay is all about fruit and acidity. It's dry and crisp, with a firm, clean mouthfeel, and pleasant citrus, apple, pear and mineral flavors.
title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2008 Karia Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Made in the modern style of superripe fruit and lots of oak, this Chardonnay is massive in the long hangtime tropical fruit, pear and peach flavors that the vineyard so easily achieves. It's not complex, but it sure is delicious, oozing with honey and spices. Drink now-2013.
title: Pessagno 2008 Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is the ripest of Ojai's current trio of '08 Chardonnays, with tropical fruit, apricot and pear flavors, but it also shows the winery's telltale acidity, dryness and minerality. Drink now.
title: Ojai 2008 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: One of the best Chardonnays available at this price. Shows welcome restraint in the crisp, clean flavors of pineapples, Meyer lemons, pears and green apples, with just a touch of oak. If you just judge by price, you'll be amazed how complex and layered it is.
title: Pedroncelli 2009 Vintage Selection Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Made in the Bonterra style of exceedingly pure fruit, this Chardonnay brims with delicious tangerines and pears. It has pretty acids that make it feel clean in the mouth. A delightful wine made even richer with a touch of new oak.
title: Bonterra 2009 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: Oak dominates this wine, with buttered toast and vanilla aromas and flavors. It's a little obvious, but there's a solid core of pineapple fruit, and plenty of racy acidity. Exotic; a Chardonnay to drink now.
title: Pessagno 2008 Lucia Highlands Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: A softly gentle, ultrarich Chardonnay. Fruity flavors of pineapples and Key lime pie are enriched with notes of caramelized vanilla, buttered toast, sautéed banana and honey. A stony minerality offers much needed weight and balance. Delicious. Drink now.
title: Antica 2009 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Comes down on the dry, acidic, minerally side of the Chardonnay street. Fans of opulence will find it lacking, but it's so clean and subtle in pineapple tart, tangerine and buttered toast flavors, it recommends itself as one of the more elegant and food-friendly Chards out there.
title: Ben Hogan 2009 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Drier and earthier than many other Chardonnays, this one is easy to drink and food friendly. It shows oak-inspired flavors of pineapples and vanilla, with a creamy, leesy texture. Nice with poached salmon with roasted new potatoes on a summer evening.
title: Concannon 2008 Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Shows rich, forward pineapple tart and crème brûlée flavors that are satisfying and dry. Delicious and spicy, although it's just a bit sharp. Drink now.
title: Groth 2008 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is one of the drier, steelier Chardonnays on the market. It shows flavors of Meyer lemons, limes and tart white peaches, with a tantalizing acidity that makes the mouth water. Trades opulence for elegance, a nice wine for roasted salmon and sweet summer corn.
title: Cali 351 2007 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A dry, streamlined wine, for those who don't like super-fruity, oaky ones. With a streak of minerals, it shows an elegant structure framing citrus, melon and peach flavors.
title: Thomas Fogarty 2007 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This is a tightly wound Chardonnay, crisp and steely. It's also oaky. The underlying flavors are of citrus and tropical fruits, buttered toast and vanilla, with a touch of metallic stone. Calls to mind the 2006. Give it a breath of air before serving to soften it, and don't drink it too cold.
title: Vineyard 7&8 2008 8 Chardonnay (Spring Mountain District)

description: Shows a Chablis-like steely, minerally dryness, with subtle notes of lemons, limes and grapefruits. Marked by firm acids, it's an elegant wine of great structure and integrity, meant for drinking now.
title: Prime 2008 District 4 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Very rich, dry and crisp in acidity, a Chardonnay that feels fine from your first sip through the spicy finish. Made with 35% new French oak, and aged eight months on the lees, it's drinking beautifully now, with pear, pineapple, vanilla custard and buttered toast flavors. Just lovely.
title: Sequoia Grove 2008 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Made in the stylish cult manner of exceptionally ripe pineapple, kiwi and pear fruit flavors, lavishly oaked, this Chard will please fans of the style. One wishes it were more sophisticated and complex, but lots of people will ooh and aah over its sheer power.
title: David Arthur 2008 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Good price for a firm, steely Chardonnay that's elegant and dry through the finish. Minerals and citrus fruits mark it, with a Meyer lemon tartness given added richness from 25% new oak fermentation. Ready now.
title: Laetitia 2008 Estate Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: ultrarich, maybe too much so for elegance, with powerful caramel and vanilla crème brûlée flavors overpowering the pineapples, peaches and green apples. Still, there's no denying the deliciousness. Crisp acidity fortunately provides balance.
title: Chalk Hill 2007 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)

description: Made in a very oaky, Sonoma Coast style that emphasizes enormously ripe fruit and crisp acids. The green apple, pineapple tart and pear flavors are enriched with vanilla, buttered toast and butterscotch Lifesaver sour candy. Flamboyant and dramatic, but not an ager, so drink young.
title: Tandem 2007 Sangiacomo Vineyards Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Quite a nice Chardonnay at a great price. It's rich and creamy and plump, with deliciously ripe flavors of pineapples, Asian pears, buttered cinnamon toast and vanilla. The richness is balanced by crisp acidity and a firm minerality.
title: Blackstone 2008 Sonoma Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A rich, fine Chardonnay that recalls how good this coastal valley can grow the great white grape of Burgundy. Complex in pineapple, pear, tropical fruit, butterscotch and cinnamon spice flavors, it has adequate acidity. At its best now, so drink up.
title: DeLorimier 2007 Stuhlmuller Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Reduced slightly with a huge heft of oak on the nose, this wine continues the robust oak theme, taking on toasted vanilla and tropical flavors around concentrated companions of baked apple and brioche.
title: Chateau St. Jean 2015 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: This giant of a wine has more than enough oaky aromas, a full body and toasty, buttery flavors that coat the palate. The vanilla, lemon zest, butter cream and grilled baguette notes are delicious, so this will be a great choice for people who like an all-out oaky style.
title: Bogle 2016 Phantom Chardonnay (Clarksburg)

description: Hints of lime blossoms, toasted nuts and wood smoke show on the nose of this very fairly priced bottling, whose previous vintages have been shown to age magically. Wood-fired pears and apples show on the palate, which will please both those seeking a bit of oak and those who enjoy a racier style of Chardonnay.
title: Le P'tit Paysan 2016 Jacks Hill Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: This is a silky smooth, full-bodied wine with a light gold color, inviting baking-spice aromas, ripe and concentrated fruit flavors and an especially rich mouthfeel, due partly to a high alcohol level.
title: Jessie's Grove 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Ripe tones of Pink Lady apple, light pineapple and tropical white flowers make for a soft and supple nose on this bottling. There is brightness to the sip, with lemongrass freshness that cuts through the slightly sweet lime-candy elements.
title: Falcone 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Driven by fresh tangy fruit flavors and lively acidity, this wine was fermented in large oak barrels (puncheons) and represents a change in style for Las Positas. It offers lots of refreshment and palate-cleansing attributes. It has a lightly earthy and floral aroma, vivid lemon and fresh herb flavors and medium body.
title: Las Positas 2016 Estate Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: A strong baking-spice component dominates this full-bodied, broad-textured and indulgent wine. It's big and bold, oaky and very ripe tasting. Aromas of vanilla, clove and nutmeg lead to pear nectar and melted butter flavors and a lingering vanilla finish.
title: Fenestra 2016 Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Light, fresh and easy aromas of lemon blossoms, tangerine juice and a chalky marble-like minerality show on the nose of this bottling from one of the most bang-for-buck regions in Monterey County. Clean and crisp on the sip, flavors of lemon juice, white peach, more chalk and a kiss of oak round out the palate.
title: White Hart Wine 2016 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Like a home-baked apple pie without the sweetness, this light-bodied wine smells of sliced apples, nutmeg and cinnamon and tastes fruity and lightly spicy. The texture is very smooth and gentle, too.
title: Cabana Wines 2014 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: There's a classic California Chardonnay backbone to this bottling, with aromas of toasted wood, crème brûlée, poached pear and apple custard, yet there are also more delicate hints of chalk and orange blossom as well. The palate combines ripe Pink Lady apples and vanilla spice and caramel richness.
title: Wente 2016 Riva Ranch Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Good balance, medium body and a nice blend of fruit and spice flavors make this wine taste very well put together. It has crisp apple and lemon aromas, deceptively concentrated nutmeg, fig and pear flavors that slowly unfold on the palate, and a good lingering finish.
title: Victor Vineyards 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Very delicate on the nose, this bottling from Blair Pence offers light lemon, fresh nectarine and wet cement aromas. It's very tight and edgy on the sip, with lime flavors and a pinch of baking spice, proving crisp and refreshing.
title: Pence Ranch 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Broad aromas of white peach and nectarine are lifted with hints of Key lime zest on the pleasant nose of this bottling. There is impressive zip to the well-structured and grippy sip, where fresh citrus juice keeps the tropical passion fruit and guava flavors in check.
title: Castoro Cellars 2016 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Bright lemon and orange rind aromas meet with sea salt, nectarine and a yellow grapefruit pith on the nose of this bottling by Karen Steinwachs. Tightly wound on the palate, this single-vineyard expression shows fresh and lively flavors of citrus pith, yogurt and Brie rind. Could use a bit more time in bottle to fully shine.
title: Seagrape 2015 Zotovich Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: The nose on this bottling is extremely subtle, with hints of stone fruit and citrus. The palate is extremely crisp and clean, with Asian pear, lime peel and hints of oak smoke. The focus is tightly wound texture more than overt flavors.
title: Peake Ranch 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Fairly showy white flower aromas meet with melted butter, lemon rind candy and match smoke on the nose of this appellation blend. There are a good amount of smoky oak and roasted marshmallow flavors to the sip, but they are cut deftly by fresh citrusy acidity.
title: Pali 2015 Highlands Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: From Santa Barbara County's first commercial vineyard, this bottling offers a clean line of lemon butter, toast and oak on the nose. A strong burst of acidity kicks off the sip, where warm brioche and fresh lemon-spray flavors ride a chalky texture.
title: Nielson by Byron 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Mellow and pleasant aromas of nectarine, Bosc pear and Meyer lemon pith make for a very classically restrained Chardonnay on this bottling. There is solid zip to the sip, where high-toned and tightly wound flavors of citrus, honeysuckle and poached pear show.
title: Rancho Sisquoc 2016 Flood Family Vineyards Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Plump aromas of lemon butter, gardenia and hot sourdough toast with tangerine marmalade show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is pillowy in texture, offering ripe flavors of peach custard, sea salt, butterscotch, tangy grapefruit and mandarin slices.
title: Foley 2015 Barrel Select Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A beautiful, elegant Chardonnay that shows the rich pineapple, pear and peach flavors of the variety, with the crisp, citrusy acidity of crunchy green apples. The alcohol is nice and low. You won't miss oak at all.
title: Sebastiani 2008 Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Very rich in pineapple, peach, pear, green apple, crème brûlée and smoky flavors, but balanced with crisp acidity and a certain minerality that makes the mouthfeel vibrant. This is a good price for a Chardonnay of this opulence.
title: Francis Ford Coppola 2007 Director's Cut Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Superripe and rich in tropical fruit, pineapple, kiwi and golden mango flavors, with additional notes of buttered toast and caramel. Fortunately, crisp Monterey acidity provides a brisk, clean finish. Drink now.
title: Kali Hart 2008 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Ripe and fruity in pineapples, with buttered popcorn, vanilla custard and smoky spice flavors. A bit direct and unintegrated now, but this is a Chardonnay that will gain considerably with a year or three in the bottle.
title: RustRidge 2007 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A lovely, drink-me-now Chardonnay that shows off the variety with cool-climate flair. Dry and crisp, it has rich flavors of pineapples, pears and papayas, with a smoky, oaky creaminess. Will hold and develop nutty complexities beyond 2010.
title: Valley of the Moon 2008 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Quite a good Chardonnay for the price. Shows classic flavors of pineapples, pears and apples, enriched with smoky oak and vanilla, and folded into a creamy texture. Good value, and easy to find, with 7,800 cases produced.
title: Guenoc 2007 Chardonnay (Lake County)

description: Bone dry and tart in citrusy acidity, this is a Chablis-style Chardonnay. It has a firm minerality grounding clean flavors of sour pineapple candy, with richer notes of vanilla and smoky oak. Elegant and food-friendly.
title: Alma Rosa 2008 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: A beautiful, restaurant-style Chardonnay that will pair well with grilled fish, chicken, pork and many other foods. It's bone dry and crisp, with mineral-infused citrus flavors enriched with sweet, smoky oak. Very Chablisian.
title: Sanford 2007 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: There's a Chablis-like elegance to this Chardonnay in the dryness and minerality, which stimulates the palate with a chalky, steely tartness. That's not to minimize the pineapple and pear fruit, much less the buttered toast and vanilla cream from oak. Very nice. Easy to find, with more than 70,000 cases produced.
title: Acacia 2007 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A bit soft and melted, but offers exotically rich flavors of golden mango, pineapple and cinnamon spice, in a custardy texture.
title: Cambria 2007 Rae's Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Offers a tremendous burst of ripe green apples, bosc pears and Meyer lemons, brightened with the crisp acidity of cool Green Valley. Also, tinges of vanilla and cream, despite being unoaked.
title: Iron Horse 2007 UnOaked Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: Oaky, with butterscotch and smoky caramel-honey flavors standing out over the underlying pineapples, oranges and minerals. Finishes dry and crisp. Drink now.
title: Talley 2007 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: A very lush, fruity wine, if a bit soft, with flavors of pineapples, lemon custard, buttered toast and smoky vanilla. Satisfies for its richness and creamy texture.
title: Hartford Court 2007 Four Hearts Vineyards Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A fine Chardonnay, which Ferrari-Carano can usually be depended on to produce. Shows crowd-pleasing flavors of pineapple jam, butterscotch, crème brûlée and vanilla custard. Easy to find, with 42,000 cases produced.
title: Ferrari-Carano 2007 Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Shows mouthwatering acidity and long hangtime flavors of pineapple essence, papaya, butterscotch, vanilla crème brûlée and toast, yet for all that richness, finishes dry. This is a good price for all that richness.
title: San Simeon 2006 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: This Chardonnay marches to its own beat. It's not one of those oaky, ultra-ripe wines, but instead shows a dry, herb-infused minerality you might call Chablisian. Shows modest fruit flavors of pineapples, while the oak is restrained. Drink this elegant Chard now.
title: Steven Kent 2005 Merrillie Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Succulent and opulent, with ripe pineapple purée, Meyer lemon tart, kiwi fruit, pastry crust and tangy mineral flavors, enriched with the buttered toast and caramel of new oak.
title: Cinnabar 2006 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Intricate and complex, with apricot, pineapple, golden currant, mineral and buttered toast flavors, balanced with fine acidity. Good now, and should evolve in interesting ways over the next six years
title: Joseph Swan Vineyards 2006 Trenton Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Enormously flavorful, with an eruption of grilled pineapples, lemondrop candy, peach pie, caramel and butterscotch notes that finish dry and spicy. Feels a little soft and unstructured, but makes for very nice drinking.
title: Patz & Hall 2006 Zio Tony Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A very nice Chardonnay for drinking with grilled salmon or chicken. It's light and delicate, with pleasant flavors of citrus fruits, pears and vanilla and bracing minerality. Really likeable for its balance.
title: Waterstone 2007 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Let this Chard warm up in the glass a bit; it will reveal intricate layers of grilled pineapples, vanilla bean and butterscotch. With a rich, creamy texture and firm finish, it's a very fine wine for the price.
title: Franciscan 2006 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Gloria Ferrer has quietly been producing a fine Chardonnay at a fair price for the quality. The '06 shows ripe Carneros character, with citrusy acids framing grilled pineapple and toasty oak flavors. Don't overchill it.
title: Gloria Ferrer 2006 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Here's a Chard at an everyday price but is significantly better than most other Chards in its range. Dry, smooth and creamy, it has textured flavors of peaches, pears, minerals and spice, with a touch of sweet rosemary.
title: Sterling 2007 Made with Organic Grapes Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: They used wild yeasts to ferment this Chard, and there is something exotic and feral about the flavors, which go beyond nectarines and pears into fruits without names. It's missing some crispness, but shows richness and opulence.
title: Dutton Estate 2006 Dutton Ranch Dutton Palms Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Rich and tasty, this ripe Chard offers a blast of tropical fruit, smoke,   buttered toast and spice flavors that are wrapped into a creamy texture. Should hold for a year or two.
title: MacRostie 2006 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is a richly oaked young Chardonnay. It brims with ripe papaya, mango, pineapple and apple flavors, while the oak barrels add layers of buttered toast, honey and vanilla meringue.
title: Roche 2006 Reserve American Oak Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: It was surprising to learn that this Chard was barrel-fermented, because the fruit is so powerful, it almost tastes like one of those unoaked Chards. Just explodes in the mouth with pineapple, peach, green apple and Key lime flavors, highlighted by crisp coastal acidity.
title: Rusack 2006 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: A very nice Chard that, at seven bucks less than the winery's Premier Reserve, is nearly as good. Dry and crisp in acidity, it has rich honey, pineapple and smoke flavors. How can a wine taste like honey and be dry? It's called magic.
title: Navarro 2006 Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: A very nice Chardonnay that defines the modern, ripe style, Beringer's '06 is rich in pineapple, green apple, grilled peach and smoky new oak flavors. The honeyed taste is balanced with vital acidity that makes the wine finish clean.
title: Beringer 2006 Private Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A lovely Chardonnay to drink tonight, this one, from the winery's fine Carneros vineyard on the Napa side, shows bright, mineral-infused pineapple, lime and spicy clove and pepper flavors. The acidity will balance a rich dish, such as seared scallops in a coconut-curry sauce.
title: Clos Pegase 2006 Clos Pegase Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is a big wine, and not really showing its best now. It's raw-boned. The oak is all smoky and spicy and dominant; the fruit is massive in pears, crunchy apples and pineapples; the acidity on the finish is tart. It needs a year or so to knit together.
title: Thomas Fogarty 2005 Gist Ranch Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: The dryness and minerality of this wine, combined with its clean, brisk elegance, make it a very nice partner for shellfish. The flavors are lemons, limes, and ripe, crisp white peaches.
title: St. Francis 2006 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Very tight now, with minerally, yeasty flavors of lees and unintegrated smoky new oak. High acidity adds to the impression of austerity. Difficult to appreciate in its infancy, but this elegant, layered, complex Chard should begin to blossom after 2008 and hold for several years.
title: Pessagno 2006 Lucia Highlands Vineyard Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Steely, crisp and very dry, this Chard has a savory mineral underpinning to the lime, Meyer lemon, green apple and pear flavors. Shows real style and finesse through the long finish.
title: Zina Hyde Cunningham 2005 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: A richly fruity, tropical-fruit-scented Chardonnay that offers plenty of weight and fruit at a reasonable tariff. Bits of butter, dried spices and citrus accent the ripe fruit, which finishes dry and crisp.
title: Wente 2006 Riva Ranch Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: The vintage was a good one for Gallo Chardonnays, and with this bottling, held back for more than three years, they have another winner. Dry and crisp, this pineapple- and green apple-flavored wine has an earthiness suggesting sweet tobacco and fresh herbs.
title: Gallo Family Vineyards 2004 Two Rock Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: A good followup to last year's bottling, Cobblestone's '06 Chard hails from the Arroyo Seco, known for crisp, ripe, elegant white wines. It brims with pineapple, peach, tangerine, mineral, buttered toast and vanilla spice flavors.
title: Cobblestone 2006 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Dry and flinty, with flavors of grilled pineapples, peaches, pears and roasted hazelnuts, this wine has a stony, minerally taste. Santa Lucia Highlands and Arroyo Seco fruit are well represented in this stylish wine.
title: Bernardus 2006 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: The oak really stands out, so if you're sensitive to that, avoid. But others, including this reviewer, will find the toasty vanilla, meringue, butterscotch and char flavors perfectly in keeping with the ripe tropical fruit, pear and Meyer lemon flavors.
title: Gallo Family Vineyards 2006 Sonoma Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Year after year, Bonterra crafts splendidly pure varietal wines, from organically-grown grapes, and in large quantities that make them easy to find. The '06 Chard is delicious in pineapple, sweet Meyer lemon, tangerine, lime and caramelized vanilla oak flavors that finish clean and long. What a super value.
title: Bonterra 2006 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: A controversial wine due to its amazing power. It's just tremendous in apricot, peach, nectarine, marzipan and crème brûlée flavors, like some dainty from a great pastry chef. But this oversized quality makes it difficult to enjoy with food. Almost better on its own as a cocktail sipper.
title: Testarossa 2006 Rosella's Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Here's a fat, unctuous, oily Chard, about as ripe as they come. Barrel fermented in all-new oak, it has an overlay of smoky char and caramelized vanilla riding over guava, nectarine and honeysuckle flavors. It sure is decadent.
title: McIntyre Vineyards 2006 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is quite a hefty young Chard. It takes the basic elements of ripe, potent fruit, oak, and Burgundian-inspired technique and elevates it all, a Chard on steroids. The peach, tropical fruit, pear, candied ginger and charry oak flavors have an acidic scour. Drink now and for the next 5 years.
title: Pride Mountain 2006 Vintner Select Cuvée Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This hugely ripe Chardonnay is just a little too big for absolute balance. Any more powerful, and it would be over the line. As it is, it flirts with it, with gobs of jammy apricots, yellow pears, citrine and Meyer lemondrop, as well as barrel influences ranging from creamy lees to buttered toast, roasted hazelnuts and smoky honey. The alcohol is over 15%.
title: Williams Selyem 2005 Hawk Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: With no oak, the pure, brilliantly ripe Chardonnay fruit shines through in this rewarding wine. It's so rich in tropical fruit, peach, pear and citrus flavors, you won't even miss the barrel influence. Best of all is the cool-climate crispness that makes the finish so clean and vibrant.
title: Four Vines 2006 Naked Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Juicy acids and rich flavors of limes, green melons, kiwi and papayas star in this dry, unoaked Chard. The acidity gives the wine an exceptionally clean, vibrant mouthfeel.
title: Morgan 2006 Metallico Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Captures the essence of Russian River Chard with its crisp acids that boost and brighten an explosion of taste. The tropical fruit and spice flavors are enriched by toasty oak, while sur lie aging adds a creaminess to the texture of this deliciously dry wine.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 2005 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a bold, oaky Chardonnay. Toasty roasted-nut aromas lead the charge, followed by hints of peach and melon, while a strong vanilla component comes forward on the palate. Finishes warm, with prominent oak spice.
title: Fess Parker 2005 Ashley's Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Dry and crisp and with some complexity. The oak is 50% new and very evident in the smoky caramel, while the fruit veers toward peaches and pineapples. As is often the case with Napa Chard, there's a sweet, herbal quality. Drink now through 2009.
title: Patz & Hall 2005 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Franciscan helped pioneer the use of wild or indigenous yeasts years ago, hence the name, and whether that technique makes better wines is debatable. Still, the level of Cuvée Sauvage has been generally high. The '05 reflects the cool balance of the vintage, with ripe peach, pear, mango and oaky-butterscotch flavors accompanied by crisp balancing acidity.
title: Franciscan 2005 Cuvée Sauvage Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Shafer's '05 is drier, crisper and more minerally than its predecessors from warmer vintages. You might even call it leaner. But it still shows the elegant balance that always characterizes the wine, with brilliant acidity.
title: Shafer 2005 Red Shoulder Ranch Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: The only criticism I have is excessive new oak. In this case, it's 100%, and the sweet char, smoky vanilla and brûléed butterscotch flavors completely dominate. Good as Beringer's top Chards are, they're not Montrachet, and the wine simply cannot shoulder that burden of wood. Having said that, it's still an elegant wine, and oak devotees will love it.
title: Beringer 2005 Sbragia Limited Release Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: The honeyed richness just oozes out from this dry wine. You can almost picture the freshly crushed grapes in their steel fermenters, it's that fresh and keen in pineapple, tangerine, kiwi, guava and other spicy, acid-rich tropical fruits. Absolutely luscious, a complex, fruit-driven wine of great sophistication and elegance.
title: Dillon 2005 Stainless Steel Fermented Chardonnay (Yountville)

description: Couldn't be riper or more powerful in flavor, a Chard that just detonates with explosive pineapple tart filling, honey, vanilla and crème brûlée. Could use a bit of subtlety, but fans of pure Chardonnay flavor will be delighted.
title: De Loach 2005 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Here's a pull out all the stops, bells and whistles Chard that aims to compete at a high level. Barrel fermented in 80% new oak, aged on the lees and put through full malolactic fermentation, it's rich, creamy, buttery and exotically flavored in opulent toasted barrel and tropical fruits. I personally like this style, but others might find it too oaky.
title: Château Souverain 2005 Winemaker's Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Nutty and melon-scented, this is a medium-bodied Chardonnay with distinct tangerine and spice components Lohr attributes to the "Muscat clone" used in this wine. Finishes with a flourish of buttery richness. This would pair beautifully with cold crab.
title: J. Lohr 2005 October Night Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Classic RRV Chard, showing bright aromas of green apples, pineapples, lemon and lime and roasted coconut, with rich vanilla cream and smoky butter notes, and that lovely, brisk acidity that makes the finish so clean.
title: Rochioli 2005 Estate Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: There's something about this single-vineyard Chard that almost always satisfies in every vintage. It's so balanced, with dependably ripe fruit offset by crisp acidity, and the oak seems just right. The '05 is deeply-flavored in pineapple, peach, mango and butterscotch, with a long, spicy finish.
title: Murphy-Goode 2005 Island Block Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Tastes firmly acidic and young. There's tightness and minerality to the citrus, pineapple sorbet and oaky flavors that finish dry. Don't serve too cold.
title: Beauregard 2005 Trout Gulch Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This wine has much in common with the winery's '05 Dutton Ranch Sauvignon Blanc. It's a tight, high-acid, lean wine, with mineral and citrus flavors enriched with a touch of honeysuckle and oak. More notable for structure than opulence, it will finely support food, and should develop bottle complexity over the next five years.
title: Dutton-Goldfield 2005 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This was a cool vintage, and while it had long hangtime, the grapes from this northwestern vineyard, in the coolest part of the appellation, struggled to ripen. The wine has high acidity and a minerally tang to the citrus, apples and kiwis. Toasty oak softens and enriches. Should gain bottle complexity over the next six years.
title: Testarossa 2005 Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: As ripe as any Chardonnay on earth, it's well-oaked and balanced in acidity. The pineapple, mango, papaya, passionfruit and smoky oak flavors, with a butter-sautéed, Cognac-splashed banana finish, will appeal to those who like their wines flamboyant.
title: Testarossa 2005 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Ultraclean and pure in fruit, with brisk, refreshing acidity, this is an upscale Chardonnay whose lemon-and-lime, pineapple and nectarine flavors are coated with smoky oak. The cool climate and long hangtime of the '05 vintage have conspired to make this balanced and elegant.
title: Addamo 2005 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
